description: Cattle are free ranged on the conservation land, and there are a few old farm structures (barns, corrales, etc.) that are not marked on any maps. Also, there are 2 campsites and a foul weather shelter on the St. Johns River. Most of the land is sabal palm and oak hammock in the expansive flood plain of the St. Johns River. That being said, after lots of rain, or during the summer, the trails may be under 3 to 5 feet of water in places.

name: Flying Eagle Preserve
description: This property is a mosaic of small lakes, marshes and swamps, with numerous scattered islands of forested uplands. A broad mixture of hardwood and cypress swamps covers the floodplain of the Withlacoochee River.

name: Flying Eagle Preserve first gate
description: This property is a mosaic of small lakes, marshes and swamps, with numerous scattered islands of forested uplands. A broad mixture of hardwood and cypress swamps covers the floodplain of the Withlacoochee River.

name: Lake Monroe Conservation Area - Kratzert Tract
description:
The Kratzert Tract of the Lake Monroe Conservation area is a wildlife management area, meaning hunting is allowed here during hunting season. USE CAUTION during deer season (i don't even go here until after general gun season is over). While there is a 1.4 mile loop marked on the maps, there are many other hunting trails, and a blue-blazed trail within the area. About a mile or so from the parking lot is a campground that can be found by following the sign at the trail intersection. This tract is huge and borders the St. Johns river.<br />
<br />
SJWMD site link: http://www.sjrwmd.com/recreationguide/lakemonroe/

name: Hickory Bluff Preserve
description:
Hickory Bluff is a 150 acre preserve situated on the St. Johns. The trails wander through dry sandy scrub to the river. Next to the river is a group camp site, including a fire ring, benches, a pavilion and picnic benches. The river is wide and deep offering swimming and fishing. This preserve is not very big, but great for an afternoon hike or camping trip.<br />
<br />
Volusia County site: http://volusia.org/growth/hickory.htm

name: Whispering Pines Park
description: There is restrooms, a swimming pool & other recreational things also.

name: Withlacoochee State Forest/ Two Mile Prairie Tract - Johnson Pond
description: This trail is part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. It is a nice hike around a pond. There isn't much cover from above and it is pretty dry. There is some interesting coral-looking moss covering much of the ground and there is lots of sand.

name: Withlacoochee State Forest/ Two Mile Prairie Tract - Oxbow Trail
description: This trail is part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. It is a pretty short loop trail that features a small lake. There are palmettos, pines, scrubs, and oaks.

name: The J. Murray & Alma B. Davis Heritage Site
description: Just a short wooded trail that points out some old historical sites.

name: Seminole State Forest/ Lower Wekiva
description: This trail is part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. It is a 10.6 mile loop. Seminole State Forest is known for having all of the naturally occurring vegetative communities found in Central Florida. A few examples of communities are flatwoods, scrub, blackwater streams and bottomland forests. This area is also known for its Florida black bear population.

name: Seminole State Forest/ Sulphur Island
description: This trail is part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. It is an 8 mile linear/loop trail. Seminole State Forest is known for having all of the naturally occurring vegetative communities found in Central Florida. A few examples of communities are flatwoods, scrub, blackwater streams and bottomland forests. This area is also known for its Florida black bear populatio

name: Seminole State Forest
description: Seminole State Forest is known for having all of the naturally occurring vegetative communities found in Central Florida. A few examples of communities are flatwoods, scrub, blackwater streams and bottomland forests. This area is also known for its Florida black bear populatio

name: Half Moon WMA
description: There is a restroom & picnic areas, but no water. There are four trails, the yellow loop is 3.5 miles, the blue loop is 2.7 miles, the white loop is 1.8 miles & the gateway loop is 1.2 miles.

name: Lake Panasoffkee
description: They have a restroom & a picnic pavilion. they also hunt out there so make sure it isn't hunting season when you go.

name: Dixie Shores : Marsh & Hammock Trail
description: This trail takes you into the marsh & into scrubby flatwoods. The trail maybe under acouple inches of wtaer in certain times of the year.

name: Dixie Shores :  Lakes Trail
description: The trail takes you around acouple lakes & through some hammocks.

name: Palm Bluff
description: SJWMD Site: http://www.sjrwmd.com/recreationguide/palmbluff/

name: Redfish Hole
description: This is a bird watching trail that takes you out into the salt march.

name: Potts Preserve
description: The property was acquired for protection of the area's groundwater recharge, as well as important surface water features and wetland habitats. The preserve's wetlands play a role in both the Tsala Apopka Chain of Lakes and the Withlacoochee River systems, part of the Floridan aquifer's recharge/discharge system. Additionally, the site provides habitat to wildlife, including a small population of threatened Florida scrub-jays.

name: Crystal River Archaeological State Park
description: The park has a museum of all the old artifacts that have been collected from the Indain Mounds with several display cases. There are acouple Indain Mounds you can walk around & even stairs & a platform on the top of one.

name: Churchhouse Hammock Trail
description: Ther is two different trails, you have a boardwalk trail & a primitive trail off the boardwalk. There is a restroom & a pavilion, no drinking water.

name: Crystal Cove
description: Along the trail you see freshwater ponds & Crystal River tidal marshes. You can also kayak & canoe. There is a restroom, fishing & no drinking water.

name: 7 Mile Loop
description: There isn't any restrooms or drinking water at the trailhead. The trail take you on a tour of pine flatwoods, basin marsh, tidal marsh, wet hardwood hammocks & basin swamps. The trail can be muddy during rainy season.

name: Canaveral National Seashore
description:
The seashore and refuge offer short self-guided trails. Castle Windy and Turtle Mound trails have shell middens left by Timucuan Indians. Turtle Mound Trail boasts a view of the ocean and Mosquito Lagoon. Eldora Hammock, Oak Hammock, and Palm Hammock trails wind through densely vegetated hammocks. Cruickshank Trail has an observation tower and marsh views.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Eco-Walk Trail
description: This is an iterpretive trail, the trail winds through pasture & marsh with flatwoods & hammocks. There is a restroom there just no drinking water.

name: Lake Texana State Park
description: Lake Texana State Park offers a wide variety of wildlife for visitors to observe and enjoy. Activities here include boating, swimming, hiking, fishing and camping.

name: Hammock Hiking Trail/Hontoon Island (Florida)
description: Free Ferry and free admission into the park. 3 mile roundtrip hike that ends at Dead River.

name: Paisley Woods Trail - Ocala National Forest
description: Paisley Woods Trail - Ocala National Forest features 22 miles of hiking trails near Paisley, FL.

name: Florida Trail: Clearwater Rec. Area - Alexander Springs Rec. Area
description:
The trail travels across open sand ridges, Thick bay heads and pine flat woods. Deer and birds are common along the tail, but Ticks, Chiggers and mosquitoes can be irritating so be sure to brig insect repellent.<br />
<br />
Camping is allowed anywhere along the the Florida Trail in the Ocala National Forest

name: Lake Beresford Park Nature Trail
description: Lake Beresford Park Nature Trail features 2 miles of hiking trails near Deland, FL.

name: Dixon Hammock
description: This park and trail are part of the Marjorie Harris Carr Cross Florida Greenway.

name: Inglis Island Trail
description: Inglis Island Trail is an easy access trail, and the area around the dam is handicap accessible. The rest of the trail is a wilderness walking trail. Location of the trail is in northern Citrus County nine and half miles north of the Crystal River. Inglis Island Trail is a beautiful, unspoiled, island wilderness walking trail of 1,200 acres.

name: Felburn Park
description: This trail provides a mix of birding habitat from scrub, hardwood hammocks, flatlands, and coastal area.

name: Withlacoochee Bay Trail
description: There is a beautiful observation deck at the end of the trail overlooking the Bay, with other observation decks along the canal. There is a canoe/kayak launch at mile marker 4.

name: Ross Prairie State Forest/ Holly Hammock
description: This trail is part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. It is a 2.3 mile loop where you will hike through depression marshes, sandhill, scrubby flatwoods, mesic hammock, mesic flatwoods, and scrub.

name: Halpata Tastanaki Preserve
description: There is restroom & no drinking water. A variety of plant communities occur on the property, including floodplain swamp and oak scrub along the Withlacoochee River and longleaf pine turkey oak sandhills occurring in upland areas. Recovering stands of oak scrub scattered amid the sandhill support the threatened Florida scrub-jay. This is also a multi trail use.

name: Spruce Creek Preserve
description: Spruce Creek Preserve features 0 miles of hiking trails near New Symrna/deland, FL.

name: Rainbow Springs State Park Garden and Nature Trail
description:
The Head Springs area of the Rainbow Springs State Park offers a swimming area, a fairly large native plant garden and a nature trail through pine flatwoods with views of phosphate pits. Canoe rentals are available for use on the Rainbow River. There is also many paved trails through old theme park attractions such as a zoo area and 4 man-made waterfalls.<br />
<br />
FL State Parks Site: http://www.floridastateparks.org/rainbowsprings/

name: Santos
description: Santos features 60 miles of hiking trails near Ocala, FL.

name: Twister
description: Twister features 3 miles of hiking trails near Ocala, FL.

name: Sholom Park
description: There is a restroom & drinking water here. This is a botanical garden, with alot of different plants to look at. There is a big pond with fish & dock so you can feed them.

name: Lake Woodruff NWR
description: Lake Woodruff National Wildlife Reserve is a massive refuge that was designed to provide habitat for migratory birds. There are several trail in the Reserve that are open to foot travel.

name: Chuck Lennon Park
description: Chuck Lennon Park features 3 miles of hiking trails near De Leon Springs, FL.

name: Bluffton Interpretive Trail
description: This is a nice short trail with information on the different plants in this forest. It has a restroom & picnic pavilion, plus a place to launch a canoe or fish from the dock.

name: Goethe State Forest/ Black Prong
description: This trail is part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. Goethe State Forest has more than 15 different natural communities and may contain the largest tract of contiguous, old-growth longleaf pine flatwoods in the state. It also features scrubby flatwoods, dome swamp, sandhill, and basin swamp. Black Prong is a loop trail extending a total of 10 miles but there are shortcuts if you want to take a shorter hike.

name: Goethe State Forest
description: Goethe State Forest has more than 15 different natural communities and may contain the largest tract of contiguous, old-growth longleaf pine flatwoods in the state. It also features scrubby flatwoods, dome swamp, sandhill, and basin swamp.

name: Goethe State Forest/ Buck Island Pond
description: This trail is part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. Goethe State Forest has more than 15 different natural communities and may contain the largest tract of contiguous, old-growth longleaf pine flatwoods in the state. It also features scrubby flatwoods, dome swamp, sandhill, and basin swamp. Buck Island Prong Trail is 1.8 miles.

name: Buncombe Hill Interpretive Trail
description: Ther is a restroom & picnic pavilion. There is still some water in the 66 acre sinkhole lake.

name: Goethe State Forest/ Apex
description: This trail is part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. Goethe State Forest has more than 15 different natural communities and may contain the largest tract of contiguous, old-growth longleaf pine flatwoods in the state. It also features scrubby flatwoods, dome swamp, sandhill, and basin swamp. The Apex trail is 1.8 miles long.

name: Cedar Key Scrub State Reserve
description: Your walking through a scrub habitat. There is a restroom & picnic tables & a shelter with tables under it also.

name: Goethe State Forest/ Tidewater
description: This trail is part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. Goethe State Forest has more than 15 different natural communities and may contain the largest tract of contiguous, old-growth longleaf pine flatwoods in the state. It also features scrubby flatwoods, dome swamp, sandhill, and basin swamp. Tidewater is a loop trail extending a total of 10 miles but there are shortcuts if you want to take a shorter hike.

name: Silver River State Park
description: Silver River State Park is home to 10 distinct natural communities, as well as a number of neat hiking trails.

name: Silver Springs State Park
description:
Silver Springs State Fish and Wildlife Area was one of five new state parks opened in northern Illinois from 1969-1971. As part of more than 20,000 acres (80.94 km2) added to the Illinois state park system during this period, Silver Springs opened to alleviate traffic at other state parks in the area. At the time, the Illinois Department of Natural Resources (IDNR), which oversees the state park system, was attempting to provide the Chicago area with the most state park facilities in Illinois. The spring is located along the hiking trail.<br />
<br />
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silver_Springs_State_Park

name: Big Cypress Boardwalk Trail
description: Just a short little trail that takes you from oak hammock to crypress hammock, then on a boardwalk to acouple real big crypress trees at the end of the boardwalk.

name: Green Circle State Trail
description: Walking, running and jogging are allowed on all sections of the Green Circle State Trail. The surface of the trail varies by section and can be crushed stone, asphalt, wood chips, boardwalks, sidewalks or roadways.

name: Ocala National Forest
description:
The Ocala National Forest is located in central Florida between the Ocklawaha and St. Johns Rivers. The Forest is approximately 383,000 acres and is the southernmost forest in the continental United States. The Ocala National Forest is rich in water resources with more than 600 lakes, rivers, and springs.<br />
<br />
Four major natural springs of crystal clear water are located in the popular of Juniper Springs, Salt Springs, Alexander Springs and Silver Glen Springs Recreation Areas. The Forest hosts a variety of major recreation, scenic and historic areas. The recreation activities are as diverse as the environment, from canoeing in wilderness waterways, swimming in crystal clear constant 72Ìâå¡ springs, year-round camping, picnicking, fishing, birding, hiking, bicycling, horseback riding and four-wheeling. <br />

name: Grand Isle State Park
description:
Grand Isle State Park is a fisherman's dream. The park is home to over 280 species of fish, which attract thousands for competitors for the Tarpon Rodeo every July. The park is located on one of the most popular barrier islands off the coast of Louisiana. Swimmers love the warm waters, bird watchers enjoy the opportunity to see their favorite species and other visitors love to relax on the brilliant beaches.

The park offers a two and a half mile nature trail for hikers and wildlife observers alike.

name: Equestrian Trail
description: There's a mix of longleaf pines, sand post oaks & turkey oaks.

name: Equestrian Trail
description: It has rolling sandhills & pastures with a Mox of longleaf pines, sand post oaks & turkey oaks.

name: Bear-N-Oak
description: It has rolling sandhills dotted with sinkholes, depression marshes & mesic flatwoods.

name: Big Bend National Park
description:
Big Bend is a hiker's paradise containing the largest expanse of roadless public lands in Texas. More than 150 miles of trails offer opportunities for day hikes or backpacking trips. Elevations range from 1,800 feet along the Rio Grande to 7,832 feet on Emory Peak in the Chisos Mountains. Elevation changes produce an exception variety of plants, animals, and scenic vistas. Generally, hikers can expect a 20å¡F temperature difference between low and high elevation hiking areas.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Devil's Hammock
description: It's mostly cypress swamp. There is a red loop that goes from the check station around the swamp & back to the check station, there is a blue trail that cuts the red loop in half. There is also a yellow trail that runs you out to the creek & ends.

name: Bulow Creek
description: Bulow Creek features 7 miles of hiking trails near Ormond Beach, FL.

name: Big Bend Ranch State Park
description: Trails provide the only means of accessing many areas within Big Bend Ranch State Park, and allow visitors an intimate rapport with the outdoors. With an extensive network of interconnected multiuse trails, the system strives to capture the spirit of the land by offering trails that are historical, scenic and educational, and offer varying levels of accessibility and challenge to people of all ages and abilities.

name: Orange Creek Restoration Area (South)
description: The Orange Creek Restoration Area is located within the Orange Creek Basin, an area that has been hydrologically altered, with varying impacts to the water and natural resources, since the beginning of the 20th century. From the 1940s until the District purchased it in 1998, the land had been used for farming. Currently the property includes a combination of restored wetlands, timberlands, pastures, and wet prairies and other wetlands. Water from Orange Creek flows to the Ocklawaha River. Natural communities characteristic of the property include mesic flatwoods, floodplain swamp, floodplain marsh and depression marsh. There is three loop trails with connector trails between the loops.

name: John's Landing
description: You can find an abundance of longleaf pines, slash pines and pond pine. Hammocks (shady places) can be found in wet, moderately wet and dry areas throughout the forest. Sandhills are open habitats dominated by longleaf pines and wiregrass.

name: Education Trail
description: Small loop trail, that's an interpretive trail.

name: Amistad National Recreation Area
description:
Amistad National Recreation Area offers hikers a number of trails to explore, whether you are interested in just a short walk or a more ambitious hike.<br />
A short interpretive nature trail can be found at Diablo East. Here you will learn about a variety of plants and enjoy sweeping views of Lake Amistad.<br />
The Sunrise Trail is 2.1 miles long and connects the park Visitor Center with Spur 454. Located on the old Brite Ranch, you will see a large variety of plants and birds while hiking.<br />
At the Pecos, you will find a short interpretive nature trail and a more adventurous trail that goes down a cliff along the Pecos River.<br />
The Figueroa Trail is a series of trails that comprise the longest trails in the recreation area. Located on the old Figueroa Ranch, these rolling trails will take you through desert and shrubland plants, while providing views of the lake and the dam. <br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Mud Spring
description: Trail takes you down to the Mud Spring. Also has a pavillion & grills by the spring.

name: Graham Swamp
description: Graham Swamp features 5 miles of hiking trails near Flagler Beach, FL.

name: Op Schnabel Park
description: Op Schnabel Park features 20 miles of hiking trails near San Antonio, TX.

name: Longleaf Flatwoods Reserve
description: The area is a diverse area of intact natural communities within the Lochloosa Wildlife Conservation Area. The uplands are comprised mainly of wet and mesic flatwoods and sandhill, portions of which were significantly affected by prior southern pine beetle salvage harvests, and these areas are in various stages of restoration. Several small wetlands drain to the southwest into a larger basin swamp. This swamp drains to the River Styx, which in turn drains to Orange Lake. The District and Alachua County purchased the property to aid protection of the Orange Creek and Ocklawaha River basins and to further the goals of the Alachua Forever program. There is three loop trails with connector trails.

name: Kanapaha Botanical Garden
description: This ia a paved walking trail, with restrooms & drinking water. Kanapaha Botanical Gardens is comprised of 24 major collections visually accessible from a 1 å_ mile paved walkway. These include the state's largest public display of bamboos and the largest herb garden in the Southeast. Some of Kanapaha's gardens are organized taxonomically; others demonstrate principles of ecology or natural selection. Kanapaha's signature plants include a premier stand of Chinese royal bamboo (Wong Chuk), and--during the warm months--giant Victoria water lilies and Asian snake arums. The months offering the most color are June through September. Adults: $7 plus tax, Children (ages 6-13): $3.50 plus tax, Children under 6: Free (when accompanied by parent)

The park has lake-front cabins and campsites for the overnighter and a rental area for boats. There are three hiking trails on the property for a more intimate experience with nature.

Franklin Park is a small 5 acre park located in Southeast Austin; it's perfect for gathering with family and friends and escaping the city.

There are 0.3 miles of well-manicured trails that navigate through this park. Trails lead to barbeque pits, basketball courts, multipurpose fields, picnic shelters, picnic tables, playgrounds, and volleyball courts!

There are plenty of opportunities to get out at Franklin Park.

description: The full name of this park is Circle C Ranch Metropolitan Park on Slaughter Creek. Lots of trails, piles of soccer fields, and a large disc golf course make this park special.

Amenities include barbeque pits, baseball fields, basketball courts, picnic shelter, picnic tables, a playground, softball fields, a swimming pool and about a mile of trails.

name: Acadiana Park

name: Buccaneer State Park
description: 1.8 mile self-guided trail encompasses many species of Oaks, Sweet Bay Magnolias and a variety of endidgus plants of the Mississippi Gulf Coast

name: Gulf State Park
description:
The Hugh S. Branyon Backcountry Trails offers a view of the park that is often overlooked.

"Several years ago, we teamed up with the City of Orange Beach to start a backcountry trail system to go through the wilderness part of the park," Branyon said. "These are areas that people have no idea are even here. We have beautiful oak hammocks that people are going to just be in awe of when they first see it. The trails run along marshes, secondary sand dunes, swamps, over creeks."

The trails are Catman Trail, which runs to Orange Beach, an extension that runs alongside the Orange Beach Sportsplex, the Gulf Park Oak Ridge Trail that runs to the back of the golf course, and the Rosemary Trail, which runs south of Middle Lake and Little Lake and comes out on the beach road. The total distance is 7.8 miles on the trails, which visitors who walk and bike are already enjoying. Other trails in the park include Hurricane Ridge, Middle Lake, Bear Creek, Aligator Marsh, Bobcat Branch, Tallow, Holly, and Armadillo trails.

name: Boggy Creek Greenbelt
description: There are shady trees, open expanses of grass, picnic tables, and characteristic Central Texas vegetation and songbirds at Boggy Creek. A quiet place to wander. Amenities include picnic shelters, picnic tables, and a volleyball court.

name: Lyndon B. Johnson State Park & Historic Site
description:
Take the trail to the Johnson Settlement. The circular trail is slightly less than a mile round-trip. Along the way you will find an exhibit center which will introduce you to the days of the cattle drives and the log home of President Johnson's grandparents.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Eilers (Deep Eddy) Park
description: The main attraction here is Deep Eddy Pool, but there is also a toddler play area, an ADA accessible ramp to the hike and bike trail, and dock onto Town Lake for fish and bird-spotting. There is a new smoker available in the park area. Other amenities include barbeque pits, fishing pier, picnic tables, a playground, a swimming pool and short trails.

name: Sam Houston Jones State Park
description: The 1,087-acre Sam Houston Jones State Park is a truly well-preserved area open to the public. Bird watching at this park is excellent because it is located near a very productive birding region. Water sports abound with convenient boat launches and rental boats for your use. Three hiking trails give visitors an opportunity for a scenic stroll through the park. Cabin and campsites are also available for rental. The hiking trails on the property equal about seven miles when combined.

name: East Metropolitan Park
description: Nice hiking trails.

name: Eastwoods Park
description: This lovely park is a hidden city gem. Used by many UT students as a place to study or wind down with a game of tennis, basketball or softball. Facilities include barbeque pits, basketball courts, fields, picnic tables, a playground, splash pad, tennis courts and half-mile of trail.

name: Shoal Creek Greenbelt-Central
description: Shoal Creek Greenbelt-Central features 7 miles of hiking trails near Austin, TX.

name: The Tammany Trace
description: The Tammany Trace features 31 miles of hiking trails near Mandeville, LA.

name: Pedernales Falls State Park
description: The park is a favorite for family hikes, with a duck pond, a quarter-mile nature trail to a scenic overlook of Twin Falls, and a wheelchair-friendly wildlife-viewing station. The easy, 7-mile Wolf Mountain Trail wraps around Tobacco and Wolf Mountains, winding along the small canyons created by Mescal and Tobacco creeks. Stop to cool your heels at Arrowhead Pool, where Bee Creek spills into stair-stepped pools.

name: Somerville Lake
description: Nearby points of interest include Bluebonnet Trails, Independence Day Trek and Salt Grass Trek.

name: Wild Basin Wilderness Preserve
description: Trails: Accessible every day from light to dark. Trail maps are available in the office. A self-guided tour of the easy access trail, The Trail of Old Time Texas, is available for $1.00.

name: Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway
description: Lake Somerville State Park and Trailway offers some of the best outdoor adventures for water lovers and trail lovers as well! This park offers boating, fishing, hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, swimming and camping for visitors!

name: Dottie Jordan Park
description: Dottie Jordan Park boasts 11 acres right near downtown Austin. It is more geared toward family activities with barbeque pits, basketball courts, picnic tables, playgrounds, a swimming pool, and tennis courts. It does have about .4 miles of trail, and locals are working on improving and extending those trails.

name: Gar Pond Track
description: Gar Pond Track features 6 miles of hiking trails near White Springs, FL.

name: Gulf Islands National Seashore
description:
There are miles of hiking opportunities throughout the Gulf Islands National Seashore. In the Florida District there are over 35 miles of designated trails and in the Mississippi District at Davis Bayou there are 2 miles of trails. In addition you can walk miles on the beautiful white sandy beaches. <br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Bridge to Bridge
description: Bridge to Bridge features 5 miles of hiking trails near White Springs, FL.

name: Fosters Hammock
description: Fosters Hammock  features 8 miles of hiking trails near White Springs, FL.

name: Grayton Beach Recreational Park

name: Fontainebleau State Park

name: Commons Ford Ranch Metropolitan Park
description:
Commons Ford Ranch Metropolitan Park covers 215 acres of land in Austin, Texas. The park is open Tuesday-Sunday from 1 p.m.- 6 p.m.

There are 3 miles of trail that wind throughout this park. Passing picnic areas and volleyball courts, the trails lead through the park and along the lake. There are two trails in total, one features waterfalls and the other offers beautiful lake views. Take a leisurely walk or take a run on these well-maintained paths.

name: Longleaf Pine Greenway Trail

name: Big Shoals State Forest- Big Shoals

This trail is also unique for Florida because of its taverns, rare ravine system and slope forest. It is mostly forested and features a narrow winding trail that follows the river. There are no restroom facilities or water access for this trail.

name: Emma Long Motocross Park
description: Emma Long Motocross Park features 6 miles of hiking trails near Austin, TX.

name: St. Marks Trail

name: Reimers Ranch Park

name: Tickfaw State Park
description: Tickfaw State Park is composed of miles of boardwalks, hardwood forests and the Tickfaw River. This park offers well-known rental cabins with excellent views, a gift shop and rental canoes. There is also a water playground on the property. There are four hiking trails for a mild saunter or a brisk hike. The hiking trails equal about 5 miles in length when combined.

name: Bull Creek Greenbelt Lower
description: The key feature of the greenbelt is a 3.5 mile hike and bike trail built and maintained entirely by the Bull Creek Foundation, an all-volunteer affiliate of the Austin Parks Foundation.

name: Stillhouse Hollow Nature
description: The Preserve's paved trail winds through a magical landscape of moss-covered junipers. Visitors are asked to stay on the trail, as the area is home to endangered plants and birds.

name: Munson Hills

name: Shepard State Park
description:
Shepard State Park is next to the Pascagoula River in the 'heart of the Singing River country.' It was once the home of the Pascagoula Indian Nation. Camping, hiking, picnicking, soccer, field sporting, disc golfing and boating are all popular here.

Eight miles of nature trails are available for hiking through the true beauty of the area.

name: Mansfield Dam Park
description: Excellent hiking trail.

name: Suwannee River State Park
description: Suwannee River State Park is located near the junction where the Withlacoochee River joins the Suwannee. The park is home to several great hiking trails.

name: Timucuan Ecological and Historic National Preserve
description:
It is time to take a hike! Trails in the Timucuan Preserve take you through shady hammocks and along pristine beaches. You can walk along the paths used by Timucuan Indians, or along the roads that enslaved men, women, and children walked to the fields. While hiking, you'll experience the beauty of the rivers and salt marshes. Choose a link and learn more about where a hike in the Preserve can take you<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Gulf Islands National Seashore
description:
Whether you visit the Seashore for a day or a week there are many activities and places to explore. Activities include swimming, bicycling, snorkeling, fishing, hiking, beach combing, wildlife watching, boating, developed camping, and primitive camping.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Walnut Creek Trails
description: Walnut Creek Trails features 15 miles of hiking trails near Austin, TX.

name: Cary State Forest / Nature Trail
description: The 1.25 mile Nature Trail at Cary State Forest winds and twists through scenic flatwoods, cypress swamp and includes a boardwalk that takes hikers across the wetlands. This trail is marked with yellow blazes. The Nature Trail boardwalk is dedicated to the memory of Lee and Mimi Adams, whose memorial funds were donated by their estate for the construction of the boardwalk. The Nature Trail at Cary State Forest is included in the Florida Forest Service's Trailwalker Program. Information on this hiking program is available at the trailhead kiosk on Pavilion Road, the forest headquarters, our website or by telephoning 850/414-0871.

name: Arkansas Bend Park
description: Beautiful trails.

name: Crooked Creek Bike Trail
description: Crooked Creek Bike Trail features 9 miles of hiking trails near Panama City, FL.

name: Schroeter Park
description: Schroeter features a large wildflower area in the spring. Neighbors have installed solar trail lights on the short wooded trail, and conduct regular cleanup events. Amenities include barbeque pits, basketball courts, picnic shelters/tables, a playground and a mile of trails.

name: Hippie Hollow Park
description: Beautiful hiking area.

name: Northeast Metropolitan Park
description: A two mile concrete sidewalk follows along Gilleland Creek in the park, making it ideal for biking, jogging, or walking while observing nature.

name: Northwest Balcones Park
description:
Northwest Balcones Park is a 6 acre park located in the northern suburbs of Austin. This park is mainly a traditional neighborhood park. It has barbeque pits, basketball courts, multipurpose fields, picnic shelters, and a playground. Although its main purpose serves as a place for recreation fields and picnic areas it does have a 1 mile trail.

The 1 mile trail loops around half of the park and looks out upon open fields. It's the perfect place to get out and stretch your legs a little.

name: Cadilac
description: Cadilac features 7 miles of hiking trails near Tallahassee, FL.

name: Pace Bend Park
description: Pace Bend Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near Lake Travis, TX.

name: Fort Braden
description: There are three loop trails, each about 3 miles. They're located in the Lake Talquin State Forest and are all part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. Each one has a portion of the trail which follows the lake. There's plenty of overhead canopy for shade.

name: Tom Brown / Lafayette Heritage Park

name: Atchafalaya Basin
description: Various hiking trails in the area.

name: Big Thicket National Preserve
description:
There are eight trails in the Preserve, ranging from several å_-mile loops to an 18-mile loop. Some are wheelchair-accessible. High temperatures and humidity during the summer can make hiking very unpleasant; hike only during the early morning or late afternoon hours during the summer to avoid the worst of these conditions. Some trails are closed to hikers and backpackers during hunting season.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Sandy Creek Park

name: Miccosukee Canopy Road Greenway

name: Timberlake
description: Timberlake features 10 miles of hiking trails near Fort Walton Beach, FL.

name: Muleshoe Bend LCRA
description: Muleshoe Bend LCRA features 7 miles of hiking trails near Spicewood, TX.

name: Enchanted Rock State Natural Area
description: Great trails! Climb to the top is very well worth it!

name: High Bridge Trail
description: High Bridge Trail is ideally suited for hiking, bicycling and horseback riding. Once a rail bed, the trail is wide, level and generally flat. Its surface is finely crushed limestone, making it easy for everyone to enjoy. Its centerpiece, the majestic High Bridge, is more than 2,400 feet long and 125 feet above the Appomattox River. It is the longest recreational bridge in Virginia and among the longest in the United States. Bring plenty of drinking water because it's not available on the trail. Access points: Use municipal parking lots in Farmville. Others are at River Road in Cumberland County; Osborne Road in Farmville; Heights School Road in Prince Edward County; and at Rice, Tuggle and Prospect. Horse trailer parking is available at Prospect, Osborne Road and Heights School Road.

name: Comite Trails
description: Comite Trails features 5 miles of hiking trails near Baton Rouge, LA.

name: Redbug
description: Redbug features 6 miles of hiking trails near Tallahassee, FL.

name: Elinor Klapp-phipps Park Trails
description: Elinor Klapp-phipps Park Trails features 12 miles of hiking trails near Tallahassee, FL.

name: UWF Mountain Bike Trails
description: UWF Mountain Bike Trails features 6 miles of hiking trails near Pensacola, FL.

name: Fort Davis National Historic Site
description:
Take a hike. Trails lead to a spectacular overlook of the fort and connect with trails of Davis Mountains State Park.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Davis Mountains State Park
description: Beautiful hiking here!

name: Huntsville State Park
description: Huntsville State Park features 0 miles of hiking trails near Huntsville, TX.

name: Lake Georgetown
description: Georgetown Lake is easily accessible from the Austin area which makes it a great outdoor destination for city dwellers! This lake covers a little over 2 square miles and has opportunities for hiking, swimming, boating, canoeing, kayaking, fishing and camping.

name: Rock Hollow Park
description: Paved walking/jogging path.

name: Usa
description: Usa features 9 miles of hiking trails near Mobile, AL.

name: Granger Lake
description: Hiking trails in Taylor recreation area.

name: Ft. Clinch State Park
description: Ft. Clinch State Park features 6 miles of hiking trails near Fernandina Beach, FL.

name: Lake Seminole
description: Lake Seminole holds over 37,500 acres of water and has over 18,000 acres of surrounding land. It borders both Georgia and Florida and sits in the heart of Chattahoochee. Recreational opportunities here include mountain biking, hiking, swimming, boating, canoeing, kayaking, fishing and camping.

name: Cumberland Island National Seashore
description:
A total of 50 miles of hiking trails meander through maritime forests, interior wetlands, historic districts, marsh ecosystems, and the beautiful beaches.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Inks Lake State Park
description: Excellent hiking opportunities.

name: Chicot State Park
description: Chicot State Park features 23 miles of hiking trails near Outside Ville Platte, LA.

name: Bogue Chitto State Park
description: Beautiful trails. You have beach, swamp,  boardwalk and gorge views all within the same trail groupings.

name: Chickasabogue Park
description: Chickasabogue Park features 14 miles of hiking trails near Mobile, AL.

name: Seminole State Park
description: Hiking - 2.2-mile Gopher Tortoise Nature Trail

name: Chicot State Park
description:
The 6,400-acre Chicot State Park encompasses rolling hills and the Lake Chicot. The beautiful park provides excellent opportunities for fishing, hiking, backpacking, camping and picnicking. There are also playgrounds on the property for children to enjoy. The park also offers rentable cabins and boats, as well as a swimming pool for your convenience.

The hiking trails on the property include a 20 mile backpacking trail that encircles the lake and a smaller eight mile hike for those who are looking for a shorter trip. Mountain biking is also permitted on the trails.

name: Stephen C. Foster State Park
description: Walking -- 1.5-mile Trembling Earth and 1.5-mile Pine Upland nature trails are temporarily closed

name: Crooked River State Park
description: Located on southern tip of Georgia's Colonial Coast, this park is the perfect spot for enjoying the intracoastal waterway and maritime forest.  Campsites are surrounded by palmettos and Spanish moss-draped oaks, while cottages are set near the tidal river.  A boat ramp is popular with anglers who often take to the water before sunrise.  Just down the road is the ferry to famous Cumberland Island National Seashore known for secluded beaches and wild horses.

name: Martin Dies, Jr. State Park
description: Martin Dies, Jr. State Park is rich in scenery and wildlife for visitors to enjoy. Paddling down the river is a favorite here but other activities include hiking, boating, fishing, swimming, mountain biking and camping.

name: Town Bluff Dam B.A. Steinhagen Lake
description: Points of interest in this majestic "Big Thicket" region of Texas include four National Forests and an Indian Reservation.

name: Langdale Park Trail System
description: Langdale Park Trail System features 8 miles of hiking trails near Valdosta, GA.

name: Florala State Park
description: Stretching along the shores of beautiful 500-acre Lake Jackson, this compact 40-acre park offers a 1.4 mile bicycle/pedestrian trail that runs the entire length of the park.

name: Dana Peak
description: Dana Peak features 7 miles of hiking trails near Harker Heights, TX.

name: Bryson Park
description: The 72-acre Bryson Park near Lilburn, GA is a very popular recreation area. The park offers a multi-purpose football field with a lighted track for walking, two youth soccer fields, a sand volleyball court, basketball courts and a half mile paved multi-purpose trail.

name: Stillhouse Hollow Lake
description: Some trails connect with other area parks.

name: Belton Lake
description: Historical sites include the old "Charter Oak" on the Leon River, near the City of Belton, and the Stage Coach Inn in nearby Salado. Tour Miller Springs Nature Area located below Belton Dam. The nature area includes a hiking trail along the Leon River, a restored historic bridge, and several wildlife-viewing points. Belton Lake is located adjacent to the Fort Hood Army Base, which has several points of interest for the military buff. The mural painted on the spillway wall of Belton Dam depicts the history of the Bell County area.

name: Laura S. Walker State Park
description: Located near the northern edge of the mysterious Okefenokee Swamp, this park is home to many fascinating creatures and plants, including alligators and carnivorous pitcher plants. Walking or biking along the lake's edge and nature trail, visitors may spot the shy gopher tortoise, numerous oak varieties, saw palmettos, yellow shafted flickers, warblers, owls and great blue herons. The park's lake offers opportunities for fishing, skiing and boating, and canoes and bicycles are available for rent.  The park's namesake was a Georgia writer, teacher, civic leader and naturalist who loved trees and worked for their preservation.

name: Paul B Johnson State Park
description:
Paul B. Johnson State Park is located in Mississippi's pine belt region. The tree-scape of this park is very unique and beautiful. The park's attraction include an exciting splash pad, great fishing, swimming and boating, hiking, camping, water skiing, picnicking, disc golfing and two playing fields for football.

A nature trail that takes visitors through the southern pines is available for hikers.

name: Reed Bingham State Park
description: Visitors to this pretty park usually see abundant wildlife, including species such as gopher tortoises, spotted turtles, limpkins, indigo snakes and nesting bald eagles. American alligators are often seen sunning along the lake's edge. During winter, thousands of "buzzards," actually black vultures and turkey vultures, roost in the trees and soar overhead. Nearly 80 percent of the Coastal Plain's plant community can be found along the park's Coastal Plain Nature Trail, making this park's habitat some of the most diverse in the country.

name: Blythe Island
description: Blythe Island features 4 miles of hiking trails near Brunswick, GA.

name: Fort Boggy State Park
description: Wonderful trails.

name: South Toledo Bend State Park
description:
South Toledo Bend State Park is located on several small bluffs that offer a scenic view of the Toledo Bend Reservoir. The lake is known for its bass fishing tournaments and other fishing opportunities.

Hiking, cycling, birding and camping are also pleasant activities at this beautiful location. The park offers picnic facilities, rental cabins, rental campsites, a conference room and two hiking trails. The hiking trails equal two miles when combined and can also be used for cyclers.

name: Wild Azalea Trail
description: Wild Azalea Trail features 0 miles of hiking trails near Alexandria, LA.

name: George W. Andrews Lake
description: Lake George W. Andrews is named for George William Andrews, who was born in Clayton, Alabama in 1906 and served as a United States Representative from 1944 until his death in 1971. The project was originally named the Columbia Lock and Dam and was renamed for Congressman Andrews in 1972. Lake George W. Andrews day use parks include: Abbie Creek Park and West Bank Park located on the Alabama side, and Coheelee Creek Park located on the Georgia side.

name: Kincaid Lakshore Trail
description: Kincaid Lakshore Trail features 7 miles of hiking trails near Alexandria, LA.

name: Frank Jackson State Park
description: A boardwalk/bridge leading from the boat ramp/parking area to the island, is one of the many unique features at Frank Jackson State Park. A short walking trail loops around the island, which provides limited access to the shoreline. An educational kiosk is located at the trail entrance and provides information on birds and small mammals, which may be seen in the park. Entry fees: $0.50 per child/senior, $1 per adult.

name: Mother Neff State Park
description: Great hiking area.

name: Fort Rucker
description: Fort Rucker Mtb Trails features 11 miles of hiking trails near Fort Rucker, AL.

name: Arizona Trail
description: The Arizona Trail is an 800  mile long distance trail that runs the entire length of Arizona. It connects many different natural features including many mountain ranges, deserts, forests, canyons, other trial systems, historic sites, and more. Unlike many long distance trails, the AZT is open to mountain bikers as well as hikers, backpackers, and equestrians.

name: Longleaf Trace  Mountain Bike
description: Longleaf Trace  Mountain Bike features 7 miles of hiking trails near Hattiesburg, MS.

name: Coronado National Memorial
description:
With over eight miles of hiking trails, Coronado National Memorial is a great place to explore the outdoors. <br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Buffalo Bayou - Addicks Dam
description: Buffalo Bayou - Addicks Dam contains the largest municipal park in the nation. Because of this, it provides a very unique place for recreation for people who live in metropolitan areas. Activities here include hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding and trail running.

name: Parker Canyon Lake Perimeter (pclp)
description: Parker Canyon Lake Perimeter (pclp) features 5 miles of hiking trails near Sierra Vista, AZ.

name: Clear Springs Rec. Area
description: Clear Springs Rec. Area features 12 miles of hiking trails near Crosby, MS.

name: Cypress Bend Resort
description: Cypress Bend Resort features 6 miles of hiking trails near Many, LA.

name: Palominas Area Trail
description: This section of the river is usually dry in the summer, until summer monsoons replenish its banks. The roots of the larger cottonwood and willow trees are deep enough to reach the ground water, enabling them to survive the dry seasons and provide valuable habitat for a variety of species. This is the southern most section of the San Pedro Riparian National Conservation Area (NCA).

name: San Pedro House Trails
description: The San Pedro Trail is a long distance trail that parallels the river though most of the San Pedro Riparian National Conservation Area. When completed, it will be approximately 30 miles long. Two trail sections can be accessed from the San Pedro House. There is also a shorter interpretive loop trail.

name: Hereford Bridge Trail
description:
The Hereford Bridge Trail is a portion of the long-distance San Pedro Trail offering visitors a diverse experience while traveling adjacent to the San Pedro River and into the San Pedro Riparian National Conservation Area. A delight to the senses, the diversity of birds, vegetation, and landscape features, will make this trip a journey worth savoring. Adjacent to the grasslands, the Fremont cottonwood-Goodding willow riparian forest is the most extensive riparian ecosystem remaining in the southwest. The BLM has protected this riparian habitat and the wildlife communities that thrive here, along with enhancing the opportunities for recreation, cultural interpretation, and education.

It is possible to hike from the Hereford Bridge all the way to the San Pedro House which is about ten miles along the river. A loop hike is possible by walking the old road bed north to Hunter Wash, then east to the river and back south back to Hereford Bridge. The total distance of the loop is about eight miles.

name: Brown Canyon
description: Brown Canyon features 6 miles of hiking trails near Sierra Vista, AZ.

name: Kolomoki Mounds Historic Park
description: The Spruce Pine Trail offers views of lakes Yahola and Kolomoki, while the Trillium Trail meanders through the forest.

name: San Angelo Trail
description: San Angelo Trail features 20 miles of hiking trails near San Angelo, TX.

name: Sonoita Creek State Natural Area
description: Twenty miles of trails are available for hiking and eight miles of trails are shared with equestrians.  A 1.5 mile hike of moderate difficulty called the "Overlook Trail" is close to Patagonia Lake State Park and is a great way to see 360 degrees of spectacular scenery. Most of the trails are more remote and the shortest round trip hike to the creek is three miles on the Sonoita Creek Trail.

name: Patagonia Lake State Park
description: Patagonia Lake offers a .5-mile hiking trail that leads to Sonoita Creek and is a very popular birding area. Additional trails can be accessed through Sonoita Creek State Natural Area.

name: CDT NM01: Mexico Border to NM Hwy 81
description:
The first section of the Continental Divide Trail runs 25.6 miles from the Mexican Border to NM Hwy 81. Along the way the trail passes New Well Peak, Bugle Ridge, Big Hatchet Peak, and Zeller Peak.<br />
<br />
The Continental Divide Trail is 3,100 miles long, stretching from Mexico to Canada and roughly following the continental divide. It is a part of the Triple Crown of long distance hiking trails in the US, along with the Pacific Crest Trail and Appalachian Trail. It is still under construction, so sections of it are constantly changing. The information posted here on Tripleblaze is the most up-to-date available, but these trail descriptions and GPS locations may become obsolete at some point in the future. If you notice any obsolete information, always feel free to post a review with the new info!<br />
<br />
Whenever possible, the Google Maps location given for each section of trail will be for the most southern point. All sections are numbered in a south-to-north fashion.

name: General Coffee State Park
description: 4-mile nature trail and wetland boardwalk

name: Huachuca Canyon
description: Huachuca Canyon features 10 miles of hiking trails near Ft. Huachuca, AZ.

name: Murray Springs Clovis Site Trail
description:
The Murray Springs Interpretive Trail is 1/3-mile-long loop, and offers 10 exhibits on life in the late Ice Age (Pleistocene). Benches and shade structures are located intermittently along the trail. There is no drinking water available along the trail, so make sure you pack your own.

There is also another trail heading east from the Murray Springs Site parking lot, along the abandoned Fort Huachuca-to-Lewis Springs railroad line. This trail is maintained for 1.8 miles, up to the intersection with the San Pedro Trail. From that intersection, you can still follow the abandoned railroad grade east for another 2.2 miles to the San Pedro River. You can also hike, bike, or ride north and south on the San Pedro Trail to several other points of interest.

name: Mission Tejas State Park
description: Three hundred years of history await visitors of the Mission Tejas State Park. The natural beauty of the East Texas Pineywoods offer great views and make for lovely hiking. Other activities here include fishing and camping.

name: San Pedro House Miller Backcountry Camp
description: San Pedro House Miller Backcountry Camp features 8 miles of hiking trails near Bisbee, AZ.

name: San Pedro House To Hereford And Back
description: San Pedro House To Hereford And Back features 18 miles of hiking trails near Bisbee, AZ.

name: North Toledo Bend State Park
description:
North Toledo Bend State Park is home to one of the country's largest man-made reservoirs. More than 900 land acres are available for your camping, hiking, picnicking and relaxing purposes. The water, of course, is great for fishing and swimming. The park features a boat launch, a fish cleaning station, boat rentals, hiking trails and cabin rentals.

Nearby are entrances to two hiking/biking trails - a 1.5-mile loop and a more demanding 4-mile loop.

name: Waco Lake
description: Trails located at Bosque Park and Reynolds Creek Park.

name: TumacÌÁcori National Historical Park
description:
The Juan Bautista de Anza National Historic Trail passes through the park, providing opportunities for walkers, bird watchers, and equestrians. A free informational trail map for the popular 4.5 mile stretch of trail between TumacÌÁcori and Tubac is available in the visitor center.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Fort Parker State Park
description: Great hiking.

name: Flint River Trail
description: Flint River Trail is a 9 mile hiking trail in Albany, Georgia.

name: Cameron Park
description: Cameron Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near Waco, TX.

name: Natchez State Park
description:
Natchez State Park is a convenient park located very close to a variety of attraction including several antebellum homes, the Grand Village of the Natchez Indians, the Old South Winery, several golf courses, the Natchez Trace Parkway, Homochitto National Forest and the Mississippi River. Camping is a very popular activity here, as well as picnicking, hiking, boating, fishing and disc golfing.

A nature trail on the property and two miles of a logging road are available for multi-use purposes including hiking. Scenic views.

name: Tubac Presidio State Historic Park
description: Tubac Presidio serves as trailhead for a 4.5-mile section of the Anza Trail which leads to TumacÌÁcori National Historical Park and crosses the Santa Cruz River twice. Please call ahead for trail conditions.

name: Claiborne Lake
description: Trails in Bells Landing, Haines Island, Holleys Ferry, Isaac Creek, and Silver Creek areas.

name: Raider Trails
description: Raider Trails is a 8 mile hiking trail in Nacogdoches, Texas.

name: Mt. Zion Bike Trails
description: Mt. Zion Bike Trails features 7 miles of hiking trails near Brookhaven, MS.

name: Monahans Sandhills State Park
description: Unique hiking area. Sand toboggans and disks, for "surfing" on the sand dunes, can be rented at park headquarters.

name: George T. Bagby State Park and Lodge
description: Located in southwest Georgia on the shores of Lake Walter F. George (also known as Lake Eufaula), this resort park features a 60-room lodge, conference center and cottages. The Pilot House Grill Restaurant provides a courtesy dock for boaters who want to enjoy meals in the park, and the conference center is an affordable setting for weddings, reunions, meetings and retreats.  When the park's championship Meadow Links Golf Course opened, Golf Digest magazine ranked it the "6th best new affordable public course" in the country.

name: Airstrip Group Site and Trail
description: The Airstrip Group Site is one of several recreation sites in Las Cienegas National Conservation Area (NCA). This 15-acre, former dirt airstrip is nestled in mesquite trees and open grassland and offers diverse recreation opportunities such as horseback riding and bird-dog trials.

name: Providence Canyon State Outdoor Recreation Area
description: Little Grand Canyon in Lumpkin, Georgia

name: Gardner Canyon
description: Gardner Canyon features 14 miles of hiking trails near Sonoita, AZ.

name: Kentucky Camp
description: Kentucky Camp features 6 miles of hiking trails near Sonoita, AZ.

name: Fairbank Loop Trail
description: Fairbank Loop Trail features 6 miles of hiking trails near Tombstone, AZ.

name: Fairbank Ghost Town To Boston Mill
description: Fairbank Ghost Town To Boston Mill features 8 miles of hiking trails near Tombstone, AZ.

name: CDT NM02: NM Hwy 81 to NM Hwy 9
description: Section 2 of the Continental Divide Trail runs 19.6 miles from New Mexico Highway 81 to New Mexico Highway 9. Along the way the trail passes Hachita Peak, Howells Ridge East, Beacon Hill, and several gravel roads. Small parts of this section follow roads.

name: Presidio Trails
description: Presidio Trails features 8 miles of hiking trails near Tombstone, AZ.

name: Elephant Head
description: Elephant Head features 13 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: Riverpark Trail System
description: The trail begins at the New Mexico state line near Vinton and extends southward for 32 miles to Tornillo, near the Hudspeth County line. Upon completion the trail will touch on the communities of Anthony, Vinton and Canutillo, in the Upper Valley, on the historical central El Paso area and the Valley of the Missions, which features the three oldest missions in the state of Texas.

name: Fairfield Lake State Park
description: Excellent trails.

name: Walter F. George Lake
description: Hiking trails throughout area.

name: Pancho Villa State Park
description: Located at the border of Mexico, the park exhibit hall and historic structures capture the history of the Pancho Villa Raid and historic Camp Furlong. The large campground offers utility hookups for campers with RVs, and a playground for the kids.

name: Kartchner Caverns State Park
description: Hikers should stay on developed trails to prevent erosion, damage to vegetation and personal injury. Please report any problems along the trail or trail damage to the staff at the Front Desk.

name: Lake Brownwood State Park
description: Nice hiking area.

name: Meridian State Park
description: Meridian State Park is home to the 72-acre Lake Meridian and is encircled by a hiking trails. Activities here include fishing, swimming, hiking, mountain biking and camping.

name: Arizona Trail Cienega Corridor
description: Arizona Trail Cienega Corridor features 26 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: Franklin Mountains State Park
description: Franklin Mountain State Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near El Paso, TX.

name: Hueco Tanks State Park & Historic Site
description: Excellent hiking area. Bring water and sunscreen.

name: Navarro Mills Lake
description: Navarro Mills Lake consists of 5,070 acres and has a maximum depth of 49 feet. This park is a popular destination for families outdoor lovers alike. It has recreational opportunities for hiking, swimming, fishing, boating, canoeing, kayaking and camping.

name: Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument
description:
There are miles and miles of trails laced around Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument. Some are easy, others are strenuous, most of them fall somewhere in between. <br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Georgia Veterans State Park
description: Established as a memorial to U.S. veterans, this park features a museum with aircraft (including a Boeing B-29A), armored vehicles, uniforms, weapons, medals and other items from the Revolutionary War through the Gulf War. An 18-hole golf course and pro shop, along with 8,700-acre Lake Blackshear and proximity to I-75, make this one of Georgia's most popular state parks.

name: Skidaway
description: Skidaway features 4 miles of hiking trails near Savannah, GA.

name: CDT NM03: NM Hwy 9 to NM Hwy 113
description: Section 3 of the CDT runs 12.8 miles from NM Hwy 9 to NM Hwy 113. About 50% of this section is trail, and about 50% follows roads. Along the way the trail passes Coyote Peak.

name: Proctor Lake
description: Hiking trails nearby.

name: Lakepoint Resort State Park
description: Complete with modern campsites, wading pool, hiking trails, a barbeque grilling pavilion, plus other large pavilions and picnic areas makes this small park perfect for group-sized cookouts and gatherings. The Park is also located adjacent to the handicapped-accessible, state-operated hunting facility "Turnipseed-Ikenberry Place Physically Disabled Hunting Area".

name: Cienega Creek Natural Preserve
description: The Gabe Zimmerman Davidson Canyon Trailhead parking lot provides access to the Cienega Creek Natural Preserve and Davidson Canyon. This is a 10-car lot. The trailhead is located just off Marsh Station Road. Note: A permit is required to access the preserve. Open dawn to dusk. Details: 520-877-6000 (Pima County). Call (520) 877-6158 for permit information. These permits are free.

name: Chiricahua National Monument
description:
Chiricahua National Monument offers you lots of things to see and do. Between looking for wildlife, birding, tours and hiking you could spend days and days out in nature!<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Lake Whitney State Park
description: Lake Whitney State Park is the state's fourth largest reservoir and has a lot to boast about. Activities here include hiking, mountain biking, boating, swimming, camping and some of the best fishing around.

name: Fort Pulaski National Monument
description:
Outdoor enthusiasts will enjoy exploring several nature trails throughout Fort Pulaski National Monument. Some of the trails include: North Pier Trail, Lighthouse Overlook Trail, Historic Dike System and McQueens Island Rails to Trails.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Backcountry Trail at Providence Canyon State Park
description: 7 mile loop. Allow at least 6 hours. Hiking and camping by permit only. Rated extremely rugged and difficult. Blazed red.                                  The 7-mile Backcountry Trail leads into the forested area off of the White Blaze Canyon Loop Trail. The beginning of it is å_ of a mile down the Loop Trail at the creek bed itself. Instead of turning left into the canyons, turn right on the creek bed. This is the beginning of the Backcountry Trail, which winds through some River Birch. After about two miles, it becomes rugged, ascending a steep grade. It follows an old logging road, where most of the primitive campsites are located. At site #2, a shortcut is available which will shorten the trail about å_ of a mile. Further down the trail, as the trail becomes rugged again, six canyons may be viewed, but they are not accessible to the hikers. The Backcountry Trail will dead-end into the Loop Trail, where hikers will turn right. This will continue through the day use area. Follow the fence line through the picnic area for the best overlooks, returning to the Visitor Center.

name: Canyon Loop Trail at Providence Canyon State Park
description:
2.45 miles. Takes 2 hours but allow extra time to explore. Rated easy to moderate. Blazed white.<br />
The White Blaze Canyon Loop Trail circles nine of the canyons. To hike canyons 1-5 from the Visitor Center, hike å_ of a mile down to the creek bed, and turn left, following the creek bed into the canyons. Hikers may reach canyons 6-9 by turning left into the second creek further down the Canyon Loop Trail. After arriving at the end of each canyon, backtrack out to return to the trail. Turn right on the Canyon Loop Trail to return to the Visitor Center, or turn left on the trail to continue the loop. While hiking through the day-use area, follow the fence line for the best overlooks. The soils are very fragile on the canyon walls, so no climbing is allowed from the canyon floor or rim. While hiking into the canyons, it is best to stay in the middle of the creek beds, because the soils on the side can be very muddy, similar to quicksand. The canyon floors are prone to be wet or muddy, so wear appropriate footwear.

name: CDT NM04: NM Hwy 113 to Hwy 494
description: Section 4 of the CDT runs 25.3 miles from NM Hwy 113 to Hwy 494. Along the way the trail passes Mayfield Ranch Road, Cedar Mountain, Rimrock Mountain, Pyramid Peak, the Leitendorf Hills, and Co. Rd. A009. Much of this section is actual trail, but a few large chunks of it are road.

name: Tom Triplet
description: Tom Triplet features 5 miles of hiking trails near Pooler, GA.

name: Little Ocmulgee State Park and Lodge
description: Nice area for hiking.

name: Clarkco State Park
description: A well-marked, five mile nature trail encircles Clarkco State Park, affording a close look at Mississippi flora and fauna. The trail is sectioned for shorter walks of less than a half-mile. There is an observation tower at the uppper end of the lake.  Bicylces are permitted as long as they yeild to foot traffic.

name: William Dannelly Reservoir
description: Excellent trails in the area.

name: Carlsbad Caverns National Park
description: The caverns offer at least 3 miles of underground hiking on paved trails through the tastefully lighted cavern.  The park also offers optional guided tours ranging from mild to wild and can be booked in advance.  Limited hiking opportunities above ground in the park through high desert terrain.

name: Robles Pass
description: Robles Pass features 10 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: Saguaro National Park
description:
An overnight trip into Saguaro's wilderness can take you from 3,000' elevation to over 8,000' in about 15 miles. Hikes may be started from any of five trailheads ranging from the easy-to-access Douglas Spring Trailhead at the east end of Speedway Boulevard to the more remote Italian Spring Trailhead accessed through Reddington Pass on the adjacent Coronado National Forest.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Rockhound State Park
description: Good trails including a nature walk.

name: Tucson Mountain Park
description: Tucson Mountain Park features 1 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: Maternity Well Group Site and Trails
description: Excellent trails.

name: Pickney Island
description: Flat, wide, and sandy - but shaded and beautiful. This is a great place to see wildlife or to just relax during vacation to nearby Hilton Head Island. You'll rarely see many folks out here - it's still a pretty well kept secret.

name: Cactus Forest Trail
description: Cactus Forest Trail features 3 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: Solavaca
description: Solavaca features 8 miles of hiking trails near Glen Rose, TX.

name: Dinosaur Valley State Park
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Mesilla Valley Bosque State  Park
description: Nature & interpretive trails; ADA accessible

name: The Monkey Trail
description: The Monkey Trail features 10 miles of hiking trails near Shreveport, LA.

name: Bardwell Lake
description: Excellent trails.

name: Martin Creek Lake State Park
description: Martin Creek Lake State Park is a wonderful place for year-round fun in the sun. Activities include fishing, boating, swimming, hiking and camping.

name: Sweetwater Preserve
description: Sweetwater Preserve features 10 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: Agua Caliente Park
description: Excellent hiking trails.

name: Pecos River Corridor Recreation Area
description: The Pecos River Corridor Recreation Area includes 6,000 acres of land with access to the Pecos River and areas surrounding the Red Bluff Reservoir. This area provides opportunity for water-based recreation and semi-primitive motorized recreation. A public access boat ramp is on the New Mexico side of Red Bluff Reservoir.

name: A Mountain Trail
description: A Mountain Trail features 5 miles of hiking trails near Las Cruces, NM.

name: AZT/ATV
description: Atv/azt features 10 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: Lindsey Park
description: Lindsey Park  is a 9 mile hiking trail in Tyler,tx, Texas.

name: Butts Park
description: Butts Park features 6 miles of hiking trails near Clinton, MS.

name: Aguirre Spring Campground
description: Two national recreation trails start at the campground. The Baylor Pass Trail has its eastern end at the campground. This is a one-way trail of six miles, which will take you to the Baylor Canyon Road on the west side of the mountains. The Pine Tree Trail is a four-mile loop that climbs to the base of the Organ Needles, in Ponderosa Pine habitat. Both trails provide spectacular views of the Organ Mountains and the Tularosa Basin. The Baylor Pass Trail is open to hiking and equestrian use. The Pine Tree Trail is open to hiking only.

name: Soledad Canyon Day Use Area
description:
Activities
The Bar Canyon Trail is open to non-motorized uses, including hiking, mountain biking, and horseback riding. It is also used for wildlife viewing.

name: Picacho Peak Recreation Area
description: Excellent trails.

name: Sierra Vista Trail
description: The Sierra Vista Trail is a 29-mile National Recreation Trail.  It is a nonmotorized recreation trail along the western flank of the Organ Mountains and the eastern side of the Franklin Mountains.  The trail provides spectacular views of the mountains, which jut majestically above the desert floor.  It is also possible to see wildlife, including mule deer and coyotes, along the trail.  The trail connects to the Franklin Mountain State Park Trail system in Texas, and it is used primarily by mountain bikers. While most of the trail is on gravelly uplands, some of the middle sections near Vado are very sandy and difficult for mountain bikes.  There are also rugged rocky sections where suspension is desirable on mountain bikes.

name: CDT NM05: Hwy 494 to Burrow Peak trailhead
description: Section 5 of the CDT runs 32.6 miles from Hwy 494 to the Burrow Peak trailhead. The majority of this section is actual trail, but there are a few sections of road. Along the way, the trail passes the city of Lordsburg, Hwy 70/I-10, Hwy 90, Walker Mountain, Gold Hill, Hornbrook Mountain, and Hwy 90 again.

name: Lake Colorado City State Park
description: Beautiful area to hike.

name: Dripping Springs Natural Area
description: The Dripping Springs Natural Area has over four miles of easy hiking trails, including the Dripping Springs Trail, which shows off desert scrub and low elevation pinon-juniper and oak woodlands. The area also boasts excellent wildlife viewing opportunities, including excellent year-round viewing of red-tailed hawk, Gambel's quail, golden eagle and rock squirrel. It offers very good year-round viewing of desert mule deer and coyote. Also watch for black-throated sparrow, ladder-backed woodpecker, verdin, black-tailed gnatcatcher, lesser nighthawk, Scott's oriole, cactus wren, desert cottontail, and collared and tree lizard in the spring and summer. Finally, there are occasional sightings of mountain lion.

name: Lefleur's Bluff State Park
description:
LeFleurs Bluff State Park is an urban park in Jackson, Mississippi. The park offers a great variety of recreational activities only a few miles from the hustle and bustle of the city. The 305-acre park offers a nine-hole golf course, a driving range, a disc golf course, camping opportunities, excellent fishing, picnicking and a few nature trails.

The nature trails at the park equal about two miles when combined. They take you throughout the park and along the river, lakes and swamplands.

name: Milagrosa / Molino Basin
description: Molino Basin features 8 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: Hunting Island Trail
description: Hunting Island Trail features 5 miles of hiking trails near Beaufort, SC.

name: Prehistoric Trackways National Monument
description:
The Prehistoric Trackways National Monument was established in 2009 to conserve, protect, and enhance the unique and nationally important paleontological, scientific, educational, scenic, and recreational resources and values of the Robledo Mountains in southern New Mexico. The Monument includes a major deposit of Paleozoic Era fossilized footprint megatrackways within approximately 5,280 acres.
The Prehistoric Trackways National Monument is located at an elevation of about 4,500 feet above sea level in the Robledo Mountains north of Las Cruces. This is a desert area in a series of canyons cut into the steep mountains, dominated by creosote. Rainfall averages 8.5 inches annually, with most coming during July, August, and September. Thunderstorms are a common occurrence and lightning poses a hazard to hikers. Average temperatures range from highs in the 90's to lows in the 20's. In warmer weather rattlesnakes are sometimes sighted in the canyons or heard under rocks so please be alert.
There are opportunities for hiking, horseback riding, and off highway vehicle driving in portions of the monument. However, viewing trackways is limited; as they are discovered, and to preserve them for ongoing and future scientific study, the trackways are removed and transported to the New Mexico Museum of Natural History and Science.

name: Gila Lower Box Canyon
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Bonita Lakes
description: Bonita Lakes features 8 miles of hiking trails near Meridian, MS.

name: Ft. Benning Fitness Trail
description: Ft. Benning Fitness Trail features 5 miles of hiking trails near Fort Benning, GA.

name: Purtis Creek State Park
description: Great trails.

name: Hunting Island State Park
description: The Island Bike/Hike trail is 8 miles long and is open to both hiking and biking.

name: Peckerwood Flats
description: Peckerwood Flats features 5 miles of hiking trails near Marana, AZ.

name: La Cueva
description: La Cueva features 22 miles of hiking trails near Carlsbad, NM.

name: Bug Springs
description: Bug Springs features 8 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: Naranja Park--Oro Valley
description: Naranja Park--Oro Valley features 8 miles of hiking trails near Oro Valley, AZ.

name: R.E. Bob Woodruff Lake
description: Woodruff Lake offers such activities as fishing, boating, water-skiing, picnicking, camping, swimming and hiking. The project features 11 parks that are well-facilitated for visitors. Conveniences at the parks include beaches, campgrounds, picnic areas, trails and boat launching ramps. Since construction of the first park in 1975, annual attendance figures have soared to over 2 million.

name: Catalina State Park
description: Hiking, horseback riding and bicycling on the trails are popular activities, with eight trails varying in length and difficulty. Leashed dogs are welcome on all trails. All trails are multi-use except Romero Ruin. Free trail guide available at Visitor Center.

name: Upper Coyote Wash
description: Upper Coyote Wash features 10 miles of hiking trails near Oro Valley, AZ.

name: Tortolita Preserve
description: Dove Mountain features 12 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: Tortolita Preserve
description: Tortolita Preserve features 9 miles of hiking trails near Marana, AZ.

name: Lake Bistineau State Park
description: This state park is situated on the western shore of Lake Bistineau. The property's lake provides wonderful boating and fishing opportunities. The beautiful views of open waters mixed woodlands make for an excellent location for a hike, camp out or swim. The playground and swimming pool are excellent areas to keep children entertained while you relax in the  peaceful park. The park offers seven rentable cabins and 61 campsites, some with water and electric hookups. The park also has 10 miles of great hiking trails.

name: Living Desert Zoo & Gardens State Park
description: Nature & interpretive trails, ADA accessible

name: Aspen Draw
description: Aspen Draw features 3 miles of hiking trails near Tucson, AZ.

name: The Ridgeland Trails
description: The Ridgeland Trails features 6 miles of hiking trails near Ridgeland/madison, MS.

name: Javelina/Mustang/Burro

name: 50-year Trail / Golder Ranch

name: Tyler State Park
