name: Helen Putnam Reginal Park
description: Helen Putnam Reginal Park features 13 miles of hiking trails near Petaluma, CA.

name: Helen Putnam Reginal Park
description: Helen Putnam Reginal Park features 13 miles of hiking trails near Petaluma, CA.

name: Ridgway State Park
description:
Only 15 miles from the town of Ouray, Ridgway's great outdoors - the "Switzerland of America" - welcomes those from near and far. Seven miles of trails connect the north and south ends of the park. About three miles of universally-accessible concrete trails and 11 miles of natural surface trails enable visitors to enjoy the scenery yet remain within easy distance of park facilities. <br />
All trails are open and in good condition. There are 14 miles of trail, open for hiking, biking and general access around the park. The Cookie Tree trail has some slight erosion on the west side of the trail (along the reservoir shoreline) due to the high water level; practice caution, the hazard is clearly marked. All other trails are in great condition. Trail maps are available at our Visitor Center. Enjoy!

name: Grayson Lake
description: Excellent hiking trails throughout area.

name: The Southern Traverse
description: The Southern Traverse features 32 miles of hiking trails near Harrisonburg, VA.

name: Kaskaskia River State Fish & Wildlife Area
description: A 12-mile trail system exists on the site and is used by hunters, hikers, bird watchers and other outdoor enthusiasts. Trails are closed to vehicular traffic. Contact the site office for a trail brochure.

name: CDT CO16: CO Hwy 114 to Sargents Mesa
description: Section 16 of the CDT runs for just over 20 miles from CO Hwy 114 to Sargents Mesa. Along the way the trail passes through some high forests as well as Long Branch Baldy.

name: Carnifex Ferry Battlefield State Park
description: Carnifex Ferry Battlefield State Park features 0 miles of hiking trails near Mt. Nebo, WV.

name: John Redmond Reservoir
description: John Redmond Reservoir was constructed in 1964 by the Army Corps. There is 92,982 acre-feet of water stored in this reservoir so there is plenty to go around! Activities here are hiking, horseback riding, mountain biking, off-roading, boating, swimming, canoeing, kayaking, fishing and camping.

name: South Shore Lake Pueblo
description:
These trails are gorgeous! They follow the rims of the canyons offering stunning views of Lake Pueblo, Pikes Peak, and the Front Range. These trails are perfect for a great workout, and keep your eye out for some wildlife!<br />
Please remember to share the path!

name: Wilderness Loop
description: Wilderness Loop features 2 miles of hiking trails near Louisville, KY.

name: Cherokee Park
description: Cherokee Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Louisville, KY.

name: Appalachian Trail 067: Browns Gap to Simmons Gap
description: This is the 67th section of the Appalachian Trail, and it runs 12 miles through Shenandoah National Park from Browns Gap to Simmons Gap. Along the way it passes the Doyles River Overlook, Doyles River Trailhead, Big Flat Mountain, County Line Mountain, the Ivy Creek Overlook, and Pinefield Hut. The trail roughly follows Skyline Drive.

name: Rockville Park
description: Rockville Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Fairfield, CA.

name: Assateague Island National Seashore
description:
Experience life on a barrier island! Assateague Island has a variety of paved and unpaved trails open for hiking. There are also 37 miles of beach to wander.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: St. Mary's River Park
description: St. Mary's River Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near Lexington Park, MD.

name: Battle of Island Mound State Historic Site
description: Loop trail around the site includes wayside exhibits with information about the battle.

name: Cosumnes River Preserve
description: Excellent hiking trails.

name: Lodi Farm
description: Lodi Farm features 17 miles of hiking trails near Fredericksburg, VA.

name: St Mary's River State Park
description: St. Mary's River State Park is a park that is not well known, but a real treasure. The park is located on the headwaters of the St. Mary's River, and is divided into two sites. This 7.5 mile trail encircles the 250 acre St. Mary's Lake. First time hikers should allow extra time for interesting detours.

name: Falls of the Ohio State Park
description:
175 acres of fossil beds are available for
easy to rugged hiking, when water level is low.

name: Truman Lake Mountain Bike Trails
description: Truman Lake Mountain Bike Trails features 15 miles of hiking trails near Warsaw, MO.

name: Beech Fork State Park
description: Beech Fork State Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near Huntington, WV.

name: Calaveras Big Trees State Park
description: On Saturdays at 1:00pm we offer a guided hike through the North Grove area of the park.  Come enjoy the beauty and grandeur of the park while learning about why this place is so special.  The hike is approximately 1.5 hours long and is open to all family members (except dogs).  The cost is free with paid admission to the park; meet at the Visitor Center and wear appropriate footwear.  For more information, please call the Visitor Center at (209) 795-3840 or (209) 795-7980. Four additional trails offer additional hiking.

name: Harry S Truman State Park
description: Harry S Truman State Park is home to beautiful water, bluffs and woodlands. Fishing, boating, swimming, hiking, picnicking, camping and exploring are all popular here. The park offers two hiking trails that equal three miles in length when combined. The trails take hikers through oak savannas, prairie grassland and to a portion of the 55,600-acre Truman Lake.

name: Napa-skyline Park
description: Napa-skyline Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Napa, CA.

name: Washington County State Recreation Area
description: For an invigorating walk, a seven-mile-long, marked trail is available. This trail circles the lake and hikers can enjoy viewing the majestic trees, beautiful wildflowers or the numerous birds and animals residing in the area.

name: Kanawha State Forest Trails
description: Kanawha State Forest Trails features 0 miles of hiking trails near Charleston, WV.

name: E.P. 'Tom' Sawyer State Park
description: The 1-mile fitness trail is a crushed limestone, level grade trail with 10 exercise stations. The 1.25- mile Goose Creek nature trail meanders through open meadow habitat to a semi-wooded area along Goose Creek. The loop trail is an easy grade trail. This trail is only open to hikers. Bicycles are not allowed on the trail. There is an additional trail near Shelter 3 which leads to the park's vernal pond. Please visit the Recreation Office for an informational guide to the vernal pond. All trails are open year-round. Please stay on main trails to reduce erosion problems in the park.

name: Caperton Swamp
description:
Passive open space
Informal hiking trails

name: CDT CO17: Sargents Mesa to Marshall Pass
description: The CDT runs for 14.5 miles from Sargents Mesa to Marshall Pass. Along the way the trail passes Windy Peak and Headwaters Hill.

name: Capitol Reef National Park
description:
In the Fruita area, there are fifteen day hiking trails with trailheads located along Utah Highway 24 and the Scenic Drive. These trails offer the hiker a wide variety of options, from easy strolls along smooth paths over level ground to strenuous hikes involving steep climbs over uneven terrain near cliff edges. Hikes may take you deep into a narrow gorge, to the top of high cliffs for a bird's eye view of the surrounding area, under a natural stone arch, to historic inscriptions...and much, much more!<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Lion Canyon Loop
description: Lion Canyon Loop is a 15 mile loop trail that takes you through deep forests and highlights gorgeous views of the surrounding mountains. This trail is shared by mountain bikes so please be sure to share the path and practice trail etiquette.

name: Appalachian Trail 068: Simmons Gap to Swift Run Gap (US 33)
description: This section of the AT runs 9.5 miles from Simmons Gap to Swift Run Gap on US Hwy 33 through Shenandoah National Park. Along the way it passes the Hightop Hut and Hightop mountain.

name: Rappahanock River Trail
description: Rappahanock River Trail features 4 miles of hiking trails near Fredericksburg, VA.

name: Seneca State Forest
description: Even the serious hiker will be impressed by 23 miles of challenging forest trails. In addition, the Allegheny Trail winds though the forest, and the adjacent Greenbrier River Trail is accessible from Seneca.

name: Pacific Crest Trail: Northern California: J
description:
Section J of the Pacific Crest Trail runs 76.2 miles from Highway 108 at Sonora Pass to Echo Lake Resort. Almost all of the peaks in this gorgeous section of trail are volcanic in origin, and you can spot old remnants of volcanic flows and volcanic sediments.<br />
<br />
Along the way the trail passes Wolf Creek Lake, Boulder Creek, Golden Lake, Paradise Valley and Golden Canyon Trails, Wolf Creek, Sierra Nevada Crest, Asa Lake, Noble Lake, Highway 4 near Ebbetts Pass, Sherrold Lake, Raymond Meadows Creek, Eagle Creek, Pennsylvania Creek, Raymond Lake, Mokelumne Wilderness, Highway 88, Upper Truckee River, Showers Lake, Bryan Meadow, Benwood Meadow, Road 1N03, and Highway 50 (South Lake Tahoe).

name: Myrtle Point
description: Myrtle Point features 3 miles of hiking trails near California, MD.

name: Caledon Natural Area
description: Ten hiking and four multi-use trailstake park visitors through environmentally sensitive marshlands and picturesque wooded areas of the park. The 2-mile Boyd's Hole Trail leading to the Potomac River is the most popular of the trails.

name: Gauley-bearpen-boundary-shoals-loop
description: Gauley-bearpen-boundary-shoals-loop features 17 miles of hiking trails near Slatyfork, WV.

name: Red Run Trail
description: Red Run Trail features 2 miles of hiking trails near Slatyfork, WV.

name: Tea Creek Mountain Trail
description: Tea Creek Mountain Trail features 5 miles of hiking trails near Slatyfork, WV.

name: Lagoon Valley
description: Lagoon Valley features 10 miles of hiking trails near Vacaville, CA.

name: Stone Lakes National Wildlife Refuge
description: The self-guided hike will take you through managed grasslands and along a riparian zone, where you will end at a wildlife viewing platform overlooking a managed wetland.

name: Beall Woods State Park
description: Five established trails offer hikerd excellent views of Beall Woods' old-growth forest. From the easy 1-mile Tuliptree Trail, which features a self-guided trail brochure, to the 1.25-mile moderately easy White Oak Trail, the nature enthusiast can get a sense of what the settlers saw when they arrived at the banks of the Wabash River.

name: Appalachian Trail 069: Swift Run Gap to Fishers Gap
description:
This section of the Appalachian Trail runs 18.6 miles from Swift Run Gap on US Hwy 33 to Fishers Gap through Shenandoah National Park. Along the way it passes the Bearfence Mountain Shelter, Bootens Gap, Hazeltop, and Milam Gap.<br />
Recommended parking spot: "Bootens Ga" lat=38.4683778493, lon=-78.4574569224

name: Salisbury City Park Trails
description: Salisbury City Park Trails features 8 miles of hiking trails near Salisbury, MD.

name: Greenwell State Park
description: Ten miles of marked trails are open to the public year around. Please note that a portion of the Blue Trail is temporarily closed due to storm damage.

name: Rock Corral Recreation Area
description: Hiking in the area offers truly scenic vistas of the valleys and Mineral Mountains. With a hike to the top of Granite Peak, a person is rewarded with an almost 360 degree view of the valleys and mountains below.

name: Mastodon State Historic Site
description: Three trails take you to the natural and cultural features of the site.

name: Gauley Mountain Trial
description: Gauley Mountain Trial features 5 miles of hiking trails near Slatyfork, WV.

name: Bear Pen (modified) Loop
description: Bear Pen (modified) Loop features 17 miles of hiking trails near Slatyfork, WV.

name: Calvert Cliffs State Park
description: Designated as a wild lands area, 1079 acres of the park are preserved for hiking and nature appreciation. Thirteen miles of marked foot trails are open to the public. Cyclists and equestrians are restricted to the service road. Biking and horseback riding are prohibited on designated wild land trails to prevent further impact.

name: Bee Tree Trails
description: Excellent hiking trails.

name: Naylor Mill Park
description: Naylor Mill Park features 7 miles of hiking trails near Salisbury/ Delmar, MD.

name: Patoka Lake
description: Excellent hiking for those willing to take on rugged terrain through rock overhangs, fern, and pines.

name: Marion Reservoir
description: Great trails.

name: Robertsville State Park
description:
Robertsville State Park is edged by the Meramec River and the Calvey Creek making fishing a very common activity here. Boating and other water sports are also popular as well as birding, picnicking, camping and hiking. The park also offers interpretive programs.

Spice Bush Trail, a .80 mile path winds through the Meramec River's floodplain.

name: Paradox Trail
description:
The Paradox Trail links the Tabeguache Trail on the Uncompahgre Plateau with the Kokopelli Trail in the La Sal Mountains of Utah. The 100-mile trail traverses a wide variety of terrain, elevation, and eco-zones, following existing jeep and county roads for most of its length.<br />
The adventurous nature of the Paradox Trail requires users to be cautious, personally responsible, self-sufficient, and have a working knowledge of backcountry survival.

name: Massanutten Western Slope
description: Massanutten Western Slope features 10 miles of hiking trails near Keezletown, VA.

name: Wolf Ridge Trail
description: Wolf Ridge Trail is a 6 mile hiking trail in Harrisonburg, Virginia.

name: Sugarloaf Ridge State Park
description: The Bald Mountain, Vista, Gray Pine, and Meadow Trails offer hikers a 6 mile or shorter loop through the park over a 700-foot elevation gain.

name: Rocktown Trails At Hillandale Park
description: Rocktown Trails At Hillandale Park features 4 miles of hiking trails near Harrisonburg, VA.

name: Charlestown State Park
description: Great selection of trails for hiking.

name: Reddish Knob
description: Reddish Knob features 20 miles of hiking trails near Harrisonburg, VA.

name: Howarth Park/spring Lake
description: Howarth Park/spring Lake features 5 miles of hiking trails near Santa Rosa, CA.

name: Lower Meramec Park
description: Excellent trails.

name: Cliff Cave Park
description: Cliff Cave Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Saint Louis, MO.

name: White Rim Trail
description: White Rim Trail features 103 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Curecanti National Recreation Area
description:
Curecanti National Recreation Area is a series of three reservoirs along the once wild Gunnison River. The reservoirs that make up Curecanti today are a destination for water-based recreation high in the Rocky Mountains. Best known for salmon and trout fishing, Curecanti also offers opportunities for hiking, boating, camping, and bird watching.<br />
There are a total of 7 beautiful hiking trails within the recreation area, all ranging from 1.5 miles to 6 miles. It's the perfect place to get away with your family, or build your endurance on a tough hike.

name: Dead Horse Point State Park
description: Dead Horse Point State Park features 9 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Lake Alpine Loop
description: Lake Alpine Loop features 79 miles of hiking trails near Bear Valley, CA.

name: The Whole Enchilada
description: The Whole Enchilada features 31 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Monarch Crest Trail
description:
Monarch Crest is an epic alpine trail that spends a significant amount of time above tree line. It offers gorgeous views of the surrounding mountains which are lush with vegetation: a distinct change from the front range of Colorado. This trail is quite popular with backpackers and mountain bikers, but it is great for a short day hike as well.<br />
CDT Description: Section 18 of the CDT in Colorado runs 10.7 miles from Marshall Pass to Monarch Pass and US Hwy 50. Along the way the trail passes Mount Ouray, Pahlone Peak, Mount Peck, and Monarch Ridge.<br />
The trailhead listed is for the northern end of this section. The southern end is located at lat= 38.39166 lon= -106.24696

name: CDT CO19: Monarch Pass to Hancock Trailhead
description: The CDT runs for 17.7 miles from the Monarch Pass Trailhead on US Hwy 50 to the Hancock Trailhead. Along the way, the trail passes Monarch Mountain Ski Area, several prehistoric walls, the Top of the Divide, Hunt Lake, Boss Lake, Bald Mountain, Taylor Mountain, Mount Aetna, Monumental Peak, Hancock Peak, Mount Chapman, and Pomeroy Mountain.

name: Props Run Trail
description: Props Run Trail features 9 miles of hiking trails near Slatyfork, WV.

name: George Winter Park
description: Nice walking/jogging trails.

name: Hartman Rocks
description:
The Hartman Rocks Recreation Area offers a convenient place near Gunnison for a variety of short to medium hikes on its network of both dirt roads and single track trails. It is one of the first areas to melt off in the spring so it may be accessible when other areas are still muddy or snowed in. It is also a good place for a warm up hike to help you acclimate to the altitude before you head up into the higher mountains. <br />
These routes wander through rolling hills of sagebrush interspersed with scenic granite rock formations and Cottonwood groves in some drainages. The area is dominated by an interesting geologic formation called a Ring Dike about 6 miles in diameter. On the western edge of this formation is the Aberdeen Quarry that was worked in the late 1800s to provide high quality granite for the State Capitol building in Denver.

name: Castle Gardens
description: Castle Gardens is a unique canyon area that features fantastic dirt ridges, drainages, and formations. This trail heads up the canyon, hugging the dirt walls, offering up incredible views of these unique formations. This isn't an expansive area; instead, the dirt formations are limited just to this one canyon. This little gem tucked away in the hills surrounding Salida is very special!

name: Chubb Trail
description: Chubb Trail features 14 miles of hiking trails near Saint Louis, MO.

name: Route 66 State Park
description: The 419-acre Route 66 State Park is a historical area that exposed many Americans to a different way of travel. The park has a visitor center with historical exhibits. It is also a popular location for birding, horseback riding, bike riding, boating, fishing, picnicking and walking.

name: Little Rainbow
description:
Hike along the base of Methodist Mountain on this well-maintained trail. The trail will take you through valleys of low-lying shrubs and then up the mountain for beautiful views of the surrounding area. <br />
This trail is designed specifically for mountain bikers so be aware that there will be bike traffic here. Please share the path and practice trail etiquette.

name: Jefferson Barracks Park
description: Great walking/jogging trails.

name: West Tyson Park
description: Great spot for hiking/jogging.

name: Eisenhower State Park
description: Abundant multi-use trails.

name: Trap Pond State Park
description: Trap Pond State Park is home to a remaining beautifully preserved portion of a freshwater wetlands that was once in the area. Visitors are welcome to partake in the many opportunities available to explore the 4.9-mile Boundary hiking trails surrounding the pond and wetland forest. During a visit, birdwatching, boating and fishing are all easy to access and popular activities at the park. The park also offers picnic tables, volleyball courts, playgrounds and horseshoe pits for your enjoyment.

name: Bear Creek/Methodist Mountain Loop
description:
Right near town, the Bear Creek/Methodist Mountain Loop takes you up steep climbs, but rewards you with beautiful views of the Arkansas River Valley. After you make the brutal climb up there is a quick descent down a fireroad that leads you back into town. This trail meets up with the Rainbow Trail which helps to make it a loop. <br />
This is a multi-use trail so please practice caution.

name: Sonoma Coast State Historic Park
description: Hikers can journey from Blind Beach to Shell Beach for a 4 mile round trip or all the way to Wright's Beach for a 6.5 mile round trip.

name: Greensfelder Park
description: Plenty of excellent trails.

name: Amasa Back Trail
description: Amasa Back Trail features 11 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Clydesdale Park
description: Great walking/jogging paths.

name: Waterdog Lakes
description: The Water Dog Lakes trail is about 2 miles one-way or 3.7 miles round-trip. This trail climbs about a thousand vertical feet on the way up to the lake, but the pristine beauty of this high alpine lake is definitely a sight to behold!

name: Deer Creek Hills
description: Excellent hiking trails.

name: Lone Elk Trails
description:
Lone Elk is a great visit any time of the year. Just remember these are wild animals so give them the respect and distance they deserve. Do not approach the animals and
certainly do not feed the animals. If you are going on a hike it is a good idea to bring insect repellant. Because of the large number of animals there can be an infestation of ticks.

name: Appalachian Trail 070: Fishers Gap to Skyland Service Road
description:
This section of the AT runs from Fishers Gap to the Skyland Service Road through Shenandoah National Park in Virginia. Along the way it passes the Rock Spring Hut.<br />
Recommended parking spot: "Skyland South" lat=38.586851174, lon=-78.3835166033

name: Quantico Trail
description: Quantico Trail features 9 miles of hiking trails near Quantico, VA.

name: Castlewood
description: Castlewood features 15 miles of hiking trails near St. Louis, MO.

name: Arkansas Headwaters Recreation Area
description:
The AHRA has a wide variety of trails for every outdoor enthusiast, from the hiker to the to mountain biker and OHV rider.<br />
Hayden Meadows, at the northern end of AHRA, has ADA accessible interpretive and fishing trails, 5 wetland boardwalks, and 2 bridges surrounding a small reservoir.<br />
Collegiate Peaks Group Picnic Area: is at the head of both the Midland Bike Trail, Barbara Whipple Trail and Four Mile systems, which offer miles of scenic motorized and non-motorized routes for all skill levels.<br />
At the Ruby Mountain campground, both the FourMile trail system and the Browns Canyon Wilderness Study Area (WSA) can be accessed. FourMile is designated for both motorized and nonmotorized use, while Browns Canyon WSA is for nonmotorized use only.<br />
Below the Hecla Junction Campground a å_ mile foot trail leads downstream along the shoreline to Seidel's Suckhole, which is a great place to watch and photograph whitewater rafting in the summer and offers excellent fishing in the spring and summer.<br />
Lone Pine Recreation Site has a designated river trail approximately 1/2 mile in length that begins near the restrooms and picnic site on the east end. This trail is used for wildlife and river viewing as well as fishing access.<br />
McIntyre Hills Wilderness Study Area (WSA) can be accessed from the Five Points Campground. A trail begins between campsites #4 and #5, but much of the McIntyre Hills WSA is comprised of undesignated, or social, trails. A trail map on the entrance station shows the trail's alignment.

name: Arkansas Hills
description:
This is the closest trail system to downtown Salida. The trail system is a combination of 11 hiking and biking trails that range from 0.4 miles to 3.2 miles in length. There are several access points and all trails are well-maintained and well-marked. <br />
These trails are multi-use trails so please practice caution.

name: Buder Park
description: Great trail for walking/jogging.

name: Al Foster Trails
description: Excellent trails for walking/hiking/jogging.

name: Lemay Park
description: Nice walking/jogging trail.

name: Grants Trail
description: Grants Trail is a paved path excellent for all non-motorized usage.

name: Bale Grist Mill State Historic Park
description: Visitors can hike from the mill on the historic trail to Bothe-Napa Valley State Park, which features extensive picnic facilities and a number of trails. The round trip hike from Bale Grist Mill State Historic Park to Bothe-Napa Valley State Park is approximately two miles.

name: Armstrong Redwoods State Natural Reserve
description: 9 loop trails with longer back country hiking possible

name: Rim Trail of the Black Canyon
description: Trail is located along the rim of the Black Canyon of the Gunnison.  It follows the rim of the canyon offering spectacular views of the canyon and surrounding area.  The area on the rim is small to large shrubbery with occasional small oaks.  The trail is self guided with a pamphlet and markers with interesting features, including many geolocial features.

name: Unger Park
description: Trail great for hiking/jogging.

name: Bothe-Napa Valley State Park
description:
Interpretive programs are offered throughout the year. Special programs can sometimes be arranged for groups by calling the park in advance. The Redwood, Ritchey Canyon Trails offer a
6.5 mile round trip with 1,200-foot elevation gain; longer and shorter options possible.

name: Laumeier Sculpture Park
description: Excellent walking trail.

name: Smallwood State Park
description: The trails at Smallwood meander through the hardwood forest, passing many natural and historical points of interest. The entire trail system is approximately 2 miles in length with several marked exit points if the walk becomes too strenuous.

name: Moab Rim
description:
This trail is a 3 mile connector to the Hidden Valley Trail. The trail follows a primitive slickrock road and has good views of the Colorado River, the Moab Valley, and the sandstone fins of the Behind the Rocks area.
From the parking area, follow the 4-wheel-drive vehicle route up the slickrock ramps of Kayenta sandstone. After about 1.4 miles, the route reaches a viewpoint of the Moab Valley. Follow the vehicle route south and then down through a slickrock area located between two large domes of Navajo sandstone. At the base of the slickrock area, the route continues along a wash bottom and then up a large sand hill. From the top of the sand hill, the route branches twice to the left. The first spur on the left leads to a view point high above Spanish Valley. The second spur route ends after 200 yards at another view point. Ahead to the south, the view is dominated by a long ridge of massive sandstone fins. From the intersection, the main route drops down into a wash and then climbs in an easterly direction to its terminus just below the pass to Hidden Valley.
The Moab Rim route is a shared use trail. You may encounter jeeps, mountain bikes, dirt bikes or ATV's on the route.

name: Black Canyon National Forest
description:
20 miles of trails exist with in park. Many trails pass by steep dropoffs, so be cautious and keep a close watch on children.There are no maintained or marked trails into the inner canyon. Routes are difficult to follow, and only individuals in excellent physical condition should attempt these hikes.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Simpson Park
description: Great hiking/jogging trails.

name: Castlewood State Park
description: Eight hiking trails of varying length wind through the park.

name: Buffalo Trace
description: Buffalo Trace features 12 miles of hiking trails near French Lick, IN.

name: Clark's Hill/Norton State Historic Site
description: An interpretive hiking trail takes you to a view of the Osage and Missouri rivers.

name: Pipe Dream
description: Pipe Dream features 5 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Austin Creek State Recreation Area
description: Four networked trails.

name: Los Posadas
description: Los Posadas features 15 miles of hiking trails near Angwin, CA.

name: Los Posadas
description: Los Posadas features 15 miles of hiking trails near Angwin, CA.

name: Los Posadas
description: Los Posadas features 15 miles of hiking trails near Angwin, CA.

name: West Edgewood Trail
description: West Edgewood Trail features 3 miles of hiking trails near Jefferson City, MO.

name: Hidden Valley Trail
description: From the parking area, follow the trail up to the base of the Moab Rim and then ascend a series of steep switchbacks. At the top of the switchbacks, the trail heads north and enters Hidden Valley, which is a broad shelf between the top of the Moab Rim and Spanish Valley. Follow the trail to a low rise that separates the two halves of Hidden Valley and continue along through the northern section to a point where the trail swings to the left and goes over a low pass. At the pass, the hiker will be rewarded with a view of the large sandstone fins of the Behind the Rocks area. The trail continues down the west side of the pass for about 1/3 mile where it meets the Moab Rim four-wheel-drive trail. The hike may be extended to the Colorado River by following the Moab Rim four-wheel-drive trail to its starting point.

name: Amphitheater Loop
description: The Amphitheater Loop Trail makes a lovely walk for those staying at Hittle Bottom campground, or for people traveling Highway 128. The trail climbs approximately 250 feet in elevation to afford a stunning view of the Colorado River corridor. Along the way, you can see interesting sandstone formations in the Moenkopi and Cutler sandstone layers

name: Fremont Indian State Park and Museum
description: Numerous trails lead visitors to hundreds of rock art panels, viewpoints, and geologic wonders located throughout Clear Creek Canyon. Petroglyphs, pictographs, pictoglyphs, columnar jointing, hoodoos, and bubble caves are all easily accessible. Pick up a trail guide at the visitor center, then hike any number of trails, which range from one-quarter mile to five miles in length. Hiking trails are for non-motorized use only.

name: Goblin Valley State Park
description: Great hiking!

name: Slickrock
description: Slickrock features 12 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Porcupine Rim
description: Porcupine Rim features 15 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Klondike Park
description: Klondike Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Defiance, MO.

name: Portal Trail
description: Portal Trail features 4 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Appalachian Trail 071: Skyland Service Road to Thornton Gap (US 211)
description:
This section of the AT runs 9.5 miles from the Skyland Service Road to Thornton Gap on US Hwy 211. Along the way it passes Stony Man, The Pinnacle, and Mary's Rock.<br />
<br />
This portion of the AT lies in the Shenandoah National Park.

name: Leesylvania State Park
description: The park has five hiking trails passing through rich natural and historical features of the Potomac. The park also includes a segment of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail. The park boasts many scenic overlooks of the Potomac including one on the remains of a Civil War Confederate gun battery at Freestone Point.

name: Love Trails
description: The Love family began to donate parcels of land to St. Louis County in 1959. The final donation provided that 15 acres of the park remain in a natural condition. The park has some recreational activities including two shelters, a playground and athletic field. Grand Glaize Creek flows through a portion of the park. Most of the floodplain area of the creek is open and maintained as lawn while the hillsides are wooded. The park has one hiking trail.

name: Kruse Rhododendron State Natural Reserve
description: There are five miles of hiking trails through the quiet forest with a short loop trail that leads through clusters of rhododendrons.

name: Negro Bill Canyon
description: Constructed trail with several stream crossings. This is a hiking-only trail.

name: American River Bike Trail
description: American River Bike Trail features 32 miles of hiking trails near Sacramento, CA.

name: Gemini Bridges
description: Gemini Bridges features 13 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Binder Lake
description: Binder Lake features 11 miles of hiking trails near Jefferson City, MO.

name: Kanopolis Lake
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Cedarville State Forest
description: Cedarville State Forest features 20 miles of hiking trails near Waldorf, MD.

name: Lake Vesuvius Lakeshore Trail
description: Relatively flat, beginner to intermediate level, 8 mile hiking trail in Southern Ohio.

name: Queeny Trails
description: Beautiful park for hiking.

name: Coronado Heights
description: Coronado Heights features 3 miles of hiking trails near Lindsborg, KS.

name: Chapman State Park
description:
Potomac River Trail - This hiking trail doubles as a service road that joins the original Chapman's Landing Road to the Potomac River. The 0.6 mile trail roughly marks the boundary between a dry sandy woodland (to the northeast), and a more moist, richer forest (to the southwest).

Marsh Trail - This marked trail branches off of the Potomac River Trail, and meanders through a fertile bottomland woods that contrasts the sandier woodland along the Potomac shoreline. The 0.7 mile trail leads to an unusual "scrub-shrub" marsh which is separated from the Potomac River by a narrow spit.

Coastal Woodlands Trail - This clearly marked, 1-mile trail joins the Potomac River Trail to make a 1.5 mile loop. The trail runs through various habitats, including a terrace gravel forest and a coastal oak forest, to eventually run along the Potomac shoreline.

name: Arches National Park
description:
Arches contains a wealth of hiking trails. Ranging in length and difficulty, these trails provide access to outstanding viewpoints and many of the park's famous features, including Balanced Rock and Delicate Arch. In many cases, trails travel under arches, affording quite a different perspective than what is visible from a car.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Tilles Trails
description: Fitness trail.

name: Matson Hill
description: Matson Hill features 3 miles of hiking trails near Defiance, MO.

name: Trinity River Recreation
description: There is a small trail system in and around the Douglas City campground. Union Hill Pond also has trails available to the exporing type as do the Browns Creek and Rush Creek areas.  Most trails are rugged and unmarked encouraging self exploration.

name: Dr. Edmund A. Babler Memorial State Park
description: Plenty of trails to choose from.

name: Lake Natoma Loop
description: Lake Natoma Loop features 13 miles of hiking trails near Folsom, CA.

name: Lake Natoma Loop
description: Lake Natoma Loop features 13 miles of hiking trails near Folsom, CA.

name: Lake Natoma Loop
description: Lake Natoma Loop features 13 miles of hiking trails near Folsom, CA.

name: Holly River State Park
description: Hiking on the many trails the park offers is another way to get acquainted with the flora and fauna of the region.

name: CDT CO20: Hancock to Garden Basin
description: The 20th section of the Continental Divide Trail in Colorado runs for 14.2 miles from the Hancock Trailhead to the Garden Basin Trailhead. Along the way, the trail passes Tincup Pass, Tincup Peak, Mirror Lake, Mirror Lake Campground, Mount Poor, Fitzpatrick Peak, and Emma Burr Mountain.

name: Mason Neck State Park
description: Beautiful hiking area.

name: Dry Creek Parkway
description: Great trails.

name: Kanopolis State Park
description: Kanopolis offers 31 miles of trails, all of which start in the state park.

name: Pomona State Park
description: Beautiful area for hikes.

name: Sutton Lake
description: Sutton Lake, in Sutton, WV is a popular destination for water sport lovers. Sutton Lake has over 40 miles of shoreline so there is plenty of space to have a good time and activities here include hiking, swimming, boating, fishing, canoeing, kayaking and camping.

name: Appalachian Trail 072: Thornton Gap to Gravel Springs Gap
description:
This section of the A.T. runs 14.5 miles from Thornton Gap to Gravel Springs Gap. Along the way it passes the Pass Mountain Shelter, Pass Mountain, Elk Wallow, Hogback Mountain, Little Hogback Overlook, and the Gravel Springs Hut.<br />
<br />
This section of the AT lies in the Shenandoah National Park.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spots:<br />
"Skyline Dr" lat=38.7677227493, lon=-78.2335947105<br />
"Skyline Dr" lat=38.7587469474, lon=-78.2621556539<br />
"Skyline Dr" lat=38.7611039627, lon=-78.2823262856<br />
"Elk Wallow" lat=38.7387592425, lon=-78.3085782481

name: Lost Valley
description: Lost Valley features 8 miles of hiking trails near Saint Charles, MO.

name: Faust Park
description: Short walking/jogging trail.

name: Mount St Helena
description: Mount St Helena features 13 miles of hiking trails near Calistoga, CA.

name: Mount St Helena
description: Mount St Helena features 13 miles of hiking trails near Calistoga, CA.

name: Mount St Helena
description: Mount St Helena features 13 miles of hiking trails near Calistoga, CA.

name: Hillsdale State Park
description: You can hike, bike, or many enjoy riding their horses starting at the Saddle Ridge Horse Camp area. You can observe native plants, the view of the lake in some places, and may even see some native wildlife. There are four different loops of trail systems: NW blue trail, SE red trail, SW red trail, and the Outlet blut loop. Vehicle permits are required for entry.

name: Whitney State Forest
description: Whitney State Forest features 7 miles of hiking trails near Warrenton, VA.

name: Pomona Lake
description: Excellent trails.

name: Eldon Hazlet State Recreation Area
description:
More than 9 miles of trails are available to hikers at Eldon Hazlet. The 3-mile Cherokee Trail has three separate loops that pass through a mature oak-hickory forest over gently rolling terrain, offering great views of the lake. The Pawnee Trail is a 1-mile loop trail running along the highest point on Carlyle Lake. Both the Cherokee and Pawnee trails lead to Burnside Cemetery, a restored cemetery with tombstones dating to the 1830s.

The Kaskaskian Trail is a 2 1/2-mile loop trail that begins at the park office and passes by the youth campground, the Pawnee Trail, various day-use areas and the Eagle trail, a 3/4-mile loop near the north end of Illini Campground. A 1/4 -mile accessible interpretive trail is located within the 3-acre prairie restoration directly across from the park office. The 1-mile Illini Trail is located across from the Campground Store and loops around the Illini Fishing Pond. All trails are closed Wednesday through Sunday during pheasant season.

name: Robert Louis Stevenson State Park
description: The best view of the wine country is from the top of 4,343-foot Mt. Saint Helena, reached by a five mile trail that winds through stands of knobcone pine to deliver summit panoramas of not only Napa Valley but the High Sierra and San Francisco Bay as well. The Stevenson Memorial trail offers a 10 mile round trip with 1,300-foot elevation gain to the summit of Mt. Saint Helena.

name: Scott State Park
description: Nature trails accommodate hikers, horseback riders, and naturalists and provide excellent opportunities to observe wildlife in natural habitats. Wild turkey, deer, bobcat and beaver are common in the area. A horse camp area provides amenities for equestrian visitors.

name: Hazel Loop
description: Hazel Loop features 15 miles of hiking trails near Folsom, CA.

name: Hazel Loop
description: Hazel Loop features 15 miles of hiking trails near Folsom, CA.

name: Hazel Loop
description: Hazel Loop features 15 miles of hiking trails near Folsom, CA.

name: Horseshoe Lake State Park
description: This 2, 960 acre park offers many exciting recreational activities. The Horseshoe Lake State Park is located in a low flood plain near the Mississippi River. Before modern day levies were constructed, heavy flood from the river would cause the bank to overflow into the flood plain which eventually created a small oxbow lake. Picnicking, fishing, boating, camping, and waterfowl hunting are popular activities here.

name: Kirkwood Ski Resort/mtb Park
description: Kirkwood Ski Resort/mtb Park features 15 miles of hiking trails near Kirkwood, CA.

name: Kirkwood Ski Resort/mtb Park
description: Kirkwood Ski Resort/mtb Park features 15 miles of hiking trails near Kirkwood, CA.

name: Kirkwood Ski Resort/mtb Park
description: Kirkwood Ski Resort/mtb Park features 15 miles of hiking trails near Kirkwood, CA.

name: St Vincent Park
description: Nice walking/jogging trail.

name: lewis & clark
description: mostly single track packed earth. steep climbs with senic vistas overlooking the missouri river.  A bit confusing in the valley where the lewis trail, 5.3 miles, splits in one direction and the clark trail goes another for the 8.2 mile loop.  both trails meet up 1 mile from the trail head.  this is a moderate rated trail in some areas.

name: Grover Hot Springs State Park
description: Nothing like a soothing soak in a hot spring after a long day on the trail. For the High Sierra visitor who wants to take a hike and "take the cure" in the same day, Grover Hot Springs State Park, located a bit south of Lake Tahoe, is the perfect destination.

name: Council Grove Lake
description: The lake was named for the nearby town of Council Grove, the birthplace of the Santa Fe Trail and a National Historic District. The lake is in the heart of the Flint Hills, one of the last vestiges of Tallgrass Prairie, and is located 20 miles north of the Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve and 30 miles south of the Konza Prairie Preserve.

name: Sovereign Single Track
description: Sovereign Single Track features 12 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Spruce Knob Loop
description: Huckleberry Trail features 15 miles of hiking trails near Harman, WV.

name: Stephen A. Forbes State Recreation Area
description: There are four established nature trails for hiking enthusiasts. The Oak Ridge Trail is a 2.5-mile loop trail located in the campground. For those preferring shorter walks, the Marlow Pond Trail is half-mile long, the Henneman Trail which guides the hiker to an early settlement cemetery is only a quarter-mile long, or take the Phillips Creek Trail -- a quarter mile with access to the lake.

name: Laurel Hill
description: Laurel Hill features 0 miles of hiking trails near Lorton, VA.

name: Seneca Creek Trail
description: Seneca Creek Trail features 4 miles of hiking trails near Spruce Knob, WV.

name: Sweitzer Lake State Park
description: 1 1/2 miles around the lake on dirt and gravel roads.

name: Fort Washington Park
description:
Fort Washington Park has a wide variety of activities. There is a 3-mile trail that follows the perimeter of the park boundary, offering the opportunity for wildlife viewing. Birdwatchers enjoy the quite solitude of the park to find that one special bird. If fishing is for you, the park is located right along the Potomac River where there are many different types of fish waiting for you.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: McDonnell Park
description: Excellent trail for running/jogging.

name: Sly Park
description: Sly Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Pollack Pines, CA.

name: Fountain Creek Nature Center
description: Walk the wetlands, search for great blue herons, and explore Fountain Creek - only 15 minutes south of downtown Colorado Springs! An "oasis on the plains" with ponds marshes, meadows, cottonwood forests, and Fountain Creek, the nature center is attractive to visitors of all ages. The nature center offers a unique look into the Cattail Marsh Wildlife Area and serves as an entry to a variety of discovery experiences. Wetlands nature exhibit feature life in, on and around the water. Other exhibits include plants, wildlife, weather and climate, and the mountain backdrop. Interpretive programs, special events, group tours, and environmental education programs for schools are offered throughout the year.

name: Jenkinson Lake Loop
description: Jenkinson Lake Loop features 8 miles of hiking trails near Sly Park, CA.

name: Brommelsiek Park
description: Brommelsiek Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near New Melle, MO.

name: Kincaid Lake State Park
description: Explore the unspoiled beauty and variety of nature habitats at Kincaid Lake State Park on two hiking trails. Named for the native flora, the Spicebush and Ironwood Trails offer 2.25 miles of connected loop trails.

name: Gibson Ranch Regional Park
description: Dogs are welcome on a leash.

name: Fountainhead Regional Park
description: Fountainhead Regional Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Fairfax, VA.

name: Mushroom Rock State Park
description: North and South areas offer various trails, including a .9 trek to see the largest mushroom rock.

name: Emerald Valley
description: This out-and-back hike is fairly level with some rocky footing in some places. On the trail you'll pass some streams and creek crossings as well as a jeep road. Hike into the beautiful aspen groves in this area and just enjoy being outdoors.

name: Red Hills State Park
description:
This 967-acre site offers wooded hills, picturesque meadows, nature areas and an abundance of wildlife. Camping, hiking, hunting and sports facilities are available and popular in the warm months. Ice skating and ice fishing are popular in the winter. The park features the Trace Inn Restaurant, and manages the 627-acre Chauncey Marsh Wetland. The pristine 40-acre lake is a hotbed for fishing and boating.

Eight miles of scenic trails of moderate difficulty wind through the park. The Indian Treaty, Robin, Valley Springs and Tulip trail overlap each other. There is also a horseback riding trail that is open to bicyclist when the conditions are appropriate.
Phone (618) 936-2469

name: Merkle Wildlife Sanctuary and Visitor's Center
description: There are four hiking trails at Merkle that explore the upland forests and marshes of the Patuxent. Our trails are open to hikers only. Bikes and horses may visit nearby Rosaryville State Park. All trail distances are round-trip, measured from the Visitor Center (except Lookout Creek Trail).

name: Creve Coeur Park
description: Excellent trails.

name: Bella Fontaine Park
description: Great walking/jogging trails.

name: Klondike Bluffs
description: Klondike Bluffs features 14 miles of hiking trails near Moab, UT.

name: Clifty Falls State Park
description: Great selection of 10 trails.

name: Fisher Towers Trail
description: From the parking lot (please sign in at register box), the trail goes down a short set of steps and then runs to the left out onto a small slickrock-covered ridge. Follow the ridge away from the main cliffs until just after it narrows and then go left down into the ravine through a small cut on the left side of the ridge. From the bottom of the ravine, the trail heads steeply up and then begins to wind directly beneath the Fisher Towers. After swinging around the largest tower, The Titan, the trail ascends and ends on a ridge with a panoramic view. The Fisher Towers are composed of Moenkopi and Cutler sandstones, and have eroded into many fantastical shapes. Climbers occasionally scale these mudstone towers (be cautious of hiking directly below a climber!). Note: This trail has a western exposure and can be exceptionally hot on summer afternoons. Neither mountain bikes nor motorized vehicles are allowed on this trail.

name: Burke Lake
description: Burke Lake features 4 miles of hiking trails near Burke, VA.

name: Knob Noster State Park
description: Choose from seven trails to explore the park.

name: Opossum Hollow
description: Opossum Hollow features 6 miles of hiking trails near Knob Noster, MO.

name: CDT CO21: Garden Basin to Cottonwood Pass Road
description: Section 21 of the CDT in Colorado runs 10.3 miles from the Garden Basin Trailhead to the trailhead on Cottonwood Pass Road. Along the way, the trail passes Mount Kreutzer, Chalk Rock Mountain, Sanford Creek, Cow Creek, the headwaters of the Taylor River, Jones Mountain, and Jones Mountain North.

name: Granite Bay Trail
description: Granite Bay Trail features 12 miles of hiking trails near Granite Bay, CA.

name: Granite Bay Trail
description: Granite Bay Trail features 12 miles of hiking trails near Granite Bay, CA.

name: Granite Bay Trail
description: Granite Bay Trail features 12 miles of hiking trails near Granite Bay, CA.

name: Huntley Meadows Park
description: Some of the best wildlife watching in the Washington metropolitan area is enjoyed here. From the å_ mile wetland boardwalk trail and observation tower, people have excellent views of beavers, frogs, dragonflies and herons. Huntley Meadows is well known as a prime birding spot, with over 200 species identified in the park.

name: Cedar Creek
description: Cedar Creek features 35 miles of hiking trails near Guthrie, MO.

name: Castlepoint Park
description: Short walking/jogging path.

name: Pipeline Trail
description:
Pipeline Trail is a 6 mile out-and-back trail near the city of Colorado Springs. This trail is pretty rocky in parts and it winds through dense forests, ever once in awhile opening up into a aspen covered field. You can sneak in some views of the surrounding mountains when the tree cover breaks. <br />
Please share the path with mountain bikers and dirt bikers.

name: Cape Henlopen State Park
description:
Cape Henlopen SP is known for its pristine beaches, specifically its two lifeguarded designated swimming beaches. The park has nearby food and drink choices, showers, restrooms and a picnic pavilion. Golfing, basketball and hunting are permitted in some areas of the park. Hiking, swimming, camping, horseback riding and biking are also popular activities here. The park offers eight trails of different difficulty and beauty. Some of these trails can also be used for horseback riding and biking.

The Beach Trail: 4.6 miles- hiking and equestrian- easy to moderate.
Pinelands Trail: 2 miles- hiking- easy.
Seaside Nature Trail: 0.6 miles- hiking- easy.
Walking Dunes Trail: 1.6 miles- hiking and biking- easy.
Salt Marsh Spur: 0.6 miles- hiking and biking- easy.
Gordons Pond Trail: 2.75 miles- hiking and biking- easy to moderate.
Bike Loop Trail: 3 miles- shared use- easy to moderate.
Junction and Breakwater Trail: 5 miles- shared use- easy.

name: Appalachian Trail 073: Gravel Springs Gap to US 211 (Front Royal)
description: This section of the AT runs 13.2 miles from Gravel Springs Gap to US Hwy 211 (Front Royal) through Shenandoah National Park. This is the last section of the AT in Shenandoah. Along the way it passes North Marshall, Compton Peak, Compton Gap, and the Tom Floyd Wayside.

name: Silver Lake
description: Silver Lake features 4 miles of hiking trails near Highland, IL.

name: Charles Fork Lake
description: Charles Fork Lake features 20 miles of hiking trails near Spencer, WV.

name: Sweetwater Trail
description: Sweetwater Trail features 3 miles of hiking trails near Folsom, CA.

name: Lake Sonoma
description: Lake Sonoma is located in the wine-growing region of Sonoma County, CA. A picturesque lake with secluded vehicle and boat-in camping available for the fishing and boating enthusiast.

name: Salmon Falls
description: Salmon Falls features 14 miles of hiking trails near Folsom, CA.

name: Salmon Falls
description: Salmon Falls features 14 miles of hiking trails near Folsom, CA.

name: Salmon Falls
description: Salmon Falls features 14 miles of hiking trails near Folsom, CA.

name: Hardy Lake State Park
description: Excellent trails plus one archery trail.

name: Rosaryville State Park
description: Rosaryville State Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near Upper Marlboro, MD.

name: Auburn State Recreation Area
description: A major part of the recreation area's 58 mile trail system is the Western Pioneer Trail, which travels from Sacramento to Lake Tahoe. Weekend backpackers can pitch a tent at a number of trail camps along the river.

name: Folsom Lake State Recreation Area
description: Hikers and horseback riders enjoy the park's 80 miles of trail.

name: St Mary's Falls
description: St Mary's Falls is a 3.2 mile out-and-back trail that leads along a creek up to the St. Mary's Falls. The trail does have an incline, but it's not too difficult, and there are plenty of places to stop and cool down in the creek along the way.

name: Bear Creek Canyon Loop
description:
This loop trail is difficult with a 2,200 elevation climb in the first 4 miles. Be ready for a great workout, but also enjoy this beautifully forested trail that has awesome overlooks where you can view the surrounding mountains. The downhill also features some creek crossings as well. <br />
This is a multi-use trail so please practice caution as there is some mountain bike traffic here.

name: Gold Camp Road
description: This out-and-back trail follows gravel roads from Colorado Springs to Cripple Creek. Part of the trail follows an old railroad grade, and it is open to motor-vehicles so you may see some traffic. You'll get to see old tunnels, aspen forests, and beautiful views of the country side.

name: Jones Downhill
description:
Enjoy this 22 mile loop trail that winds through thick forests, explores old tunnels, and traverses rocky outcroppings. This is the perfect place to get back into nature, and the views from certain sections of this trail are amazing!<br />
This trail is a multi-use trail and is popular with mountain bikers, so please share the path and practice trail etiquette.

name: Buckhorn Loop
description:
Buckhorn Loop (Captain Jack's Frontside) features a 5 mile loop trail near Colorado Springs. The trail winds through deep forests and also provides stunning views of the mountains nearby. <br />
This trail is mainly used as a mountain bike trail so please practice caution.

name: Columbine
description: This trail makes its way up the Canon from behind the Starsmore Discovery Center to the Upper Columbine trailhead near Helen Hunt Falls. The Mid Columbine trailhead is about 1 mile up the road from the main park gate by the Starsmore Discovery Center. The Upper Columbine trailhead is about 350' east of Helen Hunt Falls. Hikers, cyclists and equestrians can use this trail.

name: Seven Bridges Trail
description: The trailhead is directly off the closed portion of Gold Camp Rd. (on the west side). Park at the intersection of Gold Camp Rd, High Dr. and Cheyenne CaÌ±on Rd. Hike past the gate, which is in the northwest corner of the parking area, and follow the closed portion of Gold Camp Rd .7 miles to the trailhead. The trail is unmarked, so you will need to watch for the creek that goes under the road, and the trailhead will be on your right. This is a moderate hike, which criss-crosses Cheyenne Creek over a series of seven bridges.

name: Woodrow Wilson Bridge Trail
description: Excellent trails for hiking or jogging/running.

name: Bothwell Lodge State Historic Site
description: Two trails are available for hiking.

name: Stratton Open Space/ The Chutes
description:
There are three trailheads that service the Stratton Open Space: 1) La Veta Way off Cresta Rd; 2) Ridgeway off W. Cheyenne Blvd. and 3) trailhead on north side of road about .3 miles up the road from the main park gate by the Starsmore Discovery Center. <br />
Most of the trails within the Stratton Open Space are easy to moderate in difficulty and offer "loops" that allow users to enjoy the Open Space. Keep in mind that all trails designated as "paths" are for hiking only; equestrians and cyclists may use all of the other loops.

name: Lake Accotink Network
description: Lake Accotink Network features 6 miles of hiking trails near Springfield, VA.

name: Captain Jack's
description: The trailhead is directly east of Tunnel #1 at the multi-use trail sign. The Captain Jacks Trail system is a multi-use system that allows hikers, bicyclists, equestrians, and motorcycles. For those who are up for a real challenge, the Captain Jacks Trail joins with the Jones Park Trail at the saddle behind Mt. Buckhorn, and the trail continues for another 2.4 miles to Jones Park.

name: Marshall Gold Discovery State Historic Park
description: A walking tour takes in a number of '49er-era buildings, as well as structures dating from later in the nineteenth century. Step into the Wah Hop Store, a Chinese general store. Visit Marshall Cabin, where Marshall, who bene&#64257;ted little from his great discovery, died bitter and penniless.

name: Spanish Lake Park
description: Excellent trails.

name: Dave Moore Nature Area
description:
Description:
One of the main features of the Dave Moore Nature Area is a loop trail about a mile long which goes from the parking lot trail head to the South Fork American River and back again passing through several habitat types. Nestled in the heart of Gold Rush Country, the trail is lined with remnants from nearly 150 years ago when Chinese laborers channeled creek water by hand with pick and shovel for gold mining. Tailing piles from the Gold Rush period blanket the area which lend to the characteristic landscape that makes this area so unique.

name: Oxon Cove Park & Oxon Hill Farm
description:
Venture beyond the hilltop and explore part of Oxon Cove Park's 512 acres by strolling along the lower fields or riding the bike path along Oxon Cove.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Spanish Lake
description: Spanish Lake features 10 miles of hiking trails near Saint Louis, MO.

name: Conway Robinson State Forest
description: Conway Robinson State Forest features 5 miles of hiking trails near Gainseville, VA.

name: Carlyle Lake
description: Water-oriented outdoor recreation opportunities including camping, picnicking, swimming, boating, fishing, and hunting. Expecially attractive to sailboaters. Illinois' largest lake.

name: Manassas National Battlefield Park
description:
Manassas National Battlefield Park has over 40 miles of hiking trails, traversing key areas of the First and Second Manassas Battlefields. Many of these hikes include trailside interpretive markers describing the battle action that occurred.<br />
Opportunities exist for both short and extended hikes. Before setting out on your hike, stop by the park visitor center to obtain a trail map. Please be certain to wear sturdy shoes and bring plenty of water. Sunscreen and insect repellent are also recommended.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Siue
description: Siue features 8 miles of hiking trails near Edwardsville, IL.

name: Wakefield
description: Wakefield features 0 miles of hiking trails near Annandale, VA.

name: Paul Intemann Memorial Trail
description: Paul Intemann Memorial Trail is a fun 5 mile out-and-back hike that offers beautiful views of the area. Enjoy the winding singletrack that traverses the hill side and look over the nearby valley. Watch out for bikers and horseback riders!

name: Palmer Trail / Section 16
description:
Palmer Trail/Section 16 is a scenic but popular hike that traverses the foothills near Colorado Springs. The path winds through old growth forest, skirts along pristine creeks, and provides stunning views of the nearby mountains. Just because this trail is popular, don't let that deter you from this awesome hike!<br />
Mountain bikers are also allowed on this trail, so please share the path!

name: Cronan Ranch Up Down Trail
description: Cronan Ranch Up Down Trail is a 2 mile hiking trail in Pilot Hill, California.

name: Fort Belle Fontaine Park
description: Excellent trails.

name: Bull Run Mountain Conservancy
description: Wandering trails through the Thoroughfare Gap area around Bull run Mountain.  Sights such as an old stone mill, cemetery and civil war era ruins scattered in the woods.  Water is plentiful.  No pets, open to the public.

name: Bear Creek Regional Park
description: Bear Creek Regional Park is an extremely popular park, mainly for its stellar dog parks, with 3 miles covering a total of 575 acres. There are some walking paths that wind throughout the park for visitors to enjoy.

name: Doctor Park
description:
Doctor Park takes you through high alpine forests where the trail winds through beautiful aspens. At points the path leads out into open fields where you can take in stunning views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. Climb this trail up to the ridge and enjoy some great views.<br />
This is a multi-use trail so please keep an eye out for mountain bikers, and practice trail etiquette.

name: NEW SANTA FE REGIONAL TRAIL
description: The 14 mile portion of the trail follows the abandoned Atkinson, Topeka and Santa Fe Railroad right-of-way.  The gravel surfaced regional trail generally follows a straight and level course fo the first 6.5 miles beginning at Palmer Lake.  An easement agreement by the U.S. Air Force Academy provides a crucial 6.9 mile stretch of this trail.  Trail users must not go off the six-foot wide trail surface as it passes through the Academy.  Bicyclists must wear helmets.

name: ROCK ISLAND REGIONAL TRAIL
description: The 23-mile Rock Island Regional Trail runs parallel to Highway 24 between Falcon and Ramah and is part of the America the Beautiful Trail.  Nine miles of the trail was constructed on the former Chicago an Rock Island Railroad Line between Falcon and Peyton.  Excellent views of several landmarks are visible from the trail including Pikes Peak, Rampart Range, Rattlesnake Buttes at Homestead Ranch Regional Park, Spanish Peaks, West Mountains, and the Sange de Cristo mountain range.  Opportunities for wildlife observation are abundant. Picnic tables are located at the Falcon Trailhead, and benches are polaced at regular intervals along the trail corridor.

name: Pacific Crest Trail: Northern California: K
description:
Section K of the Pacific Crest Trail runs 64.3 miles from Echo Lake Resort to I-80. The Desolation Wilderness (which this section of the trail runs through) is one of the most popular roadless areas in California. After Desolation Wilderness is Granite Chief Wilderness, with gorgeous views from the top of Granite Chief and Tinker Knob. <br />
<br />
Along the way the trail passes Lower Echo Lake; Echo Lake, CA; Triangle Lake; Lake Margery; Lake Aloha; Heather Lake; Dicks Pass; Dicks Lake; Middle Velma Lake; Lake Genevieve; Richardson Lake; Tahoe City, CA; Squaw Creek; Granite Chief Trail 15E23 to Squaw Valley; Roller Pass; Old Highway 40 near Donner Pass; and Soda Springs, CA.

name: Boggs forest
description: Boggs forest features 0 miles of hiking trails near Cobb, CA.

name: CDT CO22: Cottonwood Pass Road to South Clear Creek
description: Section 22 of the CDT in Colorado runs 19.2 miles from Cottonwood Pass Road Trailhead in the south to South Clear Creek Trailhead in the north. Along the way, the trail passes Texas Creek, Clear Creek, West Apostle Mountain, Ice Mountain, North Apostle Mountain, and Huron Peak (elevation 14,003).

name: Midland Bike Trail
description:
This is one of the most popular mountain biking routes in Buena Vista. The ride starts with a fun stretch of singletrack that climbs up from the Arkansas River. At the top, you'll find spectacular views of Mount Princeton and the southern Arkansas Valley from the old Midland Railroad grade along CR 304. Once you turn east, the trail returns to singletrack that slices through narrow stone cuts and drops into diversions that wind down through draws once spanned by rail trestles. The trail is approximately 7.3 miles from trailhead-to-trailhead, but it's possible to shorten the ride by turning back sooner. <br />
Hiking is allowed here, but remember that this trail is meant for mountain bikers. Please practice trail etiquette and share the path.

name: Bear Bottom Loop
description: Bear Bottom Loop features 5 miles of hiking trails near Front Royal, VA.

name: Shenandoah River State Park
description: Shenandoah River State Park features 26 miles of hiking trails near Bentonville, VA.

name: Sioux Passage Park
description: Short nature trail, plus the Black Buffalo Trail, which passes through the park.

name: 3 Creeks Conservation Area
description: 3 Creeks Conservation Area features 8 miles of hiking trails near Columbia, MO.

name: Shenandoah River Raymond R.
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Red Rock Canyon
description:
Red Rock Canyon features about 11 miles of trails through its Open Space. The park is open from dawn until dusk, and can get a little crowded at times. There are dog-friendly hiking trails where owners can take their dogs off the leash. <br />
These trails wind through the scenic canyon and hikers can enjoy stunning rock formations and possibly some wildlife viewing as well!

name: Champ Park
description: Excellent trails for walking/jogging.

name: Barr Trail (pikes Peak)
description:
Barr Trail is the most popular trail to summit the famous Pikes Peak. During the 13 mile ascent you will climb a total of 7,800 feet in elevation. This hike is a very difficult, brutal climb, and should only be attempted by those in a fit physical condition. The trail is well-marked, traveled often, and easy to follow, and it should take you anywhere between 6-10 hours to summit the mountain. <br />
Enjoy the beautiful forests and rock formations on your climb up, and, of course, once you've summited the mountain-top views are sure to take your breath away.

name: Turkey Flats
description:
Turkey Flats is a 10 mile loop trail near Fruita, CO. This trail will lead you through beautiful aspen meadows on smooth singletrack, and every once in a while you'll get stunning views of the surrounding valley and the mountains in the distance. <br />
This is a multi-use trail, so please share the path.

name: Ellanor C. Lawrence Park
description: Beautiful area for hiking.

name: Berlin-Ichthyosaur State Park
description: An extensive sign system tells of the history and features of Berlin and Union for self-guided exploration. A nature trail connects the campground to the Fossil Shelter. Information and viewing windows are available at the Fossils Shelter if you cannot attend a scheduled tour.

name: Williams Canyon
description: Williams Canyon is a 5 mile out-and-back trail that winds through the canyon and brings you to a beautiful waterfall. The hike passes by deep caves, fields of wildflowers, an old stone house, and some zip lines as well. Enjoy the beautiful canyon scenery as you explore this trail!

name: Strand Hill
description:
The Strand Hill loop contains some old, steep gravel roads, but if you jump on one of the other nearby trails (Strand Bonus Trail or the Canal Trail) you can access the Strand Hill trail and the top of Strand Hill via singletrack in an out-and-back configuration.

This trail is such a beautiful section of singletrack winding through the deep aspens, definitely worth a hike!

name: Farris Creek
description:
The Farris Creek trail is 6.1 miles long. It begins at Forest Road 740 and ends at Forest Road 736. The trail is open for the following uses: Hiking, Mountain Biking, Horseback Riding, and Motorcycle Trail Riding.<br />
This out-and-back trail crosses open plains, revealing the tall mountains rising around you, and it also winds through thick, secluded forests. It's a perfect place to get outside, but remember to share the trail!

name: Colorado Midland Ute Pass
description: Explore 6 130 year old train tunnels along the Colorado Midland Ute. This trail is full of history as the tunnels will show, but make sure you bring a flashlight along. It is recommended that you hike with a partner on this trail instead of alone.

name: Lower Loop
description: This is an easy hiking trail that is accessible right from the residential streets of Crested Butte. These trails are relatively flat, but the lack of trees allows them to provide incredible views of the surrounding mountain peaks and the nearby Slate River. This is very popular with locals and tourists alike.

name: Mr. Toad's Wild Ride
description: Mr. Toad's Wild Ride features 20 miles of hiking trails near South Lake Tahoe, NV.

name: Miss River - Upper
description:
The Upper Mississippi River Project offers extensive opportunities for water-based recreation, ranging from backwater hunting and fishing to long-distance cruising in the main channel.

There are plenty of hiking trails and interpretive hiking trails that run throughout this area. Most of them will follow the Mississippi and offer views of the river.

name: Rock Bridge Memorial State Park
description: Rock Bridge Memorial State Park offers a diverse variety of recreational opportunities to visitors. The park's location a few minutes from Columbia make it a popular location for a day of fun. Some of the most popular hiking trails in Missouri are located here. Cycling, horseback riding, interpretive programming, picnicking, orienteering and fishing are other common activities here.

name: Reno / Flag / Bear / Deadman
description: The Reno, Flag, Bear, and Deadman trails are some of the best singletrack trails in Crested Butte! They offer gorgeous views of the surrounding mountains, high alpine meadows, and deep Colorado forests.

name: Elk Park Trail
description:
Elk Park Trail is an 11 mile out-and-back trail close to the Barr Trail on the famous Pikes Peak. Cross streams, scale mountains, and wind through forests along this scenic trail. It offers great views and gets you away from some of the crowds on the Barr Trail.<br />
This is a multi-use trail so please practice trail etiquette.

name: Palmer Park
description: Great hiking trails for all skill levels. The park topography consists of a mesa with finger-like extensions dotted with pine and scrub. Great views of the city and miles of trails!

name: Garden of the Gods (Ute Trail)
description:
There are numerous trails to hike at Garden of the Gods. Some of them are paved and crowded with tourists, and some of them are narrow singletrack that's more remote.

I have visited many natural places, and Garden of the Gods is close to the top of my lists of most beautiful places of all time! You have to experience the grandeur of these sandstone rocks!

Garden of the Gods is also very popular as a rock climbing and bouldering destination.

name: Appalachian Trail 074: US 522 to VA 55
description: This section of the Appalachian Trail runs 8.2 miles from US Hwy 522 to VA Hwy 55/I-66. Along the way it passes High Knob and the Jim & Molly Denton Shelter.

name: Indian Camp Creek
description: Indian Camp Creek features 8 miles of hiking trails near Wentzeville, MO.

name: Dyke
description: This is a gorgeous, high-altitude trail that offers up amazing views of the nearby mountain peaks. Also, this trail goes through the Kebler Pass aspen grove, one of the largest aspen groves & largest living organisms on the planet! Hiking this trail is worth it just for the aspens!

name: Mueller State Park
description:
Mueller State Park's 55 miles of trails provide a 5,000-acre playground for the hiker, mountain biker and wildlife watcher. Visitors are invited to explore the park's natural and historical resources via 55 miles of trails. Trails vary from short, leisurely walks to challenging, full-day hikes. The average elevation in the park is 9,600 feet. All trails are open to hikers.<br />
Mueller has several short trails for the family to enjoy. Each trail ranges in distance from one-half mile to 3-1/3 miles round trip.

name: Olmstead Loop
description: Olmstead Loop features 9 miles of hiking trails near Cool, CA.

name: Blue River Trails
description: Blue River Trails features 10 miles of hiking trails near Kansas City, MO.

name: Big Bone Lick State Historic Site
description: The discovery trail behind the visitor's center gives visitors a glimpse of the drama that unfolded at the springs during Pleistocene epoch, commonly called the most recent Ice Age. The trail is open daily from dawn to dusk.

name: Wye Island NRMA
description: Wildlife viewing and hiking are the most popular activities on Wye Island's six miles of trails. The School House Woods Nature Trail takes you through a mature hardwood forest while the Ferry Landing Trail leads beneath a canopy of Osage Orange Trees. Wye Island also houses a Holly Tree that is more than 290 years old. Follow the Holly Tree Trail to visit this long-time resident.

name: Big Creek Trail
description: Big Creek Trail features 9 miles of hiking trails near Hays, KS.

name: Lost River State Park
description: Several miles of hiking trails lead to hours of exercise and an unparalleled opportunity for nature study given the abundance of flora and fauna found in the park.   One rewarding trail leads to Cranny Crow overlook with its commanding views of the park from 3,200 feet.

name: Heiser To Barr Trail
description:
Heiser To Barr Trail is a difficult uphill climb to the pristine Manitou Reservoir. Once you reach the reservoir you start to head back down and the trail meets back up with the Barr Trail. <br />
This is a hard 14 miles so make sure you're prepared and have plenty of water!

name: Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park
description:
Hiking and biking along the towpath are excellent ways to see the park. Hiker-Biker Campsites are located from Swain's Lock to Cumberland. Several park areas have interpretive trails and other hiking opportunities.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Pine Nut
description: Pine Nut features 12 miles of hiking trails near Gardnerville, NV.

name: Folkstone Park Trail
description: Folkstone Park Trail features 2 miles of hiking trails near Herndon, VA.

name: Shenandoah National Park
description:
Shenandoah National Park has over 500 miles of trails, including 101 miles of the Appalachian Trail. Some trails lead to a waterfall or viewpoint; others penetrate deep into the forest and wilderness.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Hidden Falls Park
description: Hidden Falls Park features 7 miles of hiking trails near Auburn, CA.

name: Deer Creek
description:
The Deer Creek trail is 7.6 miles long. It begins at Forest Road 582.1 and ends at Forest Road 956.2. The trail is open for the following uses: hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding.<br />
Hike through dense alpine forests along beautiful singletrack and enjoy the high alpine views that are available on this trail.

name: Appalachian Trail 075: VA 55 to Ashby Gap
description: The AT runs 11.8 miles from VA Hwy 55 (I-66) to Ashby Gap (VA Hwy 601). Along the way it passes Manassas Gap shelter, Blue Mountain, and Dick's Dome shelter.

name: 30 Miles Of Auburn
description: 30 Miles Of Auburn features 30 miles of hiking trails near Auburn, CA.

name: Florissant Fossil Beds National Monument
description:
There are over 14 miles of hiking trails in the Monument. Most of the trails wind through pine covered hills with patches of Aspen and Douglas Fir. Some of the trails pass wet meadows or through riparian areas.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Wilson State Park
description: Three excellent hiking trails.

name: Switchgrass
description: Switchgrass features 13 miles of hiking trails near Wilson, KS.

name: Clementine Loop
description: Clementine Loop features 11 miles of hiking trails near Auburn, CA.

name: Pulpit Rock Park
description: Pulpit Rock Park is a 6 mile hiking trail in Colorado Springs, Colorado.

name: Snodgrass
description: Snodgrass isn't as steep or remote of a trails as many near Crested Butte. The trailhead is just a short drive from town, and it meanders through a beautiful aspen forest as it slowly climbs to the open meadows at the top of the ridge. For such a short little trail, that is close to town, this is really stunning!

name: Strasburg Reservoir
description: Strasburg Reservoir features 5 miles of hiking trails near Front Royal, VA.

name: Newton Lake
description:
Southwest of Newton in Jasper County, the 6,400-acre area hosts a variety of wildlife, including the state endangered prairie chicken and river otter. The site offers excellent fishing, ample picnic areas and a picturesque 540-acre shoreline trail system, as well as a 1,775-acre cooling lake. The park is an excellent location for boating (south access), fishing, hiking (22 miles), horseback riding, hunting, mountain biking and cross country skiing.

The 22 miles of hiking trails follow the picturesque shoreline and are also open to cross-country skiing and equestrian use. Five miles of the trail is open for mountain biking use. No motorized vehicles are allowed.

name: Anderson Marsh State Historic Park
description: Two trails lead along the wetter parts of the park-Cache Creek and the marsh. Two other trails-Ridge (which ascends through an oak woodland) and Anderson Flats (which crosses a grassland) explore drier parts of the park. It's less than a mile's walk to the reconstructed Pomo village.

name: Ute Valley Park
description:
Ute Valley Park has 8 miles of trails that wind through desert terrain. Most of these trails are wide and are fairly easy to hike. You'll have plenty of chances to view the stunning scenery that surrounds the park.<br />
These trails are multi-use, so please share the path.

name: North Catamount Reservoir
description:
North Catamount Reservoir has 10 miles of hiking trails that skirt the lake and wind through the nearby forests. Enjoy beautiful views of the reservoir and the surrounding area. <br />
These trails are open to mountain bikers as well so be sure to share the trail!

name: Cedar Creek State Park
description: Fourteen miles of trails offer guests a range of hiking experiences from leisure to challenging. Hikes are an excellent opportunity to observe the park's abundant wildlife.

name: Santa Fe Trail
description:
Santa Fe Trail takes you through the communities of Palmer Lake and Monument, and then it turns onto the Air Force Academy territory. The trail is a really nice, wide multi-use trail that makes for an easy hike. <br />
Please share the trail with other users.

name: Clementine/forresthill Connector Trail
description: Clementine/forresthill Connector Trail features 4 miles of hiking trails near Auburn, CA.

name: Cape May Point State Park
description: Excellent hiking area.

name: Elizabeth Furnace
description: Elizabeth Furnace features 15 miles of hiking trails near Front Royal, VA.

name: Eleven Mile SP
description:
Eleven Mile SP is esteemed for its outstanding fishing. Eleven Mile is also a popular site for sailing, windsurfing, boating, hiking and camping.

The park offers several hiking trails with various levels of difficulty. Some of which are the self-guided Nature Trail and an Orienteering trail. The trails offer beautiful meadow views, wildlife sightings and a backcountry peninsula view.

name: Clinton State Park
description: If just getting out and about is your interest, try the park's three hiking trails. The 5 mile Houseboat Cove Trail north of the beach is easy to moderate in difficulty and follows the shoreline and comes back through the woods. The 9.3 mile North Fork Trail is more challenging, running through the steeply wooded banks of the lake, and providing unparalleled views of the lake and opportunities to view wildlife. There are no exits anywhere, so be prepared for 4.2 miles up and 5.1 miles back. There's also a 40-acre restored prairie along the North Fork, but beautiful wildflowers can be seen along both trails.
