A ten mile equestrian/hiking/cross-county ski trail is located on the north side of the lake east of the Parnell Access Area. Horse trailer parking is at that location. The area is now equipped with a wheelchair ramp for mounting horses.  All equestrian trails are closed to horses from Oct. 1 to the end of archery deer season.

name: Copper Creek
description: Copper Creek features 1 miles of hiking trails near Herndon, VA.

name: Clinton State Park
description: Clinton State Park features 25 miles of hiking trails near Lawrence, KS.

name: Foresthill Divide
description: Foresthill Divide features 11 miles of hiking trails near Auburn, CA.

name: Stonewall Resort
description: Great hiking.

name: Colvin Run Trail
description: Colvin Run Trail features 4 miles of hiking trails near Reston, VA.

name: Blodgett
description: Blodgett Peak hiking trail leads steeply up the mountain to a relatively-low elevation peak. However, the views from the top make the climb worth it, as it gives panoramic views of nearby Pikes Peak and the United States Air Force Academy.

name: Difficult Run
description: Difficult Run features 30 miles of hiking trails near Reston, VA.

name: Little Falls Stream Valley Park
description: Great trail.

name: Tuckahoe State Park
description: Trails that wander through the park include the Tuckahoe Valley Trail, a self-guided Natural Trail, the Physical Fitness Trail and the Lake Trail.

name: CDT CO23: South Clear Creek to Halfmoon Creek
description: Section 23 of the CDT in Colorado runs 28.2 miles from South Clear Creek to Halfmoon Creek. Along the way, the trail passes the Sheep Gulch Trailhead, Willis Gulch, Middle Mountain, Ervin Peak, Mount Hope, Quail Mountain, Twin Lakes, Hwy 82, and Mount Elbert (elevation 14,433), the highest peak in Colorado and the highest of the Rocky Mountains of North America.

name: Trail 401
description:
Trail 401 is a trail of epic grandeur. This trail defines "high-alpine:" the summit tops out at 11,400 feet. Along it's entire length, 401 provides epic views of the surrounding mountain peaks, the valley below, and then gorgeous views of the Maroon Bells wilderness from the top. Portions of this trail pass through deep Colorado forests, but most of it runs through high-alpine meadows full of head-tall wildflowers. Hiking Trail 401 is truly unlike any other trail experience!

Note: 401 is also named "Trailriders Trail," as it is a massively famous mountain bike trail. Just be aware when you head out!

name: Lake Fairfax
description: Lake Fairfax features 3 miles of hiking trails near Reston, VA.

name: Stonewall Jackson Lake
description:
A major recreation area is located at the Stonewall Jackson State Park which provides visitors with numerous opportunities including a 374 slip marina, picnic facilities and a 18 hole championship golf course, lodge, cabins and additional campsites. Backwater areas provide excellent fishing opportunities. Canoeists and other paddlers can explore the many inlets and backwater areas along the lake's 82-mile shoreline.

Trails extend throughout this area giving access to many different points of the lake and providing beautiful views of the area. Visitors can explore miles of these beautiful hiking and biking trails which meander along the 18,000-acre Stonewall Jackson Wildlife Management Area.

Remember to share the trail!

name: Lawrence Riverfront Trails
description: Lawrence Riverfront Trails features 8 miles of hiking trails near Lawrence, KS.

name: West Monument Creek Trail #713
description: Loop hike that takes you past the Tesla Plant and up a steep canyon until finally dropped back via Stanley Canyon trail. The 713 trail is rarely crowded - in fact each time I've hiked past the Tesla plant I've seen no one.

name: Falcon Trail
description:
This beautiful trail tours the grounds of the US Air Force Academy. The trail traverses wide open prairies and secluded low mountain woods. It's a great place to get some sights in while enjoying nature. <br />
This is a multi-use trail so please be respectful, also expect a possible car search at the gate.

name: D. L. Bliss State Park
description: The Balancing Rock, "tons of granite resting precariously on a slender stone base", has long been a natural attraction on Lake Tahoe's western shore. Visitors to the Lake Tahoe area in the late 1800's and early 1900's enjoyed being photographed next to this geological marvel.

name: Graham Cave State Park
description: Take a short stroll or challenging hike on one of five trails.

name: Rampart Reservoir
description:
This is a beautiful loop trail with plenty of side trails to explore as well. The path takes you through thick forests around the reservoir, where you'll get spectacular views of the lake and the surrounding mountains.<br />
Please share the path with mountain bikers.<br />
<br />
*Currently this area is closed due to damage from wild fires.

name: Rhett's Run
description: Rhett's Run features 6 miles of hiking trails near Columbia, MO.

name: Landahl Park Trails
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Manchester State Park
description: Manchester's beach is complemented by a sizeable upland area. Instead of the usual out-and-back-beach walk characteristic of most state or county beaches, Manchester offers the hiker a loop trail tour of dark sand, ponds, bluffs and dunes.

name: North Fork Mountain Trail
description: North Fork Mountain Trail features 24 miles of hiking trails near Petersburg Or Franklin, Wv, WV.

name: Blue River Parkway Trails
description: Blue River Parkway has several miles of trails (12  miles) that run along both sides of the Blue River. The trails begin near Red Bridge Road on the north and extend south of Martin City to 139th Street. Trails are suitable for hiking, mountain biking and some equestrian use. See volunteer website below for more information on various trails and difficulty levels.

name: Capital Crescent Trail Special Park
description: Excellent hiking/jogging.

name: Sky Meadows State Park
description: Several interconnected hiking trails of slight to moderate difficulty.  Terrain ranges from light forest to open meadow.  There is a historical building and bathroom next to the parking lot.

name: Blue and Gray Park Trails
description: The section running through the park being 2 miles one way. Originates at Missouri Town 1855 in Fleming Park, follows county roads and runs through Blue and Gray Reserve.

name: Swope Park Trail
description: Swope Park Trail is a 5 mile hiking trail in Kansas City, Missouri.

name: Shawnee Mission Park
description: Shawnee Mission Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Lenexa, KS.

name: Stanley Canyon
description: Fairly steep and well traveled hike up to Stanley Reservoir with forest road connection to Rampart Reservoir. Very scenic hike.

name: Mica Mine
description: The Mica Mine trail is 2.6 miles RT and is fairly easy.  It can be hiked by those as young as 4.  It's a great hike through Ladder Canyon to an old Mica Mine site.

name: Muscatatuck Park
description: Muscatatuck Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near North Vernon, IN.

name: Anacostia Tributary Trail System
description: Hiking / jogging

name: Great Falls National Park
description: Great Falls National Park features 6 miles of hiking trails near Mclean, VA.

name: Greenbelt Park
description:
The park offers activities for the naturalist and casual visitor, and it has a conveniently located campground for visitors to the Nation's Capital. Greenbelt Park is an oasis where you can relax in an exceptional outdoor setting and over 10 miles of trails.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Turner Farm
description: Jogging and walking trails

name: Black Forest Section 16 Trail
description:
Black Forest Section 16 Trail is a square shaped loop in the Black Forest. It is a gravel path that provides a 4 mile circle with very little elevation change through the beautiful forest. <br />
This area is popular with horseback riders so please practice trail etiquette.

name: Pere Marquette State Park
description:
Known as Pere, the French word for "Father," missionary Jacques Marquette explored this area with Louis Jolliet in 1673 upon reaching the confluence of the Mississippi and Illinois rivers. Pere Marquette State Park, northwest of St. Louis, near the Illinois community of Grafton, encompasses 8,000 acres of exceptional beauty. The park is a great location for a bald eagle siting during the winter. Pere Marquette State Park offers many year round activities including horseback riding, hiking, hunting, fishing, picnicking, camping and boating. The park is home to 230 species of birds so it is a birdwatcher's paradise. The fishing variety is also excellent with the opportunity to catch bluegill, carp, catfish, crappie, drum, largemouth bass and white bass.

This park offers 12 miles of trails that are excellent for all levels of experience. The trails will take you through thick forests, towering bluffs, wildlife sightings and more. Eagle tours are also offered during the winter.

There are 20 miles or horseback riding trails.

name: Spinney Mountain State Park
description: Fishing trails exist along the river both above and below Spinney Reservoir and can be quite scenic. Hiking around the reservoir can also be fun, but be prepared, it is a long hike and only fishing access and game trails actually exist.

name: East Fork State Park
description: 32-mile Steven Newman Worldwalker Perimeter Trail circles the park and is available for hikers, backpackers, and equestrians plus 4 hiking only trails

name: East Fork
description: East Fork features 8 miles of hiking trails near Cincinnati, OH.

name: Monroe Lake
description: Four hiking trails for easy to moderate hiking.

name: Bristlecone
description:
This moderately strenuous trail has a starting elevation of 9,800 ft. and ascends up another 600 ft. from there. You'll have excellent views of Wheeler Peak, but the main feature is hiking to the Bristlecone Pine Grove. <br />
<br />
Bristlecone Pine Trees are the oldest living (and dead) things on earth. Some are known to have been on this planet for 6,000 years! Once you get to the grove there will be interpretive signs revealing all kinds of information about the ancient trees. <br />
<br />
On the way back you can head straight back to the parking lot, or take a detour onto the Alpine Lakes Loop Trail.

name: Alpine Lakes Loop
description: This 2.7 mile loop starts at 9,800 ft and escalates up another 600 ft from there. This trail provides excellent views of Wheeler Peak and passes by to beautiful alpine lakes called Stella and Teresa.

name: Lovell Gulch
description: Lovell Gulch is an nice 5 mile loop trail that has relatively easy climbs but stunningly beautiful views. Hike through dense forests and skirt large granite boulders along the trail. Dive down into some small valleys and then hike along a ridge that showcases Pikes Peak and the Sawatch Range.

name: Black Forest Regional Park
description:
This park includes 427 acres and is located approximately four miles east of Interstate 25 on Shoup Road. As suggested by its name, the character of Black Forest Park is dominated by the presence of the ponderosa pine forest.<br />
The developed area, with turf playfields, tennis courts and two picnic pavilions, were developed in natural openings of the forest. A six mile, loop trail used for non-motorized recreation winds through the park.

name: Great Basin National Park
description:
Great Basin National Park offers over 60 miles of developed hiking trails. Trail maps are available for purchase through the Western National Parks Association bookstores in both visitor centers.<br />
Day hikers are asked to sign in at trailhead registers. Permits are not required for backcountry camping, but registration is free and strongly encouraged.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Clear Lake State Park
description: Hikers enjoy the Indian Nature Trail, a self-guided trail that shows how the Pomo people, who lived in the area for centuries, utilized the area's resources. The trail passes through the site of what was once a Pomo village.

name: Prairie Spirit Trail State Park
description: The only rail-trail in the Kansas State Park system, Prairie Spirit Trail is a unique linear park through three counties in eastern Kansas with eight pocket parks along the way. It is a greenway and travel corridor open to pedestrians and bicyclists traversing diverse ecosystems including tallgrass prairie, riparian areas, agricultural lands, and communities.

name: Appalachian Trail 076: Ashby Gap to Snickers Gap (VA 7)
description:
The Appalachian Trail runs 14.1 miles between Ashby Gap (VA Hwy 601) to Snickers Gap (VA Hwy 7). This is the last section of the AT in Virginia. Along the way it passes the Rod Hollow shelter, Sam Moore shelter, and the Bears Den Hostel.<br />
<br />
If you are north bound, pick up the AT trail descriptions in West Virginia, or click here.

name: The Ribbon
description:
The Ribbon Trailhead provides access to the top end of the Ribbon Trail which snakes its way down massive slickrock slabs, past towering Ponderosa pines, and along a narrow ribbon of slickrock sloping toward the canyons below. Sweeping vistas of the Grand Mesa, Grand Valley, and Little Bookcliffs are another highlight of this trail.<br />
This is an out-and-back trail, so in total you'll be hiking about 8 miles.

name: Riverbend Regional Park
description: Portion of the Potomac Heritage Trail.

name: Potomac Heritage Trail (Virginia)
description:
http://www.f... ks/riverbend<br />
Hours:Park: Daily, 7am-dusk. Visitor Center: Jan-Feb, Mon & Wed-Sun 11am-4pm; Mar-Dec, Mon & Wed-Sun 9am-5pm<br />
Cost:Free<br />
Ages:All Ages<br />
Riverbend Park boasts over 400 acres of forest, meadows, ponds, and streams bordering the Potomac River. Numerous resident and migrant birds, and spectacular wildflowers are some of its highlights. A pavilion, available for special events, can be reserved on a first-come, first-served basis. Other facilities include picnic tables and a boat ramp for private launches. Swimming is prohibited in the river.<br />
<br />
Riverbend Park Nature Center is located at 8814 Jeffery Road and is open only for scheduled programs, groups, and appointments; for more information call 703.759.3211. The Visitor Center (address above) has live animals, seasonal exhibits, a nature library, and a naturalist on duty during open hours. Information about several self-guided programs can be picked up at the Visitor Center,

name: Cuivre River State Park
description: You can thoroughly explore the park on the 11 hiking trails.

name: Sandy Point State Park
description: Whether you feel like taking a recreational walk or looking for some of Maryland's beautiful plants and animals, Sandy Point State Park has an opportunity for you. The Symbi Trail is located by the first picnic area on the right after entering the park. This trail provides views of an old planted pine forest and leads to neighboring marshes that many plants and animals call home. There is another short trail near the small craft parking lot that provides hikers with wooded cover that is perfect for seeing some of Maryland's distinctive birds.

name: Dolly Sods North (while Available)
description: Dolly Sods North (while Available) features 30 miles of hiking trails near Canaan Valley, WV.

name: Hickory Ridge
description: Hickory Ridge features 46 miles of hiking trails near Bedford, IN.

name: Hills Creek State Park
description: 4 trails offer excellent hiking

name: Kowalski Camp
description: The Kowalski trail offers the hiker 2.5 miles following the reservoir's west edge. You must cross the dam to access the trail.

name: William H. Harsha Lake
description: William H. Harsha Lake, OH is located on the East Fork of the Little Miami River in Clermont County. In 1869 there were two active gold mines on the project. One, located on the north bank in the vicinity of Elk Lick, consisted of a flume for washing glacial deposits. The other was a tunnel mine in the vicinity of Twin Bridges. East Fork State Park is popular with hikers boasting 85 miles of hiking trails. Horseback riders can enjoy 57 miles of trail. The 2,160 acre lake attracts water enthusiasts of all kinds.

name: Allegheny (park To Park)
description: Allegheny (park To Park) features 8 miles of hiking trails near Davis / Canaan Valley, WV.

name: Cabin John Regional Park
description: Excellent hiking area.

name: Ward Charcoal Ovens State Park
description: Ward Charcoal Ovens State Park is a beautiful area known for its six beehive-shaped historic ovens. The historic area represents a unique chapter in Nevada's mining history. The park is also popular for hiking, mountain biking, picnicking, camping, fishing and cross-country skiing and snowshoeing in the winter.

name: Audra State Park
description: Excellent hiking.

name: England Idlewild Mountain Biking Park
description: England Idlewild Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Burlington, KY.

name: Broadneck Warm-up
description: Broadneck Warm-up features 2 miles of hiking trails near Arnold, MD.

name: Lower Crags Crest Trail
description:
The Crag Crest Trail #711 is a designated National Recreation Trail and is restricted to foot travel except for the first 1.5 miles of trail from the West Trailhead. This section which connects the West Trailhead with the Cottonwood Trailhead is also open to horses. This trail has become popular because it offers many scenic vistas and a unique display of geologic history. <br />
The trail is a 6.64 mile route which connects Island Lake with Eggleston Lake, however, this may be extended to a 10 mile circular hike by returning to the original trailhead on the Crag Crest Lower Loop Trail #711.1. The trail rises steeply to the crest from the East Trailhead, and more gradually from the West Trailhead. Some sections along the top portion of the crest are narrow with drop-offs on both sides. Due to the high elevation of this trail, travel is often hampered by snow drifts until early July.

name: Lunch Loop / Tabeguache
description:
This hike traverses beautiful desert terrain and the path winds through low-lying brush and climbs up scenic bluffs and mesas. With a lack of trees and forests, this trail allows you to view the entire area around, and the desert colors are stunning.<br />
This trail is mainly used as a mountain bike trail, so please share the path.

name: Pet - A - Kes
description: Pet-A -Kes is a 1 mile climb within the lunch loops trail network. Traverse rocky climbs to get to the top of this trail, and then take in the beautiful desert scenery it provides. You're sure to love this trail, and plenty of other people do too, so make sure you look out for other hikers and bikers and you share the trail!

name: Holy Cross
description:
Located in the Redlands area of Grand Junction, this trail is a fun hike full of climbing around boulders and enormous trees. Enjoy the desert landscape that the trail winds through, but know that this trail was built for mountain bikers. <br />
Remember to share the trail and practice trail etiquette.

name: Ronald C. McDonnell Campground Loop
description: Ronald C. McDonnell Campground Loop is a 3 mile hiking trail in Bethesda, Maryland.

name: Wheaton Regional Park
description: Excellent trails.

name: West Bench Trail
description:
The West Bench Trail #501 begins at the information sign and travels southward where it crosses a wooden bridge over Mesa Creek. It intersects a natural road and heads northwest parrelling the road. When the road ends the trail goes back to a single track and intersects a fenceline. <br />
After passing through a rock slide and crossing a stream bed it enters an open meadow and then into aspen and spruce/fir. It continues on through meadows and spruce/fir forests, crossing a stream several times before ending at the forest boundary information sign.

name: Horsepen Run/algoinkian Park
description: Horsepen Run/algoinkian Park features 7 miles of hiking trails near Sterling, VA.

name: Cow Mountain Recreation Area
description: Plenty of hiking.

name: Vance's Cove
description: Vance's Cove features 8 miles of hiking trails near Strasburg, VA.

name: Ed Z'berg Sugar Pine Point State Park
description: Trees are one attraction of a hike through the state park. Besides the sugar pine, look for Jeffrey pine and stately white &#64257;r. In autumn, the black cottonwood and quaking aspen are something to behold.

name: Arrow Rock State Historic Site
description: Two trails run through the park.

name: Landahl Park Reseve
description: Landahl Park Reseve features 8 miles of hiking trails near Blue Springs, MO.

name: Tower Park
description: Tower Park features 4 miles of hiking trails near Cincinnati, OH.

name: Fox Run Regional Park
description:
Fox Run Park is located in the Black Forest approximately three miles east of Interstate 25. The 417-acre park features spectacular views of Pikes Peak, four miles of trails, multi-use fields, two playgrounds, two ponds, and five picnic pavilions.<br />
There are 2 looped trails that weave throughout the ponderosa forests. This is a multi-use trail so please share the path with mountain bikers.

name: Odenton Park
description: Odenton Park features 4 miles of hiking trails near Odenton, Md, MD.

name: Two Creeks Trail Area
description: Two Creeks Trail Area features 0 miles of hiking trails near Leesburg, VA.

name: Finger Lakes State Park
description: Hike along the rugged Kelley Branch Mountain Bike Trail.

name: Boone's Lick State Historic Site
description: Learn about the historic site along the interpretive trail.

name: Fairland Recreational Park
description: Fairland Regional Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Burtonsville, MD.

name: Knobstone
description:
The rugged terrain of this 58 mile backcountry hiking trail is often compared to the Appalachian Trail (AT), and many people use it to train for the AT. The Indiana Department of Natural Resources manages the Knobstone Trail (KT) in Clark, Scott, and Washington counties in southern Indiana. It is Indiana's longest footpath, passing through Clark State Forest, Elk Creek Public Fishing Area, and Jackson-Washington State Forest. These state resource properties contain nearly 40,000 acres of rugged, forested land. The trail presently extends from near Deam Lake, just north of SR 60 in Clark County, to Delaney Park, just east of SR 135 in Washington County.<br />
(Description by Grateful One.)

name: Twin Lakes Loop
description:
The breathtaking natural beauty of Colorado's largest glacial lakes, reflecting some of the nation's highest peaks, makes Twin Lakes one of the world's most scenic places. This 12 mile loop trail circles these stunning alpine lakes, and highlights the beautiful scenery the surrounds the area. Enjoy the view of Mt. Elbert, the highest peak in Colorado, from the trail. <br />
This is a multi-use trail, so please share the path.

name: Versailles State Park
description: The Versailles State Park offers three great hiking trails. One is easy level of difficulty and the other two are moderate.

name: Limbaugh Canyon (715)
description: Limbaugh Canyon (715) is a 25 mile hiking trail in Monument, Colorado.

name: Mount Herman Trail
description: Mount Herman Trail offers a wide range of trails that take you through aspen forests, along creek beds, up to the summit, or out in wide open fields.

name: Hendy Woods SP
description: 2 miles of hiking trails provide the visitor with a detailed view of both redwood groves, Big Hendy and Little Hendy. During the hiking experience, you will find various picnicking sites for a calming break or meal amidst the surrounding groves and the nearby Navarro River.

name: Kelley Branch Mountain Bike/hiking Trail
description: Kelley Branch Mountain Bike/hiking Trail features 3 miles of hiking trails near Columbia, MO.

name: Forked Run State Park
description: 3 hiking trails provide opportunity for exploration, exercise, nature study and wildlife observation.

name: Millsite State Park
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Henson Creek Trail
description: Hiking/jogging.

name: Blue Springs Lake and Beach Trails
description: 3 mile, one way. Starts at flagpole on Liggett Rd. to Woods Chapel Rd. around the east side of the lake.  A 2-mile, Class I trail along Liggett Rd. and a Class II lane on Woods Chapel Rd. shoulder completes a 5 mile loop of this trail.

name: Stevens Trail
description: The trail provides a gentle slope that is suitable for even the most novice hikers.  From the present parking area at the headwaters of Slaughter Ravine near Colfax, the trail heads north and gradually down slopes in elevation.  From there, it turns east beneath the renowned Central Pacific Railroad, Cape Horn, crossing Robbers Ravine, and finally ends at Secret Ravine.

name: Colorado National Monument
description:
Colorado National Monument's trails offer many opportunities for hikers. Bird watchers and photographers discover the splendor that they traveled so far to find. Hikes range from only 0.25 mile to over 14 miles.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Tahoe Rim Trail - Spooner Summit To Kingsbury Grade
description: Tahoe Rim Trail - Spooner Summit To Kingsbury Grade features 13 miles of hiking trails near South Lake Tahoe, CA.

name: Tahoe Rim Trail - Spooner Summit To Kingsbury Grade
description: Tahoe Rim Trail - Spooner Summit To Kingsbury Grade features 13 miles of hiking trails near South Lake Tahoe, CA.

name: Tahoe Rim Trail - Spooner Summit To Kingsbury Grade
description: Tahoe Rim Trail - Spooner Summit To Kingsbury Grade features 13 miles of hiking trails near South Lake Tahoe, CA.

name: Trt Spooner To South Camp Peak
description: Trt Spooner To South Camp Peak features 11 miles of hiking trails near Incline Village, NV.

name: Plantation Trail
description: Plantation Trail features 8 miles of hiking trails near Davis, WV.

name: Milford State Park
description: Four trails offer excellent hiking.

name: Blackwater Falls State Park
description: The park offers over 20 miles of hiking trails. Map and trail guides are available which will assist guests in planning a hike of the right length and duration.

name: Flume Trail
description: Flume Trail features 14 miles of hiking trails near Tahoe, CA.

name: Sheep Creek
description:
Sheep Creek takes you through beautiful aspen groves and wide open fields that showcase the stunning mountains that surround you. There are some creek crossings along the trail and make sure to keep your eyes open for some beaver dams!<br />
This is a multi-use trail so be sure to share the path.

name: Dobbin House Trail
description: Dobbin House Trail features 5 miles of hiking trails near Davis, WV.

name: Appalachian Trail 077: Snickers Gap to Keys Gap (WV 9)
description:
The Appalachian Trail runs 13.5 miles from Snickers Gap (VA Hwy 7) to Keys Gap (WV Hwy 9). Along the way it passes Raven Rocks, the Blackburn Trail Center, and the David Lesser Memorial shelter.<br />
<br />
If you are south bound, pick up the AT trail descriptions in Virginia. (Or click here.)

name: Palisade Rim
description:
Palisade Rim is a beautiful out-and-back trail that you can connect with other trails in the network to make a loop. The trail follows along the rim and the edge of the cliffs, giving you an amazing view of the surrounding area.<br />
This trail is shared by mountain bikers so please share the path.

name: Kaw River State Park
description: Hiking and mountain-biking trails wind through an extensive oak-hickory forest on steep slopes with good views.

name: Milford Lake
description: Hiking trails throughout the area.

name: Palmer Lake Reservoir
description: The main entrance to the area lies between Sundance and Chautaqua Mountains and is actually the closed east end of Balanced Rock Road (aka FR322).  The road leads to both the Lower and Upper Reservoirs in addition to acting as the base to an extensive trail network.  The west end of the road connects to Rampart Range Road near the Manitou Experimental Forrest.

name: Rock Creek Regional Park
description: Experience nature and wildlife while hiking over 13 miles of scenic trails at the park. Natural surface trails cover the Lake Needwood and Lake Frank areas.

name: Greenwood State Beach
description:
Descending from the bluffs, the trail soon forks. The right fork leads to a picnic site. The left (main trail) continues downhill to a picnic site as well, then reaches the beach.

You can walk down-coast 0.2 mile to the mouth of Greenwood Creek and to a cliff beyond that blocks further passage. Hikers can travel about 0.2 mile up-coast before cliffs thwart northward progress.

name: Seneca Bluffs Trail
description: Seneca Bluffs Trail is a 4 mile hiking trail in Darnestown, Maryland.

name: Cvi Trails
description: Cvi Trails features 15 miles of hiking trails near Davis, WV.

name: Perry State Park
description: Great area for hiking.

name: W&od Trail
description: W&od Trail features 90 miles of hiking trails near Northern Virginia, VA.

name: Appalachian Trail: West Virginia
description:
The Appalachian Trail runs for 20 miles through the state of West Virginia, from the <a href="http://www.tripleblaze.com/3/3332/Virginia/Appalachian-Trail--Virginia.html">Virginia</a> border to the <a href="http://www.tripleblaze.com/Hiking-Trails/Maryland_24.html">Maryland</a> border. <br />
Click on the section listings below for additional information.

name: Schaeffer Farms
description: Schaeffer Farms features 10 miles of hiking trails near Germantown, MD.

name: Wapehani MTB Park
description: Wapehani MTB Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near Bloomington, IN.

name: Seneca Creek State Park Trail
description: Seneca Creek State Park Trail features 7 miles of hiking trails near Germantown, MD.

name: Lake Alma State Park
description: Lake Alma State Park is a beautiful 292-acre park amidst some of Ohio's rugged terrain. The park is home to a 60-acre lake and flowing creek. Camping is a relaxing pastime here, as well as picnicking. Boating, fishing, swimming, cross-country skiing, ice-skating and hiking are other common activities here. About 2.25 miles of hiking trails divided into three paths are available for moderate hiking.

name: James M. Robb - Colorado River State Park
description: There is a wonderful 3 mile long paved hiking trail that heads west from Corn Lake to the Wildlife Area as well as a 1.5 mile paved trail that heads east of the Corn Lake boat ramp. Be sure to check out the .75 mile long trail at Island Acres that follows the Colorado River. Connected Lakes has 4 miles of trails that circle around the lakes on the park, both paved and hard packed. The Fruita section has a .25 mile trail between the Colorado River and Bookcliff Lake and a trail that goes completely around Red Rocks Lake.

name: Seneca Creek State Park
description: Trails for hiking and bicycling wind through a variety of habitat. A detailed trail map is available at the park office. Mountain bikes may be used on some trails.

name: Wincopin (Savage) Trail
description: Wincopin Trail features 7 miles of hiking trails near Columbia, MD.

name: Cache Creek Natural Area
description: This secluded, hilly expanse of oak woodlands, grasslands, and chaparral is a combination of over 70,000 acres of BLM managed lands and 4,700 acres of State and County lands.  The Natural Area is traversed by Cache Creek, with its year-round water flow. Elevation ranges from 3200 feet atop Brushy Sky High, down to 600 feet in the eastern end of Cache Creek along State Route 16. Showcasing the area is about 35 miles of the main fork of Cache Creek and 2.5 miles of the north fork. Also present are several tributary creeks that contain permanent water.

name: South Germantown Recreational Park
description: In the 1960s, M-NCPPC/Montgomery Parks began acquiring the land that is now South Germantown Recreational Park in order to preserve open space and provide parkland for residents in northern Montgomery County. Most of the park's 695 acres of rolling hills were once the James and Macie King Farm, a working dairy farm since the mid-1800s. The park's state-of-the-art facilities offer visitors a variety of leisure activities from which to choose, including hiking, biking, archery, miniature golf, swimming, soccer, picnicking, and adventure play, to name just a few. Facilities are still being added to accommodate residents' diverse interests.

name: CDT CO24: Halfmoon Creek to Timberline Lake
description: Section 24 of the CDT runs 13 miles from Halfmoon Creek to Timberline Lake. Along the way, the trail passes North Willow Creek, Rock Creek, Hagerman Road, Busk Creek, Mount Massive (elevation 14,421), the Mount Massive Wilderness Area, County Road 4, and Turquoise Lake.

name: Hoyles Mill Conservation Park
description: 6.3 miles of combined natural and hard surface trail.

name: Agricultural History Farm Park
description: Enjoy over 4 miles of natural surface hiking trails.

name: Perry Lake
description: Excellent trails.

name: Shakamak State Park
description:
Shakamak State Park is a relaxing park with 400 acres of water for unlimited fishing, boating and relaxation! The park also has an aquatic center for family use. Several campsites in the area are in a shady, cool area with beautiful surroundings. The park has picnic areas, a nature center, boat ramps, reservable cabins, hiking trails, a tennis court and a field for games. There is also an area where the visitor can rent paddle boats and rowboats.

The hiking trails add up to about 10 miles in length. They are mostly composed of moderate terrain and offer a variety of scenery from shorelines to forests.

name: Ramsey Lake State Recreation Area
description:
1,980 acres of rolling hills, wooded shoreline and the Ramsey Lake centerpiece make this park a popular recreation spot for those who enjoy hiking, picnicking, hunting, fishing or camping. Visitors will marvel at the relaxation and seclusion that the park's picturesque woods, and picnic areas provide. This park has something for everyone. Ramsey Lake State Recreation Area is known for its former fox and coon hunting popularity and carnival use.

The park provides ideal amenities for camping and picnicking.

A one mile hiking trail winds through the park, plus there are many unmarked fire lanes that the public used for hiking purposes. There is also a 13-mile horseback riding trail which can also be used for hiking.

name: Tahoe Rim Trail
description: Tahoe Rim Trail features 165 miles of hiking trails near Tahoe City, CA.

name: Mary's Loop / Horsethief Bench
description:
This trail has plenty to keep you interested. From the beautiful overlooks where you can view the Colorado River, to the rock scrambles, to the wide open valley. This canyon hike will leave you satisfied.<br />
Watch out for mountain bike traffic!

name: Rustlers Loop
description:
This easy 3.5 mile loop takes you around the top of the mesa for stunning views of the Colorado River below. Canyon walls and desert bluffs surround you on this beautiful hike.<br />
Remember to share the path!

name: 3rd Battle Of Winchester Trail
description: 3rd Battle Of Winchester Trail features 5 miles of hiking trails near Winchester, VA.

name: Spruce Meadow
description:
The Spruce Mountain Trail gently switchbacks up Spruce Mountain through a ponderosa pine and Douglas fir forest up to fabulous rocky overlooks and a loop around the fairly-flat, forested mountaintop. The first lookout offers breathtaking views of Greenland Open Space, surrounding buttes, Pikes Peak, the Palmer Divide, Carpenter Creek and thousands of acres of protected open space. <br />
There are plenty of opportunities to gaze off rocky lookouts, ridges and meadows from over 8 miles of trails. Bring your camera. For variety, descend on the service road, hike the loop to the west, and hike back along the Eagle Pass trail.

name: Lake Elkhorn, Columbia
description: Lake Elkhorn, Columbia features 6 miles of hiking trails near Columbia, MD.

name: Greenland Open Space
description: Part of the Colorado Front Range Trail, the lower trail joins into the Old Territorial Road, connecting the old Greenland Townsite to Palmer Lake. The 11-mile trail system is within over 3,000 acres of Greenland Open Space. The trail passes through native grasslands, by ponds, through rolling Gambel oak hills and skirts ponderosa pine forests. There are beautiful views of Greenland open space, buttes and Pikes Peak.

name: Great Seneca Stream Valley Park
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Cave Lake State Park
description: Motorized vehicles are prohibited on all trails. Four developed hiking trails are maintained. An easy, three-mile round trip can be found on the Steptoe Creek Trail. The trail starts at the lower parking lot and crosses the creek on a series of foot and returns via Success Summit Road. The Cave Springs Trail, including five miles of moderately strenuous hiking, starts at the lower parking lot and meanders throughout the surrounding hills. Cave Lake Overlook trail is a strenuous 4.5 mile loop that starts on the east end of the lake. The Twisted Pines Trail is our newest addition that connects to the Overlook Trail. This trail is moderate, starting below Elk Flat Campground. It is just over four miles one way and ends on the Overlook Trail loop.

name: Rocky Fork State Park
description: 2 hiking trails

name: State Forest State Park
description:
The ultimate in rugged Colorado, State Forest State Park offers visitors 71,000 acres of forest, jagged peaks, alpine lakes, wildlife and miles of trails. The park stretches along the west side of the Medicine Bow Mountains and into the north end of the Never Summer Range. <br />
There are plenty of trails that wind through this beautiful park, ranging from .8 miles to 8 miles (one way). There's something for everyone, from the families with small children to the avid backcountry hiker.

name: Brown County Park
description: Brown County Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near Nashville, IN.

name: Government Trail
description:
The trail begins a short distance up Maroon Creek Road at Islen Park behind the tennis courts. It continues across the river to Buttermilk Mountain. The total trip of 7 miles (one way) to Snowmass Village winds through wooded areas and meadows. This is a pleasant hike after a steep beginning. <br />
Hikers MUST be careful to stay on the trail as it crosses private property. Miles one way: 6.8. Elevation: 9,400 ft. - 11,400 ft. (EASY - LONG)

name: Manhattan River Trail (MRT)
description: M.r.t. features 4 miles of hiking trails near Manhattan, KS.

name: Smuggler Road
description: Smuggler Road takes you up a quick and easy trail to the the top of Smuggler Mountain. From the top you'll be able to take in the beautiful views of the surrounding area. You get all the views with less of the work!

name: Zion Curtain
description:
Zion Curtain is a 12 mile loop trail near Fruita, CO. This dusty trail will give you a good workout as you climb up to the top of the rim. From there you'll hike along the top for most of the time and you'll get to take in the beautiful desert scenery. <br />
This is a multi-use trail, so please share the path.

name: Burton Creek State Park
description: Lake Tahoe's secret state park is Burton Creek, more than 2,000 acres of forest and meadowland, located just across the highway from the tiny, but well-known lakeshore campground at Tahoe State Recreation Area.

name: Woodstock Equestrian Special Park
description: Great trails.

name: Moore Fun
description:
This out-and-back trail is part of the Kokopelli Trail system, which means you can link it up with other trails to make it longer, or to use it as a loop. Most of the hike is spent climbing a rocky line with plenty of ledges. Look around because the views along this trail are stunning. <br />
This trail is very popular with mountain bikers, as is this whole area, so please practice trail etiquette and share the trail.

name: Mendocino Lake
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Mendocino Lake
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Mendocino Lake
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Corson's Inlet State Park
description: Good area for hiking the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail.

name: Black Hill Regional Park
description: Scenic views of the lake and surrounding parkland can be enjoyed on over four miles of paved trails. Natural areas within the park can be explored on foot, mountain bike or horseback, on our more than 10 miles of natural surface trails.

name: Palisade State Park
description: Great trails.

name: Empire Mine State Historic Park
description: The park has ten miles of pathways-above ground that is. Below the earth is honeycombed with some 367 miles of tunnels, some nearly a mile deep.

name: Tom Blake Trail
description:
Tom Blake Trail is a 6 mile trail that leads you through thick forests where you'll see beautiful aspen trees. This trail is perfect for a quiet stroll through the woods!<br />
This trail is multi-use, so please share the trail!

name: Rim Trail
description:
Rim Trail takes you along the ridge of the mountain showcasing the stunning views that Snowmass has to offer. Even though you get amazing views on the trail, it's not too difficult besides the initial climbs.<br />
Please share the path with mountain bikers.

name: North Bend State Park
description: North Bend State Park features 20 miles of hiking trails near Harrisville, WV.

name: Beaver Dam State Park
description: Approximately 8 miles of hiking trails within in the park encircle the lake, lead past the marsh, and extend through various wooded areas in the park.

name: Troy Built Trail
description:
Troy Built Trail is an 8 mile out-and-back trail on rocky trails traversing the desert terrain. The trail climbs up canyon walls and looks over the famous Colorado River. This trail is part of the Kokopelli Trail System.<br />
This is a multi-use trail so please share the path.

name: Rachel Carson Conservation Park
description: This park honors America's outstanding writer, environmental activist, and County resident by conserving 650 acres in the Brookeville area of Montgomery County. Most of the park was acquired just after Ms. Carson's death in 1964, although there have been periodic acquisitions through 1990. Rachel Carson Conservation Park is a conservation area dedicated to environmental preservation. The park is undeveloped but provides opportunities for quiet enjoyment of the natural environment. One of the county's premier conservation areas, this Park has more than 6 miles of natural surface trails for hiking and equestrian use.

name: West Shore State Park
description: Excellent hiking.

name: West Branch State Park
description: West Branch features 12 miles of hiking trails near Ravenna, OH.

name: Stonelick State Park
description: 4 hiking trails

name: Patapsco Valley State Park (Avalon Area)
description: Patapsco Valley State Park (Avalon Area) features 20 miles of hiking trails near Ellicot City, MD.

name: Colusa-Sacramento River State Recreation Area
description: For hikers, Colusa is a walk in the park, an easy saunter down to the river and a sandy beach. During the summer, you can swim, if you don't mind cold water.

name: Scioto Trail State Park
description: Scioto Trail State Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near Chillicothe, OH.

name: Tahoe Rim Trail: Tahoe City - Brockaway Summit
description: Tahoe Rim Trail: Tahoe City - Brockaway Summit features 19 miles of hiking trails near Tahoe City, CA.

name: Tahoe Rim Trail: Tahoe City - Brockaway Summit
description: Tahoe Rim Trail: Tahoe City - Brockaway Summit features 19 miles of hiking trails near Tahoe City, CA.

name: Ruth Stockdale/walnut Woods
description: Ruth Stockdale/walnut Woods is a 12 mile hiking trail in Liberty, Missouri.

name: Montgomery Woods State Natural Reserve
description: Redwood admirers know Montgomery Woods State Preserve as a little gem with big trees: 300-foot tall giants in a series of impressive memorial groves. The reserve's location (the most geographically isolated of California's redwood state parks) makes a visit here seem all the more special.

name: Vega State Park
description: Hikers can enjoy easy wildflower walks between Oak Point and Island campgrounds or along the South Road and near the Meadows Group Shelter Area. For a more strenuous two-mile natural surface trail through aspen forest and mountain shrub vegetation begin at the OHV parking lot. This trail doubles as a snowshoe trail in winter months.

name: Harry L. Englebright Lake
description: Harry L. Englebright Lake lies in the Yuba River Canyon, of the Sierra Nevada foothills. There are plenty of year-round recreational activities here including hiking, swimming, boating, canoeing, kayaking, fishing and camping.

name: Washoe Lake State Park
description: Trails are available throughout the park for motorized and non-motorized uses. Non-motorized trails accommodate hikers, mountain bikers and equestrian riders. Motorized trails are limited to the Virginia Range east of the park. Maps are available at the park office and information kiosks throughout the park.

name: Mountwood
description: Mountwood features 35 miles of hiking trails near Parkersburg, WV.

name: Rockburn Branch Park
description: Rockburn Branch Park features 4 miles of hiking trails near Ellicott City, MD.

name: Vineland Trail
description: Vineland Trail features 15 miles of hiking trails near Catonsville, MD.

name: Diamond Peak Loop
description: Diamond Peak Loop features 8 miles of hiking trails near Incline Village, NV.

name: Hart-Miller Island State Park
description: Besides beachcombing, a few trails are open for hiking.

name: Tuttle Creek State Park
description: Miles of hiking near the rugged shoreline.

name: Trt-brockway To Mt. Rose Wilderness
description: Trt-brockway To Mt. Rose Wilderness features 15 miles of hiking trails near Kings Beach, CA.

name: Trt-brockway To Mt. Rose Wilderness
description: Trt-brockway To Mt. Rose Wilderness features 15 miles of hiking trails near Kings Beach, CA.

name: Trt-brockway To Mt. Rose Wilderness
description: Trt-brockway To Mt. Rose Wilderness features 15 miles of hiking trails near Kings Beach, CA.

name: Appalachian Trail 078: Keys Gap to Potomac River
description:
This is the final section of the AT in West Virginia, and it runs for 6.3 miles from Keys Gap to the Potomac River. Along the way it passes Loudoun Heights.<br />
If you are north bound, pick up the AT trail descriptions in Maryland (or click here).

name: South Yuba Trail
description: River conditions vary, during spring runoff (April thru June). Some swimming areas maybe unsafe and not suitable for swimming. Please use caution. You will cross private land along some trails.  Please respect the right of private landowners. Gold panning is allowed in the South Yuba Wild & Scenic River "HANDS AND PANS" only.

name: South Yuba Trail
description: River conditions vary, during spring runoff (April thru June). Some swimming areas maybe unsafe and not suitable for swimming. Please use caution. You will cross private land along some trails.  Please respect the right of private landowners. Gold panning is allowed in the South Yuba Wild & Scenic River "HANDS AND PANS" only.

name: South Yuba Trail
description: River conditions vary, during spring runoff (April thru June). Some swimming areas maybe unsafe and not suitable for swimming. Please use caution. You will cross private land along some trails.  Please respect the right of private landowners. Gold panning is allowed in the South Yuba Wild & Scenic River "HANDS AND PANS" only.

name: Little Bennett Regional Park
description: Little Bennett Regional Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Clarksburg, MD.

name: Patuxent River State Park
description: Unmarked trails for hiking.

name: Paint Creek State Park
description: Paint Creek State Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Bainbridge, OH.

name: Benjamin Banneker Historic Park
description: Encompassing 138 acres and containing extensive nature trails, the primary focus of this park is the museum highlighting the contributions of Benjamin Banneker - the first African American man of science. This site includes a Visitors Center, featuring a collection of Banneker's works, community gallery, gift shop and patio garden.

name: Highline Lake State Park
description:
Several trails circle Mack Mesa Lake and Highline Lake. The park is close to the well-known Kokopelli trail complex and the newer, North Fruita Desert Trails bike trail complex.<br />
There are a total of 7 trails, mostly loop trails, ranging from easy to difficult with the longest trail topping out at 6.42 miles. Remember to share the trail!

name: Van Meter State Park
description:
The 1,100-acre Van Meter State Park is home to the remnants of a Missouria Indian village. Several burial mounds and earthworks can be seen at the park. The park provides excellent opportunities for outdoor enthusiasts and an 18-acre fishing lake. Camping, hiking, picnicking, fishing and boating are all popular here.

The park provides seven hiking trails that equal about six miles in length when combined.

name: Van Damme State Park
description: The park features the lush Fern Canyon scenic trail system; the Pygmy Forest where mature, cone-bearing cypress and pine trees stand six inches to eight feet tall; and the bog, or Cabbage Patch, where skunk cabbage grows in abundance. The park's ten miles of trail go along the fern-carpeted canyon of Little River. A paved road is used by joggers and bicyclists. The beach is popular with abalone divers.

name: North Bend Rail Trail
description: The North Bend Rail Trail is a multi-use recreational trail operated by West Virginia State Parks. Formerly an abandoned spur of the CSX system, the trail is part of the 5,500 mile coast-to-coast American Discovery Trail. Stretching 72 miles from I-77 near Parkersburg in Wood County to Wolf Summit in Harrison County, this scenic trail passes through 13 tunnels and crosses 36 bridges. Easily accessible from north/south Interstates 77 and 79, the trail nearly parallels US Route 50 east and west.

name: CDT CO25: Timberline Lake to Tennessee Pass
description: Section 25 of the CDT in Colorado runs just over 13 miles from Timberline Lake to Tennessee Pass on US Hwy 24. Along the way, the trail passes Galena Mountain, West Tennessee Creek, Homestake Peak, and Missouri Hill.

name: Magruder Branch Stream Valley Park
description: This park comprises 173 acres along the Magruder Branch from Damascus Recreational Park south to Watkins Road. Primarily intended to conserve the environmentally-sensitive stream valley, the park is not developed for active recreation but welcomes visitors for such activities as hiking and birdwatching. Residents may also enjoy the Upper Magruder Stream Valley Park, which is located on the opposite (northern) side of Damascus Recreation Park.

name: Fort Churchill State Historic Park
description: Five trails.

name: Dawson's Butte
description:
Dawson's Butte is a basic loop trail, with plenty of bridal trails running off to the sides. Hike through a mix of dense ponderosa forests and wide open meadows, and the grade is fairly gradual with only a 300 foot elevation change within 5 miles. <br />
This is a multi-use trail so please be aware of mountain bikers and horseback riders, and practice trail etiquette.

name: Patapsco Valley State Park
description: There are numerous hiking and mountain biking trails in the various parts of Patapsco Valley State Park.

name: McCormick's Creek State Park
description: Ten trails offer 11 miles of hiking.

name: Lake Hope State Park
description: Lake Hope State Park is a large, 2,983-acre paradise for recreational use. The park is located in the 26, 800 thousand acre  Zaleski State Forest and complete with rugged terrain. Hiking, camping, picnicking, biking, boating, swimming, hunting and fishing are all very popular activities here. The park offers great hiking trails and a 21-mile backpacking trail with primitive camping sites .

name: Hidden Springs State Park
description:
Hidden Springs State Forest (formerly referred to as Shelby State Forest) is named for the seven known springs on the property. Throughout time, many of the springs have been covered by vegetation and forest growth which is why the park is called Hidden Springs. The forest is made up of three tracts varying from flat areas to steep hillsides. Picnicking, camping, hiking and hunting are all common activities at this park.

The main hiking trail is the Possum Hollow Nature Trail. On this trail you will see the park pond and the pine seed orchard. Another trail is the Big Tree Trail which is a one mile trail featuring a large 78 inch sycamore tree. Rocky Spring Trail is a three-mile trail that offer varied scenery and features the Rocky Spring itself.

name: Big River Bike/hike/horse Trail
description: Big River Bike/hike/horse Trail features 10 miles of hiking trails near Mendocino/fort Bragg, CA.

name: Miami Beach Park
description: Situated on the beautiful Chesapeake Bay the park features a pavilion, grills, playground and a nature trail. The pavilion is available on a first come, first serve basis and not available for group reservations. To reserve areas at other Baltimore County Parks contact the local community office.

name: Gwynns Falls/Leakin Park
description: Great hiking/jogging trails.

name: Druid Hill Park
description: Two hiking trails.

name: Donner Memorial State Park
description: The park has about 2.5 miles (4 km.) of hiking trails.  Park property in Coldstream Canyon to the south contains the alignment of the primary Emigrant Trail, which leads up to U.S. Forest Service and the Pacific Crest trails beyond the park.  Maps are for sale at the Emigrant Trail Museum.

name: Tahoe Rim Trail- Tahoe Meadows To Tunnel Cr Rd (flume Tr)
description: Tahoe Rim Trail- Tahoe Meadows To Tunnel Cr Rd (flume Tr) features 9 miles of hiking trails near Reno / Tahoe, NV.

name: Tahoe Rim Trail: Nevada
description: Part of the Tahoe Rim Trail is in Nevada, and the rest of it is in California. The trail meanders through the mountains and offers gorgeous views of Lake Tahoe below and the surrounding mountains.

name: Mendocino Headlands State Park
description: Few coastal locales are as photographed as the town of Mendocino and its bold headlands. The town itself, which lies just north of the mouth of Big River, resembles a New England village, no doubt by design of its Yankee founders. Mendocino may be familiar to fans of the once-popular television series "Murder She Wrote"; it served as the &#64257;ctional Cabot Cove, sleuth Jessica Fletcher's hometown. Now protected by a state park, the headlands are laced with paths that offer postcard views of wave tunnels and tidepools, beaches and blowholes.

name: Zippety Do Dah
description:
Zippety Do Dah runs through the Book Cliffs area and features 9 miles of beautiful ridge hiking. The trail offers scenic, wide-open views of the surrounding desert country. Try to stay on the trails as there are very steep banks in places that could leave you injured. You can use this as an out-and-back trail or connect to other trails in the network to make it a loop.<br />
Please note that this trail is mainly used for mountain biking, and there is a high amount of bike traffic in the area.

name: 18 Road Trail System
description: 18 Road is an expansive 40 mile network of singletrack trails in the North Fruita Desert that is exceedingly popular with mountain bikers, but is also open to hikers. Many of the trails wind through the flatter desert surrounding the gravel road. Some climb the steep dirt mounds, and The Edge goes all the way up to the bluffs. It gets very, very hot here during the summer, so be prepared! This is a great place for a winter hike, though!

name: Edge Loop
description:
Edge Loop features 32 miles of hiking trails near Fruita, CO. The trail starts at the 18 Roads Bookcliffs Recreation Area and it takes you up into the Bookcliffs. <br />
There are plenty of intersecting trails that can be used to shorten the hike if need be. Please note that this trail is mainly used as a mountain bike trail, and has a lot of bike traffic.

name: Prime Cut
description:
Prime Cut is 3 miles of climbing up singletrack, rocky steps, and boulders. It can be used as an out-and-back or you can connect to the other network of trails, like Joe's Ridge, to make it into a loop. <br />
Please note that these trails are mainly used as mountain bike trails and there is a high amount of bike traffic in the area.

name: Sawtooth Ridge
description: Sawtooth Ridge features 9 miles of hiking trails near Truckee, CA.

name: Spring Creek Wilderness Study Area
description: The Spring Creek WSA is very popular in the Cedar City Field Office. It offers spectacular opportunities. Spring Creek WSA is home to Spring Creek Canyon and Kanarra Creek Canyon (a hike popularly known as Kanaraville Falls). Spring Creek and Kanarra Creek Canyons offer stunning narrow red rock canyons.  These canyons are pleasant and ofter spectacular hiking along the creek bottom. The canyons are located 0.5-mile South and 0.5 East of Kanarraville and are restricted to foot traffic only, as these tracts are within the Spring Creek Wilderness Study Area or WSA.

name: Covered Wagon Natural Bridge and Cedar Wash Arch
description: The hikes begin off the Cedar Wash road. High clearance or 4-wheel drive may be required for the road. Check at the GSENM visitor center for current road conditions. In Escalante, turn south on Center Street (Cedar Wash Road) and continue 9.1 miles. At this point, the road curves left and a small wash adjacent to the road on the right. Park here. Drop into the wash and walk a short distance upstream to the Covered Wagon Natural Bridge. The bridge is a 5 minute walk from the road. Return to your vehicle the same way you came. To get to the Cedar Wash Arch, continue along the road for another 1.2 miles (10.3 total) where a small, unmarked drive-through pullout is located on the south (right) side of the road. Park here. Using game trails or small washes , head in a southeasterly direction toward the large canyon ahead. Be sure to pay attention to landmarks so that you can find your way back to your vehicle. The canyon rim is approximately 0.25 miles (a 10-15 minute walk) from the road. Once your reach the rim of the canyon, head east (left) and start looking for the arch off in the distance. It is located in the white sandstone on the same side of the canyon and below the level you will be walking on, and the light opening is no visible from this perspective. If you cannot see the arch, follow the rim of the canyon east (left) until it comes into view. Retrace your route back to the road. Return to Escalante the same way, or continue on the Cedar Wash road until it meets the Hole in the Rock road. Head north (left) on the Hole in the Rock road to return to Hwy 12.

name: Dimple Dell Regional Park
description: Walkways & jogging paths.

name: Lime Creek
description: Arch Canyon is a twelve mile long box canyon located north of highway 95. If you are traveling west on highway 95 from Blanding, turn north on the Comb Wash road (a dirt road approximately one mile west of Comb Ridge, 14 miles west of the highway 95 and 191 intersection). The mouth of Arch canyon is 2 1/2 miles up that road where you will see Arch Canyon Ruins. The canyon has beautiful redrock walls, and it is possible to see several arches. The creek that runs along the bottom of the canyon normally has water (all water should be treated prior to drinking). Look along the canyon walls for hanging gardens. As you look for hanging gardens, you are also likely to spot cliff dwellings. Please remember to treat these special places with respect. This trail has no fee.

name: Olympus Hills
description: Walkways/Jogging Paths -- 8815 feet of concrete of hilly walkway with stairs. 3500 feet of it is the big loop around the natural area.

name: Battleships Trail
description: The Battleships trail was pioneered by local hiking enthusiasts and recommended to the BLM for designation through the Uintah Mountain Club (UMC) in 2010. The trail was designated that summer and now offers a sustainable hiking experience through some of Eastern Utah's most picturesque scenery. Various working volunteers have contributed to trail construction, including the UMC, the Oakley School, and the Northeastern Utah Mountain Bike Association (NUMB). The trail has moderate to difficult sections with slick rock drop offs and several gently sloping, large slick rock faces with southern exposure that you can explore during your hike. Plan for about 2 hours   exploration time. You may see several different species of wildlife (please view from a distance) along the trail from nesting raptors to elk and deer, or predators such as mountain lions, bobcats, or coyotes that frequently show up in this area. The trail should not be hiked when wet as the desert soils that make up the trail become extremely slippery and muddy, causing trail tread damage from erosion. The trail shares a portion of it's track with mountain bikes from the southwest trailhead for about a mile and å_ before becoming a dedicated hiking trail.

name: Jewel Tibbetts Arch
description: From the parking lot, the trail passes through a fence and follows a dirt road for about 0.1 miles.  The trail leaves the road and goes down several dry washes until it rejoins an old road (closed to vehicles).  After a short distance, the trail leaves the old road, and follows a series of rock cairns to near the edge of the 400 foot deep Hell Roaring Canyon.   After a short distance, the trail follows a short spur onto a slickrock platform, from which spectacular views of the arch and the canyon below can be had.  The trail returns to the parking lot across a blackbrush mesa, where it rejoins the road.

name: Corona Arch Trail
description: From the parking lot on the north side of the highway follow the trail up to the visitor register box near the railroad; please register. Cross the railroad track and follow an old roadbed up through a gap in the rim. From the gap, follow the cairns up the wash for about 100 yards where the trail swings to the left.

name: Portal Overlook Trail
description: From JayCee Park, follow the hiking trail up the Colorado towards the river "portal." Please register at the visitor box. From the visitor box, the trail begins its climb to the viewpoint. After several switchbacks, the trail follows a cairned route up "ramps" of Kayenta sandstone to the overlook. Be cautious around the overlook as there are no safety fences. This trail is frequently used by mountain bike riders.

name: Dominguez-Escalante Trail
description: On July 29, 1776, Father Francisco Atanasio Dominguez and Father Silvestre Velez Escalante set out from Santa Fe with eight men to explore trading routes to California and establish new missions with the Indians. In early October 1776, faced with a blizzard and short supplies, the party had to decide whether to proceed to Monterrey, California or return to Santa Fe. At a point just south of Thermo Hot Springs, "lots were cast" to make the decision. The historic decision was made and the party turned south to Santa Fe.

name: Hackberry Canyon Trail
description: Moderately easy hiking in a canyon bottom. 2-4 day backpacking trip, depending on how far up the canyon you go. The lower end of the canyon can be done as a day hike.

name: Harpers Ferry National Historical Park
description:
Harpers Ferry NHP has about 20 miles of hiking trails. The trails vary from easy, riverside strolls to four-mile hikes across Civil War battlefields to eight-mile adventures to the tops of mountains.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Train Tunnels
description: Train Tunnels features 10 miles of hiking trails near Truckee, CA.

name: Little Miami State Park
description: The Little Miami is a state park in a trail corridor. The 'park' is a 50-mile trail that runs through four counties of southwest Ohio. The trail is open for cycling, hiking, cross-country skiing, rollerblading, backpacking and horseback riding. Canoeing on the Little Miami River is also available.

name: Harbin park
description: Harbin park features 6 miles of hiking trails near Hamilton, OH.

name: Deerfeild/ Landen Park
description: Deerfeild/ Landen Park features 3 miles of hiking trails near Landen, OH.

name: Gold Dust Trail
description:
Gold Dust Trail provides access to Boreas Pass via the old Boreas Pass Wagon Road, which it connects to after crossing FDR 406. Much of the northern portion of the trail follows an old flume that diverted water from North Tarryall Creek and its tributaries to mining operations located in the upper Tarryall Drainage. This portion of the trail is excellent for snowshoers and cross country skiers.<br />
This trail is open year round, although winter conditions could make travel more difficult. It is a multi-use trail, so please share the path!

name: Martis Creek Lake
description: Located close to Lake Tahoe, Truckee and Reno, Martis has a beautiful, peaceful campground off the beaten path. The Martis Creek area features hiking, biking, canoeing/kayaking and trout fishing.

name: Appalachian Trail 079: Potomac River to Weverton Road
description:
This section of the Appalachian Trail runs a short 3.3 miles from the crossing of the Potomac River to Weverton Road. It follows the Potomac for most of that length.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot: <br />
"Shenandoah Street" lat=39.3215735137, lon=-77.7432830231<br />
<br />
Note: If you are southbound, pick up the Appalachian Trail section descriptions in West Virginia (or just click here).

name: Appalachian Trail: Maryland
description: The Appalachian Trail runs 41 miles through Maryland, from the <a href="http://www.tripleblaze.com/3/3335/West-Virginia/Appalachian-Trail--West-Virginia.html">West Virginia</a> border to the <a href="http://www.tripleblaze.com/3/3318/Pennsylvania/Appalachian-Trail--Pennsylvania.html">Pennsylvania</a> border. To get more detailed information about each section of the trail in Maryland, please click on the individual trail listings below.

name: Russian Gulch State Park
description: The Russian Gulch Trail from Campground to Falls is 6.5 miles round trip with a 200-foot elevation gain.

name: Cathedral State Park
description: Cathedral offers 6 miles of hiking trails.

name: Old Flume Trail/south Yuba Trail
description: Old Flume Trail/south Yuba Trail features 10 miles of hiking trails near Nevada City, CA.

name: South Yuba River State Park
description: With seven trails, hikers can enjoy a variety of scenic views.

name: South Yuba River State Park
description: With seven trails, hikers can enjoy a variety of scenic views.

name: South Yuba River State Park
description: With seven trails, hikers can enjoy a variety of scenic views.

name: Hole In The Ground
description: Hole In The Ground features 17 miles of hiking trails near Truckee, CA.

name: Hole In The Ground
description: Hole In The Ground features 17 miles of hiking trails near Truckee, CA.

name: Hole In The Ground
description: Hole In The Ground features 17 miles of hiking trails near Truckee, CA.

name: Appalachian Trail 080: Weverton Road to Crampton Gap
description: This section of the AT runs 6.7 miles from Weverton Road to Crampton Gap. Along the way it passes the Ed Garvey shelter.

name: Cacapon Resort State Park
description: Cacapon Resort State Park encompasses over 6,000 acres. Over 20 miles of trails maintained for the hikers visiting the park. From a leisure walker to an avid hiker, Cacapon has a trail to suit you. Park map and trail guides are available at the front desk. Check out the other great recreational opportunities of the Berkeley Springs area.

name: Keehner Park
description: Keehner Park features 3 miles of hiking trails near West Chester, OH.

name: Redskin Mountain
description: This portion of trail is a part of the Colorado Trail and it lies right next to the Buffalo Creek trail system, running right past the Buffalo Creek campground. As such, it is a beautiful piece of singletrack that is well-worth a hike!

name: Mendocino Woodlands State Park
description: Some 25 miles of trail loops through and around the park, an attractive mix of redwood forest, riverside and meadowland environments. The park, which totals a respectable 700 acres is bordered by the huge Jackson State Forest to the north and the big new Big River State Park to the south. Mendocino Woodlands trails connect to the far-&#64258;ung trail systems of the state forest and state park.

name: Sassafras NRMA
description: The trail system at Sassafras is open to non-motorized trail users from Sunrise to Sunset. There are approximately 9 miles of trails that travel through a variety of terrain that includes old dirt roads, field edges and paths within the young forest.

name: Pacific Crest Trail: Northern California: L
description:
At only 38.4 miles, Section L is easily the shortest section of the Pacific Crest Trail. It runs from I-80 to Highway 49 near Sierra City.

Along the way the trail passes Castle Pass, Road 19N11A, Tahoe N.F. Road 86, Meadow Lake Road 19N11, Tahoe N.F. Road 07 near Jackson Meadow Reservoir, Milton Creek, Wild Plum Campground, Haypress Creek, and the North Yuba River.

name: Sells Park
description: Sells Park features 12 miles of hiking trails near Athens, OH.

name: Marshy Point Nature Center
description: Marshy Point Nature Center is Baltimore County's pristine waterfront nature center, located on the Dundee and Saltpeter Creeks. The 400 plus acre park encompasses a mixture of wetlands and woodlands and thus is home to a wide variety of flora and fauna, especially migrating waterfowl. The building provides an exhibit hall, an auditorium for audio-visual presentations, classrooms, outdoor decks with picnic tables and trails are being developed. A canoe dock, overlook and bridge have been added. Guided canoe trips are offered to explore the coastal forests, marshes and shallow waters of Dundee and Saltpeter Creeks. A variety of programs and special events are available for all ages.

name: Donner Lake Rim Trail
description: Donner Lake Rim Trail features 15 miles of hiking trails near Truckee, CA.

name: Donner Lake Rim Trail
description: Donner Lake Rim Trail features 15 miles of hiking trails near Truckee, CA.

name: Donner Lake Rim Trail
description: Donner Lake Rim Trail features 15 miles of hiking trails near Truckee, CA.

name: Chair Rocks
description:
A mix between singletrack and doubletrack, this trail leads through a burn area left by the Buffalo Creek Fire in the '90s. The trail follows along a section of the Colorado Trail to Chair Rocks and an overlook of the South Platte area. The hike is very scenic.<br />
This trail is a multi-use trail so please watch out for mountain bike traffic, and practice trail etiquette.

name: Colorado Trail / Morrison Creek (Lunar Loop)
description:
This section of the trail can be turned into a loop. It climbs a total of about 800 feet, leaving the ascent pretty gradual. You'll hike through a large burn area which leaves you looking out over the beautiful mountainside. <br />
Most of the Colorado Trail is multi-use so please be on the lookout for mountain bikers.

name: Colorado Trail / Green Mountain
description: Colorado Trail / Green Mountain features 16 miles of hiking trails near Deckers, CO.

name: Lincoln Trail State Park
description: Fifty years after Lincoln's death, the Illinois General Assembly authorized the Illinois State Historical Library to mark the exact route traveled by Abraham Lincoln from Kentucky to Illinois. Almost another 50 years passed before the 1,000-mile trail was opened in 1963. With 3,000 markers showing the way, the trail winds through Kentucky, Indiana and Illinois. Lincoln Trail State Park is just west of the trail, as it follows IL Rt. 1. A few miles north of the park, the trail branches off onto a county road heading west toward Clarksville.

name: Tar Hollow State Park
description: Ross Hollow Hiking Trail å¥ 3.5 Miles (yellow blazes), located near the camp, provides foot access to the hills of Tar Hollow

name: Russell Ridge
description:
This trail leads you all the way up the mountain to Russell Ridge where you can take in views of the surrounding Pike National Forest. The first mile or so is a sand/gravel mix that is hard to navigate, but after that it gets better and the views are definitely worth it!<br />
This is a multi-use trail so please share the path.

name: Patapsco Valley State Park (mckeldin Area)
description: Patapsco Valley State Park (Mckeldin Area) features 4 miles of hiking trails near Ellicott City, MD.

name: Strouds Run State Park
description: Strouds Run State Park features 18 miles of hiking trails near Athens, OH.

name: Castlewood Canyon State Park
description: Nature lovers and groups enjoy environmental diversity on several hiking trails ranging from mild to moderate. The trails range from .5 to 4 miles and can be combined for longer journeys.  The winding Cherry Creek flowing along the canyon floor provides wonderful rest stops.  Pets, on a leash, are welcome on most trails, except the new East Canyon Preservation Area trail.

name: CDT CO26: Tennessee Pass to Copper Mountain
description: Section 26 of the CDT in Colorado runs 24.6 miles from the trailhead at Tennessee Pass / US Hwy 24 to Copper Mountain / Hwy 91. Along the way, the trail passes US Hwy 24, Sheep Mountain, North Sheep Mountain, Elk Mountain, Jacque Peak, and Copper Mountain Ski Resort.

name: Malakoff Diggins State Historic Park
description: Bordered by colorful cliffs, the Malakoff mine pit is more than a mile long, a half mile wide and nearly 600 feet deep. In the right light, it resembles a Bryce Canyon in miniature.

name: Chinquapin Run Park
description: Nature trails.

name: Memmen Ridge Open Space
description:
This area provides a quick escape into forested open space from nearby Downtown Castle Rock. The 43-acre parcel is located south of South Street Elementary School and can be accessed from a paved trail at Oman Road.<br />
The willows and cattails in the riparian area quickly change to a mature ponderosa pine forest on the ridge's north-facing slope. A short trip to the top of this ridge can provide views of the southern areas of Town.

name: Hopewell Culture National Historical Park
description:
A self-guided interpretive trail of the mounds is located at Mound City Group. Another trail circles the outer perimeter of these earthworks. A trail to the Central Mound at Seip Earthworks is maintained by the Ohio Historical Society. More trails are under construction at Hopewell Mound Group and Seip Earthworks.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Devil's Head Stretch
description:
Devil's Head Stretch is a rolling trail within the high mountains of Sedalia. Enjoy cool forested trails that get you out in nature, and stop along the many outlooks to check out the stunning views of the area! The area gets pretty crowded on the weekends, so you're best bet is a nice weekday hike.<br />
This is a multi-use trail and is very popular with mountain bikers, please beware and practice trail etiquette.

name: Yuba State Park
description: Great hiking.

name: Ridgeline Open Space Trail
description: These soft-surface trails travel through valleys and ridgelines of the 370-acre open space property. Visitors can take in views of the Front Range to the west and the Town below as they traverse open grasslands and dense Gambel oak.

name: Cowan Lake State Park
description: 6 hiking trails

name: Buffalo Creek
description:
The Buffalo Creek trail system is at least 14 miles long and includes a number of different trails. The singletrack itself is fairly sandy and gravely. These trails offer some gorgeous views due to an old burn and they pass by some amazing rock formations. There's a nearby campground of the same name.

Note: this is a fairly popular mountain bike destination.

name: Valley Falls Trail System
description: Valley Falls Trail System features 12 miles of hiking trails near Grafton, WV.

name: Weston Bend State Park
description: Weston Bend State Park is only a few minutes from Kansas City. The park offers picnic sites, views of the Missouri River and a few trails for hiking. Camping, cycling, picnicking and hiking are common activities here. The park offers eight trails that equal about  11 or 12 miles in length when combined.

name: Whites Cr/thomas Cr Loop
description: Whites Cr/thomas Cr Loop features 7 miles of hiking trails near Reno, NV.

name: Northwest Regional Park
description: Paved stroller-friendly paths, and trails with natural surfaces traverse wooded areas of the park and offer walkers, bicyclers, and skaters a chance to get back to nature.

name: Robert E. Lee
description: Robert E. Lee features 2 miles of hiking trails near Baltimore, MD.

name: Emigrant Trail
description: Emigrant Trail features 20 miles of hiking trails near Truckee, CA.

name: Great Seal State Park
description: Great Seal State Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near Chillicothe, OH.

name: Fox Ridge State Park
description: Eight separate but looping trails are located within the park, allowing you to extend or cut short your walk. Options range from a walk along the Embarras Riverto a nice walk through the decidious forest once common in the area.

name: Watkins Mill State Park
description:
Watkins Mill State Park is home to a 100-acre lake that attracts fishermen, boaters and swimmers alike. A long paved bicycle path encircles the lake and is used by joggers also. Camping, hiking, picnicking, metal detecting and horseback riding are also common here.

The park offers eight miles of hiking trails that are also used for cycling and horseback riding.

name: Gathland State Park
description:
The Appalachian National Scenic Trail passes through Gathland State Park. Visitors are welcome to hike the A.T. from Maine to Georgia or for just a few miles. Those planning an overnight backpack outing can park at Gathland State Park for a few days. The Appalachian Trail is a footpath only. Mountain bikers can use the trails at Greenbrier State Park.

Overnight parking for the Appalachian Trail is permitted in the Arnoldstown Road parking lot. Please take any valuables with you.

name: Webster State Park
description: There are two loops on the Coyote Trail. You can take one loop for a shorter hike, or both for a longer one.

name: Appalachian Trail 081: Crampton Gap to Turners Gap (Alt US 40)
description: Section 81 of the Appalachian Trail runs 7.4 miles from Crampton Gap to Turners Gap (Alt US 40). Along the way it passes the Crampton Gap shelter, the Rocky Run shelter, and Fox Gap on Reno Mountain Road.

name: Buck Gulch
description: Bulch Gulch is a gravely singletrack trail that climbs rather steeply up from the Open Space parking lot and intersects the main Buffalo Creek trail system. This trail passes through an old forest fire burn so there are numerous trees down along the sides of the trail, and a number of old charred trees still standing. Because of the burn there are some great views to be had on this trail!

name: Ringtail-swallowtail
description:
Ringtail-swallowtail climbs up into the beautiful and scenic Pike Hill Open Space in the Pike National Forest. The trail winds through forests and when it reaches the Open Space you get stunning views of the surrounding area!<br />
