Please share the trail with mountain bikers.

name: Colorado Trail / Kenosha To Breckenridge
description:
This section is an incredibly scenic part of the Colorado Trail. It begins by ascending up to Georgia Pass; the ascent is fairly gradual and since it's just above the tree line this hike produces beautiful views!<br />
It's about 12 miles from Kenosha to the top, and once you get there you'll want to break out your camera because the nearly 360 degree views are breathtaking.

name: Colorado Trail / Kenosha Pass To Lost Creek Wilderness Bound
description: This section of trail is 6.5 miles one-way and is 13 miles round trip if you hike it as an out-and-back. At first it passes through a few beautiful aspen groves, and then the singletrack pops out into an open alpine field with some spectacular views of the South Park Valley. This is definitely a must-hike trail!

name: City Trails - Wetlands Trails
description: City Trails - Wetlands Trails features 2 miles of hiking trails near Marietta, OH.

name: Colorado Trail/ West Jefferson Trail
description:
Start out at Kenosha Pass and follow the Colorado Trail to the West Jefferson Trail, which is about 11 miles in. You'll enjoy some beautiful trail that winds throughout this heavily forested area, and then you'll start to climb towards the timberline. Enjoy the views from up there!<br />
West Jefferson splits off and takes you down along a creek for some beautiful hiking through the woods.

name: City Trails - Marietta Middle School
description: City Trails - Marietta Middle School features 2 miles of hiking trails near Marietta, OH.

name: Red Hill
description:
Red Hill Recreation Area is a network of trails that all lead to the summit of Mushroom Rock. The paths are usually rocky and lined with low-lying desert shrubs, and the views from the top are absolutely stunning!<br />
Please share the path with mountain bikers!

name: Morgan Run Natural Environment Area
description: Great area for hiking.

name: Loch Raven Reservoir
description: Loch Raven Reservoir features 6 miles of hiking trails near Towson, MD.

name: Marietta City Trails
description: There are several great hiking trails in Marietta, Ohio that form a great trail network. Click on the individual trail listings for more information.

name: Lake Poinsett Recreation Area
description: The scenic George S. Mickelson Trail stretches over one hundred miles through the Black Hills. The gentle slopes and easy access of the converted railroad track allow people of all ages and abilities to enjoy the beauty of the Black HIlls.

name: Kris-Mar Trails
description: Kris-Mar Trails features 12 miles of hiking trails near Marietta, OH.

name: City Trails - North Hills Trail
description: City Trails - North Hills Trail features 7 miles of hiking trails near Marietta, OH.

name: Hocking Hills State Park
description: 9 hiking trails in the park

name: Fancy Creek
description: Fancy Creek features 5 miles of hiking trails near Manhattan, KS.

name: City Trails - Marietta Hs
description: City Trails - Marietta Hs features 4 miles of hiking trails near Marietta, OH.

name: Valley Falls State Park
description: Great trails.

name: Hidden Mesa
description: Hike this 1224-acre open space buffer between Castle Rock and Franktown.  Embark on this soft-surface trail from the trailhead at the old homestead at Parker Road. Follow the farm lane as it crosses over Cherry Creek and then winds up to the top of the mesa where it loops around viewpoints, rock outcroppings, grass and shrublands, as well as pines and junipers.

name: Bullards Barr Trail
description: Bullards Barr Trail features 32 miles of hiking trails near Camptonvile, CA.

name: South Mountain Battlefield
description: Maryland's portion of the Appalachian National Scenic Trail is situated along the ridge top of South Mountain. You can make a simple day hike, an overnight backpack trip or a multi-night excursion part of your South Mountain adventure. Use a detailed Appalachian Trail map to plan your outing, available for purchase at Greenbrier and Washington Monument State Parks. South Mountain features several impressive scenic vistas, including High Rock, Black Rock, Annapolis Rock, White Rock and Weverton Cliffs.

name: Jug Handle State Natural Reserve
description:
Ecological Staircase Trail
This trail takes the visitor on a tour of the geological updrift from the coast to the Pygmy Forest two and a half mile inland. This marine terrace sequence illustrates a successional story unparalleled elsewhere in California. The composition and processes responsible for this unique ecological setting offer a diverse selection of interpretive opportunities.

name: Scenic River Trail
description: Scenic River Trail features 3 miles of hiking trails near Newport, OH.

name: Smithville Lake Trails
description: Smithville Lake Trails features 9 miles of hiking trails near Smithville, MO.

name: Roxborough State Park
description: Roxborough State Park offers a variety of trails for all abilities, from the half-mile Fountain Overlook trail that affords a spectacular view of rock formations, to the challenging 6.4-mile trek to 7,160-foot Carpenter Peak.

name: Herrington Manor State Park
description:
Red and Blue trails can be accessed at the concession stand by Herrington Manor Lake or by the boat ramp.
The Green trail is accessed behind the backstop at the ballfield near the tennis courts. The Yellow trail is accessed from the green trail, behind the office or from the road to the concession stand.

name: Swallow Falls State Park
description: Much of the trail is an easily navigable old logging road. Part of the trail is single track and rocky. Within one mile of Swallow Falls State Park the trail runs alongside a stream with hemlocks and rhododendron. Approximately one mile from the Swallow Falls State Park trail head, the trail crosses a stream that you may not be able to cross during periods of high water.

name: Cagles Mill Lake (Lieber SRA)
description: COVERED BRIDGE NATURE TRAIL (.75 mile) MODERATE-Starts and ends near the sports and activity field. Stoned trail with benches and covered bridge. Wheelchair Accessible.

name: CDT CO29: Georgia Pass to Argentine Pass
description: The CDT runs for 18.3 miles from Georgia Pass to Argentine Pass. Along the way, the trail passes Santa Fe Peak and Revenue Mountain.

name: Gambrill State Park
description: Gambrill State Park features 30 miles of hiking trails near Thurmont, MD.

name: Monocacy River Natural Resources Management Area
description: Unmarked paths/trails.

name: Lake Shelbyville
description: Lake Shelbyville is a 34,100-acre park with 11,100 of that belonging to Lake Shelbyville. There is a wide variety of activities here for all ages including hiking, camping, swiming, fishing and boating.

name: Antietam National Battlefield
description:
The Bloodiest One Day Battle in American History<br />
<br />
23,000 soldiers were killed, wounded or missing after twelve hours of savage combat on September 17, 1862. The Battle of Antietam ended the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia's first invasion into the North and led to Abraham Lincoln's issuance of the preliminary Emancipation Proclamation.<br />
The Park offers six self guided totaling about eight miles.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Ohio View Trail
description: Ohio View Trail features 14 miles of hiking trails near New Matamoras, OH.

name: Gunpowder Falls State Park
description: Gunpowder Falls State Park is a 10 mile hiking trail in Kingsville, Maryland.

name: Gunpowder Falls State Park
description: Extensive trail maps available at http://shopdnr.com/centraltrailguides.aspx.

name: Sylvan Lake State Park
description: The 1.5 mile Lake Trail is open. New sections of the West Brush Creek Trail have been completed. Hike 1 mile downstream of the campground to check out Antones Creek and Borah Gulch. Or check out over 1.5 miles of new trail heading upstream from the Meadows Day Use Area. Popular trails on the surrounding White River National Forest - Sneve Gulch, McKenzie Gulch, Nolan Lake, Lake Charles and Ironedge are all good options.

name: Appalachian Trail 082: Turners Gap to I-70 Footbridge (US 40)
description: The Appalachian Trail runs 4.9 miles from Turners Gap (Alt US 40) to a footbridge over I-70 (US 40). Along the way it passes the Washington Monument Road and Boonsboro Mountain Road.

name: Peaks Trail
description:
This is a one way trail that starts from either the town of Frisco or Breckenridge. The trail climbs in and out of numerous drainages for its' entire length staying mostly in the lodgepole pine forest along with some aspen, spruce and fir forests. Most of the lodgepole pine trees are of the same age and provide ground cover and/or forage for wildlife in the area. You will cross some small clearings which were harvested in 1988. These trees were cut to increase the wildlife habitat and to improve the health of the forest by creating age and species diversity, thereby reducing the fire danger. <br />
Since the grade from Breckenridge toward Frisco is generally downhill, many people travel this direction and ride the free Summit Stage Bus back to Breckenridge.

name: Mark Twain State Park
description:
Mark Twain State Park is home to the 18,000-acre Mark Twain Lake which opens up opportunities for fishing, boating and swimming. The park is full of bluffs, oaks, and miles of hiking trail which offers several other recreational opportunities for visitors. Lodging, hiking, camping and picnicking are common here.

Five hiking trails equal about six miles in length when combined.

name: Colorado Trail
description: The Colorado Trail offers amazing singletrack, incredible views, some steep high-altitude climbs, and it passes through 6 wilderness areas. It is probably Colorado's best long-distance backpacking trail.

name: Glendale Open Space Trail
description:
This trail winds through a grassland plain with plenty of low lying shrubs around. Enjoy the stunning view of Pikes Peak and the Colorado Front Range from this easily loop trail.<br />
Please share the path as this is a multi-use trail!

name: Indian Creek Loop
description:
Hike through lush forests and open fields that look out on the surrounding Front Country. Most of this trail is on natural surfaces, however there is a section that you'll be hiking on gravel. This is a fairly difficult trail that winds up the mountain and climbs along the ridgeline.<br />
This is a multi-use trail, and a popular mountain bike trail, so please share the path and practice trail etiquette.

name: Colorado Trail / Waterton To South Platte
description: The first 6 miles of this section tends to get a little bit crowded. It's very popular for day hikes, so you'll find plenty of families and children climbing the trail. Head up to "sitting bench" and you'll break through the crowds a little. Continue to hike through beautiful forests and along rocky outcroppings, and enjoy the views!

name: Waterton Canyon
description: Strontia Springs Dam is six and one-half miles upstream of the mouth of Waterton Canyon on the South Platte River. Water is diverted from the reservoir into a 3.4 mile-long tunnel under the mountains to the Foothills Water Treatment Plant. Completed in 1983, this dam towers 243 feet above the South Platte streambed, forming a 1.7 mile-long lake with 98 surface acres.

name: CDT CO27: Copper Mountain to Gold Hill
description: The CDT runs for 12.6 miles from Copper Mountain to Gold Hill Trailhead on Hwy 9. Along the way, the trail passes Peak 8, Peak 4, and Tenmile Peak.

name: Steamboat Ditch To Hole In The Wall
description: Steamboat Ditch To Hole In The Wall features 14 miles of hiking trails near Reno, NV.

name: Washington Monument State Park
description: Most of the Washington Monument's hiking trail is part of the Appalachian National Scenic Trail. Visitors are welcome to hike the A.T from Maine to Georgia or for just a few miles. Those planning an overnight backpack outing can park at Washington Monument State Park for a few days. The Appalachian Trail is a footpath only. Mountain bikers can use the trails at Greenbrier State Park.

name: Eagle Creek State Recreation Area
description: Three marked nature trails are available for tranquil and refreshing sojorns in the forest. More adventurous hikers enjoy setting off on the12-mile Illini Trail.

name: Lake Logan State Park
description: Lake Logan State Park is on one of the best fishing lakes in Ohio. The 400-acre lake is home to pike, bass, bluegill, crappie and saugeye-- a fisherman's dream. The park is a 318-acre area that is a great location for picnicking, hiking, boating, swimming and hunting. The park offers about three miles of hiking/walking trail that take you through different scenic areas of the park.

name: Flume Loop
description:
There are 3 loop trails that run north to south: the lower, middle, and upper flume. On these trails you'll find rocky paths running through thick forests. Every once in a while you'll come to a meadow where the forests breaks a little, and you can get beautiful views of the surrounding area. This trail is not that secluded and you can usually see homes from it. <br />
This trail is multi-use so please share the trail with mountain bikers.

name: Barney Ford To Moonstone
description: Barney Ford To Moonstone actually follows 3 trails: Carter Park, Moonstone, and Barney Ford. Most of the trail follows along an old mine trail with plenty of mine ruins to keep you interested. The hike is a fairly gentle hike that winds through the beautiful forest.

name: Copper Triangle
description:
Copper Triangle is about 30 miles of trail alternating between smooth singletrack and wide 4x4 road, double track, and paved roads. The trail quickly connects with the Colorado Trail on its climb up. Here you'll hike through thick, beautiful forests until you reach the tree line. Above the tree line you'll enjoy incredible views of the surrounding area. <br />
This trail is a multi-use trail so please be on the lookout for mountain bikers.

name: East-west Regional Trail
description: This is the first leg of the East/West Regional Trail that will connect Chatfield State Park with the Town of Parker. The trail winds through grasslands and oak bluffs including thousand of acres of the Open Space Conservation Area.

name: Reno Truckee River Ride
description: Reno Truckee River Ride features 15 miles of hiking trails near Reno, NV.

name: Parvin State Park
description: Parvin State Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Centerton, NJ.

name: Glen Elder State Park
description: Four trails for hiking.

name: Wildcat Mountain/Monarch
description:
This is a private trail for the residents of Highlands Ranch. <br />
The trail takes you past low-lying desert shrubs, through beautiful prairie fields, alongside small ponds, and it provides awesome views the whole way. This trail is open to mountain bikers as well so be sure to share the trail!

name: Mark Twain Lake State Park
description: Mark Twain Lake is about 18,600 acres of fun in the sun! There are three campground here with plenty of room for visitors and other activities include mountain biking, hiking, horseback riding, swimming, fishing, boating, canoeing, kayaking and camping.

name: Prickett's Fort State Park
description: For hiking enthusiasts, the Prickett's Fort Nature Trail has 25 interpretive stations to help introduce guests to the flora and fauna of north central West Virginia.

name: Ohio View Connector Trail
description: Ohio View Connector Trail features 4 miles of hiking trails near New Matamoras, OH.

name: Highlands Point
description:
Highlands Ranch Backcountry Wilderness Area has 8,200 acres of conserved open space. Here there are 20 miles of natural surface trails for hikers and mountain bikers to explore.<br />
These trails are multi-use so please practice caution.

name: Archers Fork Loop Trail
description: Archers Fork Loop Trail features 9 miles of hiking trails near New Matamoros - Wayne National Forest, OH.

name: Youghiogheny Wild and Scenic River
description: The best trail access for hiking is found at Swallow Falls State Park. The old logging railroad right-of-way may be followed north from the east side of the river.

name: MacKerricher State Park
description: Ten Mile Dunes and lnglenook Fen, Laguna Point and Cleone Lake. These are some of the intriguing names on an intriguing land- MacKerricher State Park. Extending from just north of the Fort Bragg city limits to Ten Mile River, this park offers the walker a chance to explore headlands and wetlands, sand dunes, forest and meadowland.

name: Bluffs Regional Park Trail
description:
Bluffs Regional Park Trail features 4 miles of hiking trails near Lone Tree, CO. There is a 2.7-mile loop of soft-surface trail (3.5 miles including the feeder trails and overlooks) that winds along the open country. Enjoy beautiful views of the surrounding area.<br />
This trail is perfect for families with children, but it is a multi-use trail so please practice trail etiquette.

name: Burr Oak State Park
description: 7 Hiking Trails

name: Appalachian Trail 083: I-70 Footbridge to Wolfsville Road
description:
Section 83 of the AT runs 8.6 miles from the footbridge over I-70 to Wolfsville Road (MD Hwy 17). Along the way it passes the Pine Knob shelter.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"US 40 (Annapolis Rock)" lat=39.5354997064, lon=-77.6037213741

name: Greenbrier State Park
description: Greenbrier State Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Frederick-hagerstown, MD.

name: Caesar Creek State Park
description: Caesar Creek State Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Waynesville, OH.

name: Chatfield State Park
description: A series of trails wind through the Chatfield area and provides the park visitor with an abundance of recreational opportunities. You can take a morning jog, walk through natural areas around the reservoir, leisurely pedal your bicycle through the park or ride a horse into the sunset. Trail maps are available at the park's main entrances.

name: CDT CO28: Gold Hill to Georgia Pass
description: The CDT runs for 19.7 miles from Gold Hill Trailhead on Hwy 9 to Georgia Pass. Along the way the trail passes Brewery Hill and Mount Guyot.

name: Deer Creek Canyon
description:
Deer Creek Canyon Park is defined by its sterling recreation opportunities and golden habitat for wildlife. <br />
Hikers and equestrians have the Meadowlark Homesteader and Golden Eagle Trails all to themselves. On multi-use trails, mountain bikers test their mettle on "The Wall," a steep section of rocky terrain on Plymouth Creek Trail, and pedal the 2.5-mile Red Mesa Loop. All trail users should be aware of the risk of rattlesnake encounters. <br />
Meadowlark: Hiker only; exposed with great views of parking area, meadows and the south valley; consistent 10 percent grade.<br />
Golden Eagle: Hiker only; scenic view at summit; 3-mile hike to reach trailhead.<br />
Plymouth Creek: Multi-user trail; lush sections; rocky in spots; steep climb west of Meadowlark junction.<br />
Plymouth Mountain: Multi-user trail with scenic views to the east; Steep side slope on north end.<br />
Scenic View: Short, multi-user trail with steep section; beautiful 360-degree summit view.<br />
Homesteader: Hiker only; forested trail with an average 4 percent grade; trail follows canyon rim on the north side.<br />
Red Mesa Loop: Multi-user trail with open view of the canyon and forested section.

name: Red Mountain Trail
description: Red Mountain has a beautiful north face that towers of the town of Glenwood Springs, CO. Red Mountain Trail takes you up the eastern ridge along a private road. The path switchbacks its way up the mountain, making it the easiest and longest route to get up the mountain. On your way up you'll be able to catch glimpses of Glenwood Springs below, and once you make it to the top you'll be rewarded with outstanding views!

name: Flying J Ranch
description: This is a very easy, very flat 2 mile loop. It does pass through some pretty forests, though.

name: Meyer Ranch Park
description:
Rolling hay meadows lead to forested hillsides, with the ever-present chatter of pine squirrels and the rustle of quaking aspen leaves. The landscape invites one to meander and explore this exquisite park.Previously a working ranch, Meyer Ranch Park offers peaceful strolls through wildflower-laden meadows, lodgepole pine forests and aspen groves.<br />
There are a total of 4 hiking trails here: Owl's Perch Trail (.5mi), Lodgepole Loop Trail (1.2mi), Sunny Aspen Trail (.8mi), and Ole Ski Run Trail (1.3mi).

name: Boy Scout Trail
description:
The Boy Scout Trail near Glenwood Springs will take you through thick forests, over cattle fields, and along ridges. There are some areas where you can get really good views of the city below. <br />
This trail doesn't loop all the way but it does connect to the same road, and it's possible to hike back up the road to where your car is. This is a multi-use trail so please use caution.

name: Keystone Canyon
description: Keystone Canyon features 15 miles of hiking trails near Reno, NV.

name: South Valley Park
description:
Dramatic red sandstone spires. Stunning views of craggy outcroppings. Pleasant trails suited to beginning mountain bikers and hikers who prefer more level terrain.<br />
A diversity of trails offer quiet refuge from the tempo of the neighboring suburbs and criss-cross the eastern half of South Valley Park. The Swallow Trail is hiker-only.

name: Two-brands Trail
description: Two-brands Trail is a 5 mile hiking trail in Littleton, Colorado.

name: Lake Oroville State Recreation Area
description: The state recreation area has a couple of short hiking trails that can be linked to provide a 2 mile jaunt, a more ambitious 4.75 mile loop, or something in between. An ambitious trail-building program over the past two decades has increased the park's network from nine to more than 50 miles of trail. Check out the new Potter Ravine Trail, which leads from Lake Oroville Dam along the west shore of the lake. the 14.5 mile-long Danbebee Trail extends from the town of Oroville to Loafer Creek.

name: Downieville Downhill
description: Downieville Downhill features 16 miles of hiking trails near Downieville, CA.

name: Downieville Downhill
description: Downieville Downhill features 16 miles of hiking trails near Downieville, CA.

name: Downieville Downhill
description: Downieville Downhill features 16 miles of hiking trails near Downieville, CA.

name: Lums Pond State Park
description: The Lums Pond State Park features the largest freshwater pond in Delaware. It consists of 1,790 acres, 200 of which make up the actual Lums Pond. The park is a popular place for fishing, hiking, picnicking and sports, however swimming is prohibited. There are several picnic locations throughout the park in addition to three large pavilions. Lums Pond SP also has ball fields and game courts for a variety of sports from baseball and softball to soccer and tennis, among others. There is also a large campground on the site for year round camping.  Hikers are given the opportunity to explore many scenic views and habitats along the 7.5 mile Swamp Forest Trail that circles the pond. Lums Pond SP also features over 10 miles of multi-purpose trails (horses, bikes, hikers, and snowmobiles).

name: Commando Run
description:
You'll be climbing up a lot of 4X4 trails on this hike. Go about 1.5 miles in until you see Chair 10, and then stay left. You'll keep climbing from here until you reach Benchmark at about 10 miles in. Turn right here and then after about a quarter mile, you'll see a spur trail off to your left, and you'll want to take that. <br />
Climb to the top and take in the stunning views of the mountains and the valley below. All of that climbing is worth it!

name: Hueston Woods State Park
description: 12 hiking trails

name: Ken Caryl Valley
description:
Head out to the Ken Caryl Ranch and enjoy over 20 miles of trail in the 4,800-acres of foothills open space. There are 10 trails here ranging from easy to difficult, with the longest trail topping out at 3.8 miles. All of these trails but one are private trails, only open to residents.<br />
The Cathy Johnson Trail and South Hogback Open Space is the only trail that's open to the public. It's a 2.1 mile trail that ranges from easy to moderate along the trail.

name: Pacific Crest Trail: Northern California: M
description:
Section M of the Pacific Crest Trail runs 91.7 miles from Highway 49 near Sierra City to Highway 70 at Belden Town Bridge. This section of trail harbors great diversity in views, climate, and vegetation.<br />
<br />
Along the way the trail passes Sierra City, CA; Trail 12E02; the "A" Tree, which is a focal point for five roads; Johnsville-Gibsonville Road; Quincy-LaPorte Road; Road 22N60; Road 23N29X/Dogwood Creek Road/Butte Road; Middle Fork Feather River; Bear Creek; Lookout Rock; Big Creek Road 33N56; Bucks Summit; CRHT; Western Pacific Railroad; Belden Town.

name: Cunningham Falls State Park
description:
Lower Trail--red blaze (one half mile) This easy to moderate trail is the shortest and easiest access to the Falls. Interpretive signs and benches along the way. Return to the lake by this trail or Cliff Trail. This trail terminates at the Falls.

Cliff Trail--yellow blaze (3/4 mile) Rough terrain offers strenuous hiking past rock outcrops that lead to the Falls. Return to the lake by this trail or Lower Trail.

Cunningham Falls State Park
Campground Trail--orange blaze (3/4 mile) This strenuous trail gives campers access to the Cliff Trail.

Old Misery Trail--orange blaze (2 miles) This steep, strenuous trail with many switchbacks and scenic views connects with the Cat Rock Trail.

Cat Rock/Bob's Hill--yellow blaze (7.5 miles) This strenuous trail crosses the mountain and passes two scenic rock outcrops with scenic views.

Cat Rock Trail--yellow blaze (1.5 miles) This steep, strenuous trail leads to Cat Rock (elevation 1560') and scenic views.

Bob's Hill Trail--yellow (1.5 miles) This steep, strenuous trail leads to Bob's Hill (elevation 1765') and two short spur trails with views north and south.

Catoctin Furnace Trail--No blaze (1/4 mile) A self-guided trail which leads to Catoctin Furnace. Crosses U.S. 15 via elevated foot path (46 steps up the stairway).

Catoctin Trail--blue blaze (27 miles) This strenuous trail leads from Gambrill State Park through Frederick City Watershed, Cunningham Falls and Catoctin Mountain Park. Nine miles of trail are in Cunningham Falls. Camping permitted only in designated campgrounds.

name: Maxwell Falls
description: One of the easiest trails in the district, Maxwell Falls is a very enjoyable hike. It follows Maxwell Creek, and the waterfalls are at their best in the spring when the snow runoff is plentiful. Jefferson County law requires dogs be on a leash at all times while on this trail.

name: Hueston Woods Bike Trail
description: Hueston Woods Bike Trail features 12 miles of hiking trails near Oxford, OH.

name: Brookville Lake State Park
description: Eleven excellent trails for hikers.

name: Summit Cove/soda Creek Loop
description:
Summit Cove/Soda Creek Loop is a beautiful 15 mile loop trail. It takes you over smooth singletrack that winds through dense forests and then it opens up into scenic meadows that allow you to take in the stunning mountain views that surround you. <br />
This is a multi-use trail so please share the trail!

name: Catoctin Mountain Park
description:
The east side of the park features stunning vistas, challenging terrain, and access to Cunningham Falls. Most trailheads begin at the visitor center. Parking and trailheads are also available by the park headquarters and at three points along Park Central Road.<br />
The west side of the park is the wilder side. Adventurous hikers are more likely to see wildlife, wetlands, and an up-close view of nature. Remnants of former farms dot the land. The park's picnic areas, campgrounds, and back-country shelters connect with the trails.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Mount Bierstadt
description: This may be one of the easiest and most accessible 14ers in Colorado, and as such it's a really popular route. That doesn't mean it's not worth the hike, though! The trail climbs up from the pass about 3.5 miles until it tops out on Mount Bierstadt at 14,060 feet after an elevation gain of 2,850 feet. The lower section of the trail is pretty flat as it approaches the main climb. It runs through some shrubby trees that are very short, since it is already over 11,000 feet. As soon as the trail starts climbing you rise above the tree line, and while it does climb up a peak, the trail isn't too steep or technical. Towards the top of the ridge right before you reach the summit, there are a few boulders that you have to scramble up but they aren't difficult at all. The views on this hike and from the top are absolutely incredible! Definitely bring your camera! Also, please note that this trail does enter the Mount Evans Wilderness. Please be aware of all of the special wilderness regulations.

name: Clear Creek
description: Excellent trails.

name: Westridge Loop
description:
Westridge Loop is a network of trails that forms a loop near Keyston, CO. This trail takes you along the mountainside where you'll hike through dense forests and open areas where you you'll get stunning views of the area. At one point the trail crosses the Colorado Trail.<br />
This is a multi-use trail, so please share the path.

name: Keystone Gulch
description: This trail takes you through beautiful and dense forests that pass beaver ponds and creeks along the way. You'll start to take switchbacks up the mountain until you reach the timber line where you'll get to enjoy incredible views of the surrounding area!

name: Aqueduct Trail
description:
Mainly this trail is used as a connector between the Keystone Gulch Trail and other trails like the Blair Witch and Colorado Trail. It's about 5 miles in total, follows a stream, crosses footbridges, and offers amazing views of the aqueduct. At times it has very steep up and downhills, so be ready for a workout.<br />
This is a multi-use trail so please use caution.

name: CDT CO30: Argentine Pass to Herman Gulch
description: Section 30 of the CDT trail in Colorado runs for 16.7 miles form Argentine Pass to Herman Gulch Trailhead at US Hwy 6. Along the way, the trail passes Decatur Mountain, Ruby Mountain, Argentine Peak, Mount Edwards, Gray's Peak (14,270 ft.), Torrey's Peak (14,267 ft.), Kelso Mountain, and US Hwy 6. Unlike most of the mountain peaks where the CDT skirts below the actual top of the mountain, the CDT actually reaches the summits of Mount Edwards and Gray's Peak, a 14er.

name: Fort Mott State Park
description: An easy Nature Interpretive Trail can be found within the Park that is excellent for beginners. The trail is accessible for persons with disabilities. The NJ Coastal Heritage Trail Welcome Center accommodates displays defining Fort Mott's place in history and the environment.

name: Meadow Mountain
description:
This trail is an old forest road and climbs gradually through large open meadows, with relics of old cabins and corrals, and some aspen and spruce-fir forest near the top. <br />
The line shack is a small cabin that lies at the end of the trail. The line shack offers a good place for lunch and a vantage point of some views of the Gore Range and Beaver Creek ski area. Evidence of old ski runs shows that this was once an old ski area.

name: The Zipper
description: The Zipper features 2 miles of hiking trails near Sparks, NV.

name: Fort Frederick State Park
description:
Fort Frederick State Park is a 585-acre area that features the stone fort that served as Maryland's frontier defense during the French and Indian War. The park is full of history and provides programs that cover gun use, junior ranger, colonial children's day and the 18th Century Market Fair.

A boat launch provides easy water access for fishing and swimming use. A hiking trail and interpretive programs provide a valuable culturing experience. The park has several picnic areas, campsites, a playground and more amenities for a variety of other recreational activities.

Hiking is a pleasure at the park's short .3 miles trail that passes through the wetlands. Hikers will have to the opportunity to see a variety of wildlife including turtles, waterfowl and deer.

name: Big Bear Lake
description: Big Bear Lake features 25 miles of hiking trails near Hazelton, WV.

name: Eagle Vail Trail
description: This trail winds through an aspen grove to the junction with Pauley's Plunge.  Turn right at this junction and hike downhill on the last bit of Pauley's until you reach a footbridge at the golf course.  From here you will see a sign pointing uphill and to the left for the eagle Vail trail.  Continue hiking until you filter out onto the road about 3 miles later.  Hike the road east along Deer Blvd and Stone Creek Dr until you reach your car at the parking lot on Eagle Dr.

name: Pauley Creek
description: Pauley Creek features 18 miles of hiking trails near Downieville, CA.

name: Pauley Creek
description: Pauley Creek features 18 miles of hiking trails near Downieville, CA.

name: 3 Sisters / Alderfer
description: Near the heart of Evergreen, Alderfer/Three Sisters Park abounds with stunning vistas, landmark rock formations, beautiful old stands of ponderosa pine and the most trails per acre of any foothills park-nearly 15 miles on 770 acres. Open meadows, forests, and great views are all around.

name: Torrey C. Brown Rail Trail
description: This easy walk is family-oriented. The hike features natural and cultural history along the trail with scenic views of pastoral land and historic railroad towns. The rail trail is easily accessible from the Baltimore area, and includes restrooms and water at designated locations. Hike through history and look for clues from the days the railroad and milling were active, or enjoy the sights and sounds of nature's wonders along the Big Gunpowder Falls, including wildflowers, ferns, and wetlands teeming with frogs, beavers and other wildlife.

name: Appalachian Trail 084: Wolfsville Road to Raven Rock Hollow (MD 491)
description: The AT runs 4.1 miles between Wolfsville Road (MD Hwy 17) and Raven Rock Hollow (MD 491). Along the way it passes the Ensign Cowall shelter, MD Hwy 77, and Warner Gap Road.

name: New Germany State Park
description: New Germany has ten miles of multi-use trails. The trails wind their way through dense hemlock forest, colorful mixed hardwoods, rhododendron-choked stream valleys and towering pine and spruce plantation sites. Most trails are wide enough for two-way traffic, although several offer a narrower path typical of most hiking trails. Hiking, trail-running and biking are the most popular activities throughout the year. Whether walking along the lake or wetland, or hiking our scenic trails, visitors are sure to have an opportunity to view birds and wildlife. Abundant bird species can be found throughout the area, such as pileated woodpeckers, black-capped chickadees, barred owls, great blue herons and an occasional osprey.

name: Beaver Creek Ski Resort
description:
Beaver Creek Ski Resort features 37 miles of multi-use trails with 7 trails reserved for hikers only. The hiking trails range from 1-6 miles in length and are rated as green, blue, and black according to their difficulty levels. <br />
Some of these trails are perfect for families and pass by playgrounds, others summit mountains for scenic views of the surrounding area.

name: Rocks State Park
description: Trails connect various points of interest and picnic areas within the park. Pets on a leash are permitted on the hiking trails.

name: Dedisse Trail
description:
Dedisse Trail is a fairly easy out-and-back trail that's perfect for a family with children or a leisurely day hike. Walk through deep forests, with beautiful boulders and rock formations, and enjoy the views of the lake along the hike. <br />
This is a multi-use trail so please be aware of mountain bikers and practice trail etiquette.

name: AW Marion State Park
description:
Hargus Lake Trail offers 5 miles of scenic pleasure, providing access to the entire shoreline of the lake
Squawroot Trail, beginning at the campground, offers the hiking enthusiast 1 mile of scenic terrain

name: A-10
description:
Enjoy the views of Gold Dust Peak and the surrounding mountains while climbing up Arrowhead Mountain on this beautiful 8 mile loop trail. Hike through high meadows, oakbrush, and aspens, and enjoy a few creek crossings as well. <br />
This trail is has a high amount of mountain bike traffic so please use caution.

name: Buffehr Creek Th North Vail Trail To Davos Towers
description: This trail starts out flat, but once you hit the switchbacks you've got about 1,800 feet of climbing to do. Follow the trail through the forest, and come out on top to enjoy the views of Edwards, Avon, Minturn, Meadow Mountain and Vail. All of that hard climbing is totally worth it!

name: Iron Hill Rec Area
description: Iron Hill Rec Area is a 8 mile hiking trail in Newark, Delaware.

name: Vail Mountain
description: In the off-season, Vail Mountain opens it's trails up to hikers and mountain bikers. There are over 25 miles of beautiful mountainside trails, and some even reach up to the summit.

name: Wharton State Forest
description: Wharton State Forest features 30 miles of hiking trails near Hammonton, NJ.

name: Admiral William Standley State Recreation Area
description: The area is also a favorite place for hikers and picnickers.

name: Mount Falcon Park
description: There are a number of different trail loops at this park, some easier to access than others. Some of the loops further out offer some gorgeous views of the front range and Denver far below. There are shelters and picnic areas at the trailhead as well.

name: Hashawha
description: Hashawha features 20 miles of hiking trails near Westminster, MD.

name: Son Of Middle Creek
description:
Son Of Middle Creek is a 10 mile loop trail that offers beautiful views. Hike through scenic aspen forests and then enjoy the scenery as the tree cover opens up and showcases the beautiful surroundings. <br />
This is a multi-use trail so be sure to share the path.

name: Buffer Creek
description:
This 14 mile loop trail follows both a dirt road and some singletrack. There's a fairly long climb, but all the work pays off with scenic views of the Gorge Range and Vail Mountain. <br />
This is a multi-use trail and is frequented by mountain bikers so please practice trail etiquette.

name: Bass River State Forest
description: Bass River State Forest has eight easy walking (non-ADA accessible) trails from 1 to 3.2 miles. The 1/2 mile self-guided Absegami Trail includes a wooden foot bridge with benches. All trails start at the second parking lot at the beach. Animals, birds and plant life of the Pine Barrens may be found. A trail brochure is available at the office, or on the portion of the Pink Trail that passes through the old Civilian Conservation Corps camp near East Greenbush Road.

name: Cherry Creek Lake
description: Cherry Creek Dam, located at the southeast edge of Denver in Aurora, CO, was the first of the three dams to be built to protect the Denver region from catastrophic South Platte River floodwaters that plagued the area for more than 100 years. Recreational opportunities include camping, fishing, picnicking, an archery/rifle range, a horse stable, nature and bike trails, a marina, and a swimming area. The park is open year-round.

name: Bear Creek Lake Park
description:
The park features nearly 15 miles of soft-surface (primariliy dirt) trails for users of all abilities. Most trails are open to horses, pedestrians and mountain bikes. The trails in the park are:<br />
Owl Trail: 0.7-mile loop, 0.5-mile extension. Hiker Only. Very nice trail through a riparian area.<br />
Fitness Trail: 1.6 miles. Meanders through prairie ecosystem with workout stations along the route.<br />
Cowen Trail: 1.4 miles. Short grass prairie hike through the former Cowen town site.<br />
Fisherman's Trail: 1.3 miles. Scenic trail along the shore of Bear Creek Reservoir, with access to many fishing sites.<br />
Mount Carbon Loop: 6.9 miles. A long loop around the park, featuring the park's highest point.<br />
North Park Trail: 2.2 miles. Hilly trail through the short grass prairie on the north side of the park.<br />
Cottonwood Trail: 1.1 miles. A winding trail through the riparian area along Bear Creek.

name: Berry Creek Loop
description: Berry Creek Loop features is a nice little fireroad/doubletrack hike that takes you through some beautiful juniper and sage scrub. The trail overlooks the surrounding mountains and valleys, a great reward for a fairly easy hike!

name: Elk Meadow
description:
True to its name, Elk Meadow Park is the most likely place in the Open Space system to view herds of elk. The meadow is prime grazing ground for the largest of Colorado's native deer, as well as where mountain bluebirds flit and red-tailed hawks circle the sky hunting for rodents and other prey.<br />
Trail experiences are diverse-short jaunts on flat terrain, a rolling trek on Meadow View Trail, the 4.7-mile haul with a 2,100-foot elevation gain from the Stagecoach Boulevard trailhead to 9,708-foot Bergen Peak. This Denver Mountain Parks landmark affords sweeping views of the Continental Divide. The number of switchbacks on this steep, rocky path demand sharing the trail, as always, along with being prepared for wildlife encounters.

name: Coopers Rock State Forest
description: Coopers Rock features 50 miles of hiking trails near Morgantown, WV.

name: Wallace State Park
description: Wallace State Park is a 500-acre area made up of a six acre lake, several scenic hiking trails and lovely, shaded picnic sites. Located less than an hour from Kansas City, this park is an attraction for many people. Camping, hiking, fishing, picnicking, swimming and canoeing are all popular here. Four hiking trails wind through the park providing visitors with a combined total of about five miles of fun.

name: The Boneyard
description: The Boneyard is a 7 mile hiking trail in Eagle, Colorado.

name: Lair O' The Bear/Bear Creek Trail
description: Lair O' The Bear/Bear Creek Trail follows rolling terrain over open meadows and through thick forests. Hike alongside creeks and enjoy views of the mountains and the surrounding area. Parts of this trail are popular with families, and this entire out-and-back is popular with mountain bikers so be sure share the trail.

name: Green Ridge State Forest - Mtn. Bike Trail
description: Green Ridge State Forest - Mtn. Bike Trail features 12 miles of hiking trails near Flintstone, MD.

name: Bergen Peak
description:
Bergen Peak trail starts off fairly flat winding its way through a beautiful meadow. Following that the climb starts, there are a few steep sections, but most of the ascent consists of switchbacks.<br />
The official top of the trail doesn't offer much in the way of views because of it's surrounded by trees, however there is a rocky outcropping nearby that has amazing views for hikers to enjoy.

name: Appalachian Trail 085: Raven Rock Hollow to MD/PA Line
description:
Section 85 of the AT runs 5.9 miles from Raven Rock Hollow to the MD/PA state line. Along the way it passes the Raven Rock shelter.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spots:<br />
"Warner Gap" lat=39.6560559927, lon=-77.5382287347<br />
"High Rock" lat=39.6949074627, lon=-77.5233980836<br />
<br />
Note: If you are north bound, pick up the Appalachian Trail section descriptions in Pennsylvania (or just click here).

name: Red Rocks
description:
The Red Rocks area, located around the Red Rocks Amphitheater, is a trail network that winds up the mountain sides above the Hogback and the city of Denver, and amongst the incredible red rock formations.<br />
These trails offer gorgeous views of the surrounding area and the unique rock formations, making for very entertaining hiking.

name: Rifle Falls State Park
description: Three unique hiking trails meander along the creek and through luxuriant riparian area throughout the park. They provide access to the caves, the top of the falls, and the creek upstream and downstream from the park. The Bobcat Trail follows Rifle Creek to the Colorado Division of Wildlife's Fish Hatchery. See the Trails section for complete trail descriptions. Please use caution as parts of the trails are steep and can become slippery when wet. Come prepared with sturdy hiking boots and plenty of water.

name: Warren Gulch
description:
Warren Gulch is a high altitude trail located right outside of Idaho Springs. The trail is made of rocky singletrack that makes its way up the mountain with switchbacks. All the climbing will be worth it when you break out of the heavy forest and enjoy the stunning views!<br />
This is a multi-use trail, so please share the path.

name: Western Maryland Rail Trail
description: Common activities that people enjoy on the trail include hiking, biking, jogging and inline skating. The easy grade and paved surface make this path ideal for families, the elderly, and persons with disabilities (the trail is very wheelchair friendly) to enjoy a trek outside. The trail is suited to anyone seeking a pleasant, leisurely outdoor experience. Biking and walking are the most popular uses of the WMRT. Pets are permitted on the trail.

name: Argentine Pass
description:
Argentine Pass' 21 miles lead over scenic singletrack, 4WD roads, a high alpine pass, and offer incredible mountain vistas. Along the hike you'll come upon the town of Waldorf, a ghost town now, which will take you back in time. <br />
This is a multi-use trail so please practice caution.

name: Red Rocks/ Dakota Ridge
description: Dakota Ridge is an extremely rocky trail high on the Hogback between Denver and the front range. This is a very entertaining trail with rocks and staircases all over the place and some serious exposure on the tops of cliffs. Expect incredible views of Denver and the front range.

name: Mathew Winters
description: Matthew Winters is a great starting point for a number of different trails, including Dakota Ridge, Red Rocks, Morrison Slide, and more. The Red Rocks trail runs past some amazing rock outcroppings and the Dakota Ridge trail climbs up and then runs along the Hogback, offering great views of Denver and the Front Range. Red Rocks is a fairly easy hike and Dakota Ridge is more challenging.

name: Green Mountain
description:
With more than 2,400 acres of open space, William Frederick Hayden Park on Green Mountain is the second largest park in Lakewood. <br />
The park features a challenging network of multi-use trails. The summit, at 6,800 feet, offers unique and stunning views of the Denver metropolitan area to the east, as well as high mountain peaks to the west.

name: Rock Gap State Park - Lakeside Loop
description: Rock Gap State Park - Lakeside Loop features 5 miles of hiking trails near Cumberland, MD.

name: CDT CO31: Herman Gulch to Berthoud Pass
description: Section 31 of the CDT in Colorado runs for 20.4 miles from Herman Gulch to Berthoud Pass on US Hwy 40. Along the way, the trail passes Mount Bethel, Mount Parnassus, Woods Mountain, The Citadel, Pettingell Peak, Hassell Peak, Harrison Mountain, Vasquez Peak, and Stanley Mountain.

name: Fair Hill NRMA
description: Fair Hill NRMA is a 5, 656-acre area with beautiful fields, large woodlands and the Big Elk Creek. The creek is stocked with fish for the fishermen's convenience. Multi-use trails at the park are open to hikers, mountain bikers and horseback riders. In addition to the multi-use trails, guided trail rides, hay rides and stabling are available to the public from the Fair Hill Stables. A trail map can be purchase at the park office.

name: Walnut Point State Park
description: Hiking and nature-study enthusiasts will find 2.25 miles of trails weaving through the timber. By using the main park road and the Gray Squirrel-Twin Points connection trail, walkers and joggers can complete a 3-mile exercise loop. All trails are restricted to foot traffic only. The Lakeside Nature Trail (.5 mile) is handicapped accessible.

name: Fair Hill
description: Fair Hill features 80 miles of hiking trails near Fair Hill/Rising Sun, MD.

name: Middle Run/white Clay Combo Ride
description: Middle Run/White Clay features 20 miles of hiking trails near Newark, DE.

name: Barbour Fork Loop
description: Barbour Fork Loop is an OHV trail, open to hikers, that mainly winds throughout the wooded forests of the front country. The trail is not particularly scenic because it stays mostly within tree cover, but it's perfect for a walk in the woods. Enjoy the surrounding aspen forests, but be ready for a tough workout, because there are plenty of steep climbs along this trail.

name: Saxon Mountain
description:
Saxon Mountain trail is a rocky and steep path that climbs 2500ft up to the top of Saxon Mountain where you'll hit 11,050ft in elevation. From the top you'll get an amazing view of Mt. Evans and the Divide. <br />
This is a multi-use trail so please share the path!

name: Rocky Gap State Park
description: Rocky Gap offers a variety of hiking trails for guests to enjoy. The Lakeside Trail, a moderate 4.5 mile trail that encircles Lake Habeeb, offers hikers scenic beauty of the area. Crossing over four-foot bridges, trekking along the shoreline and winding through the woodlands are what makes this such a diverse trail. Additional trails provide magnificent views.

name: Middle Run Natural Area
description: Middle Run Natural Area features 10 miles of hiking trails near Newark, DE.

name: White Clay Creek State Park Triple Loop
description: White Clay Creek State Park Triple Loop features 10 miles of hiking trails near Newark, DE.

name: Apex Park
description:
Apex Trail is in the Jefferson County trail system, and the eastern access is in the City of Golden. The trail is 2.3 miles long gaining up to 1,500 feet in elevation. There are exposed steep trails at time with views of Denver and Golden. <br />
Apex Park also features the Enchanted Forest Loop, at 5.6 miles round-trip, which features gentle slopes and scenic views of the forest. The Pick N' Sledge loop is also available, at 4.4 miles, but it is mainly used as a mountain bike trail.<br />
These trails are multi-use so please practice caution.

name: Appalachian Trail: Pennsylvania
description:
The Appalachian Trail runs for 231 miles through the state of Pennsylvania, on its way from Georgia to Maine. It runs from the <a href="http://www.tripleblaze.com/3/3301/Maryland/Appalachian-Trail--Maryland.html">Maryland</a> border to the <a href="http://www.tripleblaze.com/Hiking-Trails/New-Jersey_34.html">New Jersey</a> border. <br />
If you are looking for detailed information about each section of the AT in PA, please click on the individual section listings below.

name: East Lick Creek Trail
description: East Lick Creek Trail features 7 miles of hiking trails near Springfield, IL.

name: Appalachian Trail 086: PA/MD Line to US 30 (Caledonia State Park)
description:
The Appalachian Trail runs 17.9 miles between the PA/MD state line and US Hwy 30 (Caledonia State Park).<br />
<br />
Along the way it passes Mount Dunlop, PA Hwy 16, Mentzer Gap Rd., Deer Lick Shelter, Rattlesnake Run Rd., Antietam Shelter, Tumbling Run Rd., Tumbling Run Shelter, Snowy Mountain, Snowy Mountain Rd., PA Hwy 233, and Rocky Mountain Shelter.<br />
<br />
Note: If you are south bound, pick up the Appalachian Trail section descriptions in Maryland (or click here).

name: Quebec Run Trails Near
description: Quebec Run Trails Near features 20 miles of hiking trails near Elliottsville, PA.

name: Indian Grinding Rock
description:
Two short trails explore the park. North Trail (one mile round trip) begins near the museum. It follows a low ridge and loops back to the reconstructed Miwok village. At the village, you can join South Nature Trail or return to the museum via a more direct route past the ceremonial roundhouse.

South Nature Trail (0.5 mile loop) is a self-guided interpretive path keyed to a park pamphlet. As you tour meadowland, oak woods, plus stands of sugar pine and ponderosa pine, you'll learn how the Miwok collected and used the bountiful local vegetation.

name: Fort Ross
description:
To Fort Ross Cove is 0.5 mile round trip; to Reef Point Campground is 4 miles round trip;
can extend walk north along park bluffs and south along coast

name: AR River - Murray Lock and Dam State Park
description: The Arkansas River is one of the Mississippi's largest tributaries. Flowing from the Rockies, this dam is created and the area offers hiking, camping, fishing, boating, canoeing and kayaking.

name: Camp Hero State Park
description: The 415-acre Camp Hero State Park is a heavily wooded area with a long area of beachfront on the Atlantic Ocean. The park offers an extensive trail system for biking, hiking and horseback riding and excellent surf fishing. Picnicking is also common. Pets are allowed on leash.

name: FL Blankenship Riverside Sanctuary
description:
F.L. Blankenship resides along the shores of the Scenic Stillwater River. Comprised of mature riverine forest, the site is a perfect place for fishing, launching canoes or just watching wildlife along the river. A bicentennial time capsule is buried on the site where a short loop trail circles the property. A small parking lot is located off of St. Rt. 48.

There is a .25 mile loop that encircles the park and allows you to take all of the sights in! Don't forget to stop by the Program Information Center or look for the time capsule along your walk!

name: Silver Lake Park
description: We begin with a stop at the center of Silver Lake Park, Silver Lake Nature Center. This 235-acre complex is unique to Pennsylvania in that it harbors the best-protected Coastal Plain Forest left in the state. It is part of the 460-acre park and Silver Lake which is the terminus of the Mill Creek, Queen Anne Creek, and the Black Ditch Creek Watershed. The main building houses a multipurpose auditorium, exhibit room depicting that which is unique to the park, offices, the Barnswallow Gift Shop, and a reference library. Immediately outside the building is a large meadow. Nearby, a 60-person amphitheater is designed for campfires and shows. Groups, private or public, often use a nearby picnic pavilion.

name: Indian Lake State Park
description: The 8, 400-acre Indian Lake State Park is open to fishing hunting, cross country skiing, hiking, swimming, picnicking, sunbathing and camping. Its six mile shoreline has been entertaining visitors for years and will continue to. Indian Lake is the fourth largest inland lake in the Upper Peninsula.

name: FOUNTAIN CREEK REGIONAL TRAIL
description: Starting along Fountain Creek at the El Pomar Youth Sports Complex in Colorado Springs, the trail continues south through the Fountain Creek Regional Park.

name: Keyesville Special Recreation Management Area
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Madison Lake State Park
description: Madison Lake State Park lies within the Darby Plains. The 76-acre park is a peaceful area with a 106-acre lake for boating, sailing, canoeing, swimming and fishing. Hiking and bird hunting are also popular activities. The park offers a one mile nature trail that takes visitors through woodlands and along the lake.

name: Quarry Park
description: The 1-mile Vista Point Trail begins as a service road in the main parking lot. The road enters a dense eucalyptus forest and begins to gain elevation. Enjoy great views through the trees of the Pacific Ocean.

name: Lake Skinner Recreation Area
description:
Nestled in the rolling hills of Winchester, CA, beautiful Lake Skinner Recreational Area is located just a few short miles east of the Temecula Wineries, close to the bustling communities of Murrieta and Menifee, and within easy access of Interstates 15 and 215.

There is a 1.5 mile groomed walking path that circles the park and affords spectacular views in all directions. Don't miss the brand new amphitheater alongside a newly installed Splash Pad for those hot days when the family just needs to cool off. Keep a look out for a wide variety of birds, such as heron, owls, hawks, and many others.

name: Fort Stevens State Park
description: Excellent hiking trails.

name: Grassy Hill Natural Area Preserve
description: Grassy Hill NAP features 7 miles of hiking trails near , VA.

name: Nottingham County Park
description: Nottingham County Park features 18 miles of hiking trails near Nottingham, PA.

name: White Clay Creek Preserve
description: Hiking trails explore the habitats of the park and tie in with trails in the White Clay Creek Preserve in Delaware.

name: Chimney Gulch
description:
Chimney Gulch Trail is in the Jefferson County trail system and is connected to the Windy Saddle Trail and Park. The trail climbs to 2,000 feet in 2.5 miles from Highway 6 to the summit at Lookout Mountain Nature Center.<br />
The trail is moderate to advanced and passes through grass prairie and pine forest, crossing streams at several places.

name: Cere's Park
description: Cere's Park features 0 miles of hiking trails near Mantua/Pitman, NJ.

name: Centennial Cone Park
description:
Hike through the remains of many farms and homesteads in this Open Space Park. The trail takes you on top of the ridges above Clear Creek and offers beautiful views. <br />
This is an incredibly scenic trail, and it's definitely a must-see if you're in the area. It is a multi-use trail so please practice caution.

name: Cecil M. Harden Lake
description: 6 trails, including 1 archery trail

name: South Table Mtn.
description:
South Table Mountain is an 8 mile loop located right outside of Golden, CO. It's the perfect hike for families or if you want to get a quick workout in. The trail takes you up the mountain via switchbacks, and once you're at the top you can check out the views from Castle Rock. Here you'll find stunning scenery and you'll be able to look out over Golden and the surrounding valley.<br />
This is a multi-use trail so be sure to share the path!

name: Plumas-Eureka State Park
description:
Eureka Peak Loop Trail takes hikers on a
6 miles round trip over an 1,800-foot elevation gain. If the ski lift road is open, the hike is 3 miles round trip with 1,000-foot gain.

name: Washington Township Park
description: Washington Township Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Avon, IN.

name: Upper Fall Creek
description: Crushed stone walking trail.

name: Barnegat Lighthouse State Park
description: One of the last remnants of maritime forest on Long Beach Island is found at Barnegat Lighthouse State Park. The forest, which is dominated by Black Cherry, Sassafras, Eastern Red Cedar, and American Holly, is an important resting and feeding area for migratory birds on their long journey to and from their breeding sites. The Maritime Forest Trail is a 1/5-mile long, self-guided loop trail through this unique environment.

name: Upper Bidwell Park
description: Upper Bidwell Park features 11 miles of hiking trails near Chico, CA.

name: Alapocas Run State Park
description: Alapocas Run State Park provides a much needed getaway amidst the cities of Delaware, some would refer to it as an oasis. This park offers a unique playground for children of all types, hiking trails, rock-climbing, athletic fields, biking and picnicking. The Blue Ball Barn, a barn built in 1914 by Alfred I. duPont, is also on the property. It houses a large collection of folk art, which makes this park truly unique. The park is home to three hiking trails: Alapocas Woods Trail 0.7 miles- easy,  PawPaw Trail- 0.3 miles- easy and Northern Delaware Greenway Trail- 2.0 miles- easy, biking is also available on this trail. The Northern Delaware Greenway Trail extends to 10 miles if you take it to the nearby shared land.

name: Pershing State Park
description:
Pershing State Park is a beautiful prairie area that offers a variety of recreational opportunities including camping, hiking, fishing, birding, picnicking, boating and a playground for children. Camping and fishing are excellent here. The scenic park include several hiking trails that wind through streams and prairie lands.

The park offers five main trails that equal about nine miles in length when combing. They are of different levels of difficulty and offer a variety of scenery and terrain. The 1.5 mile trail is handicap accessible.

name: Friendship Hill National Historic Site
description:
The ten miles of trails at Friendship Hill National Historic Site offer a glimpse of the natural world of the Allegheny Plateau.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Camden County College
description: Camden County College features 4 miles of hiking trails near Blackwood, NJ.

name: Spitler Woods State Natural Area
description: Two-thirds of the area is a dedicated nature preserve containing one of the few remaining stands of old-growth timber in Illinois. Two trails wind through the nature preserve, allowing hikers to enjoy the unspoiled beauty of the forest. Public facilities include a large, day-use area with many picnic areas convenient to parking spaces   Phone  (217) 864-3121

name: North Table Mountain
description: Mostly exposed hiking trails but you'll find a few hidden gems here including a (seasonal?) waterfall. Tremendous views and interesting geology as the trail winds around the sides of the mesa.

name: La-Ho Trail
description: Water side hike for almost the entire hike. A few hills, but nothing too bad.

name: John Bryan State Park
description: John Bryan State Park features 6 miles of hiking trails near Yellow Springs, OH.

name: Codorus State Park
description: Although the park only has two "hiking only" trails, many miles of equestrian and mountain biking trails can also be hiked. All trails are in hunting areas so visitors should wear fluorescent orange during hunting seasons.

name: Wolf Run State Park
description:
-3.5-mile section of the Buckeye Trail passes along the west side of the lake
-1/2 mile loop trail begins at the nature center providing opportunities for nature study and wildlife observation
-1.5-mile Lakeview Trail skirts the lake, providing a pleasant walk from the campground to the beach

name: Kokemill
description: Kokemill features 1 miles of hiking trails near Springfield, IL.

name: CDT CO32: Berthoud Pass to Rainbow Road
description: Section 32 of the CDT runs for 9.5 miles from Berthoud Pass to Rainbow Road. Along the way, the trail passes Colorado Mines Peak, and the peak of Mount Flora.

name: White Ranch
description: White Ranch has a wide variety of trails, from really rocky cactus-lined tracks to wooden bridges. There are several great views of Golden, Denver, and the Front Range.

name: Susquehannock State Park
description: The scenic hiking trails offer a wide variety of interesting habitats and evidence of people's past use of the area.

name: Prairie Dog State Park
description: 1.5 mile trail that gives you a great view of the lake and the prairie dogs can be seen at the Prairie Dog trail head. There is a vault toilet located at the Meadowlark trail head. The first 1000 feet of the nature trail starting at the Prairie Dog trail head is concrete.

name: Black Butte Lake
description: Excellent trails.

name: Black Butte Lake
description: Excellent trails.

name: Black Butte Lake
description: Excellent trails.

name: Brandywine State Park
description: Brandywine Creek State Park features 15 miles of hiking trails near Wilmington, DE.

name: Chestnut Ridge
description: The park features 2.4 miles of trails.

name: CDT CO33: Rainbow Road to Rollins Pass
description: Section 33 of the CDT in Colorado runs for 11.3 miles from Rainbow Road to Rollins Pass. Along the way, the trail passes the summit of James Peak, the summit of Heartbeat Peak, and Mount Epworth.

name: Sycamore State Park
description: 4 Hiking Trails

name: Fort Necessity National Battlefield
description:
Five miles of hiking trails lead through forest and meadows around Fort Necessity. Cross-country skiing is available in winter. The trails are not groomed. Trails lead through forest and meadows around Fort Necessity. There is also a loop trail at Jumonville Glen and a short walking path at Braddock's Grave.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Blue Rock State Park
description: 7 hiking trails

name: Slate Run
description: Slate Run Metro Park isn't resting on slate rock -- settlers mistook the dark soil for 350-million year old slate. It's actually shale, a soft rock made from clay deposited by water about 350 million years ago. Slate Run features a variety of habitats ranging from the open areas of grasslands, wetlands and meadows to the forested areas of beech, oak, hickory and sugar maple. Red-winged blackbirds, meadowlarks, indigo bunting, belted kingfishers and numerous other birds and wildlife can be seen at the 156-acre wetlands. More than 70 species of birds have been spotted there. The park features Slate Run Living Historical Farm where visitors can learn about and help with chores on a working 1880s farm. About 12 miles of trails wind through the fields, forests, ravines and grasslands. Visitors will cross a restored 1800s covered bridge on one of the trails.

name: Island Beach State Park
description: The Island Beach State Park Discovery Trails System provides a self-guided experience through the nine plant communities of a barrier island. Wayside exhibits located along each trail interpret the natural and cultural stories of the park. There are a total of 8 trails, each under one mile. For a copy of the Discovery Trails brochure and map, please contact the Park Office.

name: Golden Gate Canyon State Park
description:
More than 12,000 acres of dense forest, rocky peaks, and aspen-rimmed meadows laced with miles of trails awaiting the hiker, horseback rider, mountain biker and winter sports enthusiast at Golden Gate Canyon State Park. Only 30 miles from Denver, Golden Gate Canyon offers such amenities as a electrical hook-ups and tent-sites in two different campgrounds, stocked fishing ponds, picnic sites and the Panorama Point Scenic Overlook, where visitors can see 100 miles of the Continental Divide. <br />
Over 35 miles of hiking trails in the park offer pleasures and challenges for everyone. The twelve trails at Golden Gate Canyon are each named after an animal and marked with the animal's footprint. Trail head parking areas are easily accessible from the main roads in the park.<br />
Mountain bikes and horses are permitted in the park on multiple-use trails.

name: Sugarloaf Mountain Bike Area
description: Sugarloaf Mountain Bike Area features 9 miles of hiking trails near Ohiopyle, PA.

name: Ohiopyle State Park
description: Ohiopyle State Park is 20,500 acres of rugged, natural beauty. There is hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, fishing, cross-country, sledding, snowmobiling and camping available for people who just want to do it all! There are 18 trails here that add up to a grand total of 79 miles in length and range from easy to difficult.

name: Mont Alto State Park
description: Mont Alto is the oldest park in the state park system. Local hikes offer diverse wildlife hikes and fishing and snowmobiling make for a well-rounded park.

name: Brendan T. Byrne State Forest
description: Brendan T. Byrne State Forest has more than 25 miles of marked trails. The various trails and loops provide challenges ranging from long single track hiking trails to a trail accessible for people with disabilities. The Batona Trail is designed for hiking, cross country skiing, and snow shoeing (weather permitting). The Mount Misery Trail allows visitors the additional option of mountain biking, and the Cranberry Trail allows for access by wheelchairs in addition to all the other uses listed above.

name: Standley Lake
description:
Standley Lake Regional Park boasts more than 14 miles of maintained trails, single-track trails and roads that are available to hiking, mountain biking and horse back riding. Maintained trails, which make up the majority of the park's system, offer a variety of terrain that appeals to most hikers and horseback riders.There are just a few steep hills, but they will reward you with breathtaking overlooks of Standley Lake and the Front Range.<br />
While using the trails within the park, you have the opportunity to see many of the plants and animals common to this area, including native grasses, wildflowers, cottonwoods, prairie dogs, cotton-tailed rabbits, hawks and meadowlarks, just to name a few.<br />
Standley Lake Regional Park is also the starting point for some of the city's major trail corridors, including the the Big Dry Creek Trail and the Farmers' High Line Canal Trail. In addition, there is a substantial network of trails on the south side of the lake. Many of the trails link to others throughout the city's network of more than 63 miles of off-road trails.

name: Paradise Lake
description: Paradise Lake features 10 miles of hiking trails near Magalia, CA.

name: DeShong Park
description: The 208-acre DeShong Park is a day use park with horseshoe pits, shuffleboard courts, checker tables, two half-court basketball courts, a skate complex, a playground and a 1.5-mile paved trail.

name: Eagle Creek Park
description: Excellent hiking trails.

name: Angostura Recreation Area
description: Angostura Recreation Area offers 36 miles of shoreline and some of the finest sandy beaches in the state. This park offers boating, swimming, fishing, hiking and camping for visitors to enjoy!

name: James Peak
description:
James Peak Trail is an incredibly scenic trail that leads up the mountain providing stunning views. The trail starts out traversing the popular St. Marys Glacier, a permanent ice field at the base of the mountain. Crossing the glacier the trail leads out into an open meadow where you are able to lay your eyes on the beautiful profile of James Peak. <br />
Summit either by switchbacks or a direct, uphill trail, either way you'll get to the top and be able to enjoy amazing mountaintop views! Take skis or a snowboard in the winter and enjoy some backcountry skiing as well!

name: Fort Harrison State Park
description: 7 trails, excellent hiking opportunities

name: Three Creeks
description: Excellent hiking and nature trails.

name: Standish-Hickey State Recreation Area
description: The Big Tree Trail offers a 2 mile loop; the Mill Creek Trails run a 6 mile loop.

name: Turkey Run State Park
description:
Sandstone ravines, aged forests, and a suspension foot bridge over the Sugar Creek make up a small portion of this diverse park. Hiking is a prominent activity in this scenic area. The beauty of this park will take your breath away during any activity you choose to do from picnicking and camping to hiking and fishing. The park's amenities include rentable cabins, hiking trails, an inn, an inn restaurant, a playground, a tennis court and a swimming pool.

The well-known trails at the Turkey Run State Park very in level of difficulty from easy to very rugged. The trails can be slick and muddy due to the stream beds along the property. There are 11 trails that equal about 15 miles in length when combined.

name: Ryerson Station State Park
description: The trails allow visitors to explore the park on foot and on cross-country skis in winter. The trails traverse many habitats, like mature forests, wet valley bottoms, evergreen plantations and fields in ecological succession. Contact the park office for detailed trail descriptions.

name: Pickerington Ponds
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Colorado Hills Trail
description: Walk this trail through the Westminister's Colorado Hills Open Space and you'll find yourself at a scenic 11-acre pond. Although this trail is near to the city, it feels like it's completely secluded.

name: Double Trouble State Park
description: The Double Trouble Historic District has a self-guided, marked 1.5-mile loop nature trail and several miles of unmarked paths along sand service roads. Nature trail guides are available at the trailhead next to the cranberry packing house and at the park information building.

name: Winter Park Resort
description: Winter Park Resort opens up their trails in the off-season. There's over 25 miles of trail that traverse the mountain and offer hikers and mountain bikers an amazing area to explore.

name: John Heinz Wildlife Preserve
description: John Heinz Wildlife Preserve features 10 miles of hiking trails near Philadelphia, PA.

name: Battelle Darby Creek
description: Great trails.

name: Westwood Trails
description: Westwood Trails features 10 miles of hiking trails near New Castle, IN.

name: Caledonia State Park
description: The trails pass through forests and historic areas. A brochure on the hiking trails is available at the park office.

name: Appalachian Trail 087: US 30 to PA 233
description: The AT runs 19.6 miles from US Hwy 30 (Caledonia State Park) to PA Hwy 233. Along the way it passes Quarry Gap shelter, Pine Flat Ridge, Birch Run shelter, Shippensburg-Arendtsville Road (Big Flat), Dead Woman's Hollow, Toms Run shelter, and Old Shippensburg Road.

name: Batona Trail
description: Batona Trail features 50 miles of hiking trails near Burlington County, NJ.

name: Woodson Bridge State Recreation Area
description: On the Sacramento River Trail, walkers stroll beneath the grand old oaks growing along the river. Joining the oaks are walnut, sycamore, and cottonwood. The park's trees muster quite a display of fall color. Beneath the trees grow a tangle of elderberry and wild grape.

name: Charleston Falls Preserve
description: The trail system within the Preserve connects and loops its way around the park. From the parking area you can choose to go a couple of different directions, but all of the trails meet up eventually. Throughout your hike you will encounter a tall grass prairie, a 37' waterfall, a limestone cave, the Thorny Badlands, the Redbud Valley, Cedar pond, and plenty of wildlife and uncommon plants.

name: Bonner Park
description: Bonner Park features 4 miles of hiking trails near Glen Mills, PA.

name: Oakbourne Park
description: Oakbourne Park features 3 miles of hiking trails near West Chester, PA.

name: Northwest Passage / Tipperary / Spruce Creek / Flume
description:
This 15 mile loop is basically a beautiful and relaxing walk in the woods. Enjoy hiking on old reclaimed forest roads, and take in the secluded nature that surrounds you. Every once in awhile you'll catch a glimpse of the surrounding mountains!<br />
These trails are open to mountain bikers as well, so please share the trail.

name: Town Run Trail Park
description: Great hiking.

name: High Plains Trail
description:
This is a fairly easy trail that winds through fields full of prairie grass that offer stunning views of the Flatirons, and occasionally highlighting Longs Peak and some of the Indian Peaks. Part of the trail can be a little rocky, but overall it's a nice easy hike.<br />
This is a multi-use trail so be on the lookout for mountain bikers and make sure to share the trail!

name: Cr-81 To Rendezvous
description: Cr-81 To Rendezvous is a 3 mile hiking trail in Winter Park, Colorado.

name: Rattlesnake Gulch
description:
A moderately difficult trail leading 1.4 miles (one way) past spectacular views of the canyon and eastern plains to the remains of historic Crags hotel, 600 feet above the trailhead. Built in 1908, the hotel was accessed via an inclined railway from the canyon floor until it burned down in 1913. <br />
The trail continues as a .8 mile loop as it travels to a view of the Continental Divide and the railroad tracks, 1,200 feet above the trailhead. The trail is 1.4 miles to the ruins and another .8 mile for the loop, making the total roundtrip distance about 3.6 miles.

name: Eldorado Canyon State Park
description:
Eldorado Canyon State Park just outside of Boulder, Colorado offers over 11 miles of hiking trails. The specific trails in the park are the Eldorado Canyon Trail, Rattlesnake Gulch, Fowler Trail, Streamside Trail, and Crescent Meadows. These trails offer up gorgeous views of the canyon, some of the streams, and the surrounding mountains. They vary in difficulty greatly depending on which trail you choose. <br />
In addition to hiking, Eldorado Canyon is a very popular destination for Bouldering and Rock Climbing with over 500 technical rock climbing routes. Several of the trails are also open to mountain biking.

name: CDT CO34: Rollins Pass to Monarch Lake
description: Section 34 of the CDT in Colorado runs for 19.4 miles from Rollins Pass to Monarch Lake. Along the way, the trail passes the James Peak Protection Area, Skyscraper Peak, Mount Jasper, Mount Neva, Satanta Peak, Mount Adams, Lonesome Peak, and Monarch Lake.

name: Spring Brook Loop
description: Spring Brook Loop is a 5 mile hiking trail in Eldorado Springs, Colorado.

name: Doudy Draw Trail
description: Doudy Draw Trail is a 4 mile hiking trail in Eldorado Springs, Colorado.

name: Shades State Park
description:
Shades State Park is a peaceful park composed of beautiful sandstone cliffs and numerous ravines. The Pine Hills Nature Preserve is also located on the property and is open for long hikes through the diverse scenery. Camping during the warm seasons is permitted at the nearby Turkey Run State Park. The park's amenities include picnic shelters, hiking trails, fishing areas and camp sites.

The hiking trails at Shades State Park vary in level of difficulty. There are 11 popular trails on the property that make up approx. 10 miles when added together.

name: Blackhawk Loop
description: Blackhawk Loop features 18 miles of hiking trails near Payson, UT.

name: Laurel Summit State Park
description: Laurel Summit is a trailhead for trails in Forbes State Forest, including Wolf Rocks Trail and also the Laurel Highlands Hiking Trail.

name: Laurel Ridge State Park
description:
This major 70-mile hiking and backpacking trail from Ohiopyle State Park to near Johnstown is the main feature of the park. The trail traverses state parks, state forests, state game lands, other public lands and private lands.

The Laurel Highlands Hiking Trail is open year-round and is blazed approximately every 100 feet with 2-inch and 5-inch yellow blazes. Connector trails lead to and from parking and shelter areas and are marked with blue blazes. Mileage monuments are every mile. Pets are permitted.

name: Blacklick Woods
description: The park features more than six miles of trails for hiking, biking and jogging.

name: Barr Lake State Park
description: An 8.8-mile trail for hikers, horseback riders and bicyclists follows the perimeter of the lake. The trail is currently closed form mile post (MP) 2.5 (the inlet) to MP 6 (the Stone House) for trail work.There are shorter walks to the various boardwalks that extend over the lake. An easy 1.3-mile walk from the Nature Center brings you to the Gazebo Boardwalk, where you can get an excellent view of the eagle's nest and the rookery using a spotting scope. The road across the top of the dam (Crest Trail) is open to hikers and bicyclists.

name: Sinkyone Wilderness State Park
description: Take the Lost Coast Trail to Jones Beach for a 2 mile trip or to Whale Gulch for a 4.5 mile round trip.

name: Buck Creek State Park
description: 9.5 miles of hiking trails offer opportunities for nature study, bird watching and other wildlife observation.

name: Marshall Road Open Spaces
