description:
Marshall Road Open Spaces has a variety of trails totaling 7 miles just outside of Superior, Colorado. This area mostly has a desert feel and the trails run through wide open grassy plains providing beautiful views of the Flatirons. <br />
Some of these trails are open to mountain bikers so please be aware and share the path.

name: Ridley Creek State Park
description: The trails pass through a variety of habitats throughout the central portion of the park.

name: West Magnolia
description:
West Magnolia Trailhead provides access to eight miles of singletrack trails for hiking, biking and horseback riding west of the Peak-to-Peak Highway south of Nederland. An additional eight miles of Forest Roads that connect to Rollins Pass Road west of Rollinsville are open to motorized and non-motorized activities. <br />
The network of interconnected trails offers many different loop opportunities with a range of difficulty levels. It is possible to connect this system of trails with the Front Range Trailhead via a short segment of Magnolia Road east of Colorado Highways 72/119.

name: Walker Ranch
description:
Sporting a diverse array of ecosystems to explore, it's virtually impossible to get bored at Walker Ranch. From the great staircase to South Boulder Creek to the open view across Crescent Meadow to the historic homestead, Walker Ranch is a cultural and natural treasure. <br />
There are 3 trails here: Meyers Homestead Trail, Walker Ranch Loop, and Walker Ranch Link.

name: Marshall Mesa Area
description:
Marshall Mesa Trail connects to the Community Ditch Trail and a loop hike can be taken combining these two trails. Self-guided interpretive signs about the coal mining and geologic history of the Marshall area are located along this trail. Community Ditch Trail provides access to the south to the Greenbelt Plateau Trail and to the west to the Doudy Draw area.<br />
Birds of prey are frequently sighted in this area. Coyotes and mule deer are common. There is a large prairie dog town near the trailhead.

name: Meyers Homestead Trail
description: Meyers Homestead Trail is part of the Walker Ranch Open Space, about 9 miles out of Boulder. This out-and-back trail has beautiful foliage and you're likely to see a herd of elk grazing nearby. There are also interpretive signs along the trail that teach hikers about local history and ecology.

name: Okehocking Preserve
description: Okehocking Preserve features 5 miles of hiking trails near West Chester, PA.

name: Honey Creek Preserve
description:
Honey Creek Preserve is part of the Honey Creek Watershed which stretches over 143 square miles. Settlers were attracted to this area due to the abundant forests, rich soil and the Honey Creek which flowed through it. A wide variety of plant and animal life can be found on its banks and the surrounding area.

Located in the park is a mile long nature trail that follows along Honey Creek, through a prairie, wetland and woodlands. It is also adjacent to the Great Miami River Recreational Trail. Keep an eye out for the many different species of birds that live here.

name: Coal Creek Trail
description: A highlight of Louisville's trail system is the Coal Creek Regional Trail which runs east to west along Coal Creek in the southern part of Louisville. The Coal Creek Regional Trail is a continuous eight-mile, mostly soft-surface trail that currently runs from McCaslin Boulevard in Superior through Louisville to 120th Street in Lafayette. A joint effort between the cities of Louisville, Lafayette, Superior and Boulder County, the trail will eventually tie into the City of Boulder and Town of Erie trail systems as well as link to the Rock Creek Trail system and the City and County of Broomfield. Louisville is fortunate to have direct access to one of Boulder County's most well-developed and beautiful regional trail systems.

name: Pemberton Rail Trail
description: Pemberton Rail Trail features 5 miles of hiking trails near Pemberton, NJ.

name: Clark Creek State Park
description: The Clark Creek Natural Area in southwestern Mississippi is one of the Magnolia State's most beautiful outdoor treasures. Comprising more than 700 acres, it is highlighted by some 50 waterfalls, ranging in size 10 to more than 30 feet in height. Creation and protection of this fabulous area came about in 1978.

name: Michaux State Forest
description: Michaux State Forest features 20 miles of hiking trails near Chambersburg, PA.

name: Belmont Plateau
description: Belmont Plateau features 0 miles of hiking trails near Philadelphia, PA.

name: Rancocas State Park
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Prairie Oaks Metro Park
description: Hiking, dog walking, rollerblading trail

name: East Bradford (Harmony Hill) Recreation Area
description: East Bradford (Harmony Hill) Recreation Area features 4 miles of hiking trails near Downingtown, PA.

name: Samuel S. Lewis State Park
description: The one-mile Hilltop Trail winds through a pine plantation, interesting rock formations and spectacular scenic views. This easy hike also takes visitors past the George E. Stine Arboretum. Over the years, the arboretum has been severely damaged by storms and high winds. However, it still contains European beech, persimmon, concolor fir, English yew and other unique species, capturing a piece of the landscape's past. Use the Short Cut Trail, a short loop, to more fully explore the pine plantation.

name: John A. Wannemacher Nature Reserve
description: The 1.6 mile nature trail leads you through open grassland, over Boone Creek and past a beautiful woodland and wetland area.  This park is the perfect setting for hiking, running and wildlife viewing.

name: Jim Edgar Panther Creek
description:
Off-trail hiking is available from parking areas positioned off public roads throughout the site. Because unmarked, open wells may exist in the area, caution must be used by individuals visiting JEPC.

A 3- mile hiking and jogging trail opened fall of 1999 around the lake shore at Gridley Lake. Seventeen miles of new hiking and mountain bike trail opened April 16, 2001 around Prairie Lake. Seven more miles of mountain bike/hiking were opened in 2003 around Drake Lake and connecting to the Prairie Lake trail. There are 26 miles of Equestrian Trails in three loops. The trails have a lot of elevation changes.

name: Gregory Canyon / Chautauqua
description: Dozens of trails to choose from, most accessible from the grounds of the Chautauqua National Historic Landmark. We hiked a 2 mile loop combining McClintock and Enchanted Mesa trails. Open valley sections, forested trails, mild to steep climbs, views, rocks - you name it, this trail system has it all. Super convenient to Boulder and University of Colorado.

name: Cowans Gap State Park
description: Trails vary in difficulty from flat to very steep.

name: Wakonda State Park
description: Wakonda State Park is home to six lakes that attract huge amounts of migratory birds. Birdwatchers and fishermen love this park. Swimming, camping, hiking, boating, cycling, picnicking and metal detecting are other popular activities here. Five hiking trail varying in length and difficulty are offered here. When combined the trails equal about seven miles in length.

name: Pacific Crest Trail: Northern California: N
description:
Section N of the Pacific Crest Trail runs 134.3 miles from Highway 70 at Belden Town Bridge to Burney Falls. After only a few miles of hiking along this section you'll leave the Sierra Nevada mountain range behind and head on up into the Cascade Mount Range and the Modoc Plateau. Volcanic Lassen Peak and Lassen Volcanic National Park are the highlights of this section.<br />
<br />
Along the way the trail passes Belden, CA; Indian Creek; Poison Spring; Road 26N02; Humbug Road 27N01; Humboldt Road at Humboldt Summit; Carter Meadow Trail junction; Junction to Butt Mountain summit; Highway 36; Stover Camp; North Stover Mountain; North Fork Feather River; Chester-Childs Meadows Road; Warner Valley Campground; Lower Twin Lake; Plantation Loop Road; Road 32N12; Old Station, CA; Road 32N90; Road 32N99; Road 33N22; Highway 44; Hat Creek Rim Fire Lookout site; Road 22; Cassel-Fall River Mills Road; Rock Spring Creek; Cassel, CA; Highway 299; Burney, CA; and Highway 89.

name: Rocky Ridge County Park
description: Rocky Ridge County Park is a 10 mile hiking trail in York, Pennsylvania.

name: Laurel Hill State Park
description: The hiking trails of Laurel Hill State Park are listed according to difficulty, arranged from the easiest to the most difficult. Most trails are wide, easily followed and, therefore, not color blazed. Where deemed necessary, blazes are yellow.

name: Seven Springs
description: Seven Springs features 0 miles of hiking trails near Somerset, PA.

name: Betasso Preserve
description: A couple loops to choose from with scenery ranging from wooded to open meadows to views of Boulder below. Not too crowded on weekdays and some of the trails are closed to bikes on Wednesdays and Saturdays.

name: Ridge Trail To Pole Steeple Overlook
description: Ridge Trail To Pole Steeple Overlook features 6 miles of hiking trails near Mt Holly Springs, PA.

name: Mount Sanitas
description: Classic Boulder hike with incredible views and within walking distance of downtown Boulder. The Sanitas Trail climbs a tall ridge with sweeping views to the east and west. Also be sure to hit the Sanitas Valley Trail, a wide, gradual path just east of Mt. Sanitas.

name: Richardson Grove State Park
description: Over nine miles of hiking trails, picnic area with ample parking, river access, and seasonal fishing. Most popular are the Lookout Point, Tanoak Spring, and Durphy Creek Trails.

name: East Boulder Trail
description: Hike on this flat path through open meadows and around a pristine lake. This is an easy trail, perfect for families with children, or great just for stretching the legs. You'll encounter joggers and mountain bikers along here, so please practice trail etiquette!

name: Dillon State Park
description: Dillon State Park features 11 miles of hiking trails near Zanesville, OH.

name: Shawnee State Park
description: 6 hiking trails

name: Great Miami River Recreational Trail
description: The Great Miami River Recreational Trail boasts 32 miles of bikeway through Miami County. Enjoy nature while getting active by biking, running or walking along the trail. For more information, please click on the tabs below!

name: Pine Grove Furnace State Park
description: Pine Grove Furnace State Park is a 696-acre park  is located on South Mountain in Cumberland County. It boasts two lakes and has hiking, biking, swimming, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling and camping for those who want to do it all. There are six trails that add up to four miles here and the 2,000-mile Appalachian trail runs through it as well.

name: Sourdough Trail
description:
Sourdough Trail is an awesome singletrack trail that takes you along alpine trails and winds through high elevation forests. Every once in awhile the forests open up and you get to see the stunning views of the surrounding mountains and valleys!<br />
This is a multi-use trail so be sure to share the path.

name: Appalachian Trail 088: PA 233 to PA 94
description: The Appalachian Trail runs 10.7 miles from PA Hwy 233 to PA Hwy 94. Along the way it passes Old Railroad Bed Road 2, Green Mountain Road (Tagg Run), and PA Hwy 34 (Hunter's Run).

name: Summit Lake State Park
description:
Over 2, 680 acres of water, woods, wildlife and land make up the Summit Lake State Park. This park is an excellent camping area with several convenient amenities for your comfort. Birdwatching and wildlife observation are thriving activities at this location. Swimming, boating, fishing and water skiing are also popular activities in the large lake on the property. Picnic areas, boat ramps, cross country skiing trails, hiking trails and canoe, paddle boat and rowboat rentals are available for your enjoyment.

The park offers four hiking trails that equal about five miles when combined. The trails are mostly of moderate difficulty, one is handicap accessible. The trails offer a close up look at the beautiful tree groves, open fields and a wildflower meadow.

name: Barkcamp State Park
description: 4 hiking trails

name: Shawnee State Park
description: Excellent trail system.

name: Hibernia Park - Cedar Hollow Trail
description: Hibernia Park - Cedar Hollow Trail features 1 miles of hiking trails near Coatesville, PA.

name: White Rocks Trail
description:
White Rocks Trail is a 7 mile out-and-back trail near Lafayette, CO. This trail is fairly easy and crosses a few hills. The path is pretty dry and dusty, and it traverses a desert-like terrain.<br />
This is a multi-use trail, so please share the trail.

name: Hobart Urban Nature Preserve
description: Hobart Urban Nature Preserve has 1.5 miles of trail and over 80 acres of land.  This is a fantastic place to unwind by bird-watching, taking leisurely walks and observing nature.  Hobart offers an escape for city dwellers along with unique welded sculptures donated from the collection of the Hobart Welding Institute.

name: Bald Mountain Trail
description: A short, scenic hike to the top of Bald Mountain rewards you with a spectacular panorama of the Great Plains and Continental Divide. The perfect place for an afternoon picnic, Bald Mountain is ideal for both family time and contemplative solitude.

name: Wissahickon Valley Park
description: Wissahickon Valley Park features 14 miles of hiking trails near Philadelphia, PA.

name: Lost Creek Reserve & Knoop Agricultural Heritage Center
description: Lost Creek is the largest park with 457 acres of landscape.  It has 3.4 miles of trail that takes you past farm fields, through wooded areas and along Lost Creek making this Reserve a great place for hiking, cross country skiing and viewing wildlife.

name: Kooser State Park
description: The Kincora Trail is a popular trail named in honor of an Irish priest. Many short trails are in the day use area and cross-country ski trails are also available for hiking.

name: Camp Glen Gray
description: Marked trails take you all over camp. The Millstone trail is a pleasant 2 hour trip, while the History of the Glen Trail covers almost 10 miles and takes you back through the history of the region. Many other trails criss-cross the camp.

name: Marsh Creek Park
description: Marsh Creek Park features 12 miles of hiking trails near Eagle, PA.

name: Marsh Creek State Park
description: Marsh Creek State Park is 1,727 acres and contains the 535-acre Marsh Creek Lake. This park offers excellent swimming, boating, fishing, hiking, horseback riding, and sledding.

name: Gifford Pinchot State Park
description: Gifford Pinchot State Park is a full service park with with the 340-acre  Pinchot Lake as the main feature. There are 18 hiking trails with red blazes to help guide you along the way. The longest trail is the Mason-Dixon Trail which is 200 miles and runs through multiple states. The shortest is the Oak Trail at 0.4 miles.

name: Harlan County Lake
description: Year round recreational opportunities are available at Nebraska's second largest lake. Fishing, Hunting, Sight Seeing, and Hiking are just some of the activities found at Harlan County Lake. Please come and visit us for a unique experience.

name: Salt Fork State Park
description: 14 hiking trails

name: Neshaminy State Park
description: Neshaminy State Park is 339 acres and sits on the Deaware River. Hiking, swimming, boating and fishing are avilable to outdoors lovers here. There are two hiking trails here that add up to four miles in total.

name: Boulder Valley Ranch
description:
The Eagle (2.6 mile from Mesa Reservoir to Eagle Trailhead) and Sage Trails (1.8 mile [2.7 for whole Sage/Eagle Loop]) form a loop between this trailhead and the Eagle Trailhead. Heading southward on the Sage Trail you can either take this loop or head westward on the Cobalt Trail below an old smelter of 1930s to 1940s vintage and connect to the Eagle Trail as it heads toward the Foothills Trailhead. <br />
Another option is to pass the Cobalt Trail (0.9 mile) and take the Eagle Trail as it turns up toward the now dry Mesa Reservoir. A loop hike is available in the Mesa Reservoir area by following the Hidden Valley (1.0 mile) and Mesa Reservoir Trails (0.8 mile).

name: Blendon Woods
description: Great hiking trails.

name: Three Forks Loop
description: Three Forks Loop features 16 miles of hiking trails near Spanish Fork, UT.

name: Twin Arch Reserve
description: Twin Arch Reserve sits along the Great Miami River and is a great place for hiking, biking, fishing, kayaking, canoeing and viewing wildlife.  A highlight of the park is the renovated, historic Miami-Erie Canal Twin Arches.  The arches were originally built in 1837 and are one of only two structures of its type in Ohio.  The park includes a five acre pond, with fishing access. The fishing is catch and release and a state fishing license is not required, however if you choose to fish in the river make sure you have your license handy.  If you prefer nature trails, there is nearly one mile that winds through the park and by the Natural Play Area where children can play in the woods.

name: Appalachian Trail 089: PA 94 to PA 174
description:
This section of the AT runs 8.8 miles from PA Hwy 94 to PA Hwy 174. Along the way the trail passes Sheet Iron Roof Road, Mountain Road, an unnamed road, the Alec Kennedy shelter, and it finally hits PA Hwy 174 in the town of Boiling Springs.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"Sheet Iron Roof Road" lat=40.0931256145, lon=-77.1641046656

name: McGregor Park
description: This is a nice loop trail wandering through a mature woods & past a stream.  The path is finely graveled and mostly level.

name: Kings Gap Environmental Education Center
description: Trailheads for the 16 miles of hiking trails are located at the three day use areas.

name: Crowder State Park
description: Choose from four trails of varying lengths.

name: Rangeline Nature Preserve
description: Rangeline Nature Preserve features 10 miles of hiking trails near Anderson, IN.

name: Mounds State Park
description: Six great hiking trails.

name: Valley Forge National Historical Park
description:
The park contains 19.5 miles of designated, marked, hiking trails. The 6.6 mile Joseph Plumb Martin Trail connects the key historic and interpretive sites. The Horseshoe Trail begins near Washington's Headquarters and runs to the Appalachian Trail. Other hiking trails include such footpaths as the relatively flat River and Valley Creek trails, and the hilly trails on Mount Joy and Mount Misery. In addition, hiking is permitted in most open areas of the park. While hiking in the park please keep your pets on a leash at all times.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: South Saint Vrain
description:
From County Road 96, the South Vrain Trail climbs west along South Saint Vrain Creek. In about two miles, the trail follows an old road, then turns off to the right (north) and climbs to avoid private property. At the top of this climb, the trail crosses an old road with signs to the Stapp Lakes. The Stapp Lakes are on private property with no public access.<br />
At 3.1 miles, South Saint Vrain Trail crosses the Sourdough Trail. The trail continues gently along a little ridge for another mile to an intersection with the Waldrop Trail. The trail drops down and crosses a creek before the Brainard Lake Cutoff Trail forks left (south). The South Saint Vrain Trail crosses a meadow to reach the Mitchell Lake Trailhead spur road north of Brainard Lake.

name: Greenville Falls State Scenic River Area
description: Short hiking trail.

name: Valley Forge Park River Trail
description: Valley Forge Park River Trail features 8 miles of hiking trails near Audubon, PA.

name: CDT CO35: Monarch Lake to Grand Lake
description: Section 35 of the CDT in Colorado runs 14.2 miles from Monarch Lake to Grand Lake. Along the way, the trail enters Rocky Mountain National Park and passes Lake Granby, Green Ridge, and Shadow Mountain Lake.

name: Sharon Woods
description: Great hiking/jogging trails.

name: Rock Creek Station State Recreation Area
description: Rock Creek Station Recreation Area is a 40-acre campground adjacent to the Rock Creek Station State Historical Park. Nearby Rock Creek State Historical Park's Visitor Center overlooks some 350 acres of prairie hilltops, timber-studded creek bottoms, and rugged ravines and draws. Deep ruts, carved by the many wagons that traveled the Oregon Trail, are plainly visible there. They bear mute testimony to the rich history of the area. The Pony Express Station and Wild Bill Hickok are also part of this Historical Parks History and are displayed at the Visitor Center.

name: Edward R. Madigan State Fish & Wildlife Area
description: The park offers a scenic 7-mile hiking/bicycle trail, which meanders gently through grassland, woodland and riparian habitats.

name: Fort Washington State Park
description: Fort Washington State Park is an ideal destination for people who love nature. There is hiking, biking, skiing, and fishing available for everyone to enjoy. Also, be on the lookout for migratory birds and flowering dogwoods.

name: Union Transportation Trail
description: The Union Transportation Trail is the County's second rail-trail, ideal for equestrians, hikers, walkers, joggers and bicyclists.  The first two miles of this gravel trail, opened in 2010, includes a rehabilitated historic wood trestle bridge over Lahaway Creek, which is one of the few physical remnants of the old railroad. Two parking lots and access points are available at Millstream Road, Rt. 537 and Jonathan Holmes Road.

name: Ceran Saint Vrain Loop
description: The Ceran Saint Vrain Trail is an easy trail that gradually loses elevation as it follows the South Saint Vrain Creek downstream for 1.9 miles. The trail ends at National Forest System Road 252, a rough four-wheel drive road. This road climbs 0.5 miles northwest to a four-way intersection from which it is a steep half-mile to the left up to Miller Rock. Miller Rock is a scenic high-point that offers 360-degree views.

name: Lorimer Park
description: New to the facility, a 1.8 mile section of the former Fox Chase-Newtown rail line has been converted to a recreational trail. This crushed stone path provides level hiking and biking, and views of the creek valley along the entire western edge of the park. Open daily 8 am to sunset.

name: Strawtown Koteewi Park
description: This multi-use trail for horses, bikes & hikers begins at the riverside parking lot & follows White River through a nice wooded area, then circles a prairie leading to the Taylor Center for Natural History and back to the trailhead.  There is also parking at the Taylor Center.

name: Weldon Springs State Park
description: Five trails provide excellent hiking opportunities.

name: Garbry Big Woods Sanctuary
description: This beautiful 100 acre park has almost 1 mile of a boardwalk loop trail. This park offers peaceful walking and wildlife observation. Its undisturbed wet beech maple forest is quite unique. Click on the tabs below for more information.

name: Garbry Big Woods Reserve
description: Excellent hiking trail.

name: Kickapoo State Recreation Area
description: Kickapoo features 10 miles of hiking trails near Oakwood, IL.

name: Alaire State Park
description: Alaire State Park features 0 miles of hiking trails near Howell, NJ.

name: Norristown Farm Park
description: Hiking, jogging, running, roller blading, skating, dog walking

name: Heil Valley Ranch
description:
With beautiful hanging valleys, picturesque vistas, and forest meadows that seem to cling to the sky, Heil Valley Ranch is a playground for wildlife. It only takes one visit to this 5,020-acre property to turn a sedentary person into an outdoor enthusiast.<br />
There are 5 trails located here ranging from easy to moderate with the longest trail topping out at 5.2 miles. Dogs are not allowed due to wildlife concerns.

name: Appalachian Trail 090: PA 174 (Boiling Springs) to PA 944
description:
This section of the AT runs 12.3 miles from PA Hwy 174 in Boiling Springs to PA Hwy 944. <br />
<br />
Along the way it passes PA Hwy 74, Lisborn Road, Trindle Road, Old Stonehouse Road, I-76, US Hwy 11, Bernheisel Bridge Rd., I-81, and Sherwood Drive.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spots: <br />
"Lisborn Road" lat=40.1832287546, lon=-77.1115160597<br />
"Trindle Road" lat=40.1950482607, lon=-77.1083223753<br />
"Sherwood Drive" lat=40.2738983526, lon=-77.0994747247

name: Crosswicks Creek Greenway
description: Crosswicks Creek begins near Fort Dix in Burlington County, travels up the northeast corner of Ocean County, meanders 7 miles in Monmouth County, becomes the dividing line between Burlington and Mercer Counties and finally empties into the Delaware River.

name: Highhbanks Metropark
description: Excellent walking/jogging trail.

name: Glacier Ridge
description: Excellent trails.

name: Clayton Park
description: The forested, hilly trails of this park have become a popular destination for hikers, equestrians, and bicyclists. Enter from Emley's Hill Road ( 6 miles of trails).

name: Idlewood
description: Idlewood features 5 miles of hiking trails near Langhorne, PA.

name: Clayton Park
description: Clayton Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Allentown, NJ.

name: Allaire State Park
description: A network of trails winds through the park providing opportunities for hikers, mountain bikers and horseback riders. Several moderate hiking trails are in the main day use area of the park, accessible from the main parking area. The "South Side" area of the park is approximately 800 acres of varying terrain and has miles of unmarked trails as well as four primary marked multi-use trails. The South Side trails are accessible from a trail head at a large gravel parking lot located on Hospital Road.

name: Maple Ridge Reserve
description: Maple Ridge Reserve, located along the Scenic Stillwater River, has very unique topography.  Rolling hills stretch from the upland prairie through the woodland ravines and on to the Stillwater River.   Included on the property are woods that cover 70% of the land as mature woods and successional fields, including a sugar maple grove and sugar camp.  This large stand of mature maple trees provides sap for the on-site educational maple sugaring operation.

name: Stillwater Prairie Reserve
description: A circular hiking trail passes through fields, woodlands, marshy habitats and shrub lands.  Segments of the main trail follow along the river.

name: Upper Schuylkill Valley Park
description: The Schuylkill River in Upper Providence Township forms a natural backdrop to this 15-acre display of wild animals and raptors indigenous to Pennsylvania. Picnicking and fishing are popular along the river, and a short, scenic hike will lead you to the Schuylkill Canal Park in Mont Clare.

name: Evansburg State Park
description: Evansburg State Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Collegeville, PA.

name: St. Vrain State Park
description: Flat, easy trails make a leisurely stroll around the park a comfortable experience. There are three trails in the park that are named for the pond that each trail encircles. They are Pelican pond, Bald Eagle pond and Coot pond trails. Muskrat Run Trail also is 1 mile in length and encircles Sandpiper Pond.

name: Manasquan Reservoir
description: The 5.1 mile gravel Perimeter Trail offers panoramic views of the Reservoir and provides a great trail experience for all users.  This trail loops all the way around the reservoir and has a fairly even, well-maintained surface and is designated as a MODERATE trail due to its length. Mileposts are marked on the trail. An additional 1.1 mile Cove Trail is a scenic nature trail which explores the lakeshore around the Environmental Center and is open to pedestrains only.

name: Goode Prairie Preserve
description: Leisurely half-mile trail.

name: Linn Run State Park
description: Many of Linn Run's hiking trails connect to many miles of trails in Forbes State Forest.

name: Playwicki Park
description: Playgrounds, picnicking, hiking, fishing.

name: Kiser Lake State Park
description:
Kiser Lake State Park offers a relaxing atmosphere on 531 acres of rolling wooded hills and wetlands. The park is set on the scenic 396-acre Kiser Lake. Boating, fishing, hiking, picnicking, swimming, hunting, camping and winter sports are all popular at this diverse park.
The park offers five hiking trails that equal about 3.5 to 4 miles when combined and range from easy to moderate in level of difficulty.

name: Core Creek Park
description: Core Creek Park is a 5 mile hiking trail in Langhorne, Pennsylvania.

name: Middle Fork State Fish & Wildlife Area
description: There are 35 miles of marked scenic equestrian, cross-country skiing and snowmobiling trails in the Middle Fork State Fish & Wildlife Area, and 9 miles of designated hiking trails are available at nearby Kickapoo State Park. All marked trails are accessible from the parking lot near the office at 2400N, just off Road 900E.

name: French Creek State Park
description: There are 9 trials to choose from in the French Creek State Park. The smallest is the Kalmia Trail measuring in at one mile and the longest is the Horse-shoe trail measuring in at eight miles.

name: Turkey Swamp Park
description: Multi-use and fitness trails traverse the park which is located at the northern end of the NJ Pine Barrens. Turkey Swamp's terrain is relatively level and the 17 acre lake adds scenic interest.

name: Thousand Hills State Park
description:
The Forest Lake is located in Thousand Hills State Park and provides recreational opportunities such as fishing, swimming and boating, among others. Hiking, mountain biking, wildlife observing and camping are also offered at the park. Petroglyphs are also left in the park from over 1,500 years ago-- the park provides interpretive programs to explain these.

The park offers three trails that can be used for hiking that equal 12 miles when combined.

name: Hopewell Furnace National Historic Site
description:
Walk the many miles of blazed trails and historic roadways that travel through Hopewell and neighboring French Creek State Park.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Calypso Cascades
description: This trail follows a raging stream for 1.8 miles up to the Calypso Cascades waterfall. It is a fairly easy hike gaining 700 ft in elevation. After just 0.3 miles you will meet up with Copeland Falls. Watch the water for long enough and you might see the water ouzel or the American dipper bird.  Along the way you'll be shaded by lots of pine and aspen. This is a nice hike with the relaxing sound of rushing water every step of the way.

name: Hall Ranch
description:
Just west of the town of Lyons, you'll find the rolling grasslands and sandstone buttes of Hall Ranch. The over 3,000 acres of open space provides excellent viewing opportunities for wildflowers, animals, and scenic landscapes. <br />
There are 5 trails ranging from moderate to difficult with the longest trail topping out at 4.7 miles. Dogs are not allowed due to wildlife concerns.

name: Jenny Jump State Forest
description: Eleven miles of hiking trails and three miles of hiking /mountain bike trails offer magnificent views of the mountains and scenic Mountain Lake. The Summit Trail, at an elevation of 1,090 feet, offers a view of the Delaware Water Gap and the Pequest Valley.

name: Alum Creek State Park
description: 2 hiking trails

name: Alum Creek Lake
description: Excellent hiking and interpretive trails.

name: Tyler State Park
description: Hikers are permitted on all trails. Gravel hiking trails to the east of Neshaminy Creek link each picnic area. If you want a longer hike, cross over Neshaminy Creek to the west side of the park via the causeway at the center of the park. There you will find most of the park's bicycle and equestrian trails.

name: Adams Falls
description: Located at the East Inlet Trailhead. The trail is only 0.3 miles one way to the falls. There are quite a few steps throughout the trail but I would consider it pretty easy overall. After a short while you will get to a lookout point just above Adams Falls. The sound of the roaring waterfall contrasts the silence of the area. If you walk a little further past the falls you will come to a big grassy area where moose and elk like to hang out.

name: Alum Creek Phase Ii
description: Alum Creek Phase II features 6 miles of hiking trails near Lewis Center, OH.

name: CDT CO36: Grand Lake to Bowen Gulch
description: Section 36 of the CDT in Colorado runs a length 28.2 miles from Grand Lake to Bowen Gulch. Note: there is also a possible shortcut to shorten this section. Along the way, the trail passes Green Mountain, Mount Patterson, Taylor Peak, The Sharkstooth, Otis Peak, Hallett Peak, Joe Mills Mountain, Sprague Mountain, Nakai Peak, and US Hwy 34.

name: Round Hill Park
description: At Round Hill Park in Elizabeth township in the southeast corner of the county there is a modern working farm that supplements the park itself. The exhibit farm is open every day of the year and affords tens of thousands of school students on field trips, and daily visitors, an interpretive program that revolves around the farm, and the water and food cycles of life. The 17 picnic groves reflect the life of a farm with names like Alfalfa, Timothy, Wagon Wheel and Quiet Acres.

name: Central Perkiomen Valley Park
description: Central Perkiomen Valley Park headquarters on Plank Road is situated along the scenic Perkiomen Creek in the center of Montgomery County. This 800-acre park extends over 10 municipalities, offering a wide variety of family activities. Visitors can enjoy a children's playground as well as vistas of the Perkiomen Creek while fishing. Picnic tables and grills are available throughout the park's picnic grove. There is one large pavilion available by reservation for large groups. Nearby are recreational offerings of volleyball, shuffleboard and restroom facilities. For special occasions, the Park's Old Mill House is available by reservation. Visitors can walk, jog, bike or horseback ride on over 19 miles of the Perkiomen Trail winding along the Perkiomen Creek. Central Perkiomen Valley Park is an alcohol free park. Park Hours are from 6:00 a.m. - sunset, daily.

name: Perrineville Lake Park
description: In addition to access to the lake, there are two trails. The Lakeside Loop is a 1.5 mile multi-use trail on Agress Road. The Pine Creek Trail is a 1 mile unpaved multi-use trail on Baird Road.

name: Governor Dick
description: Governor Dick features 9 miles of hiking trails near Mount Gretna, PA.

name: Rabbit Mountain Loop
description: Whether hoping to spot a large raptor in search of prey or a gorgeous view of the Continental Divide, look no further than Rabbit Mountain. Located between Lyons and Longmont, the rich cultural and natural history of Rabbit Mountain is easily accessible to bikers, hikers, and equestrians.

name: Mercer County Park
description: Mercer County Park features 6 miles of hiking trails near West Windsor, NJ.

name: Monmouth Battlefield State Park
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Big Spring State Forest Picnic Area
description: A short loop trail leads to the site of the partially completed railroad tunnel. Historic interpretation is provided at the trailhead. The park provides access to the Iron Horse Trail, designed for day hikes and overnight hiking in Tuscarora State Forest.

name: Nolde Forest Environmental Education Center
description: Nolde Forest Environmental Education Center lies in the Nolde Forest State Park. Fishing and cross-country skiing are avilable to visitors here! There are five trails here that are, for the most part, an easy hike and add up to 10 miles all in all.

name: Fowlers Hollow State Park
description: On the edge of Tuscarora State Forest lies Fowlers Hollow State Park at the intersection of several multi-use trails. The hiking trails here stretch for miles into the Tuscarora State Forest.

name: Blue Knob State Park
description: Please be sure to wear appropriate foot wear when hiking at Blue Knob State Park. Trails are closed for nighttime use. When you go down, you must climb up to return. A well planned hiking trip utilizes different trails to provide an extended hiking experience that covers many miles and avoids a steep return climb.

name: Appalachian Trail 091: PA 944 to Clarks Ferry Bridge
description:
The AT runs 14.6 miles from PA Hwy 944 to the Clarks Ferry Bridge. Along the way it passes the Darlington shelter, Millers Gap Rd., PA Hwy 850, Cove Mountain, Cove Mountain shelter, US Hwy 11/PA Hwy 274, and the town of Duncannon.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"PA 850" lat=40.3217637152, lon=-77.0781507863

name: Colonel Denning State Park
description:
The 2.5-mile Flat Rock Trail rises to Flat Rock, a beautiful scenic vista of the Cumberland Valley. The one-mile, self-guiding Doubling Gap Trail is a moderate hike. The Hiking and Nature Trail Guide is available at the park office and has a map and detailed description of the hiking trails in the park and surrounding forest lands.

In addition to the 18 miles of hiking trails, the park is a trailhead for the 105-mile Tuscarora Trail.

name: Stagecoach State Park
description:
Stagecoach is part of the actual trail used by the stage line between Grand Junction and Grand Valley. This trail will take you through DeBeque Canyon and along the Colorado River, highlighting some stunning views!<br />
The trail can get pretty rough and rocky in parts, but the views make it all worth it!

name: Lion Gulch
description: The trail drops abruptly from the trailhead then begins a three mile climb along a stream in Lion Gulch. It provides access to the historic area known as Homestead Meadows where eight homesteads were established between 1889 and 1923. Information boards provide background stories at each location. Hiking to all the homesteads adds another 2.8 miles. See Homestead Meadows Trail. Lion Gulch trailhead accommodates approximately 35 vehicles.

name: Humboldt Redwoods State Park
description: The following hikes are mostly on level ground on well-maintained trails. With over 100 miles of trails available to hikers there is something for everyone. Whether you are interested in a short, level stroll through the lush forest or a multi-day, strenuous adventure, Humboldt Redwoods has what you're looking for.

name: Lily Lake
description: Lily Lake Trail is a wide, easy graveled trail that circles Lily Lake. It is only 1 mile long and is perfect for strollers, wheelchairs, and people who aren't in the mood for a strenuous hike. If you want something a little more adventurous, add the Lily Ridge trail in, which branches off of the Lily Lake trail, climbs up along the ridge, and then drops back down to the lake. The Lily Mountain trail also starts nearby, for a true mountain hike.

name: Alberta Falls
description: This is a pretty easy trail accessed from the Glacier Gorge Trailhead with only a 160 ft elevation gain. You'll hike for 0.9 miles one way alongside Glacier Creek, through a forest. After crossing several bridges over the creek you'll be at the rushing waters of Alberta Falls.

name: Washington Crossing State Park
description: There are 15 miles of moderate trails to enjoy throughout Washington Crossing State Park. These trails are not ADA accessible.

name: Peace Valley Park
description: Peace Valley Park offers a nature center, playgrounds, picnicking, hiking, boating, fishing and special events.

name: Baldpate Mountain
description: Baldpate Mountain features 10 miles of hiking trails near Lambertville, NJ.

name: Bierstadt Lake
description: The trail starts out in a forest of aspens. You then pop out at the bottom of a very tall moraine. The trail zig zags up the moraine, ascending 1.4 miles. Views of the mountains are all around. You'll then be in a forest again and the lake is straight ahead. There's also a trail that goes all the way around the lake and through the trees.

name: Trough Creek State Park
description: The trails traverse scenic vistas, cool stream hollows, hillsides and ridge tops. A popular short hike crosses the suspension bridge and follows Rhododendron Trail to Rainbow Falls. Climb the steps along the waterfall, then hike on to Balanced Rock and return the same way.

name: Trail around Bierstadt Lake
description: Trail goes through a forest of aspen trees around Bierstadt Lake.

name: South Fork of the Provo
description: South Fork of the Provo features 4 miles of hiking trails near Provo, UT.

name: Long Branch State Park
description: Three hiking trails allow you to explore the park.

name: CDT CO37: Bowen Gulch to Willow Creek Pass
description: The CDT runs for 19.7 miles from Bownen Gulch to Willow Creek Pass on Hwy 125. Along the way the trail passes the Colorado River, Bowen Creek, Ruby Mountain, Cascade Mountain, and Radial Mountain.

name: Princeton Battlefield State Park
description: Adjacent to the park, the Institute Woods is comprised of a 588 acre mixed hardwood, wetlands and agricultural land with a variety of trails. Most trails are level to slightly graded. There are no specific ADA trails but many level trails.

name: Green Lane Park
description: Green Lane Park, in northwestern Montgomery County, offers a variety of year-round, outdoor activities and programs for people to choose from. Park visitors can enjoy fishing, boating (including boat rentals), family and group camping, picnicking, 25 miles of trails for horseback riding, mountain biking and hiking, as well as two children's playgrounds. Winter enthusiasts can cross-country ski, ice fish or go ice skating. The park also offers summer concerts and movies, and family-oriented, environmental education programs on weekends.  Park Hours are 6:00 am-sunset, daily.

name: CDT CO39: Troublesome Pass to FR104
description: The CDT runs 11.4 miles from Troublesome Pass to FR104. Along the way, the trail passes Poison Ridge, Sheep Mountain, and Hyannis Peak.

name: Thompson Park Conservation Area
description: The Thompson Park Conservation Area offers passive activities such as hiking, walking, bird watching and photography. With nearly 9 miles of trails in the area, hikers can enjoy a short stroll or string together a longer hike. The Gravel Hill Trail is accessed from the parking area at the Monroe Township Soccer Complex on Prospect Plains Road.   Alternatively, hikers can park in Thompson Park and connect to the Gravel Hill Trail just south of Schoolhouse Road. Parking and portable restrooms are available at both trailheads.

name: Big Brook Park
description: Big Brook Park is a mosaic of habitats, the most significant of which is the extensive grassland covering the rolling landscape. Many field edges are mowed, providing additional unmarked trail experiences.

name: White Oak Park
description: Several walking/hiking/jogging trails.

name: CDT CO40: FR104 to Rabbit Ears Pass
description: The CDT runs just under 30 miles from Forest Road 104 to US Hwy 40. Along the way, the trail passes Little Haystack Mountain, Dennis Hump, North Ryder Peak, Ironclad Mountain, Hwy 14, Mexican Ridge South, Diamond Mountain, US Hwy 40, and Baker Mountain.

name: Tappan Lake
description: At the Corps Tappan Lake extensive recreation facilities are operated by the Muskingum Watershed Conservancy District. Visit their website at: www.mwcdlakes,com. Golden Age and Golden Access and other Federal recreation passports are not honored by MWCD. Tappan Lake is near a restored Indian village at Shoenbrunn State Park and the outdoor historical drama, "Trumpet in the Land."

name: Airfield
description: Airfield features 2 miles of hiking trails near Reading, PA.

name: Coyote Valley
description: This is a half mile one-way trail and is completely wheelchair accessible. It's a very easy, kid-friendly hike with no change in elevation. The path starts out at the Colorado River and winds through a big meadow following the river with interpretive signs and benches along the way. Elk are often seem grazing out in the meadow.

name: CDT CO38: Willow Creek Pass to Troublesome Pass
description: Section 38 of the CDT in Colorado runs 11.6 miles from Willow Creek Pass on Hwy 125 to Troublesome Pass. Along the way, the trail passes Haystack Mountain.

name: Peavine Ridge
description: Peavine Ridge features 12 miles of hiking trails near Garberville, CA.

name: Peavine Ridge
description: Peavine Ridge features 12 miles of hiking trails near Garberville, CA.

name: Peavine Ridge
description: Peavine Ridge features 12 miles of hiking trails near Garberville, CA.

name: Mohawk Dam
description: Nice trails throughout the area.

name: Boyd Big Tree Preserve Conservation Area
description: The Boyd Big Tree Preserve Conservation Area boasts an extensive trail system. With its variety of trails it is sure to please almost any level of hiking enthusiast.

name: Delaware and Raritan Canal State Park
description: The historic towpath found along the feeder and main canal is suitable for hiking, jogging and biking. Horseback riding is permitted on the main canal only. Motorized vehicles or ATV's are not permitted on trails in the park. In addition to the canal trail, patrons can access trails at the Six Mile Run Reservoir Site, Kingston greenway and Cook Natural Area Trails from the park office located in Kingston as well as one trail found within the Bull's Island Natural Area.

name: Cub Lake
description: This trail is 2.3 miles one way to Cub Lake. With an elevation gain of only 540 ft it's a great introductory hike to the park. You'll first cross a bridge over a river, then meander along on a dirt path with lots of pines and aspens on either side. There are beautiful streams and ponds along the way and cascading cliffs overhead. Once you get to Cub Lake you can then either turn around and go back or continue on to Fern Lake.

name: Bridge To Bridge - D&r Canal
description: Bridge To Bridge - D&r Canal features 7 miles of hiking trails near Lambertville, NJ.

name: Rocky Mountain National Park
description:
Rocky Mountain National Park has 355 miles of hiking trails. They range from flat lakeside strolls to steep mountain peak climbs. <br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Holmdel Park
description: Walking trails wind through the shady woods and rolling hills. There is a fitness trail too. The rolling terrain will challenge some hikers. Cyclists and equestrians are asked to use the trails in the Ramenessin section but must remain on the roads in the Northern portion in this popular park. Enter from Longstreet Road. (9.49 miles of trails)

name: Keystone State Park
description: The six miles of trails are open year-round for hiking, cross-country skiing and snowshoeing. All trails are rated from easy to moderate with parking available at most of the trailheads. All trails are foot traffic only, except for Lakeside Trail, which is open to bikes.

name: Lake Loramie State Park
description: Lake Loramie State Park is on one of the original canal feeder lakes. The 407-acre state park is a great retreat location for urbanites. Swimming, hiking, camping, boating, fishing, picnicking and hunting are common activities here. The park offers five hiking trails that equal eight miles in length when combined. The majority of them are easy in difficulty but one is moderate.

name: Heathcote Meadows Preserve
description: In 1998, the Heathcote Meadows Preserve was one of the earliest parcels acquired under the Middlesex County Space Recreation and Farmland and Historic Preservation Act.  Nestled just outside the small village of Kingston, the preserve offers a glimpse into the rich farming history of the area.  Combined with Heathcote Park (South Brunswick Township), the Cook Natural Area, Mapleton Preserve and the Delaware & Raritan Canal State Park, the preserve creates a significant green-belt around the village of Kingston, provides stream protection for Heathcote Brook and Carter Brook and provides wonderful opportunities for hiking, walking and wildlife viewing.

name: Jamesburg Park Conservation Area
description: There are many old, unmarked trails.  For your safety-please stay on the marked trails.

name: Raystown Lake
description: Great hiking.

name: Jackson Lake State Park
description: Prairie Wetland Nature Trail is a 1/4 mile, self-guided trail and is located north of Cove Campground. There is also a 1.5 mile trail located between the Visitor Center north to Northview Campground. A trail is also located on the south side of the park from the south swimbeach to Cottonwood day-use picnic area. Folks also enjoy walking along the shoreline or along park roadways.

name: Blue Marsh Lake
description: Blue Marsh features 30 miles of hiking trails near Reading, PA.

name: Delaware State Park
description: 5 hiking trails connect the lakeshore with each of the four camping areas, transecting meadows, woodlands and wetlands

name: Appalachian Trail 092: Clarks Ferry Bridge (Duncannon) to PA 325
description:
Section 92 of the AT runs 16.7 miles from Clarks Ferry Bridge in Duncannon to PA Hwy 325. Along the way the trail passes Clarks Ferry shelter, PA Hwy 225, and the Peters Mountain shelter.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"PA 225" lat=40.4119472696, lon=-76.9300555452

name: CDT CO41: Rabbit Ears Pass to Buffalo Pass
description:
The CDT runs 15.3 miles from Rabbit Ears Pass near US Hwy 40 to Buffalo Pass. Along the way, the trail passes Dumont Lake and several other high-alpine lakes. The Mountain View trail spurs off of this trail, and it offers some gorgeous views of the surrounding mountains and down into the valley with Steamboat Springs below.<br />
Much of this section of the CDT trail runs through gorgeous high-alpine meadows, which are just full of beautiful wild flowers!

name: Hartshorne Woods Park
description: Hartshorne Woods Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Red Bank, NJ.

name: Allegrippis Trails
description: Allegrippis Trails features 30 miles of hiking trails near Raystown Lake, PA.

name: Bizz Johnson
description: Bizz Johnson features 35 miles of hiking trails near Susanville, CA.

name: Devils Backbone
description: This trail goes on for at least 8 miles, and eventually connects up with several other trails in the area, but you only have to hike a mile or two to reach the Devil's Backbone. The Backbone is a line of rocks sticking out of the ground that looks like a bony spine. You've got to see this in person!

name: Sand Ridge State Forest
description:
The largest of all the state forests in Illinois, Sand Ridge State Forest has over 7,200 acres of native oak-hickory hardwoods and pines. Sand Ridge supports diverse flora and fauna as well as offering a wide variety of recreational opportunities including camping, hunting, hiking, horseback riding, snowmobiling, bird watching and picnicking. Over 50 miles of marked trails run through the rolling sandy terrain waiting to be explored.

The park offers 44 miles of trails, ranging from 1.5-15 miles each and varied in level of difficulty. Backpackers are welcome. Phone (309) 597-2212

name: Blue Sky
description:
Blue Sky is a beautiful trail which connects the Horsetooth Mountain Park, Coyote Ridge, and Devil's Backbone trail systems. Hike through a desert environment with some meadows and prairies interspersed. This is a great place to go for a quiet, secluded hike. Watch out for rattlesnakes, though!<br />
This is a multi-use trail so please practice trail etiquette.

name: Moraine View State Recreation Area
description:
This 1,687-acre park is accented by ridges left by glacial movement that are now dotted with scattered groves of hardwood trees. A beautiful 158-acre lake serves as a convenient area for relaxing and enjoying water sports. It offers year-round recreational opportunities from its location east of Bloomington-Normal and near Le Roy: Kickapoo and Potawatomi tribes lived here when settlers first came to the area. This facility has a concession stand with both indoor and patio seating, and also serves as a check station for permit pheasant hunters in the fall. The park is complete with facilities for picnicking, camping, hiking, swimming, fishing, boating, horseback riding and hunting.

A variety of hiking opportunities are offered at the Moraine View State Park including the half-mile Tanglewood Nature Trail which winds around the lake in the forest and with guide you to an area where you can view a beaver dam and lodge. The Tall Timber Trail is 1.5-miles of hiking over moderate terrain, complete with primitive camp sites. The Timber Point Trail is handicap accessible and it is a .5-mile trail through the woods. The park also offers 10 miles of equestrian trails that can also be used for hiking.

name: Tundra Communities
description:
This trail is located just before hitting the highest point on the road.<br />
It's a 0.5 mile one way hike up a gentle incline on a paved path. Here you are in the tundra, high above the treeline. It takes the plants in this area a long time to grow so you are urged to stay on the designated path. This is such a rare environment for the United States. Winds can reach up to 100 mph and temperatures are frigid for almost half the year. All you can see from here is frozen tundra.<br />
There is a vault toilet accessible at the trailhead.

name: Deer Creek State Park
description: Deer Creek State Park is one of the finest year-round fishing spots in all of Utah. There are many different kinds of fish here and it is sure to not disappoint fisherman. Other activities here include boating, swimming, hiking, mountain biking and camping.

name: Deer Creek State Park
description: 7 hiking only trails

name: Bizz Johnson Trail
description: The trail has four distinct seasons because of the high elevation location.  The trail begins at 4200' on the east side of the Sierra and Cascade Ranges in Susanville, climbs 1300' to a high point of 5500' at Westwood Junction then drops 400' to its terminus in Westwood at elevation 5100'.  Check current conditions before planning a trip on the trail by calling (530) 257-0456.

name: Clarence J. Brown Dam and Reservoir
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Ohio & Erie Canal Reservation
description: Excellent trails.

name: Round Mountain Summit Trail
description: Moderate to difficult hike mainly due to the uphill nature and the length.  This trail has some of the best viewpoints in the area.  It's variety of terrain keeps interesting the entire way.  There are a few camp spots.  One located approx. 2 miles up the trail.  The other couple are located at the top, 4.75miles.  Watch out for the afternoon thunderstorms that go hand in hand with the local climate during the peak seasons.

name: Round Mountain Foothills Nature Trail
description:
As you stroll up the road to the overlook, you will discover Ponderosa Lane. The Ponderosa Pine is the most common tree in this area. In the plains below, few plants grow higher than the grasses and sagebrush, and spruces and firs take over in the Montane Life Zone at higher elevations. <br />
To take this trail, there is a split in the main trail shortly after leaving the parking lot (about a 1/4 mile in) which allows you to continue on with the Foothills Nature Trail or instead go on to the summit of Sheep Mountain on the Round Mountain National Recreational Trail - Summit Adventure Trail portion, which is much more difficult and is rated as a Moderate difficulty level.

name: Nockamixon State Park
description: Nockamixon State Park is a 5,286-acre park that contains the 1,450-acre Nockamixon lake. The park has hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, swimming, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing, sledding and cabins to stay for peopleto enjoy! There are six trails here that add up to 35 miles ranging from easy to difficult.

name: Murdock Park Trail
description: Murdock Park Trail is a 4 mile hiking trail in Lafayette, Indiana.

name: Ireland Brook Conservation Area
description: Great hiking.

name: Memorial Lake State Park
description: Memorial Lake State Park is 230 acres and lies near the base of Blue Mountain. This park has hiking, boating, fishing and cross-country skiing for visitors to partake in. There are 2 miles of trails in all that are fairly easy hiking. They offer scenic views of the lake especially during the spring and autumn months.

name: Box Canyon Trail
description: Short pleasant hike along a dry stream bed to a small box canyon. Interpretative trail with occasional signs that give local natural and cultural information.

name: Tamarack Hollow Preserve
description: The Tamarack Hollow Preserve was saved through the cooperative efforts of the Middlesex County Board of Chosen Freeholders and the Township of East Brunswick in August of 2007.   The 232-acre tract had been approved for 57 single family homes and a sewerage treatment facility that could have discharged up to 16,800 gallons of treated wastewater per day into local streams.

name: Iliniwek Village State Historic Site
description: Follow Oxbow Trail to explore the historic site.

name: Boyd Lake State Park
description: Hikers enjoy the paved and gravel trails beside the beaches, and under the shade of cottonwood trees next to the water's edge. Boyd Lake's trail is a segment of the City of Loveland's recreation trail system.

name: Settlers Cabin Park
description: Great trails.

name: Ralph Stover State Park
description: The easy walking trails pass through many habitats and pass near the millrace.

name: Tohickon Valley Park
description: Most of the current trails, used mainly for mountain biking and hiking were on logging roads. Oak, Hickory, Tulip Popular, Hemlock and White Pines were used extensively. The Tulip Poplar is the most colorful with greenish, orange flowers and maple-shaped leaves. Look for these blooms in middle to late spring. They are usually the straightest and tallest trees in the forest.

name: Loyalhanna Lake
description: Miscellaneous trails in the area.

name: Dinosaur National Monument
description:
Hiking in Dinosaur is an excellent way to appreciate the park's scenery and rugged landscape. The most popular trails begin near the visitor centers and the two paved tour roads. Other trails begin at more remote locations.<br />
There are 4 trails total, on the Colorado side of the park, with the trails ranging from 1/4 mile with wheel chair accessibility to 5 miles of rugged hiking.

name: Fossil Discovery Trail
description: Short hike through some of the best views of dinosaur artifacts in the park.  The trail is accessed by bus, which leaves from the temporary visitor center and drops you off at the site of the previous visitor center.  The trails winds down hill through the canyon and back to the temporary visitor center.  Most times there are rangers along the trail to point out some of the more interesting points like exposed dinosaur bones.

name: Cheesequake State Park
description: There are five designated trails at the park. The Red, Yellow, Green and Blue pathways are for hiking and walking use. The White Trail (multi-use) is designated for hiking and mountain biking. Trail lengths range from 1.5 to 3.5 miles. Trail difficulty ranges from easy to moderate with inclines.

name: High Rocks
description: High Rocks features 10 miles of hiking trails near Tinicum, PA.

name: Spring Lake State Fish & Wildlife Area
description: Hikers can enjoy five trails within the park. The Stage Coach Road hiking trail is 2 1/2 miles long, Deer Run hiking trail is 1/2 mile long, and the Whispering Pine hiking trail is divided into three separate trails of 1/2, 1 1/2 miles, and 2 1/2 miles.

name: Timpanogos Cave National Monument
description:
Whether for a cave tour, an evening program, a picnic, or just to hike or walk, Timpanogos Cave National Monument is a wonderful place to visit. Located only a few miles up American Fork Canyon, with it spectacular canyon views, crystal clear mountain river, and beautiful trees and flowers, it is an oasis away from the populated Wasatch Front.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Argyle Lake State Park
description: The 5 miles of foot trails provide unparalleled scenic enjoyment. Most of the 12 trails are classified as difficult to very difficult, but Blackberry and Pitch Pine trails are rated as moderate. Be sure to look for the beaver dams along Shore Trail, as well as some of the more than 200 bird species that call Argyle Lake home.

name: Little Buffalo State Park
description: Sturdy footwear is recommended because of rocky footing on some of the trails.

name: Joseph E. Ibberson Conservation Area
description: The trails of the park travel through forests, up and down hills.

name: Appalachian Trail 093: PA 325 to Swatara Gap (PA 72)
description: The Appalachian Trail runs 17.4 miles between PA Hwy 325 and Swatara Gap (PA Hwy 72). Along the way it passes the Rausch Gap shelter and Rausch Gap.

name: Bavington
description: Bavington features 13 miles of hiking trails near Pittsburgh, PA.

name: Zig Zag
description:
Zig Zag is a 5 mile out-and-back trail at Steamboat Ski Resort. Enjoy a mix of singletrack, doubletrack, and gravel road, which winds up the mountain over rolling hills and along switchbacks. Hike through thick forests, but when the forests break you'll enjoy stunning scenery of the surrounding area. <br />
This is a multi-use trail, so please share the trail.

name: Little Red Mountain Trail
description: The hikers head north up the slick rock where the views of Vernal are stunning. The hiking trail is approximately 1.5 miles in length and is suitable for intermediate hikers. The hike is best done in the spring/summer/fall, but please avoid the trail system when it is wet to prevent damage.

name: Crosier Mountain
description:
Nice trail winding through the deep forests of Drake, Colorado. Hike through beautiful meadows, where you're likely to see some elk grazing, or head to the summit for some stunning views of the surrounding area.<br />
These trails are multi-use so please keep an eye out for mountain bikers and practice trail etiquette.

name: Allegheny Portage Railroad National Historic Site
description:
The Bridge can be enjoyed close up by hiking down the trail or driving to the traffic island on which it is preserved. In the area surrounding the Engine House are places for demonstrations of period work skills.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Boyce Park
description: Boyce Park features 20 miles of hiking trails near Pittsburgh, PA.

name: Conemaugh River Lake
description: Conemaugh River Lake has an unusual endowment of cultural resources which works to attract visitors to this Pennsylvanian park. This is a popular destination for all ages as there is hiking and plenty of picnic space to enjoy all day long!

name: Jefferson Lake State Park
description: Campground Hikers Trail å¥ 2 Miles å¥ Moderate

name: Sourland Mountain Preserve
description: Sourland Mountain Preserve features 10 miles of hiking trails near Hillsborough, NJ.

name: Six Mile Run
description: Six Mile Run  features 15 miles of hiking trails near Franklin Township, NJ.

name: Yellow Fork Canyon
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Bear Creek Mountain Resort & Conference Center
description: Bear Creek Mountain Resort & Conference Center features 5 miles of hiking trails near Allentown, PA.

name: Amphitheater Park
description: Amphitheater Park features 4 miles of hiking trails near West Lafayette, IN.

name: Coyote Ridge
description: Coyote ridge is a nice trail that is easy to access from Fort Collins and Loveland. It offers some great views of the front range and the plains and is fairly rocky in spots.

name: Ginny Trail
description:
Ginny Trail is a 5.4 mile out-and-back hike that climbs 1,500 feet. The trail is open for hiking and mountain biking, but closed to horses. This hike takes you through a major burn area, which provides stunning views of the surrounding area for you!<br />
This is a multi-use trail so please share the path with mountain bikers.

name: Appalachian Trail 094: Swatara Gap to PA 183
description: This section of the AT runs 20.7 miles from Swatara Gap to PA Hwy 183. Along the way the trail passes PA Hwy 72, I-81, Little Mountain, the William Penn shelter, PA Hwy 645, PA Hwy 501, the 501 shelter, and Summer Hill.

name: Emerald Mountain
description: Emerald Mountain is a 40 mile hiking trail in Steamboat Springs, Colorado.

name: Lake Towhee Park
description: A beautiful park with playgrounds, picnic facilities, ball field, nature area & interpretive programs.

name: Nockamixon State Park
description: Nockamixon State Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Ottsville, PA.

name: Spring Creek Trail
description:
The Spring Creek Trail is a 5.2 mile, multi-use trail that is popular for hiking and biking with residents and visitors of Steamboat. The trail becomes a classic single track on City of Steamboat Springs property for the next 1.5 miles, climbing gently along the creek. The last 1.4 miles of the trail continues to climb in the Routt National Forest to the end of the trail at Dry Lake Campground, off of RCR # 38, Buffalo Pass Road.<br />
Please share the trail.

name: Canoe Creek State Park
description:
The trails explore forests, fields, wetlands, shrubby areas, historic areas and the lakeshore. Brochures on wildlife and geocaching opportunities can be obtained at the education center or the park office.

Hikers should be prepared for trail conditions and dress for the terrain and weather. Please wear fluorescent orange when hiking during hunting seasons.

name: Yampa River State Park
description: At the Headquarters Campground, walkers can enjoy a mile of nature trail to work the kinks out from the long day's drive. The primary hiking opportunity is at many of the river access sites along the river. Hiking in the area is primarily on BLM lands and offers a diverse experience for all levels and interests. With the high-desert environment, your hikes can offer some of the most scenic views found anywhere. Areas like Duffy Mt., Juniper Canyon and Cross Mountain have some excellent hiking territory.

name: Swatara State Park
description: Swatara State Park features 7 miles of hiking trails near Hershey, PA.

name: Tinicum Park
description: The barn at Tinicum Park is available to rent for many occasions.  The wooded park atmosphere provides the perfect setting for wedding pictures, reunions or parties; located in Erwinna.  For further information, please call the Historic Properties Office at (215) 348-6627.

name: Spring Lake Park
description: Spring Lake Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Macomb, IL.

name: Prophetstown State Park
description: Excellent trail system.

name: Spavinaw Area at Grand Lake State Park
description: Excellent hiking area.

name: Twin Bridges Area at Grand Lake State Park
description: Great trails.

name: Disney/Little Blue Area at Grand Lake State Park
description: The park gives off-roaders easy access to the range with about five square miles of trails.

name: Snowdale Area at Grand Lake State Park
description: Great hiking.

name: Indian Lake State Park
description: Great trails.

name: Michigan Ditch
description:
Michigan Ditch is a fairly flat loop trail that follows jeep roads and fire roads into the wilderness. As you hike along you'll get excellent views of the Never Summer Mountains in Rocky Mountain National Park, and the Nokhu Crags. <br />
There are some steep drop-offs right beside the trail and there are bears and mountain lions in this area, so be careful!

name: Thunder Pass
description: Thunder Pass is a 12 mile hiking trail in Fort Collins, Colorado.

name: Corner Canyon Trail
description: Corner Canyon Trail features 5 miles of hiking trails near Draper, UT.

name: Horsetooth Mountain Park
description:
The scenic 2,711-acre Horsetooth Mountain Open Space (consisting of Culver, Soderberg, and Hughey Open Spaces) covers elevations from 5,430 to 7,255 feet. Its 29 miles of hiking, biking, and horseback riding trails connect to the Blue Sky Trail and Lory State Park trails.<br />
The outstanding Horsetooth Rock is a familiar local landmark visible from the plains. This open space is also known for Horsetooth Falls in the spring, and for tremendous Front Range views. Drinking water is available at the trailhead. Please carry enough for your hike or ride.

name: Wathen Trail
description:
Waltham Trail is a tough 12 mile trail that connects with a network of other trails. The trail traverses through the desert terrain, over bluffs, and it climbs rocky paths to keep your heart rate up. <br />
This is a multi-use trail so please share the path.

name: Raccoon Creek State Park
description: The park offers a wide variety of hiking options to meet the needs of the casual day hiker as well as the overnight backpacker looking for a challenge within a wilderness setting. Explore trails for complete trail descriptions.

name: Appalachian Trail 095: PA 183 to Port Clinton Post Office
description: This section of the Appalachian Trail runs 14.4 miles from PA Hwy 183 to the Port Clinton Post Office. Along the way it passes the Eagle's Nest shelter.

name: Wasatch Mountain State Park
description: Wasatch Mountain State Park, in beautiful Heber Valley, is Utahs most developed state park. Tucked away in the beautiful Wasatch Mountains, the park is both a summer and winter wonderland. Activities here include hiking, biking, golfing, camping, horseback riding, snowmobiling and cross-country skiing.

name: Lassen Volcanic National Park
description:
here are over 150 miles of hiking trails within the park which range in difficulty from a strenuous 5 mile round-trip hike up Lassen Peak to a gentle 1.85 mile stroll around Manzanita Lake. Backpacking is an excellent way to enjoy the lesser known areas of the park. A wilderness camping permit is required for all overnight stays in the wilderness (any area outside of a developed campground).<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Rattling Creek
description: Rattling Creek features 20 miles of hiking trails near Lykens, PA.

name: Clay Pit Ponds State Park Preserve
description: Great hiking area.

name: Nauvoo State Park
description:
When Mormons settled in the Hancock County community of Commerce City in 1839, they changed its name to Nauvoo, a Hebrew word for "pleasant land." Today, nearby Nauvoo State Park continues to live up to the name, offering a timbered nature trail, a small prairie plot and a quiet fishing lake on its 148 acres. The 13-acre lake has a mile long shoreline that is convenient for fishing. The lake is a popular boating and swimming site. The park has an annual grape festival that attracts numerous visitors-- it is rich in the Nauvoo history. In addition to these exciting activities, Nauvoo State Park is also a popular place for camping and hiking.

The main hiking trail is called Locust Lane. It is 1.5 miles of some of the park's best features. You enjoy complete views of the lake and woods, also keep an eye out for a variety of birds. A small, but beautiful loop is also available for the handicapped. There are a few more small trail that connect the picnic area to the play ground area to the dam. And one that leads to Gilligan's Island on Lake Horton.

name: Buffalo Pass To Mountain View Trail
description:
Buffalo Pass To Mountain View Trail passes through beautiful meadows along ridgelines that provide incredibly scenic views of the surrounding area. This well-marked trail winds through forests and skirts around lakes, and makes for a seriously beautiful hike.<br />
This section of the trail is multi-use so please practice trail etiquette.

name: CDT CO42: Buffalo Pass to North Lake
description: The CDT runs 20.7 miles from Buffalo Pass to North Lake. Along the way, the trail passes Mount Ethel and The Dome.

name: Mt Gilead State Park
description: 7 bridle trails that also allow hiking or running

name: Pineridge Natural Area
description:
A popular foothills natural area where visitors can enjoy city views, foothills terrain, a reservoir and beautiful forest- all close to home.<br />
There are seven miles of soft surface including a loop around Dixon Reservoir (1.8 miles). Pineridge is the southern end of the 6.8 mile Foothills Trail. The Foothills Trail connects Pineridge, Maxwell and Reservoir Ridge natural areas. Trail markers show you the way. Biking on the Foothills Trail is for the experienced cyclist- the trail is challenging.

name: Mackinaw River State Fish & Wildlife Area
description: Hiking hunting is the most common form of hiking in this region.

name: Maxwell's
description: The 1.5 mile trail at Maxwell Natural Area is part of the 6.8 mile Foothills Trail which crosses city, county, state and federal lands. The Foothills Trail connects Pineridge, Maxwell and Reservoir Ridge natural areas. Trail markers show you the way. Biking on the Foothills Trail is for the experienced cyclist- the trail is challenging.

name: Foothills Trail
description: The Foothills Trail is a 6.8 mile out-and-back earthen trail that travels along the foothills parallel to Horsetooth Reservoir from Dixon Reservoir at Pineridge Natural Area to Reservoir Ridge Natural Area and Michand Lane. This trail is on rugged terrain.

name: Flume Trail
description: Flume Trail features 20 miles of hiking trails near Vernal, UT.

name: Ringing Rocks Park
description: This park offers picnicking, hiking, nature areas & notable geological formations.

name: Elkhead State Park
description:
Elkhead State Park in the beautiful Yampa Valley of Northwest Colorado is an oasis in the high desert.<br />
This 900 acre reservoir provides endless recreational opportunities. They include, but are not limited to, boating, swimming, jet skiing, skiing, picnicking, wildlife watching, hiking, camping, meeting friends and neighbors, bird watching, biking, horseback riding hunting and fishing and many photo opportunities.<br />
Hike along one of a variety of trails that follow the lakeshore. Although many are short hikes, they can be very rewarding to the conscious viewer.

name: Roaring Run
description: Roaring Run features 20 miles of hiking trails near Apollo, PA.

name: Yellow Creek State Park
description: Laurel Run Trail is a 0.5-mile loop which starts at the park office. This easy hike is especially beautiful in the spring when wildflowers abound. Ridgetop Trail is a challenging 2-mile trail. It begins in the beach/day-use area and winds through a variety of habitats. Damsite Trail is a 2.5-mile trail that offers a view of the Yellow Creek dam. To get to this trail, follow PA 259 south from the park office. After taking a right turn at the stop sign, turn onto Hoffman Road, the second road to your right. This road ends at a small parking area where Damsite Trail begins.

name: Mad Creek/red Dirt Loop
description: Mad Creek/Red Dirt loop is an easy going 6 miles filled with stunning views of the surrounding wilderness area. There are plenty of chances to see a wide variety of wildlife on this trail, and in the wildflower season, this trail comes alive! There is some mountain bike traffic here so be sure to share the trail.

name: Hartwood Acres
description: Hartwood Acres features 20 miles of hiking trails near Pittsburgh, PA.

name: Appalachian Trail 096: Port Clinton to Blue Mountain Summit (PA 309)
description:
Section 96 of the Appalachian Trail runs a lengthy 26.7 miles from the town of Port Clinton to the Summit of Blue Mountain (PA Hwy 309).<br />
<br />
Along the way the trail passes the Windsor Furnace shelter, The Pinnacle, the Eckville Shelter, Hawk Mountain Road, and the Allentown Hiking Club shelter.

name: Cinder Cone
description: You'll start out following the Nobles Emigrant Trail with mild elevation gain. You then have the option to continue on and hike up the cinder cone volcano. It's about an 800 ft elevation gain to the top. It's very strenuous and takes a lot of strength and determination to get to the top. The volcanic rocks are very slippery and hard to climb. Round trip time is about 3 hours. That being said, if you're fit enough to make the trip, it's well worth the effort.

name: Pit River Recreation Area
description: Great area to hike.

name: Sacramento River Bend Area
description: Most attractions along the river can be reached by foot, mountain bike or horseback. Trailheads begin at Hog Lake Plateau, Iron Canyon, the Paynes Creek Recreation Area (Bass Pond), Jelly's Ferry and multiple trailheads surrounding the Paynes Creek Wetlands. The Paynes Creek Wetlands trail systems and Hog Lake Plateau allow for great springtime wildlife viewing. The Yana Trail, with trailheads at Perry Riffle and Jelly's Ferry, is a great way to explore the backcountry. Most trails are rugged and unmarked and encourage self-discovery. Please remember to close any gates behind you after you pass through.

name: Sacramento River Rail Trail
description: Following the course of Keswick Reservoir and the old rail line, the Sacramento River Rail Trail connects Redding to Shasta Dam. This trail system leads trail users from Shasta Dam all the way to the Sacramento River Trail and Sundial Bridge in central Redding. The 11-mile long trail is mostly flat with a section of rolling hills and curves near Keswick Dam Road.  The trail is open year-round to hikers, joggers, and bicyclists.Trailheads are located at Iron Mountain Road (Rock Creek Road junction), Keswick Boat Ramp, and along Keswick Dam Road. Free parking is available at all trailheads.

name: Red Fleet State Park
description: Great trails.

name: Battle of Athens State Historic Site
description: Enjoy the natural features of the historic site on one of two hiking trails.

name: North Park
description: North Park features 43 miles of hiking trails near Pittsburgh, PA.

name: Lehigh Mountain
description: Lehigh Mountain features 10 miles of hiking trails near Bethlehem, PA.

name: Lory State Park
description: From rolling valleys to mountainous hillsides, Lory State Park's 20 miles of trails rarely exceed a 12 percent grade. The variety of trails makes the park suitable for short or long hikes, mountain bikes, horseback riders and joggers. Safe drinking water and restroom facilities are not available on the trails. An adequate water supply should be carried and may be obtained near the park entrance.

name: Nine Eagles State Park
description: There are nine miles of hiking trails that wind their way through the wooded hills and valleys of the park.

name: Malabar Farm State Park
description: Malabar Farm State Park was once the home of Louis Bromfield, the Pulitzer Prize winner. The park offers tours of the mansion and farmland. The house has 32-rooms. Camping, picnicking, fishing, swimming, hunting and hiking are popular activities here. The park offers three hiking tails that equal about three miles in length. They are all easy in difficulty.

name: Deer Lakes Park
description: Great walking/hiking/jogging trails.

name: Dirksen Park
description: Dirksen Park features 9 miles of hiking trails near Pekin, IL.

name: Three Island Crossing State Park
description: Beautiful multi-use trails.

name: North Park
description: Walking, Jogging, Hiking trails; exercise trail.

name: Crestwood Park
description: Good hiking/jogging path.

name: Reservoir Ridge
description: Reservoir Ridge is a 3 mile hiking trail in Fort Collins, Colorado.

name: Bayswater Point State Park
description: Nice hiking trails.
