name: Bear Mountain State Park
description: Nice hiking area.

name: Brotherin Trail System
description: Brotherin Trail System features 4 miles of hiking trails near Madison, CT.

name: Lewis And Clark Monument
description: Lewis And Clark Monument features 5 miles of hiking trails near Council Bluffs, IA.

name: Tranquility
description: Tranquility features 6 miles of hiking trails near Omaha, NE.

name: Appalachian Trail 103: NJ 23 to NJ 284
description: The AT runs 9.8 miles from NJ Hwy 23 (High Point State Park) to NJ Hwy 284. Along the way it passes New Jersey's High Point, the High Point shelter, NJ Hwy 519, Goldsmith Lane, Unionville Road, Quarry Road, and Lott Road.

name: Mill Stream Run Reservation
description: Plenty of hiking trails, with varying lengths.

name: Forked Creek Preserve - Ballou Road Access
description: The 790-acre Forked Creek Preserve was acquired between 1974 and 2007. The preserve is part of the Forked Creek preservation system, which conserves more than 2,400 acres of land.

name: Evans-Judge Preserve
description: Evans-Judge Preserve features 1.74 miles of natural surface trail.

name: Royalview
description: Royalview is a 9 mile hiking trail in Strongsville, Ohio.

name: Brecksville Reservation
description: Excellent trails.

name: Sal J. Prezio Mountain Lakes
description: Excellent trails and ropes challenge course for groups.

name: Wyoming Territorial Prison
description: Several trails, ADA accessible.

name: CDT WY03: Sage Creek Road to Unnamed Road Junction
description: Section 3 of the CDT runs for 6.2 miles along a combination of gravel roads to an unnamed junction with another gravel road and the CDT.

name: Promised Land State Park
description: Promised Land State Park is a 3,000-acre park on the Pocono Plateau. It is surrounded by state forest and contains two lakes and several small streams. Activities here include hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, swimming, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling and camping. The hiking trails here connect with trails in the state forest and add up to about 50 miles in length.

name: Rocky Neck State Park
description: A network of several trails offer hikers great walks.

name: Upper Pine Bottom State Park
description: Upper Pine Bottom State Park provides access to the hiking tails of Tiadaghton State Forest.

name: Starved Rock State Park
description: Exploring the majestic bluffs and canyons is the park's primary attraction, and there are 13 miles of well-marked trails to help you enjoy them. The trails are open all year, but hikers are urged to exercise extreme caution and to stay on official trails. To keep you oriented, trail maps are located at all trail access points, intersections and points of interest. There are colored posts along the trails, corresponding to colors on the maps, and letter symbols on the trail brochure to further assist you. Finally, yellow dots on posts indicate that you are moving away from the lodge or visitor center, and white dots mean you are returning.

name: Appalachian Trail 110: Bear Mountain Bridge to US 9
description:
The AT runs 5.8 miles from the Bear Mountain Bridge to US Hwy 9. Along the way it passes Sugarloaf Hill.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"Bear Mountain" lat=41.3116106119, lon=-74.007377641

name: Seth Low Pierrepont State Park Reserve
description: A network of trails allow hikers a variety of scenic hiking.

name: Northern Skyline
description: Northern Skyline features 14 miles of hiking trails near Ogden, UT.

name: Lasdon Park, Arboretum and Veterans Memorial
description: Nature/walking trails.

name: Bennetts Pond
description: Bennetts Pond features 10 miles of hiking trails near Ridgefield, CT.

name: Clear Creek State Park
description: The trails begin in the scenic Clear Creek Valley and follow the Clarion River and wander across the surrounding hillsides to several scenic overlooks. Rhododendron and mountain laurel abound throughout the park and many varieties of wildlife, including deer, bear, turkey and grouse inhabit the park.

name: Buffalo Rock State Park
description: The River Bluff Trail offers a walk high above the Illinois River with two observation decks providing spectacular views of the Illinois River. The Woodland Trail provides an opportunity to examine and appreciate the trees, plants and wildlife prospering in the park. Across the road from Buffalo Rock State park is the Illinois & Michigan Canal State Trail Buffalo Rock Access area, providing parking for approximately seven vehicles. Water and restroom facilities are not available at this site.

name: Nelson-Kennedy Ledges State Park
description: 4 Hiking trails

name: Collis P. Huntington State Park
description: Collis P Huntington State Park features 20 miles of hiking trails near Bethel, CT.

name: Haley Farm State Park
description: The park has been preserved as open space and is used for passive recreational purposes.  A 0.8 mile bike trail winds its way through the scenic old shoreline farm.  The Haley Farm Bike Trail, which is wheelchair accessible, is part of a 7 1/2 mile town-owned bikeway routed from Mystic to Groton on local roadways.

name: Chain O' Lakes State Park
description: Over 10 miles of hiking trails through this beautiful, lush area.

name: Ricketts Glen State Park
description: Trails vary from fairly level to very steep hills. The 26 miles of trails are a prime attraction of the park.

name: Ricketts Glen SP Falls Trail Loop
description: Challenging hike with lots of waterfalls as your reward.

name: Osbornedale State Park
description: One handicap accessible trail and four additional hiking trails make for great hiking.

name: Frances Slocum State Park
description: Frances Slocum State Park is a hotbed of activity consisting of 1,035 acres with 165 of it covered by Frances Slocum Lake. The hiking trails here are quite extensive. There are 10 trails that come together to form the network at Frances Slocum State Park.

name: Goosepond Mountain State Park
description: Goosepond Mountain State Park is a 1,558-acre area for hiking and horseback riding. The majority of the park is wooded. The park is undeveloped so there are no toilets and limited parking. Dogs okay on leash.

name: Goodenow Grove Nature Preserve
description: Goodenow Grove Nature Preserve features 1.77 miles of natural surface trail, ideal for hiking/running. The 1.03 miles of natural surface trail outside of the designated nature preserve are also ideal for cross-country skiing and snowshoeing.

name: Bluff Point State Park
description: Bluff Point Coastal Reserve offers the visitor a delightful mixture of wooded hiking and biking trails coupled with spectacular wildlife viewing on Long Island Sound.

name: Cook Forest State Park
description: From the depths of the Forest Cathedral to the heights of Seneca point, the trails of Cook Forest State Park explore diverse landscapes and habitats.

name: Cententential Watershed State Forest
description: Trail maps/permits are available at kiosks located at the trailheads, at the Aquarion Water Company office at 714 Black Rock Road (Route 58) Easton. Hikers under the age of 14 must be accompanied by an adult permit-holder.

name: Goose Pond
description: Goose Pond features 20 miles of hiking trails near Monroe, NY.

name: Prospect
description: Prospect features 2 miles of hiking trails near Orleans,ca, CA.

name: Indian Well State Park
description: A two-mile stretch of trail offers beautiful scenery for hikers.

name: Goose Lake Prairie State Natural Area
description: Visiting Goose Lake Prairie State Natural Area today is much like seeing Illinois as it was over a century ago, when prairie covered nearly all of the state. Big bluestem, Indian grass and switchgrass thrive here, as do broad-leafed flowering plants known as forbs.  At times the grasses can reach 8 to 12 feet in height. All the seasons have unique beauty to behold at the Goose Lake Prairie. The area offers 7 miles of hiking trails to view the Goose Lake Prairie in all its glory. Depending on the route you choose trails can be from 1 to 3.5 miles. Different loops offer different levels of difficulty. The Tall Grass Nature Trails takes you through the prairie with the park's tallest grasses. The Sagashka Trail lets you see many different habitats from marshland to farmland. The Prairie View Trail is a moderate level trail that guides you through prairie and farmland. Picnicking amenities are also available.

name: Appalachian Trail 111: US 9 to Canopus Hill Road
description:
The AT runs 5 miles from US Hwy 9 to Canopus Hill Road.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot: <br />
"South High" lat=41.3996253564, lon=-73.8767900253

name: Glenn Cunningham Lake
description: Glenn Cunningham Lake features 9 miles of hiking trails near Omaha, NE.

name: William G. Stratton State Park
description: The Illinois & Michigan Canal State Trail provides a natural northern boundary for the William G. Stratton State Park. Sixty-one miles of limestone screened trail can be enjoyed by hikers, bicyclists, nature lovers and snowmobilers.

name: Gebhard Woods State Park
description: Gebhard Woods is a footbridge away from the historic Illinois & Michigan Canal State Trail. This 61 mile trail on the old canal towpath is easy walking and gives access to unparalleled scenic and historic sights. Bicyclists also can take advantage of the groomed towpath to enjoy the natural and manmade wonders. The trail is marked and has various wayside exhibits that describe canal era features encountered along the way. Due to the trail's composition, horseback riding isn't allowed.

name: Little Pine State Park
description: Little Pine State Park is a 2,158-acre mountainous area with great opportunities for a good time. It has excellent hiking, swimming, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing, sledding, snowmobiling and there are also campsites available for overnights adventures! There are 9 popular trails that equal about 14 miles in length when combined. The trails vary from easy to moderate in difficulty and offer great scenic views. The 250 mile Mid State Trail also winds through the park.

name: West Rocks State Park
description: West Rocks State Park features 12 miles of hiking trails near New Haven, CT.

name: West Rock Ridge State Park
description: Abundant hiking opportunities.

name: Schunnemunk State Park
description: Eight marked  trails; excellent hiking.

name: Chatfield Hollow State Park
description: Hike the trails in search of Indian caves, explore the jagged rocky ledges and recesses, relax by the cooling waters, or picnic in the soft pine woods at Chatfield Hollow State Park.

name: Kettle Creek State Park
description: Novice and experienced hikers will find an abundance of trails in the park area. Short day-hikes are possible on the many park trails. Backpackers can enjoy the 53-mile Donut Hole Trail with an access parking lot across from the Lower Campground. This trail connects onto several other trail systems. Trail maps are available at the park office.

name: Mosquito Creek Lake
description: Excellent interpretive trails in Lakeview Recreation Area.

name: Hyner Run State Park
description: The park is the eastern trailhead for the 90-mile Donut Hole Trail system, a moderate to rugged trail for backpackers. Shorter hikes are available close to the park on state forest lands.

name: CDT WY04: Unnamed Road Junction to Bridger Pass Road
description: Section 4 of the CDT runs 36.8 miles from an unnamed road junction with the CDT to a CDT access point on Bridger Pass Road. Along the way, the CDT passes Sand Hills, Miller Hill, Bridger Pass, and Atlantic Rim.

name: Bedford Reservation
description: The reservation offers trails and picnic areas, and includes Shawnee Hills Golf Course as one of its attractions. Flowing through Bedford Reservation is Tinker's Creek, named for a member of Moses Cleaveland's surveying party. The stream drops a dramatic 220 feet over a course of two miles and has cut a steep, walled gorge. The gorge, declared a National Natural Landmark, is a unique area with numerous tree, shrub and flower species.

name: Hennepin Canal State Park
description:
The Hennepin Canal was built at the beginning of the 20th century as a commercial waterway connecting the Illinois River with the Mississippi. Cheaper railway transport soon made its barge traffic obsolete, and by the 1930s, boaters, hikers and canoeists were the canal's primary users. The Hennepin was the first American canal built of concrete without stone cut facings. Picnicking, hiking, bicycling, fishing, boating, canoeing and camping are all popular activities at this park. Horseback riding and winter sports are also common activities.

Hiking is an excellent activity at this park because the park offers a 155 mile trail along the canal. Tent camping is allowed and appropriate if you plan to hike the entire length.

The park also offers a more challenging trail that is 4.5 miles long.

name: Burlingame State Park
description: Burlingame State Spark offers some of the best camping around with 3,100 acres of rocky woodland camping space. The park offers activities such as boating, fishing, swimming and of course, camping.

name: West Creek Reservation
description: Excellent trails.

name: Pacific Crest Trail: Northern California: Q
description:
Section Q of the Pacific Crest Trail runs 55.8 miles from Somes Bar-Etna Road at Etna Summit to Highway 96 at Seiad Valley. According to the official Pacific Crest Guide book, this section takes you past "the crown jewels of the Marble Mountain Wilderness: Black Mountain, Kings Castle and, of course, Marble Mountain itself.<br />
<br />
Along the way this trail passes Fisher Lake, Marten Lake, Soft Water Spring, Paradise Lake, Buckhorn Spring, Grider Creek, Bark Shanty Creek, Road 46N66, Highway 96, and the Klamath River.

name: Big Creek Reservation
description: A major component of Big Creek Reservation is Big Creek Parkway, a refreshing alternative to the standard suburban commuter routes to Cleveland. The reservation runs parallel to Pearl Road from Valley Parkway to Brookpark Road, and is located in Brooklyn, Parma, Parma Heights, Middleburg Heights, and Strongsville. Undoubtedly the highlight of the reservation is the Lake to Lake Trail, a 2.4 mile, universally accessible all purpose trail that connects Lake Abram to Lake Isaac.  On foot, by bicycle, or by wheelchair, one crosses Abram Creek and Bagley Road as they travel the trail that passes through 175 acres of headwater wetlands joining the largest kettle lakes in Cuyahoga County.

name: Elk Rock State Park
description:
Elk Rock State Park is situated on Lake Red Rock with Roberts Creek close by making it a popular destination for the avid fisherman. Historically the park was home to Native Americans until they granted rights to white settlers in 1842.

The park is named for the interesting rock formation on the property.

13 miles of hiking trails, equestrian trails and several campsites make this park a popular location for hikers, campers and horseback riders. Picnicking shelters are also provided and boating is a common activity on the lake.

The hiking trails at the state park are for multiple use so bikers are also allowed on them. The trails will sometimes be closed due to rain. Call ahead.

name: Quinnipiac River State Park
description: Four miles of the 24 mile blue blazed Quinnipiac Trail passes through the Park. Sometimes following the river bank, sometimes somewhat upland, the trial leads north/south from Toelles Road (north) to the barred gate access at the abandoned Banton Street (south). Since it is an active floodplain, the forest floor can be seasonally muddy and the river's many cutoff meanders (oxbows) inundated.

name: Appalachian Trail 112: Canopus Hill Road to NY 301
description: Section 112 of the Appalachian Trail runs 7.4 miles from Canopus Hill Road to NY Hwy 301.

name: Mary Jane Thurston State Park
description: Mary Jane Thurston State Park is situated along the Maumee River. The 591-acre park is a scenic and fun park that provides day-use and overnight recreational enjoyment. Boating, fishing, swimming, camping, picnicking, hiking and hunting are common activities here. About six miles of trails are available for hiking and each one is labeled easy difficulty.

name: Lake Red Rock
description: Hiking trails at Howell Station, North Overlook Camp, Roberts Creek, Wallashuck East, and Whitebreast Camp.

name: Cockaponset State Forest
description: Cockaponset State Forest features 20 miles of hiking trails near Chester, CT.

name: Prairie Creek Redwoods State Park
description: 75 miles of hiking trails, bicycle trails, self-guided nature trail, accessible trails for individuals with physical or visual limitations, backpacking

name: Manuel F. Correllus State Forest
description: 5,100 acres in the center of Martha's Vineyard make up the Manuel F. Correllus State Forest. The "Heath Hen Reserve" was created in the early 1900's to prevent bird extinction-- unfortunately the Heath Hen became extinct in 1932. The park is now open for public use, providing 15 miles of paths for cycling and hiking.

name: Rocky River Reservation
description: Paved walking trail.

name: Selden Neck State Park
description: A marked trail begins near the Quarry Knob camp site and leads to the quarry area in the southeast part of the island. The trail encounters the old causeway, built to transfer the granite stones from the quarry face to the shoreline for shipment.  Another trail extends northwest to the ruins of old farm buildings and a well. Lookouts from the trail offer wonderful views of the lower Connecticut River. From these the viewer will quickly understand why the Nature Conservancy designated the lower Connecticut River as one of "America's Last Great Places".

name: Bradley Woods Reservation
description: Great walking/jogging trails.

name: South Chagrin Reservation
description: Excellent walking/jogging trails.

name: North Chagrin Reservation
description: Excellent hiking trails.

name: Monee Reservoir Preservations
description: Monee Reservoir features 1.64 miles of natural surface trail.

name: Sleeping Giant State Park
description: An excellent network of trails offers plenty of hiking.

name: Storm King State Park
description: Beautiful area to hike.

name: Channahon State Park
description: Channahon State Park is a great starting point for a day bicycling or hiking on the trail. Sixty-one miles of trail along the old canal towpath gives access to unparalleled scenic and historic sights. In the spring, wildlife and wildflowers are abundant along the trail. Great blue heronsand waterfowl can be observed feeding or nesting near the park and along the canal banks.

name: Lake Anita State Park
description: A one-mile self-guided nature trail is available, where park visitors can learn about a number of the shrubs and trees which abound in southwest Iowa. Lake Anita also offers a 4-mile trail which winds around the entire lake and is available for a pleasant walk. It is a great avenue for hikers and bicyclists wanting to enjoy the great outdoors.

name: Hawk Springs State Recreation Area
description: Nestled in the Hawk Springs State Recreation Area is the Hawks Springs Reservoir which is a fisherman's dream. Activities here include swimming, boating, canoeing, kayaking, fishing and camping.

name: Gillette Castle State Park
description: The trails often follow, over trestle and through tunnel, the actor's three mile long narrow gauge railroad. Gillette's own walking paths were constructed with near-vertical steps, stone-arch bridges, and wooded trestles spanning up to forty feet. Other outdoor attractions include a vegetable cellar, the railroad station (Grand Central), and Gillette's goldfish pond.

name: Maurice K. Goddard State Park
description: Maurice K. Goddard State Park is 2, 856 acres and contains the 1,860-acres Lake Wilhelm. Teaming with wildlife, this park boats hiking, biking, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing, sledding and snowbiling. There are 5 trails here at Maurice K. Goddard State Park that add up to 14 miles of trail. They pass near the lake, through forests and fields.

name: Alewife Brook Reservation
description: Open year round, dawn to dusk The 120-acre Alewife Reservation is among metropolitan Boston's largest urban wilds and provides habitat for an array of indigenous and migratory birds including Osprey and the Great Blue Heron. The anadromous Herring migrates each spring from the Atlantic Ocean to the Reservation's Little Pond and Blair Pond to spawn. A major portion of the Alewife Reservation is designated wetland and contains Little Pond, the Little River, and the Alewife Brook. A wooded uplands and meadow provides the opportunity to view the unusual mating ritual of the woodcock, a rare sight in an urban area. The Reservation is located at the end of the Minuteman Bike Path in Arlington and is within easy walking distance of the Alewife MBTA Station. There is limited access for hikers and birdwatchers.

name: McKinley Woods - Frederick's Grove Forest Preserve
description: Frederick's Grove features 2.32 miles of natural surface trails, ideal for hiking/running. Of these, 1.88 miles are also ideal for cross-country skiing and snowshoeing.

name: Kettletown State Park
description: The cool waters of the Housatonic River make Kettletown State Park and Lake Zoar popular recreation destinations. The site also offers great hiking.

name: Trail Creek
description: Trail Creek features 4 miles of hiking trails near Arlington, WY.

name: Garfield Park Reservation
description: Good walking/jogging trails.

name: Nehantic State Forest
description: Excellent trails in the East Lyme area.

name: Sinnemahoning State Park
description: Several trails offer a chance to observe some of the more remote areas of the park. The Red Spruce Trail is about one mile long and runs from the campground to the Forty Maples Picnic Area. For one-third of its length it passes through a mixed hardwood forest, then traverses an old field converted to a spruce plantation. Venomous snakes (rattlesnakes) may be encountered in this area. Low Lands Trail was originally part of the Buffalo and Susquehanna Railroad. It is an easy hike through thick spruce, grassy openings, vernal ponds, streamside bottoms and ends at the Wildlife Viewing Area at the north end of the park. There are lots of opportunities along this trail to spot grassland birds, osprey, elk and butterflies.

name: Banner Lakes at Summerset State Park
description: Banner Lakes At Summerset Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Des Moines, IA.

name: Plum Creek Greenway Trail
description: The Plum Creek Greenway Trail travels 3.13 miles through Goodenow Grove Nature Preserve. The Plum Creek Greenway Trail is a hilly, crushed limestone linear and loop trail and travels 3.13 miles through forest.

name: Beavertail State Park
description: Beavertail State Park is known for offering some of the most beautiful vistas along the New England coastline. Most popular here is the sight-seeing, however the park also offers excellent opportunities for hiking and fishing.

name: Upper Paugussett State Forest
description: Upper Paugussett State Forest features 6 miles of hiking trails near Newtown, CT.

name: Brookside Reservation
description: Great trails for running/jogging.

name: Appalachian Trail 113: NY 301 to Taconic State Parkway
description: The Appalachian Trail runs 7.3 miles from NY Hwy 301 to Taconic State Parkway. Along the way it passes Canopus Lake, Long Hill Road, and the RPH shelter.

name: Ninham
description: Ninham features 15 miles of hiking trails near Carmel, NY.

name: Brooksvale Park And Naugatuck State Forest
description: Brooksvale Park And Naugatuck State Forest features 10 miles of hiking trails near Hamden, CT.

name: Rays Indoor Mtb Park
description: Rays Indoor Mtb Park features 1 miles of hiking trails near Cleveland, OH.

name: Brenton Point State Park
description: Brenton Point State Park offers some of the most spectacular views on the East Coast. The park offers hiking and fishing for visitors to enjoy.

name: Washington Reservation
description: Great walking/jogging trail.

name: Hudson Highlands State Park
description: Great trails.

name: Punderson State Park
description: 7 hiking trails

name: Southford Falls State Park
description: Hike your way to an observation tower and through a covered bridge. The Larkin Bridle Trail is also nearby.

name: Stoddard Hill State Park
description: The footpath offers a nice walk through surrounding forest.

name: Worlds End State Park
description: The over 20 miles of hiking trails of Worlds End State Park are mostly rocky with steep sections that climb the surrounding mountains. Hikers should wear proper footgear and be extra cautious in the winter and spring when trail surfaces can be frozen or icy.

name: George C. Waldo State Park
description: Look for wetlands by the trailhead and stone walls away from the trail.

name: Larkin State Bridal Trail
description: Larkin State Bridal Trail features 10 miles of hiking trails near Southbury, CT.

name: Brainard Homestead State Park
description: Great bird Watching, field sports, and hiking await visitors at Brainard Homestead State Park.

name: Fahnestock State Park (Clarence Fahnestock)
description: Excellent trails.

name: Plum Creek Unpaved Trail
description: Hiking, horseback riding and cycling trail.

name: Stewart Airport
description: Stewart Airport features 100 miles of hiking trails near Newburgh, NY.

name: Fort Wetherill State Park
description: The 61.5-acre Fort Wetherill State Park is situated across the water from Fort Adams State Park and is a former coastal defense battery and training camp. It has breathtaking views of Newport Harbor and offers activities such as boating, fishing, swimming, mountain biking and hiking.

name: Millers Pond State Park
description: Millers Pond State Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Durham, CT.

name: Highland Lakes State Park
description: The 3,000-acre Highland Lakes State Park is made up of mostly undeveloped woods and lakes. The park is use most commonly for fishing, horseback riding, hiking and exploring. This is an undeveloped park so there are no toilets and little parking. Dogs are permitted if leashed.

name: Oil Creek State Park
description: Oil Creek State Park features 70 miles of hiking trails near Oil City, PA.

name: Devils Hopyard State Park
description: Great trails for hiking.

name: Two Mile Run County Park
description: Two Mile Run County Park features 40 miles of hiking trails near Oil City, PA.

name: Plum Creek Play Meadow
description: Visitors can enjoy cycling, hiking, and picnicking.

name: Sauk Trail Woods-Central
description: Sauk Trail Woods-Central offers fishing, picnicking and trails for cycling, hiking and inline skating.

name: Farnsworth
description: Farnsworth features 16 miles of hiking trails near Waterville, OH.

name: Applegate Lassen Emigrant Trail
description: The Map of the Applegate Lassen Emigrant TrailApplegate Lassen Emigrant Trail was one of the major trails providing access into California and Oregon, also called the California Cutoff after it left the Oregon Trail near Fort Hall, Idaho. Trail markers identify the routes of these national historic trails, while publications, maps, and BLM offices can assist the traveller on a journey into the discovery of the early California Emigrant Trails.

name: Lava Wilderness Study Area
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Lakefront Reservation
description: The 17-mile Cleveland Lakefront Bike Trail traces the Lake Erie shoreline providing access to Edgewater Park, the E. 55th St. Marina, Gordon Park, Euclid Beach Park, Villa Angela Park and Wildwood Park.

name: Varden Conservation Area
description: The trail system travels through most of the conservation area's scenic beauty, including old farm fields, forests, tree plantations and wetlands. There are many opportunities to see wildlife, including deer, wild flowers and songbirds.

name: Mount Pisgah State Park
description: Mount Pisgah State Park is a 1,302-acre park at the base of Mt. Pisgah. There is a vast amount of activities to do under the mountain here including hiking, swimming, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing and snowmobiling. There is a network of hiking trails that are suitable for everyone. The trails travel around the lake, through wooded areas, old fileds, open farmlands and rugged terrain.

name: Thorn Creek Woods Nature Preserve
description: Thorn Creek Woods features 2.45 miles of natural surface trail, ideal for hiking/running.

name: Tionesta Lake
description: Beautiful hiking area.

name: Hunters Woods Preserve
description: The 43-acre Hunters Woods was acquired between 1973 and 1975. The preserve is part of the Hickory Creek preservation system, which conserves more than 2,000 acres of land.

name: Lunatic Fringe
description: Lunatic Fringe features 4 miles of hiking trails near Green River, WY.

name: Hinckley Reservation
description: At the southern end of Cleveland Metroparks is Hinckley Reservation, the site of the nationally-known annual return of the buzzards. Located in Hinckley Township in Medina County, the reservation is dominated by the 90-acre Hinckley Lake, enjoyed by ice fishermen in the winter months. Another attraction of the reservation is Whipp's Ledges, with elevations rising 350 feet above Hinckley Lake and formed more than 250 million years ago.

name: Brent & Mikes' Trail
description: Brent & Mikes' Trail features 6 miles of hiking trails near Green River, WY.

name: Acacia Reservation
description: Nice walking/jogging path.

name: Machimoodus State Park
description: Mount Tom is Machimoodus's high point at 314 feet above sea level. The old roads and trails that lead to its southern slope feature two lookout points. Both of these provide visitors access to picturesque and scenic vistas of the mouths of the Salmon and Moodus Rivers, along with overviews of the Salmon River Cove and the Connecticut River.

name: Squantz Pond State Park
description: A variety of trails offer excellent hiking.

name: Sylvan Island
description: Sylvan Island features 5 miles of hiking trails near Moline, IL.

name: George Dudley Seymour State Park
description: Today: a trail leading from the end of Clarkhurst Road leads past old foundations to a broad, grassy, Connecticut River tidal flat. Interpretive signs assist the visitor in the interpretation of the foundations of the estate on the landscape. Rock cliffs offer scenic views to the west and south.

name: Spring Creek Greenway Trail
description: The western segment of the Spring Creek Greenway Trail is a hilly, crushed limestone loop and linear trail and travels 5.01 miles through the forest, savanna, and wetland of Hadley Valley. Download a map of Hadley Valley.  The eastern segment of the trail is a hilly, crushed limestone loop and linear trail and travels 3.44 miles through the forest and savanna of Messenger Marsh. Download a map of Messenger Marsh.

name: Hickory Creek Preserve - Hickory Creek Barrens
description: Hickory Creek Barrens provides access to the 3.68-mile, paved western segment of the Hickory Creek Bikeway.

name: Appalachian Trail 114: Taconic State Parkway to NY 52
description:
The AT runs 4.8 miles from the Taconic State Parkway to NY Hwy 52. Along the way it passes Hosner Mountain Road.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot: <br />
"Hosner Mountain Road" lat=41.5408718687, lon=-73.7529869679

name: Hop Brook Lake
description: Hop Brook Lake is a very popular day-use destination with plenty of opportunities for outdoor lovers. Activities here include swimming, hiking, canoeing, kayaking, fishing and cross-country.

name: Pymatuning State Park
description: There are trails near Tuttle and Jamestown campgrounds, and the abandoned railroad grade on the Spillway is a flat, wide trail.

name: Pymatuning State Park
description: 2 hiking trails

name: Sunderbruch Park
description: Sunderbruch Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Davenport, IA.

name: Joe Orr Woods
description:
Located in Chicago Heights, just outside of Chicago, Joe Orr Woods connects with Halsted Woods and Wilson Woods to create the Cook County Forest Preserve.

Plenty of trails run through Joe Orr Woods and connect with the surrounding woods to provide a great experience. Get out and escape the city, and don't forget to stop by the beautiful picnic areas after you hike.

Trails are shared by bikers, inline skaters, joggers, and others.

name: Hammel Woods - Crumby Recreation Area
description: Crumby Recreation Area features 2.18 miles of natural surface trail.

name: Joliet Iron Works Historic Site
description: Joliet Iron Works Historic Site features 0.59 mile of paved trail that provides a self-guided interpretive tour of the site's historical significance.

name: Colvin Grove Preserve
description: The 175-acre Colvin Grove Preserve was acquired between 1991 and 2007. The preserve is part of the Rock Run preservation system, which conserves more than 1,450 acres of land.

name: Sugar Creek Preserve
description: Sugar Creek Preserve features 1.48 miles of natural surface trail.  The preserve also provides access to the 22.29-mile, crushed limestone/paved Wauponsee Glacial Trail.

name: Wadsworth Falls State Park
description: Spend a summer day cooling off in the mist of the waterfall or an autumn day hiking or biking the varied trails of the park.

name: Vollmer Road Grove
description: Vollmer Road Grove provides excellent opportunities for cycling, hiking, inline skating and hiking.

name: Hurd State Park
description: Good hiking trails.

name: Archbald Pothole State Park
description: A small loop trail starting at the wayside follows an old coal mine tram road passed rock ledges and through a forest.

name: Potato Creek State Park
description: Excellent hiking opportunities.

name: Ole Bull State Park
description: Ole Bull State Park is 132 acres in the Kettle Creek Valley. It is a mountainous area that offers swimming, fishing, hiking, ountain biking, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling and camping for people to enjoy! There are three trails that add up to five miles here but the Susquehannock Trail System runs through the park.

name: Walnut Woods State Park
description:
Walnut Woods State Park is named for the 260 acres of woodland that make up the park. The uncommon black walnut trees are abundant at this park and more than 90 species of birds have been sighted here.

This beautiful and unique park provides several shaded picnic areas with fireplaces, two and a half miles of cross country skiing trails, several river activities and a cool, shaded campground.

The cross country skiing trail can also be used for hiking.

name: Appalachian Trail 115: NY 52 to NY 55
description: The AT runs 7.2 miles from NY Hwy 52 to NY Hwy 55. Along the way the trail passes I-84, the Morgan Stewart shelter, and NY Hwy 292.

name: Flossmoor Road Bicycle Lot
description: Bikers can enjoy over 100 miles of paved bicycle trails and over 200 miles of multi-use trails in the Forest Preserve.

name: North Creek Meadow
description: North Creek Meadow provides picnicking, snowmobiling, hiking, inline skating and cycling trails.

name: Lovers Leap State Park
description: Trails through the park will lead the walker through centuries of land-use history. Heading northeast from the parking lot the trail utilizes the 1895 Berlin Iron Bridge, one of five remaining in Connecticut, to cross the Housatonic River. Across the bridge the Lovers Leap Trail heads southeast 1,200 feet to the rock formation that gives the park its name.

name: Glenwood Woods-South
description: Glenwood Woods-South provides trails for cycling, hiking and inline skating as well as picnicking facilities.

name: Salmon River State Forest
description: Hiking is a popular activity here.

name: East Harbor State Park
description: 11 hiking trails

name: Sweet Woods
description: Sweet Woods offers trails for cycling, horseback riding, hiking, and inline skating, as well as picnicking facilities.

name: Colchester
description: Colchester features 7 miles of hiking trails near Colchester, CT.

name: Thorn Creek Unpaved Trail
description: Thorn Creek Trail offers excellent cycling, horseback riding and hiking.

name: Day Pond State Park
description: Great trails through surrounding forest.

name: Lansing Woods
description:
Located in Lansing, in the suburbs of Chicago, Lansing Woods is the perfect little park for a get-a-way. Just a few miles away from the shores of Lake Michigan, this park offers a quiet retreat.

A network of trails runs through this park offering wonderful hiking opportunities. Remember that trails are shared with cyclists, in-line skaters, and joggers, so be aware of your surroundings. Take advantage of the beautiful picnic areas that Lansing Woods offers as well!

name: South Cape Beach State Park
description: Located between Waquoit Bay and Vineyard Sound, South Cape Beach State Park has a mile long white sand beach and several other beautiful features including: a salt marsh and scrub oak/pitch pine woodlands. Canoeing, fishing, hiking, interpretive programs, swimming and picnicking at this pristine park are popular activities. The park has a parking area and public restrooms for your convenience.

name: Jurgensen Woods
description: At this ecological management site, visitors enjoy cycling, hiking and picnicking.

name: Euclid Creek Reservation
description: Excellent trails.

name: Illiniwek Forest Preserve
description: Illiniwek Forest Preserve is a 5 mile hiking trail in Hampton, Illinois.

name: Waquoit Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve
description: The Waquoit Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve  encompasses 2,700 acres of waters, beaches and marshlands. Several trails and a camping area called the Washburn Island provide excellent hiking and camping opportunities. Fishing and canoeing are also popular activities.

name: Lackawanna State Park
description: A series of looping trails limited to foot traffic wander through the campground and day use areas of the park. Additional multi-use trails explore forests, fields, lakeshore areas and woodland streams.

name: Mississippi River - Pools 11-22
description: Excellent trails throughout the area.

name: The Urbandale/West Des Moines Greenbelt
description: The Urbandale/West Des Moines Greenbelt is a 0 mile hiking trail in Des Moines, Iowa.

name: Arcadia State Park
description: Arcadia State Park features 25 miles of hiking trails near East Greenwich, RI.

name: The Center Trails
description: The Center Trails features 0 miles of hiking trails near Des Moines, IA.

name: Tinley Creek (unpaved)
description: Cycling, horseback riding and hiking are popular here.

name: Pachaug State Forest
description: There are four popular hiking trails, maintained by the Connecticut Forest and Park Association, that run through Pachaug State Forest. The Pachaug Trail runs about 30 miles (48 km) in an east-west route that follows a horse-shoe curve north. It begins at the northern end of Pachaug Pond and ends at Green Fall Pond. The Nehantic Trail is a route just under 15 miles (24 km) that begins at Green Fall Pond near the Pachaug Trail trailhead and runs northwest to RT 201 near the Pachaug River. The Quinebaug Trail runs North-South for about 7 miles (11 km) from the junction of Breakneck Hill Road and the Nehantic-Quinebaug Trail Crossover to its northern terminus at Spaulding Road. The Narragansett Trail runs from the southwest to the northeast, starting from Lantern Hill in North Stonington. The Narragansett Trail leaves the State Forest at the Connecticut/Rhode Island boundary; it enters Yawgoog Scout Reservation in Rhode Island and later ends at Ashville Pond in the village of Canonchet in Hopkinton, Rhode Island.

name: East Branch Clarion River Lake
description: Interpretive trails in East Branch Dam Recreation Area.

name: St. Mihiel Woods
description: St. Mihiel Woods offers cycling and hiking trails.

name: Imagination Glenn
description: Imagination Glenn features 10 miles of hiking trails near Portage, IN.

name: Prompton State Park
description: Prompton St Park features 25 miles of hiking trails near Honesdale, PA.

name: Centennial Trail/I&M Canal Trail
description: The Centennial Trail/I&M Canal Trail is a 10.81-mile crushed limestone/paved linear trail in four segments in Will County.

name: Appalachian Trail 116: NY 55 to Metro North Railroad (NY 22)
description: The AT runs 7.6 miles from NY Hwy 55 to the Metro North Railroad (NY Hwy 22). Along the way it passes Nuclear Lake, the Telephone Pioneers shelter, and County Road 20.

name: Yankee Woods
description:
Yankee Woods are part of the St. Mihiel Reservation and Cook County Forest Preserve. Located just south of Chicago, this park is an escape from city life. Join your friends here and go for a bike ride or a hike, or just hang out at a picnic area or under a pavilion.

There are plenty of walking paths that wind through Yankee Woods and the adjoining recreation areas. Take advantage of the picnic areas that these trails lead past! Most of these trails will be multi-use trails and will therefore have other outdoor enthusiasts on them. Please practice trail manners when you're out!

name: Midlothian Reservoir
description: Visitors enjoy cycling, fishing, hiking and inline skating.

name: Appalachian Trail 117: NY 22 to Hoyt Road
description:
The AT runs 6.8 miles from NY Hwy 22 (Metro North Railroad) to Hoyt Road. Along the way it passes the Wiley shelter and Duell Hollow Road.<br />
<br />
Note: if you are north bound, pick up the Appalachian Trail section descriptions in Connecticut (or just click here).

name: Hadley Valley - Bruce Road Access
description: Bruce Road Access provides access to a 5.01-mile, crushed limestone segment of the Spring Creek Greenway Trail.

name: Bremen Grove
description: Bremen Grove offers picnicking facilities, as well as trails for cycling, hiking and inline skating.

name: Sizerville State Park
description: The hiking trail system offers a series of five loop trails. The Bottomlands, Campground and North Slope trails take the visitor through a variety of lowland habitats and are relatively easy to walk making them ideal for hikers of any age.

name: Prairie Rose State Park
description:
Prairie Rose State Park is known as one of the most attractive parks in western Iowa. The 422-acre park is surrounded by scenic hills and accented by a beautiful lake. Recreational activities abound in this popular location including hiking, swimming, fishing, boating, camping, picnicking and relaxing. The park has boat ramps, horseshoe pits, picnic shelters, a playground and several hiking, snowmobiling and cross country skiing trails that make it a convenient location for any of your favorite activities.

The park's seven miles of multi-use trails make for a scenic day of hiking, wildlife observing or biking. (Snowmobiling and skiing are also allowed on these trails.)

name: Kelleys Island State Park
description:
Hunting, winter sports, fishing (with license), picnicking, swimming, hiking, boating and camping are popular activities at this fascinating destination. The island is known for its unique geological features and popular for its recreational options. It is a 677-acre area on the northern shores of the island.

The park offers a one mile hiking trail that takes you around the northern shore and four miles of multi-use trails that weave through the East Quarry.

name: Hopeville Pond State Park
description: Three trails offer hikers opportunities for nature study in this park.

name: CDT WY05: Bridger Pass Road to Hwy 287
description: Section 5 of the CDT runs for 18.8 miles from Bridger Pass Road to US Highway 287 / Wyoming Highway 789. Along the way, the trail passes Chokecherry Knob, Interstate 80, and the city of Rawlins.

name: Colton Point State Park
description:
The trails traverse very rugged terrain, passing close to many steep cliffs, and may have slippery surfaces. Stay on designated trail surfaces and wear appropriate footwear.

Do not overestimate your ability or stamina; think "Safety First" and take your time to enjoy your experience. Avoid the temptation to get on rock overhangs for a better view. Stay behind the railings and fences.

name: Midlothian Meadows
description: The park offers cycling, hiking, inline skating, and picnicking.

name: Golden Spike National Historic Site
description:
Big Fill Loop Trail: This is a mile and a half round-trip walking trail. You will be walking out on original Central Pacific grade and back on the Union Pacific grade. The trail allows you to see and even walk out on the Central Pacific's Big Fill. Walk through cuts, over fills, and see drill marks where workers blasted rock away. Keep in mind, all of this was accomplished by simple tools, sweat, and an amazing amount of endurance.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: River Highlands State Park
description: The are many trails in the park to lead the hiker across wooden bridges, over streams, along the 150 foot high bluff, or down to the water's edge past a unique geologic feature known as the blowhole. Here one can hear the wind as it whistles past the bluffs. The Native Americans came to listen to the "wind being caught by the spirit of the earth." When the colonists arrived they called it Devil's Blowhole, believing it was an act of Satan. Sailors knew it as an area of quick winds as the park is just upstream of one of the tightest bends on the lower river.

name: Calumet City Prairie
description: Cycling, hiking and inline skating are popular at this park.

name: Nasketucket Bay State Reservation
description: Nasketucket Bay State Reservation is a 209-acre park of lovely walking trails through a forest, an wide open field and a rocky and beautiful shoreline.

name: Rubio Woods
description: This park offers cycling, hiking, inline skating, and picnicking opportunities.

name: Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore
description:
A wide variety of hiking trails traverse the various habitats of Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore. The varying lengths and difficulty levels make it easy to choose the trail that's right for you; from a short easy stroll to a challenging all-day trek. Many of the trails are open all year and the hiking experience can change with each season so come out often.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Appalachian Trail: Connecticut
description: The Appalachian Trail enters into Connecticut from <a href="http://www.tripleblaze.com/3/3307/New-York/Appalachian-Trail--New-York.html">New York</a>, runs through the state for 53 miles, and then exits into the state of <a href="http://www.tripleblaze.com/3/3303/Massachusetts/Appalachian-Trail--Massachusetts.html">Massachusetts</a>. Please see the individual trail listings for more detailed information.

name: Appalachian Trail 118: Hoyt Road to CT 341
description:
The AT runs 11.5 miles from Hoyt Road to CT Hwy 341. Along the way it passes CT Hwy 55, the Ten Mile River Lean-To, Bulls Bridge Road, Schaghticoke Road, Tenmile Hill, Cedar Hill, and the Mount Algo Lean-to. this section of trail begins on the NY/CT state line, heads into Connecticut for a ways, crosses the border back into New York and runs in that state for a ways before crossing back into Connecticut and finishing on the Connecticut side.

Note: if you are south bound, pick up the Appalachian Trail section descriptions in New York (or just <a href="http://www.tripleblaze.com/3/2444/Hiking-Trails/Appalachian-Trail-117--NY-22-to-Hoyt-Road.html">click here</a>).

name: Turtlehead Lake
description: Turtlehead Lake offers cycling, fishing, hiking, inline skating, picnicking and snowmobiling.

name: Harrison Lake State Park
description: 3.5-mile hiking trail with 2 branches circles the lake and provides the opportunity to explore the scenic lakeshore and woodlands

name: Mattatuck State Forest
description: There are miles of rugged trails with scenic overlooks in convenient proximity to the city of Waterbury and surrounding towns. The forested corridor of Mattatuck lends a woodland aesthetic to the scenic drive along the Naugatuck River and provides a transition from the more industrial/urban landscape of the Naugatuck Valley to the "quieter" countryside of the Litchfield Hills. It also stands as a sure sign of nature's resilience and of the determination of resource managers and conservationists.

name: Whistler Woods
description: Whistler Woods provides picnicking facilities, as well as cycling, hiking, and inline skating trails.

name: Black Rock State Park
description: Excellent hiking is available on the Mattatuck Trail from the Grey Stone section of Waterbury to the Wigwam Reservoir in Morris. This trail offers a scenic view of the Naugatuck Valley, highlighting Black Rock. There are many side trails where one can see Black Rock Lake, Black Rock Pond, mature forests and meadows. Hikes can be from 30 minutes to all day.

name: Arrowhead Lake
description: Arrowhead Lake offers cycling, fishing, hiking, inline skating and picnicking.

name: Prouty Place State Park
description: Prouty Place State Park is located in Galeton, PA and is surrounded by the Susquehannock State Forest. It gives access to fishing and hiking to visitors. Trailheads here lead into the Susquehannock State Forest.

name: Indiana Dunes
description: Excellent hiking area.

name: Goddard Memorial State Park
description: Excellent trails.

name: Cherry Springs State Park
description: The Cherry Springs Working Forest Interpretive Trail begins by the information kiosk and features wayside exhibits on forests and forestry practices.

name: Herbert Hoover National Historic Site
description:
The grounds of the historic site are open 24 hours a day. Maps, an audio tour, and Junior Ranger activity books for self-guided walks are available at the Visitor Center. The self-guided walking tour includes the Birthplace Cottage, Blacksmith Shop, Schoolhouse, Friends Meetinghouse, Statue of Isis, Gravesite, and other historic features of the park.<br />
There are 2.5 miles of unpaved walking trails though the 81-acre tallgrass prairie and along Hoover Creek. In the winter the snow-covered trails are suitable for cross-country skiing, though the trails are not groomed for skis.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Saw Wee Kee Park
description: Saw Wee Kee Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Oswego, IL.

name: Jermain Park
description: Jermain Park features 4 miles of hiking trails near Toledo, OH.

name: Horsetail Lake
description: Horsetail Lake offers trails for horseback riding, cycling and hiking, as well as fishing.

name: Camp Columbia State Forest
description: Currently, work is being done on an interpretive trail system throughout the park to convey to the public the deep and interesting account of this fascinating and historical piece of land.

name: Del Norte Coast Redwoods State Park
description: Allow extra time for this hike; it's a strenuous journey back to the highway from Damnation Cove. An additional precautionary note: the &#64257;nal length of trail down to the beach is a tricky descent from the sometimes muddy and slippery bluffs and should only be undertaken by those con&#64257;dent in their abilities. Also, rocky Damnation Cove is best explored at low tide when you can view the tidepools.

name: Forty Acre Woods
description: Forty Acre Woods provides trails for hiking, cycling, horseback riding as well as picnicking facilities.

name: Centennial Trail
description: Excellent for cycling, horseback riding and hiking.

name: Maumee Bay State Park
description:
The 1,336-acre Maumee Bay State Park offers fine recreational facilities and fun. The park is home to scenic meadows, lush marshes and wet woodlands. Camping, hiking, picnicking, fishing, boating, swimming, hunting and cross-country skiing and sledding are the park's most popular activities. Golfing is also common.

The park offers three trails that equal 11 miles when combined. The Interpretive Boardwalk takes you through the swamp and marshlands and two multi-use trails offer easy traveling.

name: Vassar Farms
description: Vassar Farms features 10 miles of hiking trails near Poughkeepsie, NY.

name: Palos Park Woods
description: Popular area for cycling, horseback riding, hiking, and picnicking.

name: Cap Sauer's Holding
description: Cap Sauer's Holding offers bicycling, hiking and is an Ecological Management Site.

name: Swallow Cliff Woods
description:
Just outside of Chicago, Swallow Cliff Woods sits right next to the Cap Sauers Holdings Nature Preserve, and provides plenty of recreational opportunities. Hiking, picnicking, and even sledding in the wintertime are all popular activities here!

Well-manicured trails run all through this wooded area. Paths pass nice picnicking areas with group shelters that are open for public use. Keep in mind that these trails will be shared by many different kinds of outdoor enthusiasts so remember your trail manners!

name: Teason's Woods
description: Visitors here enjoy cycling, hiking, and picnicking.

name: Patterson State Park
description: Patterson State Park is a good destination for picnicking and starting out on a hike. There is campig and hiking available for visitors here. There is a trailhead here for the Susquehannock Trail system.

name: James Baird State Park
description: Beautiful wooded trails.

name: Saganashkee Slough
description: Saganashkee Slough offers excellent cycling, fishing and hiking.

city: Brewster, Dennis, Eastham, Harwich, Orleans, Wellfleet
name: Cape Cod Rail Trail
description: The Cape Cod Rail Trail is a 22-mile paved rail trail. The trail is made up of an abandoned Old Colony Railroad corridor and extends from Route 134 in South Dennis to LeCount Hollow Road in South Wellfleet. The Cape Cod Rail Trail also connects to a few other bike trails, including the 6-plus mile Old Colony Rail Trail leading to Chatham, 8 miles  of rolling trails within Nickerson State Park and the Nauset Bike Trail leading to Coast Guard Beach in Cape Cod National Seashore. The trail's paved surface and well-marked automobile crossings make it ideal for cyclists. The trail is also open for horseback riders, walkers and runners.

name: Sag Quarries
description: Enjoy fishing, hiking and cycling at Sag Quarries Park.

name: Eggers Grove
description: This ecological management site offers bird-watching, cycling, hiking, inline skating, and picnicking.

name: Dan McMahon Woods
description: Dan McMahon Woods is an Ecological Management Site offering cycling, horseback riding, and hiking.

name: Pioneer Woods
description: Sledding, picnicking, hiking and cycling are available at Pioneer Woods.

name: Sag Valley Trail (unpaved)
description: Enjoy cycling, horseback riding, and hiking on the trail.

name: West Barnstable Conservation Area
description: "1,114 acre conservation land. 15 miles of trails"

name: Red Gate Woods
description:
The Red Gate Woods, near downtown Chicago, connect to a larger park system allowing visitors to check out the Wolf Road Woods, McMahon Woods, Willow Springs Woods, and Pulaski Woods. This area provides a great getaway from the urban sprawl.

There are plenty of well-maintained trails that run through this area and connect with the surrounding areas. There are peaceful picnic sites and shelters along the way for visitors to enjoy, as well as an Ecological Management Site.

These trails will most likely be share by other outdoor enthusiasts so don't forget your trail manners!

name: Mount Tom State Park
description: There is a stone tower on top of the mountain that is a favored destination among hikers. The summit of Mt. Tom is 1325 feet above sea level, 125 feet higher than its Massachusetts counterpart. The tower trail is less than one mile long and rises some 500 feet.

name: Waterfall Glen Forest Preserve
description: Excellent hiking.

name: Leonard Harrison State Park
description: The trails traverse very rugged terrain, passing close to many steep cliffs, and may have slippery surfaces. Stay on designated trail surfaces and wear appropriate footwear.

name: Woodcock Creek Lake
description: Interpretive trails in Bossard Nature Area.

name: Lincoln State Park
description: Lincoln State Park offers 10 miles of hiking trails.

name: Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area
description: Hiking is a popular year-round activity at Wildcat. More than three miles of nature trails wind through the canyons and rocky bluffs, with four main trailheads and foot bridges on three trails. The primary trail is located below the large shelterhouse and is accessible to hikers of all ages and abilities. However, some of the side trails have steep grades. Lowlanders should bear in mind that elevations in the Hills" approach 5,000 feet in some areas and the altitude can affect breathing and stamina. Foot bridges, a rain shelter add to the hiker's enjoyment.

name: Bullfrog Lake
description:
Bullfrog Lake is the perfect place to get your biking, fishing, hiking, or picnicking on!

Miles of hiking trails run through the Bullfrog Lake Forest Preserve into Red Gate woods, Wolf Road woods, McMahon woods, Pulaski woods, and Willow Springs woods nearby!

name: Little Red Schoolhouse
description: This Ecological Management Site has a visitor center, trails for hiking, and excellent bird-watching opportunities.

name: Knoch Knolls
description: Knoch Knolls features 5 miles of hiking trails near Naperville, IL.

name: Pokagon State Park
description: Nine trails offer a variety of hiking opportunities.

name: Henry De Tonty Woods
description: Cycling, hiking and inline skating are popular here.

name: Camp Kiwanis Equestrian Staging Area
description: Enjoy horseback riding, cycling, and hiking the trails in this lovely park.

name: Palos Hills
description: Palos Hills features 30 miles of hiking trails near Palos Heights, IL.

name: Maple Lake-east
description: Visitors to this park enjoy cycling, fishing, hiking and picnicking.

name: Country Lane Woods
description: This Ecological Management Site offers birdwatching, cycling, trails and picnicking.

name: Gay City State Park
description: Gay City State Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Hebron, CT.

name: Hidden Pond Woods-East
description: This is an Ecological Management Site with cycling, horseback riding, and hiking trails. Picnicking is also popular.

name: Buffalo Woods-South
description: Excellent cycling, hiking and picnicking here.

name: Lyman Run State Park
description: Lyman Run State Park is a 595-acre park with the 45-acre Lyman Run Lake making it a scenic setting for outdoors events. It has a variation of hiking, atv trails, swimming, baoting, fishing, snowmobiling and camping. There are 6 trails amounting to 6 miles and the 85-mile Susquehannock Trail System passes through the park. The majority of the trails are rather difficult hikes but there is a little bit of easy hiking available.

name: Pulaski Woods
description: Pulaski Woods offers cycling and hiking trails.

name: Wolf Road Woods
description: Visitors enjoy cycling, hiking, and picnicking.

name: Minnewaska State Park Preserve
description: Minnewaska State Park features 15 miles of hiking trails near New Paltz, NY.

name: Spears Woods
description:
This large recreational park is located just minutes from downtown Chicago with Lake Michigan right down the road as well. Spears Woods offers a nice retreat from the urban sprawl.

Trails will take you all throughout this park giving you a beautiful tour of the area. You will pass plenty of different lakes and ponds as you hike your way through this park.

These trails will be shared by other outdoor enthusiasts so remember your trails manners!

name: Oldfield Oaks
description: Two miles of looped limestone footpaths meander through mature oak woodlands and open prairies, the perfect setting to see coyotes, foxes, and a variety of nesting and migratory birds. Horse traffic is not allowed at Oldfield Oaks.

name: Appalachian Trail 119: CT 341 to CT 4 (Cornwall Bridge)
description: The AT runs 11.1 miles from CT Hwy 341 to CT Hwy 4 (Cornwall Bridge). Along the way it passes River Road twice, the Stewart Hollow Brook Lean-to, and Silver Hill.

name: John Husar I&M Canal Paved Trail
description: John Husar I&M Canal Paved Trail offers excellent trails for cycling, hiking and inline skating.

name: Willow Springs Woods
description: Willow Springs Woods, an Ecological Management Site, offers picnicking and trails for cycling and hiking.

name: Major Taylor Paved Trail
description: An excellent place for inline skating, hiking, and cycling.

name: Saylorville Lake
description: Acorn Valley, Sandpiper, and Walnut Ridge have great trails.

name: Taconic-hereford
description: Taconic-hereford  features 15 miles of hiking trails near Pleasant Valley, NY.

name: Buffalo Woods-Central
description: Visitors here enjoy cycling, hiking, and picnicking opportunities.

name: Springbrook Prairie Forest Preserve
description:
Originally slated to be the site of a 200-acre dragon-shaped lake with a swim beach and campground, today, the 1,829-acre Springbrook Prairie Forest Preserve in Naperville is instead one of three regionally significant grassland bird communities in the state and home to species like meadowlarks, dickcissels, grasshopper sparrows, woodcocks, and bobolinks as well as state-endangered northern harriers, short-eared owls, and Henslow's sparrows.
A stream re-meandering project has created twists and turns and a wider, shallower bank along the namesake Spring Brook. These changes have slowed the flow of water, improving aquatic habitat and allowing the brook to more easily pour over its banks and into the preserve during heavy rains, a valuable flood-control feature for nearby residents.
SpringbrIllinois Nature Preserves Logoook Prairie Nature Preserve and Springbrook Marsh Land & Water Reserve, both within Springbrook Prairie, comprise 1,650 of the preserve's 1,824 acres. The site features expansive prairies and meadows and supports numerous rare bird species.
District ordinances already dictate the preservation of rich, natural habitats, but land and water reserve status provides an extra layer of protection for future generations. The District continues to own, manage and maintain these areas, but individuals who destroy natural resources or violate other regulations are subject to state penalties. For more on the nature preserves system, visit the Illinois Nature Preserves Commission's web page at http://dnr.state.il.us/inpc.

name: Buffalo Woods-North
description: Buffalo Woods-North offers hiking and cycling trails, as well as picnicking facilities.

name: Nickerson State Park
description:
Nickerson State Park is a beautifully wooded area, unusually close to Cape Cod. The landscape is different from what is normally associated with the area. Eight kettle ponds are located on the property, making fishing and canoeing popular. Several paths that winds through the park are open to mountain bikers, hikers, cross country skiers and horseback riders.

The park's 1,900 acres offer over 400 campsites, a yurt camping area, an amphitheater, eight miles of roads and multi-use trails and an eight mile bike path that connects to the 22 mile Cape Cod Rail Trail. The park is an excellent recreational area.

name: Greene Valley Forest Preserve
description: Excellent hiking/jogging trails.

name: Dan Ryan Woods-North
description: This park is known for cyling, hiking and picnicking opportunities.

name: Topsmead State Forest
description: Numerous trails and unpaved lanes are available for walking. In addition, the Edith M. Chase Ecology Trail offers a 7/10 mile walk with interpretive signs.

name: West Hartford Reservoir
description: West Hartford Reservoir features 10 miles of hiking trails near West Hartford, CT.

name: Headlands Beach State Park
description: Three trails.

name: Atchinson (hogback Ridge North)
description: Atchinson (hogback Ridge North) features 3 miles of hiking trails near Madison, OH.

name: Chapman State Park
description: In addition to the trails at the park, Chapman is the trailhead for backpacking trails on adjoining public lands. Map and trail information is available in the park office. Free parking is available at the park for those who would rather not leave their vehicles along public roadways.

name: Shawme-crowell State Forest
description: Shawme-crowell State Forest is home to 285 year round campsites and a few yurts. 15 miles of roads and multi use trails provide access to beautiful woodlands for hikers, horseback riders and cross country skiers.  700 acres of pitch pine and scrub oak make up the Shawme-crowell State Forest,

name: Arie Crown Forest
description: Arie Crown Forest provides excellent cycling, hiking and picnicking opportunities.

name: Lippman Memorial Park
description: Lippman Memorial Park features 12 miles of hiking trails near Wararsing, NY.

name: Case Mountain
description: Case Mountain features 33 miles of hiking trails near Manchester, CT.

name: Cape Cod Canal
description: Paved trail.

name: Tolowa Dunes State Park
description: Hikers can follow Dead Lake Trail from Sand Hill Road to Dead Lake for a 2 mile round trip; to Tolowa Dunes is a 3.5 miles round trip.

name: Green Canyon
description: Green Canyon is a 3 mile hiking trail in N Logan, Utah.

name: Macedonia Brook State Park
description: Hike the Blue Trail across Cobble Mountain and other peaks for outstanding views of the Catskill and Taconic mountains which offer splendid foliage viewing.

name: Mansfield Hollow Lake
description: Recreation facilities at this Corps-owned project are managed by the State. Free boat launching and excellent bass and pike fishing opportunities keep the 450-acre lake popular with local residents. Bass tournaments for groups require a State permit. Recreation facilities include a picnic area, drinking water, restrooms, hiking trails and hunting. For up-to-date information, call (860)923-2982.

name: James L. Goodwin State Forest
description: Whatever your desired hike may be, from a couple hundred feet to a dozen miles or more, the James L. Goodwin State Forest has a great combination of natural beauty, exercise and educational opportunities to offer you.

name: Kent Falls State Park
description:
In the mid nineteen-seventies, considerable trail reconstruction was done by the Youth Conservation Corps of Connecticut. The covered bridge is an authentic reproduction built in 1974 by a park employee, Edmund Palmer.

Kent Falls Trail winds 1/4 mile up along the falls. Although not difficult to walk, it is steep. There are many scenic vantage points that can be enjoyed along the trail.

name: Freetown-Fall River State Forest
description:
Near the entrance of Freetown-Fall River State Forest you will find a day use area with a wading pool, a picnic area, fields and restrooms. The rest of the park is mainly 50 miles of unpaved roads and trails for horseback riders, dog sledders, mountain bikers, and seasonal motorcycle and snowmobile users. Hunters are also welcome during the correct season.

The 5,441-acre forest also includes the 227-acre Watuppa Reservation. This area belongs to the Wampanoag Nation and is a very historic area.

name: Scusset Beach State Reservation
description: Scusset Beach State Reservation is a popular fishing, swimming and camping area located on Cape Cod Bay at the east end of the Cape Cod Canal.  98-campsites provide visitors with options of where they'd like to stay and how much space they prefer. Picnicking, cycling and boat watching from the pier are also common activities here.

name: Big Creek State Park
description: A 26-mile paved multi-use trail allows bicyclists and pedestrians to travel from the beach south through the Saylorville Lake area all the way to Des Moines. Eleven miles of snowmobile trails provide winter recreational opportunities. Big Creek is also popular with cross-country skiers.

name: Bolton Notch State Park
description: Bolton Notch State Park offers visitors hiking and rock climbing.

name: Hop River State Park Trail
description: This former railroad line is now a trail that winds 20.2 miles through the towns of Manchester, Vernon, Bolton, Coventry, Andover, and Columbia.  Like a pathway through time, this serpentine path passes among modern subdivisions and crosses roads, but mostly takes the trail user along a remote, quiet and long unused path through the eastern Connecticut countryside.

name: Old Furnace State Park
description: Hikers may access the trail by crossing Furnace Brook opposite the picnic area and locating the dark blue blazes on the trees. The trail leads through pine forest gently upslope until it steepens toward the end in about å_ of a mile. (A return by the same route provides a hike of about 1.5 miles.) Any question of effort will prove worthwhile with the panorama from the rocky outcrops. The view, from 200 feet above the valley, is described by some as stunning, and encompasses Half Hill Pond (also known as Upper Ross Pond) in the immediate foreground and in the distance an unobscured view across eastern Killingly and beyond into Rhode Island. A lush mix of deciduous and coniferous tree cover surrounds the lowland wetlands and adds a special mix of vibrant color in the fall.

name: Maple Grove Forest Preserve
description: Multipurpose and interpretive trails wind through the maple forest, where hikers can appreciate the spring wildflowers and amazing fall colors. Trails are provided to experience this rare habitat; please follow all rules.

name: McDowell Grove Forest Preserve
description: McDowell Grove features nearly 7 miles of looped turf and limestone trails for hikers, bicyclists, cross-country skiers and horseback riders. The trails connect to the Regional Trail, which links with four other preserves.

name: Rocky Gap (easy Loop)
description: Rocky Gap (easy Loop) features 11 miles of hiking trails in Warren, PA.

name: Jedediah Smith Redwoods State Park
description: The park has about 20 miles of hiking and nature trails, river access, a visitor center with exhibits and a nature store. Drive Howland Hill Road (gravel-not recommended for trailers) and stroll in the Stout Grove.

name: Lake Macbride State Park
description: Multi-use trails wind for miles around the lake. All park trails offer opportunities for the sights and sounds of Iowa at its best. Bird watchers will thrill to the sight of nearly every songbird native to the region. During the spring and fall, shorebirds, waterfowl and ospreys are frequent visitors.

name: Coralville Lake
description: Excellent trails.

name: Windsor Meadows State Park
description: The Bissell Bridge Walkway Trail is a 1.8 mile trail that crosses the Connecticut River separated comfortably from the I-291 highway it parallels and is shared by diverse trail users. The Walkway connects Windsor to the large system of multi-use trails in Manchester and East Hartford. It also offers some scenic views of the state's namesake waterway in the process.  Several picnic tables, a grassy lawn and a small handicapped accessible pavilion serves both the trailhead and the parking area.

name: Warrenville Grove
description: Multi-use trails at Warrenville Grove are part of the Regional Trail system, which links Blackwell, Herrick Lake, Danada and St. James Farm preserves.

name: Salt Creek (unpaved)
description: Salt Creek (unpaved) offers excellent cycling and hiking.

name: Bemis Woods-South
description: Bemis Woods-South is an Ecological Management Site offering cycling, bird watching, hiking, inline skating and picnicking.

name: CDT WY06: Hwy 287 to Co Rd 63
description: Segment 6 of the CDT in Wyoming runs 18.4 miles from Hwy 287 to Co Rd 63. Along the way, the trail passes Shamrock Hills and Rendle Hill.

name: Hidden Lake Forest Preserve
description: Over 2 miles of limestone trails wind through the preserve, making it a great destination for hikers, joggers, birders and other wildlife watchers.

name: Appalachian Trail 120: CT 4 to US 7
description:
The AT runs 11.5 miles from CT Hwy 4 (Cornwall Bridge Road) to US Hwy 7. Along the way it passes West Cornwall Road, the Pine Swamp Brook Lean-to, Mount Easter, and Forge Mountain.

Recommended parking spot:
"West Cornwall Road" lat=41.8734895778, lon=-73.3912514661

name: Danada Forest Preserve
description: Nearly three miles of multipurpose trails wind through the preserve's prairie, woodland, and marsh habitats and connect with the Regional Trail (linking four other preserves), providing a scenic excursion for hikers, joggers, bicyclists, equestrians and cross-country skiers. Behind the main barn is a double-looped nature trail through an oak savanna with many native wildflowers. When conditions permit, trails are groomed for classical and skate-style cross-country skiing. Horseback riders are asked to restrain their mounts when riding through woods, through the Naperville Road underpass, or around sharp corners to avoid confronting less-visible trail users.

name: Herrick Lake Forest Preserve
description: Excellent trails.

name: Housatonic Meadows State Park
description: Great trails for hiking.

name: Bemis Woods-North
description: Bemis Woods-North, an Ecological Management Site, offers birdwatching, paddling, picnicking, cycling, hiking and inline skating.

name: Fossil Butte National Monument
description:
Two trails with wayside exhibits provide opportunities to experience the geology, fossils, wildlife, plants, and wide-open spaces of Fossil Butte National Monument. Both dirt trails gain elevation and have some steep up and down sections. Wear sturdy hiking shoes, carry plenty of water, and protect yourself from the sun and insects. Vault toilets at each trailhead are wheelchair accessible.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Scotts Bluff National Monument
description:
Four trails offer visitors breathtaking views and the chance to take a walk back into time. <br />
The North Overlook trail provides an amazing view of the North Platte River valley, the badlands, and the cities of Scottsbluff and Gering.<br />
The South Overlook provides a view of Mitchell Pass, remnants of the Oregon Trail, and the Oregon Trail Museum and Visitor Center.<br />
The Saddle Rock Trail runs from the Visitor Center to the summit of Scotts Bluff and includes a foot tunnel.<br />
Oregon Trail Pathway: Between 1841 and 1869, over 350,000 people traveled west past Scotts Bluff. Before 1851, pioneers used Robidoux Pass since the badlands between the river and the bluff made travel impossible. Nine miles south of Scotts Bluff, the pass offered a spring and a trading post operated by the Robidoux brothers. <br />
The best views of Saddle Rock, Dome Rock, Sentinel Rock and Mitchell Pass can be seen from the Prairie View Trail. The paved 1.2 mile path is open to bicycle riding as well as foot traffic and leads from the visitor center parking lot to the east boundary of the monument.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Snake Den State Park
description: Excellent trails.

name: Brookfield Woods
description: Brookfield Woods is an Ecological Management Site offering cycling, hiking, inline skating and picnicking.

name: Cape Cod National Seashore
description:
There are twelve Self-Guiding Trails at the seashore that are open year round.<br />
Source: National Park Service

name: Penwood State Park
description: An extensive trail system is maintained in cooperation with the Connecticut Forest and Park Association, which provides volunteer assistance. Most hiking trails start and end in the main picnicking area. Each trail is a color-coded loop with the exception of the Nature Trail built by the Youth Conservation Corps. This trail encircles Lake Louise and passes by the pinnacle overlook.

name: St. James Farm Forest Preserve
description: Three mowed-grass trails totaling 3.4 miles lead hikers, bikers, horseback riders and cross-country skiers through the preserve's natural areas. Visitors on the Illinois Prairie Path can enter from Hoy Avenue. Interpretive signs along tree-lined promenades called "allÌ©es" relate the history of the estate.

name: Talcott Mountain State Park
description: The Tower Trail is 1.25 miles long; a walk to the Tower takes approximately 30 - 40 minutes. Also running through the park is a section of the Metacomet Trail, developed and maintained with volunteer assistance by the Connecticut Forest and Park Association.

name: Myles Standish State Forest
description: Myles Standish State Forest s the largest publicly owned recreational area in southeastern Massachusetts. True to its title, the park is home to five large camping areas, 16 ponds, 15 miles of bicycle trails, 35 miles of equestrian trails, 13 miles of hiking trails and one of the largest pitch pine/scrub oak communities north of Long Island.

name: Blackwell Forest Preserve
description: Hikers, bicyclers, horseback riders and cross-country skiers can enjoy more than 6 miles of turf and limestone trails, including a convenient route to the Illinois Prairie Path. Trails around the McKee Marsh area feature two observation decks, a bird blind, and signs that describe the history and ecological significance of the marsh.

name: Mills Norrie State Park (Margaret Lewis Norrie)
description: Excellent trails.

name: Mohawk Mountain State Park
description: In total, the White Memorial Foundation contributed over 2,900 acres to the acquisition of the forest, starting in 1921. The rugged hills of this wildlife sanctuary provide panoramic vistas. A black spruce bog offers the visitor the opportunity to view a unique plant community.

name: Mayslake Forest Preserve
description: A one-mile multipurpose trail winds around the shore of the lake and leads to Portiuncula Chapel.

name: Fullersburg Woods
description: Taking a self-guided tour of this 1.3 mile trail through lowland woods and restored prairies by foot, bicycle or cross-country skis is a good way to learn about DuPage County's natural history. Most of the trail follows Salt Creek, providing visitors with the chance to see local flora and fauna. The half-mile walk along the banks of Salt Creek leads to Graue Mill Historic Site. Over a century ago, Frederick Graue put the waters of Salt Creek to work for him in a milling operation. Today, this National Historic Landmark allows visitors to see the mill operate as it did in Graue's day. The mill is open Tuesdays through Sundays from 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., mid-April to mid-November. For information about field trips, programs or admission fees, see www.grauemill.org or contact Graue Mill at (630) 655-2090.

name: Natchaug State Forest
description: Excellent hiking in this beautiful state forest.

name: Twenty-Sixth St Woods-West
description: Twenty-Sixth St Woods-West offers trails for cycling, hiking and inline skating as well as picnicking facilities.

name: Pacific Crest Trail: Northern California: R to the Oregon Border
description:
Section R is the last section of the Pacific Crest Trail in California and it runs 36.7 miles from Highway 96 at Seiad Valley to the California/Oregon border. This section stays high up in the mountains as it makes a long traverse to the Oregon Cascades. There are many logging roads in the area, so the trail is usually paralleling a road.

Along the way the trail passes Seiad Valley, CA; School House Gulch; Lower Devils Peak Lookout Trail 12W04; Fern Spring; Lookout Spring; Cook and Green Pass; Road 47N81; Road 40S01; Wards Fork Gap; and Donomore Creek.
